review_body: The Hotel is in a good location, convenience parking Nice rooms small pool (which I didn't use)The breakfast is an American style Which I am not crazy about. What disturbed me was the use of disposable dishes which create a big amount of trash. I was happy with the information provided by the Hotel of the possibilities in the area.

I got charged $39 for a fee when I paid my full price on here when I went to check out they asked me for exactly $39 but what for the room I got light was broken and shower didnt work right at all I paid $236 in total for my room then got charged 39 dollars when I left everything clean and never did any damage

Club Quarters is across from Grand Central so conveniently located. The amenities are sufficient. Most of the staff and courteous. There is a problem with the elevators that is frustrating and may be why one staff member at the front desk is so discourteous.

Love the location of this hotel, the price, and nightly reception, but when I stayed there in Feb, and elevators didn't work with regular room keys. What this meant for me on the 14th floor is that I either had to get close to that floor (say the elevator stopped at Floor 10, I got off and walk the final 4), or I had to find a staff member to use their key to direct the elevator to the floor. Until the elevators are working again, I recommend staying on either the top floors or street level floors.

For the price, an incredible hotel! Clean, modern, everything works perfectly. Very new facilities, very good and modern bathroom, staff ias always willing to help, housekeeping was very good, a great stay overall.

Elizabeth and the rest of staff team carries the 5 stars score. They are always smiley, gentle.The hotel is really well located + facilities of laundry in DIY system is so practical! Not to mention the yoga mat, one per room!Only need to amend the air conditioning / heater to produce less noise

I had the pleasure of staying at this hotel this past weekend and I had a blast! The room was comfort and the location was great. Thank you to the amazing staff members during Sunday’s happy hour, Elizabeth and Marcos! They really went above and beyond to make sure our stay was perfect. Its team members like Elizabeth and Marcos that would make me return to Club Quarters! Also, Elizabeth’s dress was adorable!

Having stayed at Club Quarters hotels in different opportunities, I can say that it is a great chain of hotels, and Grand Central is no exception. The rooms are clean, comfortable and well thought. Location is great, walking distance to Grand Central (you can go anywhere from there via subway) and places like UN, 5th Ave, and others. They are not the most spacious if you have a lot of luggage, but this is easily manageable. The staff is very friendly and will go the extra mile to help with any needs. The coffee and snacks provided 24/7, and the 27th floor terrace and also great bonuses.

I made a quick trip up to New York and found this hotel on line. It was affordable and convenient so I booked it. But it was so much more than I anticipated. From now on it will be my go to hotel in NYC. The rooms, though small (which is fine in New York), were clean, comfortable, and modern. The staff -- Caesar, Sara, and Tre -- were wonderfully friendly. And, on the 27th floor, there is a terrific "living room" and balcony that provides a comfortable area to work and to take advantage of the fresh ground coffee and snacks. I look forward to my next visit.

Much appreciate this hotel. Perfect in all respects. I'm shocked that I didn't know about this place earlier. Having lived in NYC for close to 20 years and having recently moved away (to Dallas) it's always nice to return, but the price-tag per location isn't always welcoming. This provided both and was hands-off and friendly. Great find and will come again.

Just got back from a great stay at the Club Quarters, Grand Central. It was fun catching up with old friends (Jillian, Liz, & Greg) and making new ones (Crystal & Tre). The staff is always so pleasant and friendly and willing to go out of their way to make your stay extra special. Huge shout out to Jillian for going above & beyond! Please know that it was definitely appreciated.This hotel provides a lot of extra amenities that you just don’t find in most hotels, especially not ones in NYC. The rooms are spacious (esp by NYC standards) & well appointed. The Midtown Manhattan location is great. The lounge on the 27th floor has a TV, computers, printers, and bathrooms. There is also an outside patio area, with great views of NYC. The lounge is the place to be at the CQ. For breakfast there is fresh fruit (red & green apples, oranges, & bananas) and designer granola bars, such as Luna, Kashi, and Lara. After breakfast they offer fresh snacks such as Wasabi peas, M & M’s, Sesame sticks, etc., as well as packaged snack bags of popcorn, pita chips, etc., plus several different kinds of canned sodas. Then every day from 5-6 PM (also in the lounge) they have their free wine happy hour, where they offer glasses of red and white wines. Coffee, tea, and water are available all day long. Plus there are Keurig coffee makers in every room and mineral water dispensers (and bottles) on every floor too. I love staying at this hotel and highly recommend it to others all of the time. Cheers!
This is 1 of the best hotel in NY. the price is very confortable and the position is pretty perfect . you are in the center of NY and you are very close to all the best place to visit.Perfect Hotel..

This hotel is at a great location in midtown Manhattan. Lots of places to eat around the hotel. Good family hotel. The observatory on the 27th floor gives very good view of Manhattan. Easily accessible through subway and Uber.

Nice room. Comfy bed. Tea and coffee facilities in the room plus an upstairs communal lounge for free drinks, snacks and happy hour each evening too! Slow lifts - I didn’t worry but other guests were complaining each time we used them.Didn’t have an iron or ironing board in the room. Didn’t ask if I could borrow one so have no idea if there was one available.All in all a cute, friendly hotel in a good location. Would use again.

Poor hotel safe, iPad was attempted to be broken into while in hotel safe.Numerous attempts to notify upper management at hotel and no response as to the problem and the apparent total breakdown of security.

For long periods of time during my stay, I'd set the thermostat to some reasonable temperature like 72F, and the heater would just go "click" every minute or so and wouldn't actually turn on the heat. This made the room very uncomfortable to stay in. The bathroom was even colder. I told the front desk about this, and while I was out they "fixed" it in some very impermanent way, and passive-aggressively turned the heat up to 80 for when I got back. As if to say "oh this isn't warm enough for you well HOW ABOUT THIS". The next morning it was 66 again.Also the elevator is malicious and won't let you out at your floor.

The room smells like urine and cigarettes. It was only cleaned after I complained at the front desk. After it was cleaned it continued to smell the same way. It seemed like someone urinated in the floor

Shout out to Elizabeth at the front desk on excellence in customer service and EQ. She welcomed us in a warm and inviting manner and offered us great information on the property. When I asked about the size of the bed, she initiated a discussion to better understand our needs and didn't hesitate to look for ways to enhance our experience. This property is simply great and the location is very convenient.

This was my first time at this hotel but I will be back. I have stayed in many rooms this size but none had such an efficient layout and high quality furnishings. Great lighting for getting work done and great smart TV for entertainment. Gym was nice and included a Peleton Bike. Guest lounge had great snacks and coffee machine, with free wine in the evening.

This is one of the best rates I've ever got in NYC. The room was really nice, quite spacious by NYC standards. They have water machines on all floors. Location is great. But what really stuck with me was how friendly all the staff were.

Rooms were good size for New York. The lounge upstairs was great to socialize. A college roommate came and there was plenty of room to sit, talk, drink free wine and snacks. The price for New York as very reasonable.

This was a perfect stay. The location was perfect. They were clean, staff was very friendly. I loved the roof top lounge. This was my 2nd stay with the CQ company 1st time at the Grand Central property. I will continue to stay with CQ in other states.

Staff were nice and the lounge was comfy with a nice view.. great location and the rooms were clean. Easy walk to grand central station and Times Square and many nice restaurants and shopping .. highly recommended

Started out by walking into a dreary dark and very plain lobby where I checked in. Process was efficient but not welcoming. Went up to my box of a room. There is no closet. Just an armoire. Room is efficiently laid out but it felt a bit claustrophobic. The pillows were rough and noisy. Key didn’t work for the 27 floor so I could not access that floor. The tv didn’t work at times either. Finally, the gun is extremely small and basic. To end things on a great note, the AC wasn’t working in the gum and it felt like a sauna. No response from the hotel staff. Will not stay here again and would not recommend.

My boyfriend and I had a disastrous Airbnb experience so we decided to book a room at Club Quarters. Needless to say I was beyond impressed by the hotel and all of the staff. We were immediately greeted at the front desk by Elizabeth. She was phenomenal, she not only insured we were taken care of when we arrived she also checked on us regularly throughout our stay, absolutely FANTASTIC. I will definitely be recommending this hotel in the future.

The rooms were smaller than the average NYC boutique hotel. The telephone in the room was disconnected and when I called from my cell, they said they'd send someone right up. No one ever came up to fix it. The happy hour they offer is so below par. There's only about three 750 mL bottles of cheap wine and a few jars of bar snacks (trail mix, cinnamon raisin crisps). When those bottles run out, they don't replenish them. It's a really disappointing happy hour compared to other hotels' (servers, charcuterie plates, various olives/pickles, diff. breads, beer/diff. wines, etc.). The seating area is really outdated and kind of inconvenient for the size of the room. There was only one washcloth in the bathroom when we arrived, which was strange. They did bring up a few more when we called and requested them. Elizabeth, front desk rep, was really amazing and was super helpful. *I wouldn't depend on this* but I asked for a late check-out and they actually offered to waive the fee once I checked out. The front desk reps were really amazing. I don't really blame them for the negative features of this hotel. I'd just stay elsewhere.

The room was just as you'd expect at CQ. A bit small but well-appointed and clean. GREAT location and rooftop lounge.Sara & Elizabeth & all the women whom we dealt with at the front desk were SUPERB - GREAT attitudes and wonderful customer Service!

This was my first stay at the Grand Central Club Quarters [on my final receipt, the hotel was listed as Hotel Boutique at Grand Central]. Relatively inexpensive, its daily Activities Fee was $21.72, fairly reasonable given the tendency of such new, unadvertised additions to NYC hotel fees to go up to $40/day. The hotel is new, and well-designed; my room was small but very comfortable, a bit like a cabin in a luxury ocean liner; the level of thoughtful detail is very high, right down to the placement of the light switches, electrical outlets, and wastepaper baskets. There are few traditional hotel services -- fine for those like me who don't want them. There's an excellent diner (we used to call them deli luncheonettes), the Comfort Diner, further east on 45th St, just beyond Third Ave. Coffee, fresh fruit, M&Ms, &c. are available free on the 27th floor of the hotel 24/7 -- the coffee and related hot drinks out of a complicated machine, and surprisingly good. (One of the many drinks options was "hot foam," which I never got around to trying, but wanted to). The front desk staff was particularly friendly and helpful. They were expert in helping me get the elevator buttons to work (the heat-sensitive buttons are failiing, and about to be replaced, but their insensitivity at present is a real nuisance). I shall return: recommended!

1. Great front desk staff - watched Sara and Elizabeth handle a number of issues and pretty rude clienta very skillfully2. Shower needs volume adjust, not just temp3. Elevator panel is a BIG loser ... we and many guests had problems getting it to work4. Shower curtain ahould be weighted at the bottom so it doesn't blow into the shower when showeringAll in all, though, CQ is a good value and we appreciate you!

This hotel is very comfortable for business travelers. Not only for its location but also it has a good meeting place at the 27th floor for business people and a relaxing place for the tourists as well.

The hotel room was awesome. VERY clean and up to date. Pretty furniture, top of the line toilet and shower head in the bathroom. The location is great. The view from our room was awesome without an additional cost. Overall a 5-STAR experience. I absolutely recommend you stay here if you are reading this!

First time in NY and was the perfect location hotel, we love walking and everything we did was walkable.Special mention to Cenny who greeted us when we arrived and made sure our stay was the best it could’ve been.Loved the hotel too, everything we needed, we’d definitely stay again too.

Very good Hotel, comfy beds and pillows. It is very well located just steps from Grand Central. The top floor was a good surprise! They always have coffee, tea, fruits and granola bars and in the evening, wine. All complementary. Very good staff, including Rafael who was great. The rooms are small, but have everything you need.

We had a lovely stay at Christmas time. The Hotel is near some great places to sightsee a small walk away from Grand Central Station. The staff was lovely & so will to help out,would highly recommend this accommodation.

I got a deal online to stay at the Club Quarters Hotel in NYC and I had a great experience. The location was in walking distance to everything in Midtown. I didn’t take a train or cab once. The hotel staff were very kind and helpful. I mean like everyone was helpful and smiled. Seeing people smile in NYC is a rare occurrence so that was refreshing. Also they had complimentary coffee, soda and snacks all day everyday. And there was complimentary wine at 5pm everyday. The room was very clean, and even though it was small it had all you needed. Fast WiFi, and an option to mirrorcast from your phone to the tv to watch Netflix or whatever. Honestly, I might exclusively only stay at this hotel from now on when I come to NYC, it was the greatest experience I’ve ever had.

We absolutely LOVED this hotel! Staff is awesome, rooms are spacious and super comfy! Happy hour w free wine and snacks is a plus and great spot to unwind! If you’re looking for a place to stay which is conveniently located I highly recommend!

Centrally located boutique hotel near great restaurants and bars. Staff is friendly and very courteous. The restaurant in the property is very good with a great selection in the bar. The bartender, Tim, is fantastic.

We have stayed in other Club Quarters so we were familiar with this hotel. Our preference was to stay across from Rockerfeller Center but discovered the hotel changed to a Radisson and they didn't have rooms available during our visit.Club Quarters has a nice concept where they have complimentary bottled water refills on every floor. They have a lounge on the 27th floor and since we were here in Nov the outside patio wasn't open. It does have a nice view from the Club room-lots of light with tables and comfy chairs to relax in. We missed their complimentary happy hour from 5-6 pm during our three night stay so I can’t comment on that but they did have complimentary snacks (fruit, crackers, peanuts and M&N, soft drinks, coffee and tea) available in the Club room during normal hours which was very nice.Our standard room didn’t have a mini fridge or microwave and I realize that the other times of our stay was for work purposes where my husband was in the city for much longer time. I should have reserved a superior room that has the mini fridge and microwave. The Davios restaurant on the lower level in the hotel serves breakfast only till 10 am. We had slept in due to the time difference and went down a few minutes after they closed. There are other places close by so not a problemThe bathroom door was broken and didn't close so that was the only little negative I would note.

I had a very nice stay at the Club Quarter Hotel, Grand Central. I liked the central location in midtown Manhattan, the room and the proximity to Grand Central. I especially appreciate the front front desk rep, specifically Rafael, who made a great effort to make my stay even more enjoyable by assisting me with finding the right room for my needs (the first room didn't work out for me because of the street noise on the Lex Ave. side). Thank you Rafael for making me feel at home at your hotel.

I’m not a big city guy but I have travelled a good amount over the years. I wanted to spend a couple of nights in downtown Manhattan with my spouse to see a museum and the new Hudson Yards. I booked through Expedia as I often do. The $125 a night price on the Expedia site morphed into $165 with fees, taxes, etc. but being just a block from GST is a great location if you are arriving by train. Club Quarters is different, I’ll give them that. Definitely not a grand hotel feeling with a tiny lobby no real front desk and dim lighting. It’s a self-service almost dormitory vibe. There are amenities like a 27th floor terrace with snacks, coffee, computers and wine from 5pm to 6pm. There is an exercise place I did not visit. There is a closet on each floor with some items like steam irons available for guests but I could not get the coffee pods for the Keurig machine nor extra pillows I wanted and had to call the staff. They were accommodating.The elevator buttons worked intermittently which was a pain sometimes riding up and down trying to get my floor button and the keycard to work. The basic room I had was quite small and I think set up for one person although our reservation was for two. The bathroom had two bath towels, one face towel and one wash cloth. The shower was great. Housekeeping is fine. There is little counter space in the bathroom. There was a microwave, a fridge and the coffee maker but no safe. Expedia listed a safe in their description but Club Quarter’s web site did not list one. A message sent to the hotel asking about this went unanswered. The HVAC was just a little noisy but the street noise on a Friday night on the 19th floor was unsettling and not conducive to a good night’s sleep. Saturday night was more tranquil. I would not in the future accept a room across from the elevator the noise from which was also intrusive. We’re I young and traveling alone this hotel might be ok had I had a better room. I think for the price I could have found a place with less noise and more space.

Greeted by the lovely Elizabeth this little hotel was comfortable, very clean and had friendly staff the entire stay. The rooms are perfect, clean and well designed. It was the perfect place to get good sleep during a week of work in the city. My neighbors were all quiet and polite. My new home away from home!

We really had a great time during our few days at Club Quarters. The rooms were a nice size (for New York) and their Happy Hour from 5 to 6 is really a good time with nice views of the city from the 27th floor. A good mix of people were there during our stay so it was interesting to meet people from all over the world. Next time we are in New York we will stay in Club Quarters again.

We really enjoyed our stay at the club quarters hotel for New Year’s Eve weekend. It’s conveniently located near Broadway and fifth Avenue and more. The lounge on the 27th floor is very nice. Great views. Elizabeth was super helpful. Thanks!!

Staff are rude and willing to assist with a simple request. We asked if they could lower the temperature in the lobby as we were struggling to breathe. I was told they don't control the temperature but when I started lowering the temperature of the temperature controller next to the reception desk, I was told off in a rude manner that I'm not allowed to touch the controller. The staff clearly aren't interested in the comfort of their guests, please don't reward this establishment with your business.

Club Quarters was one of my best hotel stays ever. The location was awesome, the staff was very friendly and accommodating and the amenities like the 27th floor lounge with complimentary snacks and a 5pm free wine happy hour were awesome. We were also able to have them hold our bags before and after our check in/our time which made traveling so much more enjoyable. Rooms were also clean and very functional. Pleasantly surprised by this great value hotel!

Very efficient use of space, giving a lot while remaining modestly compact. Excellent cleaning staff. Great 27th floor common space with excellent views, snacks & seating. Mattress needs to be replaced (sank toward middle), TV had a discolored bar across top. Great staff, very helpful.Overall, a great experience.

My first visit to New York was an outstanding experience because of the amazing Cenny, Tre, and Elizabeth (this hotel's staff. Not only were they friendly, professional, courteous, and quick to be helpful, they went out their way to make my family and I feel so much better about an awful experience with one of the restaurants that we visited, by leaving a beautiful card, candy, nuts, and wine in our room, while we were out. I am so very glad that they not only listened to us complain about the restaurant, but added to the enjoyment of our stay at their lovely hotel by showing that they cared. Free hot coffee, beverages and snacks 24/7.VeronicaGoodyear, Arizona &Family from California

The hotel is conveniently located near the venue where our conference takes place. The filtered water stations are a BIG bonus. The staff is very friendly, helpful and responsive. We did have to ask for a second bath towel for our room, but this was provided quickly. The location near Grand Central Station allows us quick access to food, shopping and the subway.

My Daughter, Mom, Sister and I enjoyed our stay here. The 1st night the room wasn’t what we booked and Cenny made sure our room was upgraded within hours. Cenny, Tre and Elizabeth gave great suggestions and directions for our 1st trip together here to NY and also had wine and snacks placed in our room. Great experience!!

This is a very nice hotel in midtown Manhattan. The staff is very helpful and efficient. The room was nice and clean with a little table and sofa. Location is great within walking distance to most attractions.

I stayed there for business for a week. The location is super and nearby most of the relevant places.The team there was exceptional and service oriented I would like top mentioned especially Elisabeth Rafa greg who was super helpful and communicative

Close to Grand Central, stores and restaurants. Easy check-in/check-out. Nice bathroom and lighting. Lots of street noise, windows are not soundproof. Dated decor, changing out cheap, silk looking bedspread to a nice comforter would do wonders.

- Multimedia system doesn't work, no TV, no paid TV- Shower is painful to take due to high water pressure, shower head wont hold in the holder because of it, shower room design makes floor wet all over disallowing post-shower use- air conditioner is loud, impossible to sleep- poor amenities (no slippers, bathrobes, drinking water, etc)

It just wasn't the right fit for me. I was not comfortable with the room set up and it had some issues. I wasn't going to complain that I could fit my fingers under the door, the gap was so huge I had to put a towel there. Heater was loud. Bathroom sink was dirty. Carpet dirty, stain on headboard, holes in sheets. It was just not a good pick for me. Staff were always great no complaints there. Friendly and helpful. I won't stay again.

Nice hotel in a great location. Price was reasonable when compared to comparable to other midtown hotels. The lounge was cozy and the happy hour was nice. A short walk from Grand Central made it attractive for out of towners from Connecticut.

EASY 10/10!!!!! Our recent stay at club quarters grand central was absolutely amazing! The room was so clean and cozy with a breath taking view. Awesome location in the city for a couples getaway, business trip, or family vacay. Tre, Jillian, Elizabeth, Greg and Cenny = best staff EVER! Thank you so so much for making our trip, and making it feel like home. We will most definitely be back. Highly recommend this hotel, don’t even waste your time searching. You won’t regret it, I promise!!!

Elizabeth was so friendly and SO helpful!! She gave the best recommendations of all the hot spots around NYC. she also was eager to help us get transportation to the airport. Her charismatic personality really made our trip so enjoyable. Greg also was very fun and very helpful for everything to know here in the city. I’d come back for the staff alone!

From start to finish, our stay at this hotel was awful. Several problems with the 3 rooms we booked to include one room that had a non functioning thermostat so no air or heat, one room that did not have the included chair bed and one room that required an extra rollout bed. None of the rooms had adequate towels or blankets. Most disappointing was the lack of care and concern by the hotel staff. Despite making our needs known, maintenance was not called and our requests were not acknowledged and/or responded too.

Room was okay. Was told there would be a fridge, but there was not one. However, one was delivered after I requested it. Fitness Center was inadequate; Peloton bike was broken. Was overcharged at checkout, so watch your bill.

Hotel is in a great location. Short walk to Grand Central Station, lots of restaurants and shopping. The staff was efficient, friendly and professional. Also, enjoyed the availability of snacks and work area in the common room. Only downside is the size of the room...tiny. It was clean and well maintained, but really small for two people.

Great value, location and amenities.Good fitness room, great rooftop lounge, good wifi….Staff friendly and helpful. Not sure how to improve on this one?Definitely recommend for a NYC visit with Grand Central across the street!

Everything fine as advertised except “kitchenette.” We expected a few dishes and cutlery, but there were none. We had to search the neighborhood to buy a couple of cardboard cereal dishes and a couple of plastic spoons. Other than that, the room was carefully and thoughtfully put together.

Great, attentive staff, great location. Incredible lounge with free snacks, sodas, specialty coffees 24/7 and free wine for happy hour. Only complaint is that rooms are way too small even for NYC standards

Great staff in a friendly hotel near Grand Central. Rooms were compact but functional and very clean.Nice lounge on the 27th floor. Check was fast and rooms were ready early. Awesome!I changed it from 4 to 3 stars because I could not get out of this review.

Good hotel in a good spot, but you're playing Russian roulette with whether the elevator buttons will register your push and get you to your floor. Several times I tried to get to my 12th floor room only for the elevator to not register push, resulting in a trip all the way to the top and bottom a couple of times. This has been an issue during multiple stays at this hotel this year, and it's a known issue by the staff and others who have stayed here. You would think the hotel would invest in getting it fixed. It's become such a pain that I'm considering staying at other nearby hotels on future business trips. Just highly annoying.

Love this hotel! Plenty to see and do around the area. Rooms are clean, and staff are super friendly! The automatic latte/espresso machine on the 27th floor is a must visit every morning for a wake up drink, or any time throughout the day when you want something warm. Even after dinner! They lay out snacks and fruit at all hours of the day and night too. Have stayed here before, and would definitely stay here again! Love this hotel!!

CQ Grand Central is home from home, the crew are always friendly and efficient and the location and facilities are ideal. I love the terrace lounge and the gym facilities. The coffee machine and pods are a bonus which makes one feel at home.

My family went up for the weekend to catch a show. First time staying here. The rooms were so comfy and clean. The staff is So friendly and fun. We loved the 5:00 wine and snack hour!’ All around a Great place to stay

The friendly staff, great amenities, clean rooms and convenient location always keep me coming back whenever I’m in NYC. I’ve never had any issues when staying here, and I always have a really pleasant stay.

Thanks to the staff at Club Quarters for all their help with our group booking. We had an excellent time. The rooms are good size really happy with the in room yoga mat. Thanks to Elisabeth who was really attentive to what a visitor to New York needs to know. Really helpful team. The wine on floor 27 is a must!

Great experience, very professional staff. The hotel met all of my expectations. It was centrally located for what I needed to do. Even though 2 out of the 3 elevators were out the front desk told me before I registered and put me in a lower floor so I could use the stairs at least to go down. The price of the room was very reasonable.

If you’re looking for a convenient clean and well located hotel this is it. Nothing fancy. Very useful. The 27 th floor snack room is a nice touch. Grand central is an attraction on its own account.visit the oyster bar.

We met Elizabeth during the happy hour (right after we checked in) and she was an AMAZING first impression. The location is excellent but her customer service will have us return before anything else (you can stay anywhere in NYC tbh) happy hours are fun, but she locked it down. She checked on us multiple times and really made us feel welcome despite the crowd. 10/10 would stay for Elizabeth again

People were friendly, room was clean and comfortable. My one complaint, the TV did not work. When we checked in and I mentioned my birthday, they sent a bottle of wine as a birthday gift. I thought that was very thoughtful. They had coffee 24/7 and happy hour from 5-6 everyday, lots of snacks. I enjoyed hanging out in the common room, I will definitely stay there again.

A comfortable and convenient hotel! Good location as close to the office and central station which means you can get to wherever you need quickly and easily. I have stayed there several times so I feel safe and relaxed. Staff are always helpful!

I am an avid fan of Club Quarters at Grand Central. It's the best hotel for the price and the service is exceptional. Highly recommend. The rooms are spacious for NYC, and the hospitality in the morning and evening is so appreciated.

This hotel has a great location and is walking distance to a lot! Only drawback was that we were given a handicap room, the shower ending up soaking the whole bathroom turning it into a slip and slide. Also the water pressure was slightly unbearable,

Upon arrival we were greeted with an inviting smile and warm welcome from Elizabeth!! That immediately set the tone of our stay. During our check-in Elizabeth took the time to expain all of the Club Quarters Hotels amenities and perks all the while making us laugh. She could tell that my sister and I were more reserved but encouraged us to participate in all the hotels amenities which made our stay pleasurable. She is a lovely and professional agent and made our stay enjoyable.Johnny was extemely helpful and flexible with our questions and needs. He was very discrete, kind, respectful and punctual. My sister and I took a chance on this hotel and we are glad we did!. We travel a lot but our stay in New York was limited but the service here was unlimited. Thank you for your hospitality. We will definitly come back and will also check out the other locations on our tracels for Club Quarters Hotel.

Positive: GREAT location, friendly staff, decent rooms, 24h coffee and fruits, wine o´clock, nice rooftop.Negative: elevators were not working properly and the "resort/facilities fee" is very expensive.

I loved the central location of this hotel. So easy to get around the city. The hotel has a nice club on the top floor with great views and free wine starting at 5pm. Plus snacks and coffee. Rooms were on the small side but that’s NYC. Room was clean and bed was comfortable.

Small, but efficiently appointed room. View of Chrysler Building. Only one ice machine on 3rd floor. Good AC. My requested wake up call did not occur. The elevator card reader did not work so access to “Club Level” was not possible. Free wine @ 5, skyline views, morning coffee...Nope.

First off, the $33 nightly parking fee can not be beat anyplace else in NYC! The Happy Hour is a pleasant surprise, as is the purified water station on each floor. This is not a luxury hotel, nor does it pretend to be. It is perfect for a long term stay, whether for business travelers or others seeking an apartment like setting. The room was clean and the bathroom was more than fine. Room was no different in size than much more expensive hotels I have stayed in the past. I was on the 9th floor on the Lexington Ave. side and the noise level was minimal. Proximity to subway, Grand Central - all greatly convenient. Hotel staff helpful, efficient and friendly- they held my bags the next day until I was ready to get my car. Davios, a great chop house, is a nice addition to have attached to the hotel. I will definitely stay again!

I was staying in Manhattan for an extended trip and wanted a place with a kitchen and a refrigerator. Club Quarters looked like it ticked all the boxes. Sadly the reality as a little different. While the room itself was perfectly adequate, the kitchen area was minuscule, there were no utensils to use, the WiFi was set so that you had to sign in every single time you looked at your device, and most annoying of all the lift call buttons did not work. Everyone visiting had a hard time getting the buttons to work. The staff were aware but in the 12 days I stayed nothing was done to fix the problem. I really wanted to like Club Quarters but it was unnecessarily disappointing.

First, you can't beat the location one block away from Grand Central. Secondly, the rooms are modern and thoughtfully appointed, albeit on the small side. Thirdly, service is impeccable from the young and enthusiastic staff. The lounge on the top floor with a view of midtown, free beverages and snacks is a great bonus. Highly recommended for business travelers and couples, not so much for families due to small room size.

The Club Quarters seem to be built for business travel. the rooms at this one are small (as are most in Manhattan) but well-designed and functional. There's a comfortable chair with built ins next to it with plenty of plugs/USBs for all my devices. The closet and drawers are sufficient for a longer stay. There is a nice happy hour on the top floor. The one quirk is the elevator was a bit difficult to operate - one had to hold down the button for a long time (~10 seconds) or that floor wouldn't stay lit. Once you knew the trick, it was fine, but lots of people were on the elevator after having missed their floor.

Great value, great location, and unexpected perks such as happy hour, snacks, espresso machine and truly terrific service. Within walking distance to the iconic Grand Central, Central Park and to Broadway shows too.  This hotel is a keeper!

Hotel is very convenient to Central Park, Time Square and Grand Central Station. Rooms are adequate and clean. Look forward to next stay. Only issue I had was the location of coffee maker and how it had to be “rigged” to hook to electrical outlet. But truly appreciated having coffee maker in room. Liked the yoga mat as well.

Reading all the reviews about the size of hotel rooms in midtown Manhattan, I was positively surprised. The room was very clean and of decent size. The staff was very friendly and attending. The living room on the 27th floor with free coffee and snacks was a bonus.

That fact that this hotel is in a great location is a given, especially as the overnight rate gives that one away. Beyond that, you’re instantly reminded that there’s a ‘happy hour’ every day on the top floor, which btw, draws quite the crowd. Beyond that, the hotel is very average, with a rough and ready lobby area, which gets crowded easily. The room itself was ok, but didn’t have a safe-keeping facility in the room, which is a major omission. You can lodge your precious items in a communal room on one of the lower floors, which was a time consuming affair. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant/bar either, which is odd too. Beyond the great location, there’s little else to get excited about with this hotel.

The staff was amazing, they brought us a complementary bottle of wine. Beautiful terrace on the 27th floor with complementary happy hour every evening. Bed was comfortable and room was clean. The shower water pressure wasn’t the best but nothing that would keep me from staying there again. Excellent location.

Club Quarters Grand Central is my go to place. Compact but very comfortable. Well appointed and well located. Love the roof top lounge and the wine happy hour. Late night snacks and breakfast snack are terrific.

The elevators do not work don’t stay here also the shower sprays everywhere when you turn it on. There is no bar or restaurant here either. Staff was annoying and unhelpful. When i complained about the elevators they said there is nothing they can do and they charged me for late checkout instead of throwing that in for the broken elevators

Cenny, Tre, and Elizabeth were charming, professional, and very interested in making sure we enjoyed our stay in NYC! The facility was safe, clean, and near everything we needed. The views from the club house were spectacular, and it was great to sit out on the balcony and take in the city lights.

Kudos to Tre, Jillian, Cenny and Pete for making our stay in NY so memorable. Truly appreciated the early check-in process to accommodate us after a red eye flight. The Happy Hour drinks and snacks gave us a great respite to relax from our busy days. Thank you!

We stayed at the CQ Grand Central 9th -16th October. The location (literally across the road from Grand Central) was brilliant for our sight seeing needs.The greeting when we arrived was friendly and professional meaning the booking in process was quick and simple. Had I booked directly through CQ it would have been even easier with their app.The room was on the 26th floor so traffic noise was minimised, it was also handy for popping up to the club room.The fruit and snacks were very welcome. We didn't go up for the "happy hour" but know it was well attended by the other guests and provides an excellent chance to use the roof terrace.The room was certainly adequate for our needs (two adults) but if you're the sort that likes to really spread out you may be disappointed. The bathroom was compact by many US hotel standards but this is NYC.... what do you expect?All of the staff we met from the foyer to our housekeeper were extremely polite and friendly. I would have no hesitation in booking this hotel again if we were returning to New York.

Loved the location and the room was compact but had everything that we needed for a good price ( booked through Booking.com ). Good coffee and snacks on the 27th floor and nice touch with the reusable water bottles and filler stations.

We loved this hotel, very clean and good sized room we had a double bed and a single pull out sofa and still had loads of room, the beds were really comfy and we all slept great, all the staff I encountered were so nice and helpful, it’s just round the corner across from the market entrance to the grand central station, so good we are booked to go back.

Stayed here last weekend with my girlfriend and we loved it! Amazing price for the location. Clean room. But the best part was the staff. Elizabeth was so helpful and kind and we enjoyed every interaction with other staff members as well. Can't wait to come back!

Hotel is very close by Grand Central.They were friendly at the check in, the room was clean and big. They had free water, tea and coffee. Very happy with my stay. Will definitely come back and stay here next time.

We had an really great experience with this hotel. The staff was extremely friendly and the location can’t be any better. We wanted the New York experience without the craziness of the city. We were walking distance from Times Square and had unlimited food options.

This was my second time at Club Quarters, and on both occasions, the service has been terrific, the room small but beautifully appointed and immaculate. And how could you improve on the location? My wife and I were able to walk to most of the places we needed to be, and we had the sense of being in the very heart of one of the world's great cities — a city even more intense than London, which we visited the month before.

Great staff experience - everyone was friendly and super helpful. The rooms were clean, comfortable, and very quiet! The hotel itself - with Happy Hour, an incredible coffee/espresso machine, and the terrace overlooking the city completed the outstanding experience. Now, if I could just get one of the espresso machines at work...!!

The room was small but the bathroom renovated. The view was not very exciting - just towards an office building and down to some airconditioning installations. The rooftop with drinks all day we enjoyed but the lobby very narrow!

Look around. There is lots of choice in the area that presents as better options. Room are small. Beds are average. There is no foyer to meet in. it is a basic accomodation set up. Staff are polite and helpful.

I had initially written a glowing review of this hotel. However, I just saw a charge on my credit card for this hotel that shouldn't be there. I purchased this through priceline and all costs (room, taxes, etc.) were supposed to be included. I called and they apparently charge a "resort fee" - even though this definitely is NOT anything close to a resort! It's a decent midtown hotel - that's it. I explained that priceline never mentioned anything about a resort fee, nor did their front desk staff when I checked in. I asked them to waive this under the circumstances and they refused. Nothing I can do now, but I wanted to warn other travelers about this bait and switch tactic. I won't be staying here again as a result.

Very good location, excellent conditions.Hotel is clean, we appreciate that they have filtered water for free at every floor.Happy Hour at 5pm every day!!!We plan to return to this location whenever we are going to visit Manhattan.

Nothing special. Rooms were a bit on the small side with small bathrooms as well. Lounge was crowded. Hotel staff was more interested in getting you to sign up for the app than in helping you check out quickly.

Love the hotel's proximity to Grand Central Station. The staff was very attentive to our needs. They had a great free wine happy hour and snacks every day which was nice. The rooftop terrace was wonderful for relaxing with the beautiful view. Would definitely stay at again!

I really enjoyed my stay here. The free drinks and snacks on the 27th floor made all the difference, which is something you don't get at other hotels. The location is probably the best in the area, as you are steps from the Chrysler Building as well as the subway.

Not as good as other Club Quarters I have stayed at. Staff was immature and unprofessional. Elevators made noises that made us feel uncomfortable. Fire Alarm went of four times on a Saturday morning. Even the announcements that they were false alarms were not professional. Concierge was useless. We got out as soon as we could.

Thanks for having us! Love the room and location! The rooftop lounge is a great addition. Checkout via app is the quickest way to do it rather than wait online in the lobby. Highly recommend you join their club membership.

We travel often & it’s rare to find really good customer service.Well, the staff @ Club Quarters Boutique Hotel were the BEST!!! Especially Elizabeth & Sandy-they were outstanding, We enjoyed our stay & will return!!

We had a studio with bedroom, living and kitchen, Bedroom was spacious, view was amazing, the staff very friendly. We have to teens that slept on the extended couch very comfortable. We appreciated the "Happy Hour " and also the fact that snacks were available free 24 h.

I love this hotel! I recently discovered Club Quarters about a year ago and have stayed a few times. Great hotel staff, awesome amenities such as complimentary coffee, wine hour, snacks, etc. The gym is clean and newer equipment, although smaller, gets the job done. This past visit, Greg @ the front desk, was awesome. He was always smiling, helpful and made my stay better.

We absolutely loved Club Quarters. Great location, comfortable room and we loved having a Keurig in our room and the fabulous 27th floor snack room with the great outdoor area. The refillable water bottles on each floor were so handy as we headed out each day. The staff was very accommodating- especially Elizabeth and Greg. We will be back!!

I stayed at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central during the UNGA week this year. This is the second time I stayed there. The hotel is clean, the staff members are friendly and very helpful. The snack bar is so great. And the 5pm happy hour is not to be missed.

My husband and I were in New York both for business and my birthday and we stayed at club Q. Great place. Super easy check-in and out and great room. The room was well laid-out and spacious. As well, the bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows perfect. I don’t like super strong coffee and the coffee in the room was delish. Liked the water bottles you could fill up on each floor. The 27th floor room was a nice plus with munchies and wine at 5 ( we didn’t have but still...) the added bonus was that, when we told the front desk about our recent wedding and my birthday, they brought up wine and chocolates along with a nice note of congratulations. Totally unexpected and sweet. Elizabeth the front desk girl was sweet, gregarious and helpful. She was awesome! We will come back here again for sure!!

Smooth checkin. Nice room. Spacious bathroom and big window. Nice views as of 12 Floor. Complementary water and coffee all day long. Fantastic view from 27 floor terrace. Only downside is very slow elevator.

We were really thrilled with our choice of accommodation as we wanted to be within walking distance but away from Times Square. The room was good sized with lots of storage space. Bathroom was lovely. The staff were all welcoming especially those in the social area. The snacks, coffee and wine were a perfect bonus! Can definitely recommend!

I've stayed at several Club Quarters locations in New York. This CQ is definitely the best experience to date. My room was very comfortable and the lounge space was great. The staff was friendly and helpful. I would definitely choose to stay here again.

I like the terrasse and the staff. Very useful. View was really nice. Drinks, coffee, tea and snacks were nicely arranged. I recommend other colleagues to stay at this hotel. Also very convenient to have a restaurant at the basement

Just got back today from a 4 night stay here. Great location....12 mins walk to Times Square and 18 mins to Empire State building. Grand central is only a few blocks away so accessible for the subway. The room was fine...not massive but NYC rooms rarely are but fine for my partner and I. The hotel has free water bottles and refill stations which were great given it was a very warm average 27 degs during our stay! On the 27th floor there is also complimentary tea, coffee and snacks throughout the day including fruit at breakfast. There is also wine at 5pm every day....great to have a glass sitting out on the terrace.Check in and check out were easy and you can download and app to use the lift and save swiping your room card. Staff were always really helpful and smiling.Overall great place and location. Would happily return!

Can’t beat the location- easy to get to the UN, Grand Central and all the major sites. No frills but very comfortable. Decent sized room, coffee machine and a small seating area. Good size bathroom and water available in recyclable bottles on each floor. The only problem was the TV which didn’t work the way it should and a drip drop in the air conditioning unit (I think) that kept me awake. I did the laundry service and it was efficient even though a bit expensive

- The hotel is very noisy, so it is hard to have a good sleep.- There are no slippers in the room.- The internet is very to login and every time it requires room #, Name, and email address.- The coffee machine is almost on the floor so it is not easy to use and there is no kettle for hot water.- The snack bar on the top floor is helpful but the coffee machine does not already work.- When I checked out, I was asked if I want to get my receipt printed or emailed. I said both. Then I was told that the printer was broken. One week later, I still have not received receipt in my email. I called back and left a message and no one returned. I just called back again and hopefully I will receive my receipt soon. It is a terrible experience to chase the receipt so that I can process my business trip related costs.

Good value, great rooftop lounge, amazing staff. The showers sucked with handheld shotty heads. The TV in room never worked well as well. Overall, it’s a pretty compact hotel with no employee elevator...but good value for its location.

upstairs during the happy hour we had the pleasure of being greeted by the amazing and gorgeous host, Elizabeth. she was so sweet and really made our stay at the club quarters! will definitely be back because of her!!

This is the best possible location if you like to get about on foot,also handy for Grand central and times square, simple rooms that work,good coffee always available in the lounge.GoodGfree wine available after five everyday with snacks.

Such a great hotel. We booked fairly last minute and got a great price. The hotel is in a good location just around the corner from grand central. The rooms were clean and had all we needed in them. The hotel lounge was such a money saver, we could get a coffee, fruit and a cereal bar for breakfast and have a glass of wine and snacks before heading out for the evening. It also had a lovely terrace with a nice NY view. For what we paid we felt this was a really great NY find!

We stayed two nights and found the service, amenities offered, and its location to be top notchThe hotel is geared toward the business traveller with work space available in the room as well as on the 27th floor. The standard room itself is small but adequate, though the bed could have been more comfortable. Our room 1503 needed some small maintenance.The staff was exceptional and always ready with any assistance.They do offer reduced rate parking should you have a vehicle which was nice. We parked and used the subway or walked wherever we needed to go.They offer a free wine and snacks on the 27th floor each evening, free use of the laundry, easy check in and out among other conveniences.I would not call it a family type hotel, but it is a great spot for the business traveller and adult travellers.

hotel is quick and efficient. Small lobby. Does the job. Rooms are nice and everything is smartly put away. For the price, can't beat this location and the rooms are nothing special but also not dingy or tired (like the nearby Roosevelt!). Nice happy hour amenity and roof deck if you can enjoy that.

Great central location. Staff were very welcoming, friendly and helpful. The snacks and drinks on the terrace every evening is a nice touch. Only slight negative was the WiFi was a bit patchy and kept dropping from my phone

Only staying for one night, but very impressed. Hotel in a nice location, tooms, smart TVs w/pairing ability/apps. However the customer service by Johhny D finding me ketchup in the middle of the night is tops! Came through in the clutch! Staff overall as well, but he went above and beyond.

We loved everything about Club Quarters. The rooms, cleanliness, staff were ultra accommodating, beds comfortable, price. It was very clear that the staff were interested in meeting your needs. The location was perfection for us as it was across the street from Grand Central Station where we arrive into NYC by train.

The Club Quarters Grand Central is perfectly located for most of my business trips to NYC. Friendly and helpful staff, who seem to actually enjoy helping hotel guests. Great idea the hotel has - the refillable water bottles on each floor. Clean room.

Lovely boutique hotel away from the hubbub of Times Square but close enough to walk to the theatre. Great view of NY from the 27th floor patio. Several nice restaurants in the area. Close to Grand Central and the subway system.

Second stay and noticed that standard is dropping. Window handle was broken, elevator buttons do not work, etc.Nice place but owners should invest a bit to keep up the place. Terrasse is of course great and room are good. Quiet.

After 9 nights at the hotel. I wanted to say that the staff was great and very welcoming, especially Elizabeth who was very helpful and nice and took care of everything I needed with a smile, which defiantly made my stay there much more easier!Hopping to get back soon!

Hotel location is ideal for tourists, with Grand Central station 5 minutes walk and Time Square 20 minutes. Room was clean, comfortable and a good size for a basic room. Staff were pleasant, welcoming and always keen to assist

It was OK, but would likely not stay there again. It's a bit of a small think, but if a guest needs an iron and ironing board, I don't feel the guest should have to go to a communal closet inn the hall to get it and hope it is available.

Perfect for my meeting at MetLife building. Easy check-in and person at reception stopped her discussions with someone to actually help me check out since that was a quick transaction. Good service personnel.

This hotel is everything you need in NYC - convenient location near Grand Central, very nice staff, easy check in and check out, affordable, and most importantly...clean. The daily happy hour is a great perk as well!

Once again we stayed at the Club Quarters/ Grand Central Location.Everything about the hotel is marvelous....from the location, to the price, to the friendly, caring and helpful staff. A special thanks to Elizabeth/ Liz, at check out for being so kind and friendly.Simply put, this is a great place to stay

We stayed in this hotel at the end of August and then again for three nights in September.This is a great hotel in a fantastic location. Close to Grand Central station, The Empire State and the Chrysler Building. My partner is in a wheelchair, so things aren’t always easy. The staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful. Yes, the rooms are small, but it’s Manhattan, if you want a big room, you’re gonna have to pay way more than Club Quarters prices. The room was very clean and had everything we needed.I would say the only downside to this hotel is the very temperamental elevators!!! Don’t always expect to end up on the floor you want at the first time of trying.That said, we would definitely stay here again due to location and friendly staff.

This was my second stay at CQ Grand Central, and although the room was rather dark, on a lower floor this time, the room itself, the amenities, & the service were all very satisfying and professional. It’s location is in the center of the heart of Manhattan: minutes from Grand Central. The roof deck, in particular, is a welcome refuge and resource. My reservation, and my check-in was last minute so the room assignment was understandable. The desk clerk managed to provide an improved room for the second day and night. CQ will remain among my first choices for a stay in NY.

I enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters. Very clean spaces, LOVED the lighting in the bathroom for getting ready in the moring. Nice work space as well as very relaxing. Enjoyed the "Living Room" on the top floor and the view was amazing.

Great location, comfortable room, plenty of snacks to choose from on the 27th floor. The coffee was excellent. The views from the top terrace were spectacular. I definitely liked that you had chilled water on each floor.

Great location, friendly staff and a clean room. Great free wine and snacks between 5-6 in the roof top bar. Would recommend to anyone visiting New York. Staff always welcomed you as you came in and out of the hotel and made us feel very welcome. From Hannah and Tom

This location by far was the best and I'd been to NY more than 3-4 times, this is the most centrally located hotel, close to touristy sites, local shops, train station, and main shopping area of 5th avenue. Price of the room was reasonably by NY standard and my room wasn't like a shoe box, so I can't complain much. I only don't like the noise due to lower level room assignment, window facing the main street. Other than that, I love this hotel location and the perks - Wine at 5 everyday at Level 27, what a view of NY skyline!!!

The cost is reasonable compare with another same level hotel. I spended lots of time for looking for accomodation. Because newyork hotel cost is really expensive. I kept searching internet review. So i choose this one.I also recommend this hotel. Clean, good staff, good condition bath.Location is not in main. But it doesn’t matter for sightseeing

Great hotel at a perfect location in NY city. We were 3 persons and the room was big enough considering we are talking about New York. Grand Central was around the corner so there was no problem to get anywhere. On the 27th floor there was coffee, sodas, fruits and snacks available for free and the terrace was a great place to hang out. I would recommend this hotel anytime. We‘ll come back here 100%.

Clean, modern, efficient hotel with friendly and helpful staff. Beds are comfortable and hotel was quiet except for the expected street noise here and there. Location is terrific and there is a poke/ramen place across the street -- what more could you want? Rooftop terrace is beautiful. Coffee, water, snacks, fruit all available around the clock. Did not use the gym or laundry facilities but would have for a longer stay. Rooms are small but well thought out and there is everything one generally wants/needs. A/C worked great. Elevators are a bit finicky but not a big deal. I found this hotel to be much preferable to bigger hotels like the Hyatt or Marriott.

We were very satisfied with our stay and the price (relative to NYC pricing). Generally clean and comfortable and friendly staff. The hotel is a bit nontraditional in that the lobby is small and bare bones, but the rooms are pretty typical, and the hotel has a large indoor and outdoor area on the 27th floor with coffee, tea, water, and snacks that is basic but nice. By the time we got back at night, the snacks were down to apples and oranges, but in the morning there were also jars of nuts, M&Ms, little pieces of toast, and one or two other things.The room was not large but larger than we expected, and the bathroom was large by NYC standards. No tub, but nice sized shower, and plenty of flat space to put toiletries. Not as many towels as most hotels provide, but enough. And they did provide shampoo, soap, etc. The bed was comfortable enough; only two pillows but oversized ones. A/C worked fine. There is no minibar in room, but there is a Keurig with both caffeinated and decaffeinated tea and coffee. We were on the 12th floor facing the street; you could hear the street but it wasn't loud.The elevators did not seem to take an inordinate amount of time. Though we never made it to the wine happy hour, it seems like a nice amenity.This area of Manhattan is generally a bit quieter than other areas, at least on weekends, but we like that, and this hotel is just a few short blocks from Grand Central.

great location near Grand Central Station. Like most hotels in NYC it now has the dreaded resort-destination fee, but at least at this hotel you feel like you get something for it. A lovely penthouse lounge with patio, snacks and happy hour with decent wines.Rooms were tiny (reminded me of a cruise ship) but well laid out, but bathrooms spacious. Who is in their room much in NYC anyway?Great staff, especially Elizabeth at the front desk and happy hour pourer!

Bit tired and didn’t feel value for money. Good location but room was basic, lifts took forever to come every time and always only 2 out of 3 working. Price wasn’t cheap so was a bit of a let down unfortunately

We are regulars at all the Club Quarters in NYC. But the Grand Central location is a gem! We hosted an event at the rooftop one night, and our stay during the week was so pleasurable. Not to mention that Greg G. is so hospitable, he gave us great tips on where to dine. Definitely coming back again, but not soon enough!

Very good! it is the second time that I stay there. I loved and recommend that to another friend that will stay at happy new year! The happy hour is excellent! The wine and snack is so good and I loved MM chocolat. There some fruits. Marcos attended us and he is a very good person.

Many thanks to the Club Quarters staff, especially Jillian on reception, for making our brief stay in NY so enjoyable. The room was spotlessly clean, staff so friendly and location was perfect. Definitely the place to stay on our next trip...see you then!

Good location near Grand Central Station. Decent rooms - not heaps of space (understandable in NY), and a little dated. We weren’t allowed in even an hour or two early to our room, which was not our experience anywhere else in NY or the States, and frustrating given we’d flown overnight from San Fran. We loved the rooftop space and free drinks during happy hour.

Well located to Grand Central Terminal and the subway system. Check in was a breeze. There is a lobby and a very large patio on 27th floor with free drinks and snacks. The views are great . I would consider staying at Hotel Boutique again.

This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to many attractions and super close to Grand Central for public transportation. The rooms are small, but well appointed. I wouldn't recommend more than two people share a room. The room was also quiet even the rooms with a view. They offer some unique and awesome amenities in this hotel, like the room on the 27th floor that always has snacks, coffee, ice and water available along with a great view. They also have a nice workout room and offer the use of a washing machine and dryer for free. Now with that being said, this place is not without it's quirks. They are bare bones when it comes to pillows, only two, guess we could have asked for more, it just seemed like too much trouble. The A/C in our room made a crazy rattling noise, again our fault for not letting them know and giving them a chance to fix it. And like many NYC hotels the elevator was a bit slow at times, and you had to use your keycard before choosing a floor, this was tricky to achieve and aggravating at times. One more thing, I don't think they offer king sized beds. Maybe they have a few but were no longer available when we traveled. Now with that being said, I would not hesitate to stay here again, especially if the price is right.

Great location, decent room space , very helpful staffs, professional service. The club living room is located in the top floor, from which you can find a good view of the midtown area. Before stay in CQ, I also spent 8 days in another 4-star hotel in midtown west of NY, but I'd say CQ providers much better service.

Stayed a few nights during a business trip to NY.The location is great- you can walk ( it’s not super close but it is walkable) to Central Park and there are plenty of nice little cafes and shops around the corner from this hotel. Ofcourse there is also the grand central building where you can take the subway various directions which was practical and an experience in itself!In the afternoon you can enjoy the roof Terrace with a drink during the social which was a quite nice little extra.Rooms a small but I’ve gathered that’s typical NY..

This hotel is in a perfect location, with lovely, clean rooms and common spaces for lounging, taking in the view or having a snack. And if you want an elegant meal, there a restaurant on the lower level that's first class! From the first moment I walked in I was welcomed by one of the friendly staff--Greg...and later was expertly assisted by Elizabeth getting cabs, and answering questions...This hotel will be my choice whenever I return to NYC.

Great customer service from all the staff, and we enjoyed the happy hour service a lot. The view from the rooftop was breathtaking and had a nice area to sit and relax. I would definitely love to return to this hotel.

Great location one block from Grand Central Station and a few blocks away from Times Square (enough away so you don’t have to deal with the traffic). Awesome friendly staff (Elizabeth) and 27th floor free snacks, water, soda and coffee all day was wonderful. 5pm free wine and additional snacks incredible. Discount on parking down the street (ICON - 33/night) are you kidding me? Can’t find that anywhere else.

We stayed here for a business trip. The club room is very small, but had a bar fridge and microwave. The location is excellent. The room was very clean, and the staff helpful. There is a hospitality room on the 27th floor with a terrace area. There are free drinks and snacks 24/7 and free wine from 5-6pm. The Italian restaurant attached to the hotel had very average food. I’d stay here again, but would get a bigger room. The a/c was too loud to have on to sleep, so it made the night very hot.

This is truly my favorite hotel in NYC. I’ve never had any issues, and I always feel comfortable, safe, and at home here. The rooftop/lounge, location, and other amenities can’t be beat. Highly recommend!

Loved the location -- steps from Grand Central. Room was nice and comfy if a bit on the smaller side. Absolutely LOVED the terrace/lounge on the 27th floor. Great views and great place to meet friends. I would definitely stay here again.

In the heart of the City of NY, this hotel is quiet and understated,. Good place for business, walk to everything. No restaurant or bar but there are thousands next door. If you don't need a doorman to open the door for you or a bell hop to take your bags, you will like this hotel.

First, THE GOOD. The location is convenient (across from Grand Central and right on Lexington Ave, useful for grabbing taxis), the bed was comfortable, the water pressure was strong, and the internet connection was reliable -- so this hotel it hit my Top Four needs nicely. THE BAD. The rooms are ridiculously tiny even by Manhattan standards. The luggage surface accommodates only modest-sized suitcases, so I had to hoist my large suitcase onto the desk -- but it's not really a desk, just a horizontal board resting on somewhat wobbly legs, something clearly designed to look stylish more than offer any practical use. A lightbulb was out by the bed (sorry, but this is worth noting in a room with only two lamps) and the light at the bathroom mirror didn't work. Don't bother having any guest meet you in the lobby, which is a small room with no place to sit and a little ck-in stand like a restaurant maitre d' would use. When I asked for a 1pm checkout instead of noon, I was told that would cost an additional $50. Even with the pluses mentioned above, why would I want to return to a place that nickels and dimes you like this, when the city has so many properties that make me feel welcome?

Staff very thoughtful and helpful. Room was minimum... too much light from the glass door to the bathroom in the night and morning. More amenities in the bathroom please... and guest "closet" in hall was nearly empty.

Rooms as expected are small but they have everything you need.comfy beds & modern style and most importantly in my case is great location. I’d come here again If traveling solo or with a partner. Spend your whole day and night outside, enjoy NYC. You should only need the room for recharging your energy.

It took 4 hours to check in after being told over and over that my room wasn't ready. I've never had this type of issue before and it was very disappointing and tiring. Probably won't be staying here again.

Outstanding service. We have stayed at several club quarters and we like Grand Central the best. Not to say that the other ones are not good. But we really like Grand Central the best. Outstanding customer service. The rooms are very clean as is the entire hotel. It was a great place for us to spend our 40th wedding anniversary

Stayed here for 4 nights in early August. My third time in NY but my first time staying in this hotel and I hope it won’t be my last. Excellent location close to Grand Central Station & subway. Nice coffee shops & restaurants close by for good food. Grand Central food market across the street & a few nice Irish bars within a few minutes walk for a night cap. Check in & out was very easy. Water stations on every floor a big plus. Didn’t use lounge but it is a nice addition to have free snacks & hot drinks available throughout the day. Nice spacious room with plenty of room for big cases. Overall noise was not an issue in comparison to other areas of Manhattan.

This hotel is very nice, clean and staff was friemdly and helpful. The location made it easy to get around the city. We've made 6 trips to nyc and this was our favorite hotel so far. Would stay there again for sure! The 27th floor hospitality room with outdoor patio was outstanding!!!

Ordinarily, as a member locked into the Intercontinental Hotel Group, we'd almost always stay at a Crowne Plaza, Intercontinental or Holiday Inn. However, we used to stay often at the original Club Quarters in midtown Manhattan and Wall Street. The staff at CQ were just wonderful from the moment we stepped into the hotel. All staff members wishes us good morning/afternoon/evening with a sincere smile. The front desk staff were superb and more engaged than any hotel employee I have spoken with for a while (I wish I had kept their names so I could thank them directly here).The room and bathroom was spotless and in great condition. Our room was rather small, but perfectly functional. The bed and linens were very comfortable. I normally request a high floor in Manhattan, but no this occasion, we were given a seventh floor (of 26). However, we both slept very well, since although our room looked out on to Lexington Avenue, the room is wonderfully sound-proofed (unlike many).The hotel has a comfortable 27th floor lounge with a beautiful patio affording views up and down Lexington and a direct view of the spire of the Chrysler Building.Beautiful branding throughout the hotel, Thoughtful amenities such as water filling stations with recyclable bottles. Coffee on demand in the 28th floor lounge area. Checkout could not have been simpler, and one of the best employees even got our bags for us after having clocked out.Club Quarters, Grand Central was beyond faultless!

The Club Quarters at Grand Central Station exceeded our expectations. The staff was courteous and helpful. The room was clean, very nice, and comfortable. The Living Room and outdoor deck on the top floor was unique and most enjoyable and especially appreciated the coffee machine in the morning!

This hotel is located near Grand Central terminal. The hotel and room were immaculate , free wi-fi, nice tv. There’s a rooftop terrace open to hotel guests with coffee, water and snacks. We loved this hotel and will stay again.

Had an amazing time at Saturday happy hour all you can drink wine with staff members Elizabeth and Marcos. They were both very sweet and even gave suggestions of places to visit in the city! Thanks again! Will definitely suggest and book again with Club Quarters Grand Central.

Great value for money just steps away from Grand Central Station. Kind and friendly staff who were always willing to help. The hotel was clean, the rooms were newly renovated, and the bathroom was OK. Most importantly: location, location, location. Situated on 45th Street and Lexington, being so close to Grand Central Station was a huge plus. I definitely recommend this hotel.

The room was reasonably priced for midtown Manhattan and provided everything I needed from a place to get my work done to a place for getting some sleep. It had it all, the hotel certainly knows how to maximize the space it provides.

Fantastic location near Grand Central Terminal, near to various buses and subway lines. Simple hotel rooms, but lacking nothing. Great little lounge on the 27th floor with a terrace and some cool views.

Excellent location convenient to metro and shops. Most pleasant staff, friendly and kind. Comfortable room larger than we expected with a well- designed sitting area. Modern shower, clean room and well- appreciated coffee device

Rooms are small like every other NYC hotel, but very comfortable and clean. Quiet despite being steps from Grand Central, comfortable bed. Very happy with our stay overall. PS Free bottled water, coffee and daily free wine hour before dinner were a classy touch.

This is my second stay at your facility. We have visited three CQ locations and Grand central is the best.! Like to take this opportunity to thank your staff members for their professional assistance. Special appreciation goes to Jillian and Elizabeth, for going above and beyond to make accommodations after my over night flight... the other front desk staffs were always friendly and willing to help, the gentlemen working on the 27th lounge keep the place clean and well maintained all the time ( it is not easy to keep the lounge ready and presentable 24/7!). Overall, I have noticed that staff member at your facility pay attention to what they do. Not only they do their job well but they make the guests fell they like what they are doing ! I have stayed in other hotels, Jillian, Elizabeth, and all your hardworking pprofessionals have made CQ Grand Central standing out! Also like to mention your clean rooms, microwave, fast elevators, coffee and snacks, especially the 27th floor lounge with a view ... I have left a review on Hotels.com . I booked with them.

The hotel is right next to grand central which made taking the subway so much easier! The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The only negative feedback would be the shower pressure was terrible. The sink had more pressure lol. But the bed and view was fantastic. And the lounge on the rooftop... WOW!!! Free snacks and coffee all day and then free wine from 5-6?! It was FANTASTIC!

Really enjoyed my two-night stay at the CQ Grand Central. It feels like a new hotel, with updated room features (plenty of outlets), and speedy elevators. The staff are all great - based on their attitude, this hotel is well managed. They have a really nice top floor lounge with snacks and sodas, and a late afternoon happy hour. There's a deck to get some fresh air and a view of the Chrysler building nearby. The location is just a block from Grand Central. I was on the back side of the hotel - still had a little view but no street noise, which was great. Will definitely stay here again on another trip to NYC.

Very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms were small, but you’re in Manhattan! Rooms were very clean and smelled fresh. Bed was super comfy. Twenty-seventh floor is goo for a quick snack or coffee, with a terrace and business center.

Next to, practically in, Grand Central. Great location. Great value. Well run. Clean room. Highly recommend. Not easy to find a reasonable place in midtown with great security. The free snacks, the free laundry and the views from 27th FL make this a must go to hotel in NYC

This is the newest in the Club Quarters chain and the new design is fantastic. Always a great value, super clean, comfortable and efficient, I was most impressed by Sandy who helped me professionally, kindly and efficiently with a tricky reservation situation I created by mistake. Definitely recommend this hotel highly!

This was an excellent hotel to stay at in the heart of Manhattan. Clean room, and really helpful and friendly staff members. The little extras made this hotel great: a small gym, laundry room and lounge and balcony with free snacks and a great view (and free wine for a couple of hours each day!). I’d definitely stay again.

I enjoyed my stay. They had thought of all the essentials!Restaurant on the 27th Floor has fruits and snacks for residents free of charge all day round, purified water on all floors,Happy hour with free wine every day at five pm.Business centre free of charge...what more could I ask for?

I stay at this hotel in your CQ chain whenever it is available when I come to NY. The African American male at the front desk is so helpful. He has checked me in the last three times I have stayed and remembered me, which considering NYC, is pretty amazing. He always has a warm greeting and supplies efficient information. I have stayed at all your NY locations over the past 15 years, and this guy should be made manager at those locations. The staff at the other locations can never find me in the system, and show little care. The Spanish woman at the front desk was very nice to others that I heard, but I did not have any transactions with her. The 45th st hotel is the place to stay in NYC.

This hotel is located near from grand central station, it’s silent, clean, and the staff is very friendly. The price is good, and this was the second time in that place. The room is small, but in NYC all the rooms are small, so I recommend it.

A little dated setup, but awesome location (2 mins from Grand Central Station), great rooftop lounge and free washing/ dryer! Also, look out for 5 pm wine everyday - which I never did make it anyway due to work ...

I was very happy with this room I reserved on Hotels.com. My first time using the site and this room did not disappoint! Close to GC and the express bus to the airport. Comfortable bed, great waterpressure in the shower. Large enough as not to feel boxed in like lots of other NYC hotels. I was concerned when I saw my room was across from the elevator but I must say I did not hear any noise whatsoever!
