Staff makes you feel very welcome. The are efficient and helpful with anything you need. The location is excellant. Rooms are clean and well kept. The only problem was the layout of the room was crowded for the small space. I liked the snacks on the 27th floor and appreciated the water stations on every floor.

The Club Quarters Hotel was located near Grand Central on E 45th St. The room was small but comfortable and very clean. Very nice for quick overnight stay. The employees very nice and helpful. My only suggestion would be to have some sort of night light. When we left bathroom light on, it lit the bedroom because of translucent window in the door. Had to turn light off and than had trouble finding our way around in the dark Otherwise, very nice

While the rooms are small they are very well laid out. Nice size bathroom with marble shower but no tub. Very good water pressure and adjustable jets. Bed was comfortable but mattress may have been approaching is useful life. Getting off the bed you could feel the coils. Unlimited water bottles and variety of free snack is a really nice set of perks. very nice size wall mounted TV but remote a bit difficult to use on apps. Nice plush towels and really good toiletries. Microwave and mini fridge in room. Super helpful and friendly staff. I needed assistance crossing the street to get Tylenol and the guy at the front desk guided me across and held an umbrella for me, since it was raining.

Arrived with a red-eye from LA. A pleasant surprise was that there was a comfortable and quiet room waiting for me. The rooms are compact but nice and the location is really good for exploring Manhattan.

ELIZABETH is amazing. Greeted us the first day. Want to take her back to Oklahoma!Been here 5 days...she is the only one we, my husband and I, know by name and she knows us and everyone else from the around the world by name. She should have her own hotel, spa, etc.Victoria Woods, Owner ChappelWood Financial Services. 405 348-0909Victoria@ChappelWood.com

I stayed here for five nights with my husband. We originally booked this hotel when it was Hotel Boutique (or prior to Club Quarters taking Hotel Boutique over) so there was some confusion when the taxi dropped us off as noone had informed us but it was a great stay.Staff - all very friendly and helpful - they always checked that you were ok and wished you a great day/night, we had great recommendations for cars/taxis which saved us money! Room - this was spacious for a New York room and given we were only on the 10th floor it was very quiet and we slept really well. We were also located quite near the lifts but were not disturbed at all by them or any guests. Hotel - location is great and right in the middle of Manhattan making most tourist attractions within easy walking distance, it is also located close to Grand Central so getting the subway is easy. So many food options surround the hotel too. The hotel adds great value for money with the free wine and drinks every day along with free soft drinks and snacks all day, use of computers and printers and a lounge/balcony area with views of the Chrysler Building. For a small gym room it had a good mix of equipment meaning you could get a good workout in and quite a few people could fit in all at once.Overall, we had a really great stay and would recommend this hotel for anyone coming to New York.

I have stayed in several NYC hotels and had a great experience here. It is now my #1 place to stay. The hotel is only a couple of blocks from Grand Central Station and an easy walk to Rockefeller Center. The room was very clean and roomier than most in the city.

I stayed here over the last five days and overall had a good experience: comfortable, big bed and firm but comfortable pillows; sockets right by the bedside; an adequate room size; a wardrobe; toiletries; very good soundproofing from the urban jungle outside. A large flatscreen with a decent enough range of channels. Plus a happening happy hour from 5-6pm every day with free wine (a solid, dry white wine from the North Fork included) and snacks (SO yummy granola) and fruit (apples, oranges, pears). But then there are the cons: the lack of a room minifridge is SO ANNOYING. You can leave food with the reception to put in the staff fridge but it’s really trying to have to ask for it each day or night. There’s plenty of room in the room for such a minifridge. The WiFi is also not great: it cuts out here and there and at times made it hard to work in the room. Finally the staff made made me grit my teeth sometimes. I guess they’re trying to be hip and cool but it came across as unprofessional at times: with their jaunty behavior, playing hacky sack in the lobby and the braying guy giving out wine. Maybe I’m just too fuddy-duddy. Finally, the key card system is finicky in the lift and often doesn’t connect you to the floor you want.

Nice property, in a great location. Came on a family trip and it was perfect. The staff was nice and helpful. Rooms are nice sized. Included: smart tv, gym, community washer & dryer, and lounge area on top floor. Highly recommend.

This was our 3rd time staying at this location and it was a great stay! Our room was a club-sized room, which is a little smaller than the standard room, but fine for our needs.It was overlooking Lexington and on the 3rd floor, but we were so tired the street noise really wasn't an issue. It was neat, clean, and in good shape. I would like to compliment the staff as a whole. Check in was super fast and easy, everyone was pleasant and very friendly. The staff appears to love their jobs in the way they interacted with guests. Chris was hilarious! On our last 2 stays, the lounge didn't have happy hour, but now it does, which is a nice addition. Chris mingled with guests and was a superb host. Thank you!I would make some suggestions regarding housekeeping. It would be great if at least a couple of additional towels were stocked automatically. We had 2 bath towels, we were 2 guests, and when I asked for 2 extra they were quickly delivered. I left a note the next morning to please leave us an extra and housekeeping did. On our last night, the tv would not turn off. A tech came up and looked at it, touched something, and the tv went off. In a few minutes, the tv came on again on it's own, and we called back. The tech came up, pulled out the wires and just totally unplugged it so we could get to sleep. We did make sure upon check out that the staff knew that the cables were out because there was an issue. We had a late flight so we hung out in the lounge area until it was time to leave. We enjoyed conversation with Chris again, and some of the other staff members who were preparing things for a gingerbread making party upstairs. Thanks for another great stay! We are looking forward to next year's trip.

The rate is very competitive for NYC so expectations were not to high. Was pleasantly surprise that it’s a full service hotel that gathers well for short overnight stays in NYC. However was extremely disappointed in quality of bed.

Great hotel for the price and position. Check-in was easy. Great common room on the 27th floor. Happy hour and snacks very much appreciated. Ashley at the front desk was extremely helpful with a business matter for me. The Happy Hour Host is great. All the staff are pleasant. Rooms are just fine, mine had a refrigerator and microwave. Free wifi, The position of the hotel is fantastically central. Will stay here again. Highly recommend.

Overall, this was an enjoying place to stay the night while on a business trip to a company nearby on 3rd Avenue. A little bit on the expensive side for the amenities offered, but good enough compared to the other hotels.

Club Quarters has been my go to hotel in NYC for years. It doesn't have bells and whistles but the staff is excellent and accommodating, the rooms are clean, the amenities are great and the location is perfect. It was our first time staying at Grand Central, we usually stay closer to Rockefeller Center but we will definitely book this location next time! Cheers to the staff and the hotel

Good location but few amenities. There is no real breakfast location - it is an Italian restaurant in the basement with a limited menu and no congenial place to meet or even eat. The rooms ae clean,, but Spartan. This is a place to sleep...period.

Shower head not working, the tap was broker, it was a nightmare to take a shower, the water was spraying to the ceiling, it was either cold water or strong stream of hot water.When I told the manager, the was like "OK, you are leaving anyway"

Address is perfect base for walking to everything one needs to do in Midtown and steps from Grand Central with subway lines to where ever else you need to go. Speedy check-in and check-out.Friendly Staff was very accommodating to roommate who arrived hours earlier than me although reservation was in my name. Kitchen area and bathroom in our studio were modern and clean. I did not cook but appreciate having fully-equipped kitchen and option.

The room itself was fine; large for a NYC hotel. But the street noise was horrible. I was given a room on the second floor, so was awoken each morning at 4 a.m. for trash pickup. I could also hear train-track noises, presumably from Grand Central.

My wife and I stayed at the hotel for the first four days of our honey moon. We where received by Zishan who gave us great and warm attention. The faccilities are comfortable and the location unbeatable, at just 3 blocks from grand central Station. We are definitely coming back.

Zishan was an incredibly helpful and kind! We really enjoyed our stay plus the wine functions were very nice as well, beautiful hotel overall thank you again for your accommodation Zishan! Greatly appreciated.

The staff were polite and helpful, the room was clean. There was free snacks on the top floor and a balcony overlooking the Chrysler building. The location of this hotel was excellent, very close to the Grand Central station.

Our second S\sy at the CQ Grand Central. Great location easy walking to shopping, plays etc. Chrisat the evening Wine tasting is a great host as he was last year. Hope to be here again next holiday seaso

Fantastic location across the street from grand central station. Early check in was nice with friendly staff. Small room on 9th floor looking into lex ave. Nicely fitted out , Keurig , fast WiFi free. Piece de resistance is the lounge / terrace. Great cappuccino machine, quality snacks , NYTimes, and views down lex ave , 45th st. Wine at 5pm every evening. Around $200/nt. Tip ask for a high floor with a view.

We had been up and traveling since 3am and were exhausted by the time we got to the hotel. Zishan greeted us promptly and even let us check in early. Great proximity to lots of local sites and grand central.

Firstly the location is fantastic and the staff were very friendly and checked us in and out very efficiently. However we barely slept whilst here due to the heater sounding like a motorbike engine next to our bed. Even if we turned it "Off" it still turned on every few minutes heating up the room more and more so eventually we'd have to turn it back on to cool the room back down. We mentioned it on our first night and an engineer was sent to our room, he manged to make it ever so slightly quieter by sticking some towels underneath it but it barely made a difference and was still very difficult to sleep next to, waking up every half hour or so.

A very comfortable and well located hotel. Efficient and friendly staff. 27 th floor 24 hour lounge especially useful especially for jet lag visits to computer and printer. Two staff members , elizabeth and Antonio were especially. Helpful and friendly in the lounge. Certainly would recommend hotel

Stayed here from 7th Dec , great location, nearly all attractions within walking distance. Received a very warm welcome from receptionists. Emailed hotel prior to visit and asked for flowers and champagne for my wife’s birthday and they were waiting for her in the room , so a big thank you to Mallory for arranging this for me. Great staff, nothing too much trouble. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation.

Fantastic location and very friendly staff. Warm and comfy bed. great complimentary drinks and snacks on 27th floor.Only downside was that room was very small and smelled a little damp.Would definitely stay here again.

Club Quarters Grand Centralade our weekend stay in NYC comfortable and easy. The location was great - walkable to many of the things we wanted to do. The staff went above and beyond - from Davis S at check-in and Chris and Elizabeth at the wine reception. Our room was efficient ( like a cruise ship cabin!) and clean. This hotel offered everything we wanted at s decent price. We will definitely be going back.

Superior service. First room smelled like smoke so they quickly reassigned a room. Great evening cocktail hour. All the staff was very friendly and helpful. Good location, overall only improvement could be the very slow elevators. Dont wait until the last minute to leave for an important work meeting!

From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were made very welcome and totally looked afterAll the staff give the highest customer service and are extremely helpful, informative and friendly The guest lounge on floor 27 is amazing and as we still had the use of this on our last day it made a huge difference to our holidayThe rooms are really comfortable and spacious I would highly recommend this hotel for its location, comfort, cleanliness and great staff.

The CQ Grand Central was a very comfortable hotel with excellent staff. I had no issues during my stay. - Free water in dispensers on every floor- 27th floor has lounge with free espresso/coffee machine to recharge, snacks all day, including breakfast bars and fruit in the AM. Happy Hour with free wine in the evening from 5-6.- Lounge also has many places to sit and relax, take in the views etc.- Room had great WiFi, easy to connect and fast- TV had apps to connect to Netflix, Prime etc.- Elevator was fine, but everyone seemed to have a little difficulty from time to time getting their room key to work selecting floor. They have an app you can use as well for room key and elevator, but I did not try it.- Every encounter with staff was pleasant. They were accommodating and thoughtful.- Many plugs for charging and dimmer lights next to bed.- Mini fridge, microwave and sitting area/table to do work or snack at. Nice shower, hooks by the door and good air quality!

Our reservation was booked through Booking.com. Hotel name was Hotel Boutique at Grand Central, located at 447 Lexington Ave, Luckily I called from the airport to ask an unrelated question, and heard on the recording that the address was actually 128 E. 45th St. It wasn't until our cab pulled up, I saw the name was Club Quarters. Other than that, nice stay, great staff, great location!

An excellent small hotel with great atmosphere. Top location near Grand Central with good outlook, well designed rooms and enthusiastic staff. The level 27 lounge is a great social space with 'wine at five' a special treat. All in all quite unique.

Very clean, modern and centrally located hotelWalking distance from GC Train Station, Times Square, 5th,6th and 7th Avenue shoppingBeautiful lounge area on the top floor that over looks the city life!

Lovely hotel. Fab central location. Very friendly staff. Lovely rooms and the beds are so comfy Lovely touch with the free coffee and snacks on the 27 Floor. We stayed on the 25 floor. There was a coffee machine in your room and bottled water just outside

Perfect!Great location, friendly helpful staff. Highly recommended! Wonderful rooftop lounge with tea, coffee (inluding latte and cappicino) plus all sorts of snacks and fruits. I couldn’t ask for more!

First time staying at club quarters. Clean, convenient and staff very friendly. Was told the rooms would be small, but it was about the same size room as those of other mid-town hotels. The lobby is small and can get over crowded. Will stay there again.

The room was nice and clean, a bit bigger than expected for NYC. Comfy mattress however we were suppose to have a queen it was more like a double. Happy hour is a nice added touch with free wine and snacks at 5 everyday

Great location. Rooms are plenty big. Pretty quiet on the 23rd floor. I missed the happy hour, but plan to be there next time. Coffee in the morning in the lounge and also in the room. Happy to return to this property.

Great location near Grand Central Terminal. Bathroom was first rate. Fitness room had towels and water and new equipment. Check in was easy. The bedroom had a good layout. The messages from the staff ahowed evidence that they valued my business.

Have stayed in New York before and had a great time. As for this time same again and was not disappointed as for the hotel great stay fantastic location and can’t fault the staff the only thing I wished I had asked for was a room higher up for better view and less noise other than that thank you for a wonderful stay.

I was skeptical for some reason about Club Quarters, but we had a excellent stay. From the moment we entered the lobby (which isn't really a lobby - just a few manned kiosks) Sandy welcomed us in a very warm way. She was delightful and we talked about her 5 star service. The room is small but normal for NYC standards. Clean and new its a perfect place to stay especially when you are in NYC. We visited the 27th floor and were surprised to see a few snacks, coffee, and beverages available for free. The view from upstairs is great - Helmsley and Chrysler Buildings. David Scott was charming and helpful both as our wine hour host and in taking our bags in after check out. I recommend this hotel wholeheartedly.

Close to Grand Central, clean, well organized, friendly helpful smiling staff. Love the 24 hour snacks and great coffee. We will definitely stay here again. Rooms are on the pricey side , but secure and comfortable.

This hotel is all you need for a short stay in New York. It is clean, centrally located but the best thing of all are the friendly helpful staff. Special mention to Chris, the host on the 27th floor who supervises Happy Hour - free wine! (5 -7pm). It’s the perfect place to relax after sightseeing and good way to chat to other guests. The rest of the time there is hot beverages soft drinks and snacks here. There’s a glass room where you can see the twinkling lights of Manhattan. Chris is a great host who can’t do enough for you. There’s also free hot drinks in the room.Why go anywhere else?!

Myself, my husband and 11 month old stayed here two weeks ago. The location was great. We could walk to time square, central park, the empire state building. We were just off Lexington Ave and a short walk to 5th Ave. Room was clean and spacious. We had a kitchenette which was great with a baby. Super view too. We could use washing facilities free of charge. Only down side was our microwave oven was not working which would have been handy for heating food but that really is only downside. Room may not reflect price but location does.

Four nights at this hotel. Comfortable, clean rooms, small but on par with other hotels we have stayed at in NYC. Staff are very friendly - special mention must go to David Scott and Chris (didn’t get Chris’s surname). Both of them served us in “The living room) with free wine and snacks. They both made us feel like family, a difficult thing to find at hotels, but we really enjoyed their company. Definitely return to this hotel, location is great, across from grand central station.

The room was dirty. Half the lights didn’t work. The shower head leaked everywhere and was difficult to get focus in one direction. The ads did not equal what I found. Don’t be duped by the glitzy ads!

Great hotel experience close to shops, events and restaurants! I have been using Club Quarters Hotels for more than 5 years, started with business travel and now also use for personal travel. All of the locations where I stayed have been great experiences. This includes all of the NYC locations and Boston.

Very good located, the rooms well equipped, very friendly and attentive staff, nice features for free (washing machine/dryer, snacks/beverages in the roof top lounge, free water on the floor, yoga mat in each room, fast wifi anywhere in the hotel).

Stayed in the hotel for 5 nights as part of a holiday to New York, San Francisco and Vegas. The hotel is in a great location however the room was tiny and since we were in USA for 3 weeks we had large suitcases and nowhere to store them. This wasn't too much of a problem as we didn't spend much time in the room but we were tripping over each other when we were both in the room. One concierge was very helpful, another not so much. Wine hour is a nice touch. Only other negative is that there was no safe in the room. Overall for a trip to NY it wasn't bad.

The hotel is well organized, have a grate common area at the top floor, close to the Grand Central Station so give a great mobility in NYC and other cities. All in it was the best cost/benefit relationship I got in years.

I spent a night at the Club Quarters at Grand Central. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The room was perfect, clean, modern and quiet. The location was central to everything. You cannot beat the value of Club Quarters.

We enjoyed the location of Club Quarters, Grand Central. It was close to so much that we could walk to. The hotel was clean; Chris provided great, friendly, personable service along with others. They were all able to suggest places to eat and how to get there.

Great weekend, great location. Room very tight but we made it work. The room was designated for "3" but we had to put the roll away up against the cabinets to have a smidge of walking room to the bathroom.

Nice location, but not 4 stars hotel, e.g. no valet parking, no help with luggage etc. long wait for one of only 3 elevatorsOk room, but needs an upgrade.Small closet, enough room only if you’re staying for the night

Great location that gave me access to transportation (subways, cobs, and Lift). Outstanding staff that made sure everything was taking care of. The facilities are comfortable and great business areas to work and catch up with colleagues.

When researching NY we stumbled across the Club Quaters. And we are so pleased we did. The accommodation is clean and well presented. As you would expect in NY, the rooms are smaller but adequate and the bathrooms were spotless and everything worked. We stayed at the Grand Central location, which is perfect for most tourist attractions. The lounge on the 27 floor is a nice addition, with 24 hour tea, coffee and snacks and wine and beer for an hour in the evening. The best however is the staff. They are friendly, fun and provide good service. A stay at Club Quaters is definitely worth considering and we will book their properties in other cities as well.

Chris is a fantastic host he made us feel super welcome, very charming and a cool dude! The hotel was great and the wine at 5 was always a good time! Thanks guys will stay here again! The rooms were very clean and the lounge has a great view of the NYC skyline. Highly recommended.

The hotel features smaller well thought out rooms that are clean, modern and close to Grand Central Station at 45th and Lexington. There is also a great lounge on the 27th floor for complimentary coffee and snacks along with free glasses of wine from 5-6pm daily.

This hotel was in a great location. Super close to the subway station and walking distance from major attractions. Would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff was very welcoming. The snacks are a nice bonus.

We had a great stay at this hotel very relaxed atmosphere ,staff very friendly rooms cosy but had everything you need ,happy hour daily at 5 snacks available all day with coffee machine.Roof terrace with amazing city views .Free laundrette service. Chris was the hotel influencer fun guy will make you feel at home ,thanks to all staff we really enjoyed it and will def be back .

Clean rooms, centrally located, nice extra's, great service. I stay at this location for 1 week every month, the staff are great. I highly recommend this hotel to business travellers, it is much better than similar hotels in the same area and price category

Where do I start?... what an amazing trip. Defiantly one to remember. Wonderful, clean room with great views. Lush refreshments and free wine ... the biggest shout out and praise to the staff. They deserve a promotion and pay increase especially Elizabeth (she’s a total queen- and needs to be promoted ASAP), David, Wilkin and the team for making our trip extra special.I would 100% stay again. I stayed at the Club Quarters in Chicago and loved it. And the CQ Grand Central one did not disappoint. Love love love! Great thanksgiving week!

This was a convenient and comfortable place to stay in midtown. I appreciated the free laundrette and the lounge on the 27 th floor with happy hour. David Scott and Chris were good hosts. I would stay here again.

Good value for short business stays. Friendly staff and good common working lounge / terrace on top floor with complimentary refreshments. Rooms are smallish, so recommended if you plan to spend most of your time out and about.

Great room, great service at the front desk, and I would definitely stay here again. The people at the front were very helpful with storing bags and arranging transportation. Free water bottles which was great!

I have stayed here many times and I keep coming back for all my midtown NYC trips. It is in a good location and the rooms are clean, safe, and in good condition. The staff is friendly and happy to help you. I have never had an issue at this hotel.

Very much enjoyed our stay at Club Quarters Grand Central, which was well located directly across the street from the aforementioned Grand Central Station. So very easy to get from point A to point B, whether using the subway or walking.

Great location, very helpful and friendly staff, and the room was clean, spacious and well-equpiied.I recommend drinking and / or eating in Davio's Restaurant in the basement. Great food and wine and the staff are also very good.

This property is clean, comfortable, close to Grand Central which is great location. There are a large number of quality restaurants fairly priced near by. I enjoy the happy hour, every time I am greeted by friendly and helpful staff. David Scott went out of his way to help me with luggage as well as provide directions. The people that work for the hotel make you feel very welcome.

A hotel perfectly located within reach of anything that you wish to see/visit in NYC. The friendly and helpful staff, cosy rooms, free availability of bottled water and snacks, and views will not disappoint.

This was my second stay at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central. The lobby, like the rest of the facility, is compact, but the rooms are comfortable, the amenities surprisingly varied and the location cannot be beat. What is more, the staff is professional, friendly and accommodating.

Visited for a few nights for the marathon. Room was clean and well-equipped with a comfy bed, and the table with seating was a nice bonus. The room was a little on the small side maybe, but that's the norm for New York.Hotel itself had good amenities, including a 'living room' that offered free wine for an hour every evening and a free laundrette. It's also in a convenient location for quite a few of NY's landmarks (walking distance to the chrysler building, Grand central, times square etc).A final mention goes out to the staff. They were all very friendly whenever we encountered them in the elevator or on the corridors, with the cleaners tidying the room consistently well and keeping the tea/coffee filled. Staff will also go the extra mile, with a special shout out to Jannine, who was able to help ship my passport to our next hotel in Philadelphia after I managed to leave it behind!Overall, great place to stay.

Snacks, drinks, Chris the hotel Influencer. What more do you need?Good sized room for downtown.Clean, newer decor, decent for on the top.Convenient location 1/2 block from my client so we will be returning often over the next 3 years.

Great location to explore NYC. And what a view we had from our room!Staff was friendly and helpfull. Room was clean and spacious enough. Very quiet.In the morning there is coffee and cereal bars available.Between 5 and 6 they offer wine or soda' and snacks. David entertained the crowd, great show he gave. :-)

Great location close to grand central terminal. Excellent facilities on the top floor, great staff and service. You can do some washing and fill up your water bottles get ice or catch up on the computers/ wifi in the lounge . The snacks were great and 5 ‘o’clock wine hour is great .Very comfy bed and bathroom really good. Had a great stay.

The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel and rooms are always clean and the 27th floor common area has great views, snacks and drinks. An additional benefit is the filtered water stations on each floor-convenient and great to have handy.

Had a great stay at the Club Quarters! Wine @5 was a great surprise and location was great! The Hotel Influencer was a great treat and very entertaining! View from the hotel lounge was amazing! Definitely worth a visit!

I really appreciate the wine at 5 after a long busy day and love the snack variety . Staff is always helpful and love the choices of coffees in the morning. Great view from the 27th flood of Manhattan.

I chose this hotel due to price and location. They are located central to our office and at a lesser rate than most other chains. I was pleasantly surprised at the facility as a whole. The friendliness of the staff and cleanliness of the rooms was exceptional.

Never having been to New York before, we really did not have a clue about where best to stay. we were staying weekend of marathon so prices were higher than usual but Club Quarters offered the best deal. It is in a great position for sightseeing - just a block from Grand Central -which is now my favourite rail station ever! we arrived late at night to be greeted by Gillian who was ever smiling and helpful. our room was comfortable with a view of the Chrysler building - lit up at night it personified the New York we see so often in films Bed was comfy and there is a bench and table if you want to eat or work in your room. Bathroom was roomy and very clean. An added bonus of Club Quarter hotels is there living room and terrace on the top floor. You can grab tea coffee and cold sodas here at any time plus snacks and fruit. Its pleasant to sit out on the terrace and watch the world go by too. Each floor has a water cooler with re usable bottles which is also useful. the staff are helpful if you need advice on planning your day and I would happily recommend this hotel.

The rooms are a bit dated as another reviewer pointed out, but it's a nice hotel that is clean and well managed. I had a "superior" room, and wasn't sure what that meant when I booked it. I don't think there would be room for three but a couple could be very comfortable in this room. Queen bed, dining table/desk with two chairs, twin sized couch bed, wardrobe, very nice bathroom with walk in shower. The bathroom is a big plus. Great shower! Also a fridge, microwave, coffee maker and nice big screen TV with lots of channels. I thought the housekeeping was just phenomenal! But the big selling point is the location. Not very noisy but still in the heart of midtown Manhattan. A couple of blocks to Grand Central Station. Maybe a ten minute walk to Time Square. Restaurants everywhere. To me it felt like shelter from the storm, a nice retreat after a long business day.

The perfect ease for business travels: Complimentary water bottle service in the hallway makes it easy to stay hydrated. Laundry room, just in case. The best part, was the Peloton spin bike in the fitness room. It was nice being located across the street from the Grand Central Station. I was able to grab a coffee and a quick bite to eat before heading to my conference.

Our room was mostly clean but dated-it didn’t look like those shown on the website. I didn’t feel that it was a great value for what we paid. We found unwrapped sticky candy stuffed in the chair. The club floor was nice and had great views. The elevators took ages to come, if we weren’t on the 10th floor we probably would have just taken the stairs. Good location.

We spend 5 nights in this hotel for the TCS New York City Marathon. We had an excellent stay in the hotel. Rooms were big enough, equipped with modern stuff (yes! USB outlets!), friendly staff, and the lounge at the 27th floor was cozy, terrace with a magnificent view, free coffea/tea/snacks. (i especially loved the iHome alarm clock... went all over the internet to get one myself... none found...:( )2 blocks from a public transport hub (Grand Central), within our block nice bars (The Wheeltapper) and restaurants (Blackwells). For an excellent city trip, i would highly recommend this hotel!

This was my first trip to New York and one of the best things about the trip was the Club Quarters Grand Central hotel. Arriving:When I arrived, my friend who had booked the room had a late flight so I couldn't check in. The staff at the desk were kind to keep safe my bags for me and invited me to stay in the lounge to wait for my friend. I was very tired and it was quite late but everything was made better by the amazing view in the lounge, and the free snacks and drinks. I met Elizabeth, who was working at the lounge. She was incredibly kind, funny and answered all my questions, recommending great places to go to during my stay. She is a hoot and brings a smile to a weary travelers face! She goes the extra mile for her guests at the hotel! Problem solving:Whenever there was a problem during the stay, the staff members were always attentive and on your side to find a solution. Melissa and Mallory were especially helpful (and that helpfulness extended even after I had checked out!)Happy hour:Drinking wine with a dazzling view makes everyone feel glamorous. David at the happy hour was entertaining and kind, clearly someone everybody likes! The wine was amazing (and free, OMG!)Room:The room was clean and an amazing view from the 23rd floor of the Chrysler building! Shower has a good pressure and the air-con worked fine.Elevators: As its quite a popular hotel, of course there's going to be a bit of traffic with the elevators, but you kind of figure out when everybody is leaving at the same time and I often waited to go a little bit later or earlier. Also, I just want to mention that every single member of staff that I met at the elevators always said Hello and goodbye or good morning or good night. I just think that's a little detail that should be appreciated.

Room was smaller and more dated than expected, and didn't look anything like the pictures online. There were often issues with elevators which caused delays. We were on the 4th floor, which meant you could hear all the noise from the street/station.Location was good - right by subway and within walking distance of many attractions. Staff were friendly.

I stayed at Club Quarters in Grand Central for the 2018 NYC Marathon. This is written from a perspective from someone who hasn’t been to NYC since 1998. I mainly travel for leisure. Visited with my husband. Check in: Came in at about 2:15 PM on a Thursday, was able to check in early. Accommodating and nice. Chris greeted us at the door and he was awesome and friendly!Room: Fairly quiet, was able to sleep well with very little sound from the street (view faced Lexington Ave and E 45th street). I was on 7th floor and view was fair. Walls seemed solid for soundproofing. Had a Keurig machine. Bed: Comfortable, pillows were soft, and they only provided two for the queen bed so we called the front desk and asked for 2 more and they brought them up right away. There’s also a blanket in the closet that is one of the softest blankets I’ve ever felt, which made it more comfortable.TV: Worked well, channels were plentiful. Air conditioning: Works fast, was able to be comfortable in the room. Bathroom: When we checked in, the staff asked if we were ok to be changed to a “handicapped accessible” room, has an accessible shower, and stated it was “bigger.” We both did not have physical disabilities, and we thought the room was fine. The shower had a chair that could be folded up, and we kept it up. Water was hot. Water pressure was fair. Had a sliding “barn” style door, which was adequate to keep sound down. There was a fan in there, but there was no way to turn it on. I’m not sure if there was one at one point, but it gets foggy when there’s hot showers.Amenities: WINE O CLOCK!! Free wine at 5 PM Everyday! Complementary water bottles on each floor with cold water – this was nice so I can have water as I was in and out all day. Snacks available throughout the day on the 27th floor. Breakfast had a big coffee/espresso/cappuccino/late machine (only one for the bar), bananas, apples. Also had Pepsi products in cans. Snacks included granola, M&Ms, pepper crisp crackers.Davio’s, which is an Italian restaurant in the basement of the hotel was decent! Ate here for two nights, one including before the marathon. When you tell the hostess your room number they charge it to your room and take 15% off. What they could do better: Provide a night light in the bathroom – I don’t like to turn on the light when I have to get up in the middle of the night. This was minor, but something I could’ve liked. This is an AWESOME location for a hotel in NYC and we loved staying here. Thanks for making my trip an amazing one!

Great place to stay,close to grand central station and the UN.free laundry station with free detergent and small gym. One of the best features is the terrace on the 27 with a very nice view of midtown .but the staff is marvelous ELIZABETH is spectacular a jewel of this hotel excelellent communication skill and vibrant personality, definetely I would be returning to this hotel because of Elizabeth

Club Quarters Grand Central was a great location for our 5 night stay in New York, with easy access to public transport and local attractions. The hotel was very comfortable and the staff extremely helpful at all times, making us feel genuinely welcomed.The unusual thing about the hotel was the guest lounge on the 27th floor where snacks and hot & cold drinks were available 24/7, in a comfortable and relaxed setting with great music. The icing on the cake was the free happy hour at 5pm, which we took advantage of a couple of times, enjoying red/white wine and nibbles!I would thoroughly recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

I loved my stay at CQ. I booked for the proximity to a work conference, and in additional to the perfect location, the hotel facilities and amenities were a happy surprise -- extremely clean, professional and helpful staff, very comfortable rooms, everything is very new and modern... Extra highlight to the 27th floor, HH at 5pm, with very good wine, with a perfect view of the city. Amazing to have in that area a co-working space, with table, computers, delicious coffee and a number of snacks! Saved my life a number of times! I loved the gym and the option of a laundry (even though I haven't used the last).

Enjoyed the stay.Nice staff, Rey, Johnny, I think.random text to fill the requirement of minimum characters. Yes indeed some more random stuff. Was very nice as mentioned above. All is good. Drink a lot of water.

The hotel is in the nearby of almost everything by foot or subway, being close to Grand Central station and Empire State. From the 27th floor there is an amazing view and terrace where you can have free coffee and snacks for breakfast and happy hour in the evening. The Standard room was good, not perfectly clean but after we requested it, it was immediately done. Wi-fi good, large smart TV, very small old fashioned wardrobe. People were kind, welcoming and always nice!

The hotel is centrally located in Midtown Manhattan. It is a few blocks from the theater district, MOMA and other interesting places in Manhattan. There are many restaurants and food shops of different cuisines you can choose from. The room is quite small but comfortable enough with necessary amenities. The top floor serves like some sort of club where guests can enjoy free cocktails from 5pm to 6pm and there are snacks all day. You can watch the news on TV, work on your computer or use the hotel computers available. You can eat breakfast at the balcony with a good view of the city streets. There is a drinking water dispenser on the corridor with empty bottles for the guests to take to their rooms. Very nice hotel with friendly staff.

Property was very clean and the staff in the lobby was very nice. We wanted an extra blanket one night and they brought it to us. The location to grand central station is so perfect for people wanting to explore the city on foot!

Location: Very nice, in the heart of Midtown, without the confusion of Times Square neighbourhood. Very close to the Grand Central Station (of course), makes it very easy to go either north-south axis, as well as east-west, a rare thing in NYCRoom: considering NYC hotel rooms, it's big and very cozy for the price range, clean, neat. Highly recomend it.Services: Hotel has gym, laundry, iron, coffee, snacks, sodas, fresh fruits, all included. It is very useful and we're greatful for that. Better wifi of my lifeStaff: everyone was really nice and warm, we felt really welcome and well taken care of.Ace of the cake: Wine o'clock (discover for yourself!)We highly recommend the hotel and we're looking forward for coming back asap

So where should I start? The hotel was really amazing. It was super close to everything and we walked only 2 minutes to get to the grand central. Also it was super easy to reach everything from the grand central. The rooms were really Clean and the bed was super comfortable. We also had an amazing view from our room or when we went to the 27 floor. Also the staff was very kind and cool. We would also like to thank zishan. We were about to buy a helicopter flight which isn’t really cheap. So he was about to help us to get the tickets and so on bit still he was really honest and told us to rethink it. Also he gave us the advice to go to an amazing park to see the skyline from manhatten. So all in all it was perfect because of the auper kind staff, rooftop bar and the clean rooms

see above - nothing to add to what I've said above. Good room nice staff etc. Lobby a little scanty. Good location. Quiet. Light switch defective, TV remote dead (batteries). Nothing more to add. Would return without much hesitation.

Newly renovated room, staff were friendly and helpful, and the common room on 27th with the daily happy hour was a great surprise. The location was perfect as we were close to Grand Central to grab the trains, a 10 min walk to Times Square, but the area wasn’t super crowded.

Love that they have water bottle stations for water on every floor. There is also a peloton bike in the gym! The location was perfect for us because we needed to also go to Brooklyn for an expo, plus was close enough to everything we wanted to do in Manhattan. Only negative was an elevator was down and sometimes there was a wait. We have stayed here before though and that was never an issue. We love Club quarters!

Service at the hotel was exceptional. My friend and I put two toddlers to nap and really needed a glass of wine to wind down but the hotel restaurant was closed. David and Scott at the front desk went out of their way to take care of us and grab us a free bottle from room service. The room layout with a door to the bedroom is also wonderful for traveling with a child where a little privacy goes a long way.

Came to NYC for a 3 days sight seeing trip with family so wanted somewhere central knowing we would spend most of our time out and about. This hotel was ideal. Great location next to grand central, friendly, helpful staff and rooms that were smart clean and functional. Sold as room only but coffee available all day and in the morinings bowls of apples, oranges bananas and cereal bars. In the evening complimentary wine and snacks between 5-6pm.Only (slight) issues on our trip were that one of the three lifts was permanently out of order and our room on the second floor was a bit noisy from the traffic and you could hear the trains under you coming into Grand Central. I told my family it was part of the atmosphere of being in NYC!Would definitely stay.here again. It can’t be bad if senior aircrew use it.

Grand Central location is great for getting around midtown Manhattan. Less hectic than Rockefeller location. Appreciated room upgrade based on availability at no additional cost. Rooms consistently clean with appropriate amenities. CQ also has a generous rewards program.

The only problem and it is significant is that one out of three elevators is working. Very frustrating. It takes a long time to get an elevator and the elevator is packed because two elevators are not operational. you would think that this would be taken care of after three days of this nonsense!!!

I had business in midtown on the east side, and had this hotel recommended to me. I stayed one night and thought it was excellent. The room was small, but comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well-organized. The water filters on every floor with refillable bottles were a nice touch. The fitness room was small and crowded in the morning, but it was generally well-maintained. The staff was friendly. I don’t typically stay in midtown, but I would stay at this hotel again.

The room was clean, comfortable and had everything I needed. The staff is friendly and helpful. Kudos to Rey at the front desk and David at the lounge. I will definitely be back. If you stay here don’t miss the wine and snacks on the 27th floor.Rudy

Our room smelled like cigarette smoke and though the hotel offered to ionize the room, we just put up with the smell as we were only there 2 nights. I would not stay there again..the staff was very nice though but for the money, I am sure we can find a better room next time.

The location was the first priority for my choice and I win with that. Excellent place, easy to find shopping places, bars, restaurants and also simple to reach the downtown or any other parts of the city. Must book for business trips and also recommended for city tourists.

Modern, extremely well maintained. The top floor has a beautiful lounge with free coffee, tea, soft drinks and snacks. Great WiFi and there are computers available for business travelers. Very friendly and helpful staff. Great value for the money and an ideal location for Midtown East. I will stay there every time I go to NYC.

The room is fine, despite no having breakfast there are some snacks available and coffee that helps you start the day of work. It was very clean and didn't notice the street noise at 11th floor. I recommend it.

Recently stayed here for two nights and had a great experience. Front desk staff were exceptional - both on checkin and checkout, just superb: friendly, efficient, helpful, really excellent customer service. The room was small, but very smartly organized - there was no wasted space, but had everything we needed, and was very clean. Will definitely be staying here again.

Great business travel hotel - Especially love the free snacks and coffee machine (a bit too much, almost). Always a pleasure here! Zishan was especially helpful getting me early check in, and I couldn't be more greatful!

We had an amazing time at the club quarters at grand central. The room was a corner room, had a full kitchen a nice bathroom and a separated bedroom. A dining room table, sink, microwave and a fridge! Awesome room recommend this location to everyone. I couldn't be happier with our stay! PLUSSSSS great location

I am a frequent traveler to this property and all of the hotel staff are very professional and courteous!Room was perfectly cleaned!Perfect Hotel location: You are 2 blocks away from Grand Central and easy traffic flow location pick-up or drop off(Corner of Lexington Ave) for NYC taxis, Airport limo's, Uber, Lyft, etc. Also close to many surrounding restaurants.This is a my preferred hotel of choice every time I come to NYC! Already planning my future Business & Personal hotel trips at this property!

Good hotel. Nice room. Blindingly fast WiFi. Good service. Only two lifts working so I will take one star off, but I’d definitely stay again. The restaurant serves excellent food - steak to die for. Recommended for business trips and tourism too as it’s so well located.

I stayed twice there. The first time I was surprised for good. Nice room, nice bed, great ammenities. BUT I stayed the following week-end not just by myself this time and I was told that I was getting an upgrade in order to be more comfortable because we were two people in two beds...When I got to the room. It was the same size, the bathroom had a sliding door (not really nice if you don’t feel 100% confident with your room mate). The TV was just in front of one bed....And the beds.... wow.... two tiny kids beds.... I wouldn’t call that and upgrade in fact I would call that a downgrade.

Cool boutique hotel in the heart of midtown rubbing shoulders with the Chrysler Building and minutes away from 5th Avenue, Times Square and Central Park. Great staff and comfortable rooms. And free wine at five...what's not to like about that??

The hotel and its location are great, in the midtown and easy to get around. Especially, the service of hotel staff: David and Julian is super outstanding! Will return to this hotel again for the next trip in NYC.

The rooms are cleverly designed and attractive. The problem is that the rates have gone up dramatically, leaving Club Quarters as just another option. My husband and I were disappointed, having expected a more economical stay.

Loved the stay... Very clean and modern... Recycling bin in the room was a plus... Loved the lounge and the view from the top of the building... Great friendly service... Unlimited filtered water at no additional cost... Thank you... :)

Lovely hotel in convenient location right by Grand Central Station for easy connections. Hotel has great range of amenities Including rootlftop terrace, coffee machine , snacks, gym and laundry room! Highly recommend!

New hotel, good room, they receive packages for you, has coffe, granola bars Orange,apple, banana, beverages, wine snaks..ali for free in the 27 floor 24 hours . realy good surprise.. excelent staff..

Overall, an excellent place to stay. Staff was friendly and helpful. The 27th floor was great for snacks, relaxing on the terrace and working on my laptop. My second floor room was a bit noisy at night but otherwise I was very satisfied with our stay. Loves the self service water bottles on my floor!

What a fantastic property. Thanks to Cesar and ESPECIALLY Michelle Barszcz for being the best management a property could ask for. Rey, David, Julio, Sasa and others make each of our stays fantastic. Checking out was equally easy with 2 young ladies whom I regrettably did not get their names but were smiling and very helpful. Thank you

Just had a fantastic stay in the CQ Club Quarters hotel. We had a very warm and friendly welcome from all the staff particularly, Chris, Rey, David, and the brilliant Broadway advisor Jillian. Nice room, great views and conveniently located. Thank you Alun and Bethany.

I stayed for four nights here in October, three solo and one with my husband. The 11th-floor room was small but comfortable with a good bed, decent storage space and a good-size counter with chair that served me as a work area. The remote for the flat-screen TV was the easiest to operate of any I have used worldwide. Housekeeping kept the small bathroom (shower only) and bedroom absolutely immaculate. Lighting was excellent. The A/C, however, was terribly loud, and I really missed not having a safe. I got frustrated with the unreliability of the WiFi. Each floor has a free water-to-go station with empty bottles that can be filled with chilled water. There is also a guest closet in the corridor with items that are often needed. For example, I made good use of one of the ironing boards and an iron.The lobby is not traditional. It is a small space with two computer stations and a bench that can likely accommodate three people. A staff person, however, is always here. Guests can check in and out by computer or with staff. Three elevators make up the back wall.I interacted with several staff members throughout my stay. All were upbeat, friendly and helpful. They gave reliable answers quickly to any question that I asked. For those who want a hotel with a place to relax, the hotel has a huge room with an outside terrace on the 27th floor. The view from there is amazing day and night. It has a small business section with computers and printer and snacks and drinks are always available. A Happy Hour occurs daily from 5 p.m. to 6 p.m.I consider the hotel to have location, location, location. Located in the Midtown area, it is close to Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, Fifth Avenue and the list goes on. Bus lines and subway stations are nearby. There are restaurants and cafes all over the place and many good breakfast spots.

like this hotel for because of its nice size rooms, friendly and accommodating service, lounge on the 27th floor with treats and happy hour.Fun to stay here, I always come back.One critique: the water pressure in the shower isn't great

Hotel is in a very central location. Staff were friendly and courteous. The room was very small and basic with high window and no view (a bit like a prison cell actually). The overwhelming issue with this room was the air conditioning which when switched on sounded like a truck was in the room with the engine running. It was so loud we had to switch it off and suffer the heat instead as it was impossible to sleep. As we were only staying one more night (and we are British) we didn't bother complaining as we couldn't be bothered moving rooms again. The top floor lounge and balcony were ok but nothing special. The coffee machine was out of order when we stayed.

Location is first class, only just round the corner from Grand central, hotel is very clean with a happy hour up on the 27th floor, which also has a rooftop terrace where you can sit with a few of coffee or soft drink and look at Manhatten. The real bonus for me was the staff, they were without exception very pleasant and helpful. Our room was fine and we'll maintained. Only slight negative was the A\C was quite loud therefore the room was quite warm. Would definitely stay there again.

The Club Quarters at Grand Central is a well located hotel near the UN headquarters and close to Grand Central Station. Near to shops and restaurants as well, the location and its convenience made the high price acceptable since it was during UNGA and everything was expensive. That said, the hotel offers friendly and helpful staff with relatively good security, small but efficient rooms, a top floor lounge, and free water. A restaurant/bar was located in the basement but I did not have the chance to try it. I would stay there again as the walk to the UN was very convenient and the location was great.

Check in was a breeze and he was very engaging and helpful. The rooms are small but typical for NY. You can’t beat the location either. you need to check out the top floor for snacks but especially for the view. We enjoyed our stay!

The hotel itself is nice and clean. The location is good. The front desk staff could care less about their customers. At over $350/night I expect a better level of service. There are plenty of other nice places to stay in the city.

Great prices hotel in a good location. Only two minutes from grand central station and 10/15 minutes from time square. Rooms were modern and clean and the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful.

Very good check in experience and customer service, as the staff was very attentive and helpful. Modern, clean and well laid out room albeit a bit small for two people but perfect for one. This is after all NYC, so I don't expect a large room. Convenient midtown location right next to Grand Central station.

We love this location for its proximity to Grand Central Station and the amazing views and nice snacks and drinks available on the balcony. The rooms are comfortable and the bathrooms clean and stocked.

We stayed at Club Quarters Grand Central from 13th Sept until 21sr Sept.We booked through Agoda and based our decision to stay on price,location and TripAdvisor reviews.We are very happy to say that we are so glad we decided to stay here,We new that the price and location were good,and the hotel came thru as well.Clean rooms,free coffee and fruit on 27 th floor,plus great views,rooms with wifi,USB charging,coffee machine,fridge and microwave,water station on each floor.Friendly helpful staff,special mention to Zishan,Pete,Rey and Chris.We would most definitely stay at this hotel againps laundry on 3rd floor,a godsend,two large washer driers,and free laundry powder.

I chose to stay at the Club Quarters Hotel Grand Central due to its location, at Madison Avenue, near the Grand Central Station, where was close to the location of the meetings I had in New York. The room was small but this is normal in New York. The service during my stay was very good. However, at my arrival back home, I noticed that I had forgotten my jacket in the room's wardrobe. I immediately emailed the hotel and got a prompt reply informing me that my request has been forwarded to the housekeeping department. After this, nothing else happened. I tried to email the hotel directly again and, this time, no response whatsoever. Of course leaving the jacket at the room was my fault but I'd expect a minimal level of attention from the hotel. It is difficult to consider staying there again.

I was very pleased with the staff. Michelle was exceptional with helping me prior to my trip and following up with me once I was there. I hope that Michelle gets recognized/rewarded for her outstanding service and hospitality. Also, I had a very good experience with Elizabeth as she assisted me on the 27th floor. Elizabeth has a great and positive personality which was also helpful to me. I hope she is also recognized and rewarded for her fantastic hospitality and service. I have always been big on feedback whether it's positive or negative. That is the only way a company or individual can improve.

Rey and Jeff are so sweet to all the guests and very helpful. Glad to recommend to all. Hotel is close to shopping, food, and entertainment. The hotel goes out of its way to make their guests comfortable

I stayed here for 4 nights with my Wife as a surprise present for my 50th Birthday and the Hotel was superb. From a welcoming and informative check by lovely staff, we went to a very clean & comfortable room with a view of the Chrysler Building. Chris was the host for Wine at 5 and he was fabulous. He not only made sure we all had a great time but was always ready to help out with a recommendation for anything you wanted to do. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting NYC as the location is perfect for getting about as it is across from Grand Central Station and only a few minutes walk to Times Square.

Chris, the best host ever, and this hotel are tops. Everyone is very accommodating and the 5 o’clock wine hour is excellent. Can’t go wrong with this place. Very nice location. Right in the center of everything.

We stayed in a small suite - a corner bedroom and a small compact but perfectly formed living area with a sofa, table and amazing kitchen area (complete with cooking utensils!) - the view from our bed was amazing!!The rooms were extremely clean and well kept and we immediately felt at home!Everyone raves about the staff and quite rightly - from the lovely enthusiastic welcome when we arrived to the 'welcome back' everytime we returned to the hotel - and ofcourse the very charming Chris who served us complimentary wine and snacks between 5 and 6 on the 27th floor terrace - and equally the friendly maintenance and housekeeping staff that we met in the corridors and lifts - everyone was incredibly pleasant and friendly.The hotel is beautifully situated just a short walk from Grand Central which in turn takes you everywhere (although perhaps a printout of how to get there the quickest way would have been extra helpful as there are several entrances and at first we kept walking the the furthest one by mistake!!!)If we returned to NY we would defo stay here again and we would like to thank all the staff for making our stay so so pleasant.

It was my second time staying at this hotel and would stay there again in the future if I visit New York again. The hotel is located in a very central place, only a few meters away from the Grand central Station and within walking distance to the Time Square. It is very well connected to public transport and on a safe neighborhood. People are very friendly and willing to help you. The rooms are clean and cozy. Also there are free snacks 24/7 with coffee available at the lounge as well as and fresh water on every floor. Great value for money.

Ticks many boxes. Great location - close to the Chrysler Building & Grand Central Station. Nearby subway connects you to anywhere - Downtown, Times Square, Central Park, Madison Square Garden etc. Walking distance to Rockefeller Centre & Empire State Building.Good, modern, clean facilities.Friendly staff - Chris checked me in and was really helpful.Connected to Davio’s Italian Steakhouse, if you charge your meal to your room, you get a 15% discount on the meal - which by the way was FANTASTIC - both quality and service - totally recommended.I’d stay here again without hesitation and recommend it to others visiting NYC too.

The rooms are small, but really, other than sleep and shower what do you need a room for in Manhattan? The happy hour was great and my board members and staff were able to sit comfortably in a relaxed space and socialize. Location is great and the staff is friendly and helpful.

Location is great but the entrance is small so a but hard to find at first. The room was a decent size for Manhattan with a small couch and table and plenty of room for lots of luggage. But the best thing by far us the staff. Manhattan can feel a but overwhelming so it's really great to have such warm and helpful staff to make you feel at home. The view from the lounge is fantastic and the free wine and snacks are a great bonus.

I had a marvelous stay at this hotel and enjoyed my time mingling with other business travelers while sipping free wine. The room was very comfortable and clean, the staff was excellent. Everyone made me feel welcome.

this was my second stay and very satisfactory. all services were good. the gym could be bigger. the 27th floor snack and business center were excellent. the staff service was very good. checking in and out was without glitches. And the location of CQ being centrally located was excellent!

I had made a reservation at a different hotel that I had to leave because it was disgusting! I originally stopped at the Midtown location but they didn't have enough nights available. But the staff there, called this location and booked this for me. Once I arrived Zishan took care of finishing my check in and even upgraded me once he heard my horrible story! Throughout the stay the staff were extremely friendly and attentive. But it was Zishan AGAIN who saved me on my last day of this work trip. I had some unexpected shipping that had to take place and a plane to catch. Zishan extended me to a late check out to help accommodate this last minute stress factor and Chris helped me carry my packages to the FedEx store. I swear they made everything fall into place and helped ease my stress so that I could focus on solving my work issue and catching my plane on time. I can't thank them enough!!Not only was the hotel extremely clean and comfortable, but there were snacks in the terrace lounge on the top floor and a water dispenser by the elevators on my floor. Did I mention I'm hypoglycemic too? These little things really meant so much to me and I have become a loyal customer as long as the accommodations stay at this level!

The room was much larger than average, with a nice seating area, mini fridge and microwave. The happy hour was a welcome bonus. The club lounge deck on the 23rd floor had amazing views to downtown.The location was great for us, as we don't mind walking. It was 15 minutes to Times Square and Rockefeller Center, and 20 minutes to Central Park. Lots of great food around, including the incredible fast-casual 100% plant-based Terri at 685 3rd. Ave.The staff were always very friendly and helpful. The wine poured at happy hour was from a local winery on Long Island, and was surprisingly good (we live in Marlborough, New Zealand's premier wine producing area).On the down side, but certainly not enough to detract from the highest rating: Since the rooms have the fridge and microwave, they should include plates, glasses and cutlery (or these should be readily available from the club lounge). When we called to get some cutlery, all that we got was some cheap takeout plastic that was unsuitable for cutting the bread and bagels we purchased from the Grand Central Market. Also, I really dislike the "pod" coffee makers (Keurig, Nespresso, etc.) as the amount of waste they generate is unconscionable. Better to have a small drip coffee maker or high-end instant (Starbucks Via, Robert Harris Fusio). All-in-all, highly recommended and very good value for the money. We will be looking to stay at this and other Club Quarters properties in the future.

A very clean, comfortable, well-designed, friendly hotel, with decent sized rooms, a good gym, and lots of great restaurants nearby. The reception staff could not have been more helpful, and the "club" on the 27th floor had excellent coffee and healthy snacks. What's not to like?

Great hotel and easy to access everything. The room was spotless and the amenities were great. Staff lovely and very helpful. As it’s New York the rooms are cosy but there’s a lovely lounge and balcony on the 27th floor with Apple products to use. along with coffee and snacks.

I stayed at Club Querters Grand Central for a werk of business meetings in midtown. Sleep was easy as tge room was silent and the bed was very comfortable. The coffee machine in the room is a nice touch. The young people at the front desk were always corteous and helpful. I got a room in the 24th floor with a wondeful view of the surroundings. I even got work done in the terrace on the 27th floor; wonderful place. will certainly stay in Club Quarters again. I wonder if they have rooms for a family of five.

The location was good, being very close to Grand Central. The staff were incredible from the moment we arrived, Michelle upgraded us to a room with a spectacular view and the terrace was fantastic with free wine and snacks! Can't say enough how kind the staff were, we had some problems with our laundry and Pete, Kadija and Michelle were unbelievably helpful to us! And having a chat with Elizabeth will always make your day fun! Thank you so much to everyone for making our stay a special occasion, would recommend very highly and would definitely stay again. The room was very comfortable and always clean.

Nice sleek decor and a very nice bathroom. I liked the water dispenser and bottles in the hallway. The king bed is two twin beds pushed together but there is nothing spanning that gap which is uncomfortable to lay on. Also the air conditioner from the room above dripped constantly on our window ledge. The happy hour is a nice idea however the wines were mediocre. We usually went to the food court in Grand Central station for breakfast. On Saturday we hoped for a nice breakfast at the hotel restaurant but they only have a continental breakfast during the weekends.

Advertised as Hotel Boutique Grand Central, this Club Quarters Hotel is unfortunately misleading some visitors who are unaware of this (including myself). It is a typical basic hotel located near Grand Central Station in New York, but is certainly not a boutique hotel. Rooms are small, basic and clean. However the air coditioner is old and very noisy, the water pressure from the shower is very poor, the furniture is dated (the seat had cracks in the upholstery) and the bed dipped down in the middle. The check in area is a small elevator lobby with no seating and three mobile podiums and there is no obvious Hotel Boutique name branding on the entrance, which makes finding this hotel difficult for new visitors. The 27th level outdoor terrace overlooks Lexington Avenue which is a nice spot in good weather. Staff are pleasant and friendly. Be aware about what this hotel is when booking and don’t expect more, especially if paying a premium. We were disappointed as it did not meet our expectations.

You can hardly find the entrance, the reception is small, but then the experience grows. Nice clean rooms and the gathering at 5pm on 27th floor indoor/outdoor is a party when Chris is serving the wine. There is a fitness centre as well ( I am told)

Good location and friendly and knowledgeable staff. Free breakfast comprising of fruit and snacks and be back at the hotel between 5pm and 6pm for a pleasant surprise!! Chris was an excellent host and provided excellent for Restaurants etc.

Booked last minute due to company error. Was super stressed out when I got there. Gillian at the front desk was really helpful with check in. She also got me a fridge in my room, which I needed for health concerns. Good location, clean rooms, and close to the business center. Will Definitely return

Great location, 15 minutes walk from Times Square. But quiet enough to get great sleep. Staff were amazing and special note about Chris - true talent with people. There is no bar but the rooftop terrace with complimentary drinks etc is a really nice touch.

My daughter and myself came to NYC to celebrate our big birthdays. The hotel is in a perfect location and within walking distance of loads of the main attractions such as Times Square, The Empire State Building, Rockefeller and Broadway. It is right next to grand central station so quick and easy to catch a train to Central Park or downtown Manhattan to Ground Zero and to get across to the Statue of Liberty. Our room was spotless and modern with a fab view and the real gems were the staff. From friendly David welcoming you at the Reception, to the lovely hilarious Chris handing out complimentary drinks on floor 27, we couldn’t have wished for a nicer place to stay. We will definitely be returning.

Initially, it started off bad by not having the right room for my family's needs. I requested a room with two double or queen size beds. I ended up with two small twin beds. The young lady at the front desk simply couldn't accommodate us. This is where the guest service manager (Rey) came in to rectify the problem. He went out of his way and upgraded us to a full-size suite at no extra charge. He even went further and gave my family full breakfast vouchers for our 3 day stay. Another staff member (Chris) also went out of his way to help use have a wonderful stay at the hotel. He used his contacts to get reservations to various fine restaurants of our choice. He is also responsible for the happy hour between 5 to 6pm. Lot's of free wine and snacks to allow guests of the hotel to mingle. Great job Chris! I also discovered that he is a great and upcoming artist. I suggest you check that out. The only down side to this hotel is that, it is a bit out of the way from all the action of Times Square. Thus, there is a bit of walking to do. I recommend that you invest in a good pair of running shoes or a subway pass for the duration of your stay.

Never been to NYC before and selected this hotel based on price. Brilliant decision. Room, although tight is very clean and comfortable. Rooftop terrace is a wonderful ace to grab a coffee or glass of wine and either plan or reminisce about your day. The location beside Grand Central Station means you are a short subway ride from just about anywhere in Manhattan, Bronx, or Brooklyn. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. Staff are also super friendly.

Very close to the Subway and Grand Central Terminal.10 min. walk to Times Square. Bottles of water at our disposal on every floor.Fantastic terrace on 27th floor with free coffe/tea.Free luggage storage.

Very central, close to some of the major tourist destinations and a subway stop. Within walking distance of Times Square, Empire State and the Rockerfeller centre. Rooms are tidy and more spacious than expected, staff are friendly, and free snacks and soft drinks are available 24 hours on the top floor. The roof top terrace on the 27th floor has great views (and there’s free wine between 5-6pm)! Definitely worth the visit if you’re planning on staying central in Manhattan. Also a massive shoutout to Chris- he was great. Always happy and friendly and really made our stay all the more worthwhile.

I stayed for 4 nights and had an excellent experience. Very welcoming and friendly staff. Superb location to stay in Manhattan. My room was a decent size, great comfortable bed, good bathroom too.Nightly wine on the top floor was a great touch too, and clearly well received by many guests.Help yourself to sodas, coffee and snacks the rest of the day.If I return to Manhattan, I'll return here for sure.

6-17 September 2018 - once again at Club Quarters, this time with my wife and once again exceptional and very friendly service from all staff, rooms are a good size for NYC, excellently maintained and cleaned. The free self-laundry service is a very big factor for longer staying clients, the exercise facility is very good, and the upper deck and terrace are great not only for snacks and relaxing, but the free wine at 5 with Chris entertaining, serving the wine, and offering dining, and travel advice is a fantastic way to wind down after a stressful day. My hat off to Chris and a big thank you for your help during our stay. His colleague is also very helpful during her time, albeit at a lower key, but also a thank you. All in all a rating of 15 out of a high of 10 - thanks.

The suite was large and comfortable. Also loved the free happy hour on the rooftop from 5-6! Great, friendly staff. Awesome location just adjacent to Grand Central Station. I loved that I could order room service from local restaurants, too - charged to the room.

I was there on a business trip, the hotel is walking distance to Grand Central Station. So, its central to all locations you'll need to travel to. Guest Services is great and helpful. It's a convenient location whether you want to grab a bit to eat, dine, shop, or even get a quick haircut in 15 to 20 minutes opposite the hotel before your business meeting. There's a yoga mat in the closet, water bottles outside the rooms, and a lounge area on 27th floor for snacks, tea and coffee

The staff was very serviceminded, we enjoyed the coffeemachine, fruit and the wineour on the topfloor. We also enjoyed having fresh water in bootles outside the elevator. All of this for a quit ok price.

Fantastic hotel in a great location. I was greeted by a very friendly gentleman named Chris who held the front door open for me and gave me a warm welcome. I was a frequent guest at the hotel in the past few years but have not been there in a year. Imagine my surprise when I got to the reception desk and saw Rey whom I had dealt with on many past visits. He gave me a huge smile and immediately said "Welcome back Mr. Pellegrino, we have missed you"! Talk about feeling special. Employees like Rey and Chris are tremendous assets and make a long day in rhe the road more pleasant with their welcoming attitudes.

My wife and I were spending a week visiting my step daughter and her husband who moved to NYC last Xmas. As they were living in Manhattan we decided a hotel close to them would be appropriate. We settled on this hotel on the basis it was not only close to them within a 15 minute walk but also close to all the major attractions.The room we had was on the small side which was to be expected but clean with good facilities. The only drawback which we did not complain about was that we were on the seventh floor at the back of the building. This was just about level with the air con mechanisms on top of the next door building. They were incredibly noisy and as there was a heatwave when we were staying were working overtime thus making even more noise. I know that the hotel would have moved us but we coped.The lounge area was really good with snacks and free wine and soft drinks available between 5pm and 6pm which opened out to a small open air terrace which gave you great views. The tea and coffee were available all the time. The lounge also had the IT facilities for guests.We hope to visiting my step daughter and her husband on a yearly basis whilst they are there and subject to getting a good price for the hotel we will not be looking elsewhere when we do.

We really enjoyed the club living room and found Elizabeth really friendly, welcoming and attentive. She was always there with a smile from the day we arrived. She went above and beyond to make me feel welcome and really added to my stay.

I came to visit my friend who was a guest at the hotel and on the Club Living Room and Elizabeth was immediately super warming and inviting! She was so attentive and kind. Turns out we are neighbors in Bushwick! Thank you Elizabeth for amazing hospitailty, conversation, and care!

Just returned from a terrific stay at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central. From the minute we walked in the door until checkout the staff was friendly, accommodating and genuinely wanted us to enjoy our stay. The room was clean and well appointed, the Peloton bike in the gym was perfect and the hospitality/snack area was on point. We will definitely return.

This centrally located modern hotel boasts clean, comfortable rooms and a very friendly staff. The price is right and Davio's restaurant in the lower lobby is excellent. I will definitely plan to book here on my next visit to Manhattan.

The hotel was pricyworthy especially considering it's location. Enjoyed the rooftop bar, room was nice and have no complaints really. Also we had the pleasure to talk to Chris who made sure our visit was nothing but great!

We liked this hotel a lot. Great location near Grand Central Station. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. One nice feature was the banquette seating in the room. The top floor indoor and outdoor space was a nice bonus. Every employee we encountered was friendly, including Zishan and Ray at the front desk. Ray, especially, would make it a point to talk to us and ask about our plans for the day. We would definitely stay here again.

We have been to NYC many times and this was our first at this Hotel. Six of us stayed from ages 5 to 69 years young we had an awesome stay in this hotel.
