Room was small, but clean and the bed was fine! Airconditioning was hard to regulate, either very cool or off. Very noisy too. Fresh purified water on every level with bottles to fill. From 5 till 6 pm free wine on top floor with terrace. What I missed was a safe in the room to put your valuables but there were free safes on the second floor.

From the moment we arrived ‘everything was perfect’. The desk staff were extremely polite and helpful, the room was excellent ... well equipped, comfortable, air conditioned, cleaned every day and very quiet considering it was a relatively large hotel. A light breakfast of coffee and fruit was available each morning. One of the highlights of our stay was 5 o’clock wine time on the top terrace. This was an opportunity to meet fellow guests over a glass of wine and nibbles; overseen by Chris, who was superb host making everybody feel welcome. We would certainly recommend this to anyone staying in NewYork.

We really enjoyed our stay @club Quarters Hotel and had no reason absolutely for any complaints. We were very close to the NYC heart and most of the visitor's places of interest are a walk away from the Hotel.

Elisabeth was outstanding... One of the nicest ppl i met while visiting NYC. Elizabeth went above and beyond to help me one out one afternoon in particular and for that i am very grateful... I will be visisting again...

Very nice and clean hotel for a business tripStaff is very helpful, all the accomodations needed are present 3 min walk from Grand central Station in the center of Manhattan Room service OK but there are plenty of shops around

The hotel is perfectly located by Grand Central and not too far from Time Square.I arrived late in the day and I had no choice but to accept a room on the second floor.First disappointment, there was someone else bag in the room...Then the hotel is right on top of the subway every time a train pass, your can hear it like you are in the station.Not sure if the rooms on higher floors are that noisy.I won t risk it again and I advise you not too if you can t sleep with noise

Travelled with my 12 YO son for 9 nights. It was good to be away from Times Square madness in a location that was perfectly situated to use the subway. Lot's of food options close by and very friendly and helpful staff. Johnny was a legend & even brought over some bagels from Jersey for me to take back home. The 27th floor club lounge and balcony was a fantastic option to relax, use a computer & grab a quick snack or coffee. I'd stay again!

The address for me appears to be on Lexington Avenue ..... this entrance is poorly signposted. I spent a few minutes trying to find the hotel reception.The entrance on 45th street is well signposted.The staff are polite and attentive

Good location. Quiet. Comfortable. Convenient. Nice breakfast room and happy hour with indoor and outside seating on 27th floor. Efficient check-in--no traditional lobby. Good TV. Free wifi. Keurig coffee maker in room. Free water bottles.

CQ Grand Central hotel is located in the middle of everything.. You can easily access famous avenues. It is also located just beside Grand Central and Subway. The hotel itself is clean and well-maintained with excellent friendly staff throughout the hotel. Service provided compared to the price is great! Highly recommended & it will be my destination again for any coming business trips.

This hotel is literally NYC's hidden gem. It's located across the street from Grand Central Station so traveling anywhere in NYC was a breeze! It's also 5 minutes away from 5th avenue, 10 minutes away from Time Square, and half way between Central Park and the Empire State Building. I can't say enough about the staff especially Robert and Chris who helped track down a VERY important package which the shipper had put the incorrect address on. The Club room that I had for my stay was basic, but exceptionally clean. The lounge on the top floor is a great place to unwind after a long day and the free water bottles are a big help while exploring the city. This was my first visit to NY but I hope not my last and if I'm lucky enough to visit this great city again I'll DEFINITELY be staying at Club Quarter (Grand Central).

The Club Quarters Hotel was a very pleasant place to stay in NYC. It was a great location, with roomy quarters, nice amenities, and a very pleasant staff. One of its greatest attributes is the nice patio-public area on the top floor. Very nice space!!

Great location and staff. Never hesitated to provide guidance and willing to go the extra mile. Plan to stay at the hotel again on my next trip. In the perfect spot for anyone traveling to Manhattan for a visit or business.

It's really great hotel, perfect location, rooms are clean and well equipped.We would like to say thank you to Rey and Shuba.Many thanks to Robert for a great taxi you booked for us.Big, big Thank You to Chris, who made our stay very special. Just+Tom+Aniela London

This was our first trip to NYC and stayed at Club Quarters (and got married as well). I wish I could give more than 5 stars. Excellent location, very friendly and helpful staff. Our room was on the 24th floor with fantastic view, even when you step out of the lift. Our room was really quiet and kept clean throughout. We were happy with the size of the room, it fits for its purpose. Great lounge and terrace on the 27th floor. The 5 o'clock happy hour means happy hour, Chris makes sure of that. He is such a character, always made us laugh. The entire hotel staff were fantastic, I lost my bag and got it back in less than half an hour. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and I would happily return. PS,Chris, hope you got a couple of longer trousers (or pants) lol.Best wishesJ&P

Our normal place to stay in the West Village was booked so we tried the Boutique Hotel Grand Central. This was particularly convenient since the Amtrak train was re-routed to Grand Central from Penn Station. Well within walking distance from station and to Restaurant Row and Theatres. Thoughtfully designed room layout, clean and up to date, and welcoming staff. We will stay here again!

Check in was great even able to get into room upon early arrival, very friendly and accommodating front desk. The room was compact yet very efficient, clean and well laid out. Complimentary unlimited bottled water and 27th floor complimentary hot and cold beverages plus assorted snacks was an added bonus. We really enjoyed our complimentary Happy Hour with Cris serving up the wine. He had a great sense of humor and kept everyone smiling.

i just got back yesterday from 2 weeks vacation in New York.I stayed at Club Quarters Hotel Grand Central.I am so very glad i choose this hotel, cause its a very good location in New York, Midtown East. just round the corner from Grand Central Terminal and other attractions are within walking distance.Also, the front desk staff are so nice and Very helpful, always with a smile and very friendly. hotel is also very clean.At this hotel, they sever free tea coffee, water, snacks all day. free wine from 5 to 6 pm ,on the 27th floor terrace all in all i would stay again here when in NY, and would highly recommend it to anyoneTheresa May June 2018Malta

Stayed here with my girl friend for 6 nights. Great aspect of the hotel: excellent location. Less than 5 minutes walk to grand central station meaning subway and local attractions are very easily accessible by foot (one can run from the hotel uptown to central park and around it, if that's your thing), rooms are clean, excellent cold water filling facility on every floor, happy hour (free) at the 27th floor, Chris is extremely helpful and friendly. Points to be aware of: The basic rooms are very small. There is no safe deposit box in the room (i reckon there is one down in the lobby). Lobby is very basic and small. Points to clarify and maybe improve: Check in and check out process went smoothly however the person that checked in for us did not give us any other information other than your room is on the XX floor. I aspect information which include (location of gym facilities, happy hour, bar, WIFI access) to be volunteered instead of me asking for each and every one of those. The day before check out, we went to the reception to ask for late check out the next day and was told by the staff that unfortunately they are not able to do so until the day of check out and it is a first come first serve basis as to who comes down/call them as early as possible. We did not really believe him and hence we waited till his shift ended and rang the evening reception guy and he did it for us in less than 2 minutes. "unable to do so or just shunning work??"Overall: Good hotel centrally located. Basic facilities. Comfortable.

Hotel is convenient because close to Grand Central - other than that, room are so so ; cupboard is very small even for a 1 week trip, no much room either in the bathroom; no fridge, no safe, no slipper to walk on carpet; and reception area on the groundfloor is far from pleasant !

This hotel was a very good choice. The rooms were very clean. On every level you could get fresh water bottles. Between 17.00-18.00 you can get free drinks at the rooftop. The staff was very friendly especially Chris was always in a good mood and very helpful.

We have a great time in the hotel. The rooms and staff are exceolent. Especially Chris, he is a perfect host. We are really enjoy staying here. Location is also very good - its close to all the major attractions

Having a great time. Hotel is spotless and in great situation. The lounge on 27th floor is a real bonus ...in the shadow of the Chrysler building ....across from Grand Central station and the Fabulous market. The staff are friendly and helpful especially Chris in the lounge . Wine is free between 5 and ,6 and Chris is a very entertaining host and makes you feel so welcome speaking lots of languages (not Welsh tho ) would definitely recommend this hotel. We chose a room with a kitchenette which is very useful especially in a place like New,York where it is so expensive to eat out. The free snacks and water and coffee 24 / ,7 bonus. Check out the website everyone

We love staying in the hotel. Rooms and staff are fantastic. We are here a nice 3 days and feeling all the time very welcome. Especially with Chris we have a great time at the terrace and so I am sure that we will enjoy the next 5 days here

Very enjoyable room with all mod cons very comfortable bed . free wine happy hour is a great success with happy staff greeting us .free WiFi is a bonus and works well .washing machine is a challenging thing perhaps a separate dryer would be more easier for people to use .

So glad a friend recommended this hotel which is so convenient to Grand Central Station, the market, and many cafes and restaurants. We loved staying here- good rooms, clean and efficient. everything worked! An unassuming front desk led to very well fitted rooms, a free guest laundry- so helpful when travelling, and a free wine at 5.00 ! Rey, Shuba and Mustafa were so helpful to us- suggestions where to go,procuring a taxi etc. all delivered in a friendly manner. We will return and recommend to other travellers.

We stayed here for a week at the end of May 2018 for my birthday and had a lovely time. The hotel staff were really friendly and helpful before we even arrived to help us make arrangements during our stay. Our room had a huge comfortable bed and the air con worked like a dream (it was sweltering hot in the city). I would definitely choose to stay here againOur room had a great view of parts of the city...including the top of the Chrysler Building which looked amazing at night

I loved this place! It was clean and very customer oriented. The staff were extraordinarily friendly and helpful. It is in a great location. a block or two from Grand Central Terminal on Lexington. There is a lovely terrace on the 27th floor with a lounge with coffee and snacks available and a free Happy Hour from 5-6. The rooms are small of course (it's Manhattan) but clean and well appointed. The price was very reasonable. I could not have been happier with my stay here.

Very small rooms but didn’t spend any time in them apart from sleeping. The rooms and hotel were very clean. Walking distance to Times Square and lots of subway options from grand central station. Didn’t have to get a taxi once. The hotel has a fabulous terrace overlooking Lexington Avenue and lovely to have coffee up here in the morning or watch the lights in the evening.Free water bottles and water on every floor which was brilliant and cereal bars and fruit in the lounge on weekdays - it would be nice if this was provided at the weekend too for non business travelers. Would definitely recommend and return again.

I ALWAYS enjoy staying here! All of the hotel staff are so friendly and helpful; especially with their knowledge of the top restaurants near the hotel property! The staff always go out of their way to make your stay pleasant! Please keep up the excellent and superb customer service!

My husband and I stayed for one week at the Club Quarters on East 45th Street and were blown away by the service, location and amenities on offer. We were checked in by the friendly Mustafa who let us know all about the Club Room on the 27th floor where there are free sodas, water, coffee and snacks all the time and a free wine hour every evening at 5pm. Chris the host of happy hour was hilarious and gives good chat while pouring delicious wine. Also saved a lot of money and time grabbing coffee and waters here each day rather than having to buy them although there are several small shops and 24 hour Duane Reade and corner deli on the corner of street.The room was large especially for Manhattan standards and even had a dining table and seating area which was nice when bringing food back to the room. The air con was also easy to control and worked perfectly. Housekeeping provided by Yuki was outstanding every day and on our last day she actually realised we had left a set of Airpods and ran down to reception to return them to us while we were checking out, thank you Yuki!Michelle and Ray at check out were also very helpful and professional.Literally 2 minutes walk to Grand Central Terminal with lots of food options and subways 4, 5, 6, 7 and the S shuttle which takes you direct to 42nd St Times Square in 2 minutes. Was a great base for navigating around New York and surrounding areas by subway and train. Get the unlimited 7 day subway pass for $33 well worth it!Would definitely recommend this hotel and return next time we are in New York.

Great location and handy for train station (Grand Central), late snack breakfast and evening nibbles, free coffee and soft drinks with a free happy hour. Really helpful staff. Great balcony area. Most tourist sites with 30 minutes walking.

Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights late April.Check in and out excellent and professionalRoom was good, small, but it is New York, bed comfortable and shower and amenities as to be expected.Good location, few minutes to Grand Central Station and shopping areas.The only comment to be made was our room overlooked a main street and each night the traffic noise was sufficient to wake us, especially the sirens from emergency vehicles going about their business. Seems like there is little or no noise insulation on the windows. Perhaps a room away from the main street(s) would be advantageous.We took advantage of the free drinks and nibbles one night and the host that night kept all in the room amused, a nice touch.There is a restaurant in the basement and we believe this is not associated with the hotel, but they do recommend it. We tried breakfast the first morning, it was overpriced and underwhelming. There are many better options close by.Yes we do recommend, however if we come back to this hotel we would be careful with our request for a room away from the street noise.

Stayed here for one night as I was passing through New York. The reception area is a bit lacking but the staff weren't. There was everything I needed in the room and bottled water in the corridors that you can stock up and refill. Its very handy for Grand Central Railway Station and 5th Avenue for shopping, etc. The restaurant downstairs does breakfast but no hot food. There are lots of other places to eat nearby so not a huge issue. About a 15 min walk to Times Square.

We arrived early in the evening and were welcomed enthousiasticly by Chris. The rooms nice and clean. Everything was present for a comfortable stay in the middle of New York. Fith avenue and time squaire on 5 minutes walking distance!

Stayed here recently as a layover from Europe trip and to visit son/DIL. Great location, friendly, fantastic staff especially Chris, Debbie and Shuba. Room was very clean but small, as in my closet is bigger at home, small. It was enough for the couple days we were in the city, but any longer and I would've been cramped. Also, the way the room was situated the bathroom door, which has a glass panel, when used during the night, the light shone right onto the bed and would wake up the person there. Would definitely use again for shorter stays or if I had a bigger room.

Perfectly situated friendly hotel. Close to the happening and still relatively quiet at night. Thank you to Chris and the other staff ! We recommend this hotel to everyone who likes New York and free wine by Chris at five !

Nice price, location and staff-Mustafa who was born on the same day with me was awesome!!!! Near the grand central terminal and everything is convenient. The 27th floor is good for take a break and the free wine every evening is great!!!!

We stayed here a few nights and found the room to be pretty basic and cramped, but it’s not a big deal because no one comes to NYC to stay in their room. We happened upon the snack / drink area at 5pm when free wine was being served. The top floor patio was a beautiful place to sit and enjoy some wine and snacks. I would come back here on future trips.

We had a glass of wine on the terrace and Chris was our host. He was awesome. This is a great hotel and location. The view is great. Check-in was easy. We are here for 10 days. Really looking forward to our visit here.

Hotel suits our needs perfectly. Rooms were decent size and clean and tidy. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Rooftop terrace with free coffee, soft drinks, snacks were greatly appreciated and the free wine at 5pm daily was just icing on the cake. We also loved the free laundry facilities. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Times Square as it is within walking distance to most attractions Times Square, rockafella centre, Empire State Building and Central Park. Also grand central station is about 50 metres from hotel.

The hotel exceeded my expectations. Very clean and organized. Well located (next to Grand Station). Water and coffee machines released. Staff very attentive and dedicated to help where possible. The desk clerk Rey was excellent, helping me to solve a problem. I will stay at this hotel whenever I come to NY.O hotel superou minhas expectativas. Muito limpo e organizado. Bem localizado (ao lado da Grand Station). Máquinas de água e café liberadas. Funcionários muito atenciosos e dedicados para ajudar no que for possível. O funcionário da recepção Rey foi excelente, me ajudando a resolver um problema. Ficarei neste hotel sempre que vier a NY.

This hotel was an excellent choice when my friend and I decided to spend 4 days in NYC. We were very well welcomed early in the morning when we arrived, very nice and polite staff.Right in Midtown Manhattan, very close to Grand Central Station, this hotel is perfect to visit NYC and remember that you are not in Manhattan to spend all day and night in your hotel room ;) However the room is clean, a personalized welcome on TV screen, enough space around the bed and in the room to move around for 2 people and luggage, a very nice and hot shower and nice view on the street.. Great terrace view with a complementary glass of wine from 5 pm to 6 pm.We just loved our stay there and if we are going back to Manhattan, it will be in this hotel.

Overall Outstanding, 2 small problems 1.) front dor is not easy to enter and the phone number whet to a machine, we say 3 other parties have trouble entering. 2.) the bed was too hard, a matress cover would soften it up just right. Otherwise a wonderful location and a nice happy hour on the 27th floor

The hotel is subtle, but once there it is great, and you have to give it to Chris, the host on the roof top, and general all round 'go to' chap. If I owned a hotel, he would be my man, and I recommend him to any international hotel, even Tokyo where I live, to liven up the crowd and make the guests smile and remember the hotel. Behind the face is a genuine guy who is helpful to all. Someone take this guy to higher heights. he makes the stay memorable - I will be back with my wife, and hope he is still here.The hotel is excellent because of its staff and all the staff were very helpful, but this guy is exemplary - thanks Chris, and all the other staff, you made this trip not just business, but fun.

My daughter love to stay in the hotel with me when I come to visit. Club Quarters is our first choice in New York City hotels. From the moment you are greeted at check in by Rey and Debbie, until your goodbye, this hotel has everything and more. Hospitality, room comfort, decor and of course wine at 5pm.

Great view from the 27th rooftopterrace. We were welcomed by the entertaining host Chris or polite Rasa with free wine from 5pm untill 6pm, cappuccino and snacks. The wholeday long there were free oranges,apples, excellent coffee and mueslibars.Thank you so much. 5 stars for the hotel and its staff.

The hotel has a quick check-in the bed is comfortable and amenities are good. I always stay there because it is easy to get to my meetings. I really like the fact that you can stream movies from your own devices to the TV.Breakfast had good options from the buffet or from the menu and

The Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central is a pleasant place with a few issues. I found the room quite small, even by New York standards. However, it was manageable for our four (4) night stay. There were some comfort issues to include the room thermostat. If it was set at 74 degrees, it became warm and stuffy. When set at 73 degrees it got quite cold to the point of being uncomfortable, certainly well below 73 degrees. In other words, the room was either too cold or too hot. We found no thermostat setting that was

We stayed in three different Club Quarters hotels over the las ten days in three different states...by far Grand Central had the best customer service with Johnny and Chris. Wine from the 27th floor was fabulous.

Club Quarters surprised me with it's bare-bones reception area. One or two staff members occupied the small space but quickly took care of us and got us into our two rooms at 11am!The room was not large but well-designed and comfortable. Microwave, fridge, and coffee maker fit nicely in the room without taking up too much space. On the 27th floor the whole floor is a haven for guests to relax, use a free Apple computer, grab a cup of coffee or tea and chill out. At 5-6 the 27th floor is their happy hour venue with free wine and snacks. Step out on to the balcony and what cool views of the city day or night. Rey and Debbie at the front desk were charming and efficient. The only miss was the free coffee machine on the 27th floor can need breif maintenance at times that was quickly resolved with a call to the front desk. Would definitely stay here again.

Hotels location is excellent, staff is very friendly, clean rooms, water at every floor free, so you do not need to pay money for a bottle of water. Living room at the top of the hotel is very good place..Our room was on the second floor and all the street noise was inside the room.Next tome I will absolutely stay in this hotel on a upper level room. Thank you guys...

Hotel was great. Location could not have been better. Near time square, grand central, fith avenue and bryant park. Thr staff was wonderful too! Chris pour me some wine! I would recommend this to others

The Guest Service employees are outstanding. Both Chris and Kevin were extremely helpful and courteous during happy hour on the 27th floor The personalities are as big as New York City and extremely helpful in finding places to eat and things to do

The Club Lounge on the 27th floor (with a peek-a-boo view of the top of the Chrysler Building) is the best reason to stay at Club Quarters Grand Central, as well as its location. Also, Johnny at the evening desk was especially nice. The rooms are utilitarian, and housekeeping does an efficient job of tidying up the rooms (though the shower room, without a fan, was quite musty). Unfortunately, the room did not come equipped with a safe, recycle bin, nor a view (on the plus side, the HVAC units outside my fifth floor window masked any and all street noise!). I also missed the daily Wine@5, but from the many remaining cups in the Lounge afterwards, it seemed to be quite popular. The business center co-located with the Lounge has three Mac computers and printer for use, as well as numerous plug-in stations and WiFi (fast and available throughout the hotel). There is a small, windowless gym on the third floor as well as complimentary W/D (beware: the dryer takes for-e-ver!). For an unusual snack, try a Japanese riceball or two at the nearby Omusubi-Gombei; Seamless is also available for in-room delivery. Overall: a solid 3.5 (rounded up)

Good location. Near mid-town within walking distance of Times Square and other sites. Close to E line, so getting to/from JFK airport (via Jamaica Station/Airtrain) was a breeze. Room was clean and had everything we needed. Staff was very friendly and accommodating (we were allowed an early check-in since our room was cleaned). Noise was not a problem since windows were either double-panes or well insulated. Great lounge on the top floor that provides tables, computers, snacks, etc. Very happy with our stay there. Price was not cheap, but nothing really is in New York.

Excellent hotel! Great location! Chris is one of the servers for HH on the roof deck. He was very personable and very attentive to everyone. Great service and excellent customer service over all. Hope to stay here again soon!!

Everything you need, nothing you don't. I didn't have anymore space than I needed, and the added terrace and amenities were great. Got my morning coffee there each day (I would put two cappuccinos in one cup and heat it up in my room!) and would sneak some snacks when needed.

The hotel is very well located, very close to Grand Central Station. You can reach Times Square, fifth avenue, Central Park, all by foot in few minutes. The rooms are very clean and new. The things we have purchased on line was directly delivered in our room, which was great. There were only some not so good things: there wasn’t a frigobar at the room; the main entrance is not at Lexington Avenue. We highly recommend this hotel.

This was my first stay at a CQ property but won’t be my last. Centrally locates, walking distance to everything and, if you’re too tired to walk, taxis are everywhere. Spacious, clean, comfortable room.

Stayed here for 2 nights in May 2018 meeting friends from the UK- the staff were excellent particularly Jeunesse who was working the happy hour bar - thanks for a great stay and the wine was delicious

our stay was perfect. check in without any problem, nice and clean room, very friendly staff. awesome view from the terrace in the 27.th floor, in the morning coffee and tee for free, free fruits, free Pepsi, soda and water and m&ms. we can really recommend this hotel and if we come back to NY we will definitely book this hotel again because also the location near grand central station is perfect!

Room was small but clean. Location is very close to Grand Central Station and convenient to the theater district, Times Square, Fifth Avenue shopping, and restaurants. Staff is extremely professional and helpful.

Great location, very clean & efficient housekeepers, loved the convenience of the laundry & they supply the washing detergent, 2 min walk to Grand Central station, rooms were quite roomy, beds could of been comfier, & the lifts were a bit slow, but small issues mainly. Would definitely stay there again.

The hotel is a block away from Grand Central Station, amazing location, great, clean rooms, great service, free water and coffee and the open wine bar at 5pm is great.Chris is so nice and the team the best!!

A very Nice stay indeed! Fine rooms and a perfect location. And especially the free sky bar in the afternoon and the ever enthusiastic Chris at the bar making sure that everybody had a good time so the best stay in NY

Good location, good hotel, great staff at a reasonable price for NYC. Really enjoyed the Free Wine at Five reception hosted by Chris. Have stayed at other Club Quarters Hotels in NYC but this is our favorite. Would definitely recommend this location.

Toby,thanks for you found what we left in room 501 last night and send them to our room today, these items are worthless but very useful for my sleeping.we really appreciate you.you are so kind and we feel the warm from you and club quarters hotel.

What a pleasure to have Chris pouring at the complimentary wine 5-6 at the top of hotel. He is a true asset to this hotel. He not only works the front desk, he works the awesome happy hour. Keep up the good work. Will see you again very soon.

Very friendly staff, Chris was amazing. They made us feel at home. They always had suggestions on activities or great food locations! It is located close to everything. There were some water pressure issues in the shower but over all a great hotel.

We stayed at Club Quarters for 5 nights and found it to be an excellent choice.Location wise it's situated on Lexington & 45th st. beside Grand Central Station.It's a sort walk to Times Sq. and all that entails .... theatre,music,shops etc. The hotel was vey quiet and obviously well run,the rooms were a decent size with all facilities as advertised.The water machine on every floor dispenses free still/sparling water for bottling [bottles provided] ,a nice touch.... The added bonus was 'Wine @ 5' with host Chris, dishing out free wine to all in the 27th floor lounge for an hour every day.We are planning a return trip already to this great city and Club Quarters will be our base ... see you next time ! ,Noel & Catherine [Cork,Ireland]

Great service, great location. Rooms are a little small but I would still highly recommend this hotel. The employees are very professional and helpful. This really makes a difference. On the 27th floor Antonio was professional and courteous. You won’t be disappointed! Thank you Antonio!

Hotel offers good value given the location with easy access to great restaurants and entertainment (Grand Central station is only a couple minutes walk). Grab a bottle of cold water and walk around the area

Breathtaking views from the roof top terrace. Chris and Rey are wonderful hosts! Extremely convenient location, right next to Grand Central Station. A great place to enjoy the best New York has to offer!

Rey and Chris were absolutely the best! They were the best hosts at happy hour...they went out of their way to make me feel welcome and were very attentive and friendly! They are "top notch" employees and great representatives of the Club Quarters!!

Happy Hour at 5:00 until 6:00. Chris was the best host. Outgoing and friendly to everyone. He was bilingual he made everyone feel welcome. Thanks Chris for a great night! I will definitely be back! You are the best! Keep smiling!

Absolutely nice people at the reception! Breathtaking view from the top floor. Free water for every client, such a great idea. Spacious and very clean rooms.Fantastic gym.Excellent breakfast location (roof terrace) but a wider choice of sweets would be appreciated!

Thank you for the wonderful place to stay! The accommodations were amazing and the staff was energetic and welcoming! Chris was fabulous and gave us the kind of welcome we needed after a stressful commute.

Stayed here for 12 nights on a business trip. Housekeeping took my pijamas on the 4th or 5th night probably by mistake when they changed the sheets. I told the receptionists multiple times ( probably all their reception people heard of it, I asked every day). Same response, we will look for them and return them to you. Same thing every day. When I started saying it’t not ok for me to sleep in my fitness clothes because they took my pijamas one of them actually made a joke that he would go to Marshalls and get a pair for me, all laughing. I did not appreciate the unprofessional attitude at all. My pijamas were nowhere to be found until the end of my stay. After I insisted that it is absolutely not ok and I should be compensated for them they took a day to get manager approval to reimburse me for the amount I showed them on Amazon for an almost identical pair. They said I would get the money back on my card. What do you think? No money ever returned...No interest in your customers plus bad jokes plus committing to something and not doing it after the customer left. Seriously? I travel a lot for business, I’ve never been treated this way.

Great location, two minute walk from Grand Central Station. Arrived in the early AM, the staff were very accommodating. They were able to reserve the room for us and have us checked-in promptly. The rooms were decently-sized and clean. Many little details that made our stay very pleasant and memorable - water bottle stations, club living room with daily wine tasting. And thanks to Chris who made our stay very inviting.

Cannot day enough nice things about the service here. I filled out the customer survey after check-in and noted there was no fridge in the room. By the time I returned from shopping a couple of hours later there was a fridge in my room and a message in the phone explaining where to find the iron and ironing board on my floor. They stored my luggage on the last day and when I came back earlier than anticipated they have me access to use 27th floor lounge so I could wait for my airport car (which they had organised). My only wish would be that they had quieter air cons!

The staff was fabulous at Club Quarters...friendly & efficient. We had a suite which had ample room for three people, a corner room with great views and a lounge with a fun happy hour! We would definitely stay at this hotel next time we are in the city!

very good location in the center of manhattan and very nice stay in a room with kitchen where every day perform cleaning, in general everything perfect.Very pleasant reception staff help you with any questions

Club Quarters is geared towards business travellers and all of this hotel's features and amenities supports that. To start, it's located about a 3-4 minute walk from Grand Central Station so you can pretty much get anywhere in the city via subway in no time. The hotel itself is just a few doors down from Lexington Ave. so the exterior of the hotel isn't that busy on a standard day. The lobby area is very small, but then again, it doesn't need to be big and grand because the guests who stay here just need a place to sleep while on business. The staff at the front were very helpful when I arrived and I'd highly recommend downloading the CQ app on your phone and checking in with that (you can even get an electronic room key) and you can avoid any waiting time and go right to your room. My room was the standard club room and it had a nice little sofa and table and a pretty sizeable bet, but wasn't that comfortable if I do say so myself. The shower pressure also wasn't great but the rest of the bathroom did the trick. I liked the TV set up in the room where you could connect to the room's wifi and stream Netflix or Hulu or even airplay from your device if you wanted. Really cool! I was on the 4th floor and didn't have a window at all, which didn't really bother me, but it would have been nice to see outside during my stay.As per the rest of the hotel, every day from 5-6pm there's a wine and cheese tasting on the gorgeous 27th floor lounge and terrace. The terrace is outside and has ample seating with views down what I think was 3rd Ave. as well as the Chrysler Building to the South. The lounge itself has snacks and beverages all complimentary at all times during the day and night. The gym is pretty small and on the 3rd floor but it's what you'd expect for a hotel gym. Like I said, the staff were awesome and definitely enhanced my stay here. I would 100% return, especially to this location, even though there are a few others around the city like Midtown, Times Square, opposite Rockefeller, and Wall St.

I stayed at the CQ Grand Central. First time at Club Quarters. Room was not huge, but this IS Manhattan after all. Location is great, staff is frendly and helpful. The mobile app is awesome and makes the experience much easier when you're in a hurry.

Struck completely lucky with this gem of a hotel on our first trip to New York! Rooms were good but staff were better! Nothing was too much bother and all were on hand to offer helpful hints and tips. Massive bonus was 5-6pm cheese and wwine wine on floor 27- and Chris owned it!! He was greatfun and ensured glasses were topped up and everyone left with a smile on their face!

Reception staff were friendly, room was comfortable & cozy given its small size - I was on the 20th floor and it was quiet up there. Would have been nice to have a safe, but perhaps that's available in larger rooms. Also nice to have water dispensers in the hallways of each floor. Would consider staying here again!

Chris was unbelievable! His warmth and hospitality made me feel so welcome. The reception at 5 is very nice and the lounge on the 27th floor is very nice. The location is also perfect right next to Grand Central. I will stay here again for sure!

Amazing housekeeping Yuki! Great service. Granted us a nice and warm room with every little corner cleaned and all our beds with extra blanket as requested. Thank you Yuki for such a great service!!!!

We were there to meet a rep for a college interview. The hotel was super cute and very clean. We had a small queen room which worked for the 2 of us. The employees were very welcoming and helpful. They even asked my daughter when we checked out how her interview went. Close to parking and food. Would recommend.

This is not the most luxurious hotel I have ever stayed at - the rooms are clean, functional and comfortable - but you will never get a better value for a room in Manhattan. From the bottled water stations on every floor, to the stocked lounge with happy hour, to the in room Netflix and streaming, and mobile keys on my phone....this place is head and shoulders above other hotels at twice this cost in NYC. Local wine is a nice touch even if Long Island is not Napa, Rey and Kevin provide a great experience and awesome service

Staff at reception upon my arrival were extremely helpful with a difficult situation. Chris and Alberto saved the day for me. Five stars for them. When I came totally jet-lagged and exhausted and had a problem with my luggage, they worked hard to solve the problem. I am really thankful.

Efficient cleaning service, 2 minutes from grand central station and ten minutes from time square, good price, reception open 24 hours, good wi fi, beautiful sight from terrace on level 27, free water and coffee

Bottles of water with refill stations on every floor. A wonderful terrace lounge with a view..comfy inside with work stations, computers and sofas. Great little automatic coffee machine from lates to American coffee. They supply different snacks durring the day from breaksfast bars, fruit, snacks to m&ms and then a wine happy hour! Lovely staff!

My wife & I stayed here for a long weekend in a club room - queen bed. Room was small-which is what you get in NYC. We were on the 26th floor which was one floor with a very cool feature - bottled water filler on demand. We took advantage of this, a lot. Always an issue in hotels. Plenty of elevators, never waited for long. Staff was pleasant and we took advantage of the managers wine hour one evening. Nothing too special but when the weather is warm enough they will open it up for fresh air. Location was great, easily walkable to everything and only a couple of blocks to grand central (Starbucks located across the street). Only downside was the bed, Queen was not very comfortable and worn in the middle as I would imagine single travelers would be staying in this smaller room. Would not hesitate to return but would go with the King room.

Great location (if you’re going to a UN or a business meeting - or shopping), clean and tidy room, good bathroom and the club service is excellent. You can print your documents at the hotel if you forgot to do it back home. Lovely, polite staff.

Nice hotel in a relatively intimate atmosphere. Rooms small but clean and well appointed. UpsTairs "living room" to relax with snacks is perfect. Grab takeout and have it there--casual and nice. Relaxing.

Was met at the desk on arrival after an exhausting flight from Australian by the very helpful and friendly Robert, and my room was perfect for my 5 day stay in Manhattan, a mixture of business and seeing Springsteen on Broadway. All the other staff at the hotel were wonderful at all times. The hotel location was central and it was grand, an easy walk to Broadway, to the UN, and a good base for my walks to the Brooklyn Bridge and the 9/11 Memorial, and the galleries on Central Park. The space on the 27th floor was ideal for working and having a glass of wine after a tiring day, and the view to the top of the Chrysler Building is stunning. Club Quarters contributed greatly to a wonderful stay in fabulous New York.

Excellent staff at the reception. Very good attention on the 27th floor. We were able to check into the hotel even though it was not the right time to check in.While there is no breakfast the possibility of eating something in the morning is good

This hotel was in a great location. Rooms were clean and decent sized. Cocktail hour on the rooftop was amazing with wine and snacks. The staff were amazing!!!. I would definitely return to this spot.

Overall, I really enjoyed my stay at Club Quarters, Grand Central. The staff were friendly and everything was clean. I was so appreciative of the staff letting me check in early. I also appreciated the cool tech features of the room, including Chromecast built into each room, as well as the 24 hour gym availability. In terms of areas to improve, I would say the noise level can get quite bad, especially if you are on the second floor where meeting rooms can be rented out and night staff pass through during the evening. But this definitely wouldn't stop me from staying again and recommending it to friends and family!

I got in late and left early--staff was efficient and friendly and the room had everything I needed. Great night's sleep in a comfortable bed, plenty of good pillows. Nice touch to have apples to take--just what I needed before going to bed.
user_location: Honeoye Falls, New York, United States

review_body: I loved this hotel. My overall stay was good and I’d go back again to this specific location. had a few minor issues and they took care of them immediately. Staff are friendly and the location was perfect for my business travel. Free wine nightly a bonus for sure.

We were there on holiday. The hotel is located near Grand Central Station as such it is ideally located for all the site seeing. Staff very good and helpful. Five o’clock is wine o’clock in the upstairs lounge and it’s free! Very good local wine.

What a hidden gem this is. We booked this as our friends were staying too. Not one that is a typical chain but it’s wven better as you get the personal touches the chains forget. Free filtered water stations and facilities throughout. Tasting session daily in lounge with free treats. Free laundry service and right next to Grand Central Station!This is our third time in NYC and when we go back... we willl be back to Club Quarters!Special mention to Mustafa and Kris. Very friendly and gave loads of tips. Plus cracking sense of humour.

I really enjoyed this hotel! The room was small but most rooms in the city are always a little smaller than normal. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice and clean. It is in an excellent location for public transportation (or walking to mid town sites) and the price was great compared to anywhere else I looked. I would recommend to anyone!

My stay at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central was great. The room and bathroom were both very clean. The location was good - close to where I was in town for business. The hallways and entry to the hotel were also clean and checkin was easy!

I have stayed here several times and was pleased with each stay. The staff is accommodating, rooms clean and location good. I arrived quite early before my room was ready but was able to work in the business center until my meetings.

I really liked this hotel and would definitely go back. The room was small but very well designed, the bed was comfortable, the staff was friendly and helpful, The only reason I didn't give five stars is because the water pressure in the shower was one of the weakest I've experienced.

The staff is very helpful, the facilities very good, especially the lounge at the top floor. Gym is tiny and a bit claustrophobic, though. Restaurant is high-end too. The main drawback is the noise in the rooms facing the street.

We have stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central Station location for several years... 7-8 times a year. The staff is above par and always EXTREMELY Helpful!! Customer Service Manager, Michelle Barszcz is FANTASTIC!!!! She knows how to make her guests feel at home, has great communications skills and just

I always stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central when I am in NYC, and I am never disappointed.The rooms are a good size for NYC and cleverly laid out to make the most of the space. I love the free wifi and filtered water. The top floor lounge offers amazing views and is superb for my meetings, and the free laundry is always really appreciated. I also really love the hotel's gym, especially the Peloton exercise bike, which I really enjoyed using.Keep it up QC Grand Central and I'll keep coming back!

Were there April 21st and 22nd. We come in by train, and it's really close to Grand Central, so that's nice. The rooms are comfortable, not big, but it's mid town NYC. But there's a very spacious and well appointed lounge on the 27th floor. They have a wine tasting every day from 5-6; Chris is a charming and enthusiastic host. Made for a very nice experience

Recently visited New York and choose this hotel for our stay. The staff were all exemplary, the room excellent (large bed) and all facilities that you would ever require with a great location. If I could name all the excellent staff I would (sorry). Nothing was too much trouble and made our stay even more enjoyable.

This was the first time in this hotel but have stayed in the Club Quarters in Times Square last year. In terms of service they were both great. The Grand Hotel had great views from the social room and really enjoyed the happy hour. The complimentary laundry service was excellent, I wasn't expecting it but came in very useful. Rooms were more spacious and had a wardrobe this time which for me was great! I may have missed this, but my only negative was that there was no bar, there was a restaurant onsite, but I didn't visit during my stay. The gym was really spacious and well equipped too, I made use of this one. Location to Grand Central was a huge bonus, less than a 2 minute walk. Would stay again!

Elizabeth was amazing. I found her in the elevator and she completely change my view of the hotel. She was very friendly and helpful. I noticed that she was able to communicate in English as well as Spanish and was very energetic and entertaining. The company should take advantage of her full potential.

This is the 3rd (maybe 4th) time we stayed here. The location is great. Easy check in. Clean room. Great staff.The hotel has lots of extras to make your stay enjoyable. The 27th floor lounge is terrific.

Highly recommended, a lot of freebies ie; filtered water, cold, hot drinks and snacks, toiletries and wifi, they have a hairdryer in room so no need to take one and good size tv, room was a bit small but adequate for what we needed.

My boyfriend and I stayed one night (Saturday, 4/21) in the Club Quarters hotel. We took the train in from CT, went to a NYY day game on Saturday, and then had sightseeing planned in Manhattan & Brooklyn on Sunday. Because of this, we wanted a hotel that was in a central/convenient location, and close to Grand Central as well as the subway. We also wanted a decent, comfortable room with modern amenities. Club Quarters ended up being the perfect choice for us. First off, it's got the ideal location of being right next to Grand Central as well as a subway station that took us up to the Bronx and down to Brooklyn. It's also very walkable to lots of restaurants, bars, and attractions nearby. Second, we loved the room itself - it was on the smaller side, but plenty of room for two people. It was clean and super modern, with a comfortable bed, plenty of outlets, and a nice shower. We also liked how our floor had a water machine with free water bottles that you can fill and take with you (I believe every floor had these, if I recall correctly). We also LOVED the free wine on the 27th floor lounge/sunroom from 5-6pm! Chris Q., one of the Club Quarters staff members, ran the wine hour - he was super friendly and enthusiastic, which made it extra fun (as did the unlimited refills).We would definitely stay at Club Quarters again next time we're in NYC, and I would recommend this place to anyone looking for NYC lodging as well!

This is a great hotel, but the topper was the free wine reception on the 27th floor. Chris was the host and went out of his way to make me and my wife feel special. Sometimes one person can make or break a stay. Chris made our stay memorable!

Chris made sure that everyboby felt welcome and having a good time. Great location and fine service in central Manhattan near Grand Central station. The hotel also offer fitness and other services....

This is a great hotel with great rooms, amenities and generally excellent staff. Everyone is friendly and competent. The only glitch in my stay was when I checked out.The long man who checked me out seemed confused because someone else with the same last name and a similar first name (even though because I am a woman the other person is a man) was convinced the I was checking in for a second stay. When I told him that wasn't the case, he continued to show confusion asking for my credit card and ID as if I had reserved the room for a second stay. It never dawned on him that we could be two different people and he continued down this path. I showed my pique. Eventually he figured out that we were two different people with similar first names--though with male and female versions-- and the same last name, assigned to the same room. However, in the meantime I felt I was in a comedy of errors. I know the other employee found it ridiculous as wee because of the way she tried to brush it off and apologize. A n annoying end to an otherwise great stay.

I do not feel like writing a review. I had a nice stay. The room was nice and clean. The wine on the 27th was. Great way to relax after a long day. The location was great. I will be back again. That’s all I have for now.

CQ Grand Central is perfectly located for our office and the staff is outstanding. Special shout out for Mustafa (who checked me in) and I saw each day and Rey (who helped me get a dinner from Davio's for my boss who was getting in late due to flight delays). Both Mustafa and Rey were outstanding and are just two reasons to stay there. All the staff was friendly and helpful and the stay was great. Thanks again to all!

The hotel room was great, the breakfast room has snacks and coffee. The staff are all trying to outdo each other to provide the best service. Mustafa, Debbie, Rey, and Sandy all were great hosts. I checked my bag at the front desk in the morning and when I checked in it was in the room. It had an iron in the room, which is great for business travelers.The health club is convenient and open 24 hours. There was also an exercise mat in the room. The location is right next to Grand Central so it is easy to get subways all over town.The only criticism is that the heater was somewhat noisy.

My visit to New York was my first since relocating to the UK last year. I stayed for almost three weeks and wanted somewhere where I could feel at home. The location, close to Grand Central, was perfect for travelling all over the city. My room was on the small side but just right for one person - it contained a fridge and microwave, which meant I did not have to go out for every meal, plus a Keurig coffee machine. Chilled, purified water was available on each floor. On the top floor there was a spacious lounge with complimentary tea, coffee, water, soda and snacks, and at 5pm every evening this was augmented by wine and cheese. The staff were helpful and friendly, and I must single out Chris, the welcoming host of the wine and cheese evenings, who went out of his way to greet all guests with humour and geniality. I was concerned that it would feel strange to be in New York and not be living in my own apartment, but the Club Quarters Grand Central came as close as possible to replicating that situation. I most definitely plan to stay there again on my next visit.

Excellent staff in a well appointed hotel. The room was very clean and perfect for our needs. Don’t forget to visit the 27th floor for snacks and treats or enjoy the view. We ate at Davio’s which was fabulous. The free wine happy hour between 5 and 6 was great fun!

The room was very clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel is near a lot of restaurants and Grand Central so it's a very convenient place. The break room at the top of the hotel has a nice view.

This is a really comfortable hotel, at a very convenient location. The hotel is clean and fully functional. There is good complimentary coffee and foodstuff in the 27th floor club and the view is incredible from the terrace.

Front desk staff were fantastic, very helpful and kind. Room was clean, comfortable and the gym equipment is new and functional (small gym - 3 treadmills, 2 ellipticals, free weights). I’d stay here again!

Mainly a hotel catering to businesspeople around the corner from Grand Central Station. Rooms are very very clean and efficient, typical NY smallish, but not tiny. Modern fixtures and technology (TV setup very up to date, and you could download an app to use as your room key). Each day at the fabulous Chris hosts complimentary excellent local wine (and cheese, for now) in the big 27th floor lounge that has 24/7 coffee and tea making, snacks and lots of spaces to hang out in. Smalll but OK fitness room. We were very happy at our stay. Don't drop the cheese!

I recently had a 3-night stay at Club Quarters Grand Central and it was a wonderful experience. The location is ideal, especially for those traveling into and out of Grand Central. The hotel is a 5-minute walk from the station. I most impressed with the staff who were all so friendly, helpful and professional. A special shout out to Chris, Rey, Michelle and Debbie, who made my stay extra nice. The lounge on the 27th floor is well-stocked with beverages and snacks, and was a nice place to hang out. The room was very clean and very comfortable. The only criticism I have is that the bathroom door has a pane of frosted glass, so when I or my fellow traveler used the bathroom at night, the light shone through the glass making it difficult for the other one to sleep. Otherwise, staying at the Club Quarters Grand Central was a great experience and I look forward to staying there again in the future.

We came to enjoy Manhattan for our anniversary, and had a fabulous time at the Club Quarters, Grand Central. For anyone wanting to be a decent walking distance from Broadway, Times Square, and other great attractions in Manhattan, this is the place. Clean and pleasant. While the rooms are relatively small, the 27th floor has something called

The place is perfect for business and enjoying nyc. Great location between mid-town and the UN. Amazing staff who are so friendly and helpful - from sending a stapler up the elevator to giving you chocolates as a pick-me-up. All the staff are lovely, special thanks to Debba and Chris. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to others.

Excellent hotel, modern rooms with lots of outlets. Great coffee make. The staff at the hotel were outstanding. Happy hour on the 27th floor was great, I had wine with apples and cheese and the view of Lexington Ave was nice.

We were very pleasantly surprised during our stay. Everything was clean, punctual, and kept simple and inviting to guest. The staff was forthcoming, responding swiftly to all requests. The lounge on the 27th floor is just fabulous.

Great hotel. It is clean and it has a lot of perks. You can enjoy the lounge area with free coffee and snacks with beautiful views of the city at the 27th floor 24h with beautiful jazz music. At 5pm there’s free wine and cheese. But the best, it’s the staff. Iit’s amazing how kind and cool they are, really amazing. Special mention to Chris and Elizabeth.

We enjoyed the rooftop lounge and happy hour! There is snacks all day and happy hour (5-6pm) with free wine and cheese. Chris was an absolute delight and good entertainment! Also the hotel lobby staff (Mustafa and a kind woman) was so welcoming and helpful upon arrival and throughout our stay. Will definitely recommend to friends and family.

The hotel is beautiful, clean and with a lot of services and in the middle of the city. But, the best of all is the staff, all of them are very kind,they offer to you a lot of things and cares. Especial mention to Chris, amazing.

Chris and Elizabeth made my stay at club quarters feel so welcoming. The service is excellent and I will definitely recommend and come again. Thank you for everything and I appreciate it on my birthday!

Great hotel right in the heart of midtown Manhattan. Right next to Grand Central and easy walk to other subway lines. Times Square just a few blocks away as well. The hotel itself offers great, modern rooms, that are just perfect. The hotel provides free filtered water and the bottles to go with it on every floor. Ok workout room. Very small and limited in what it has to offer. Free washer/dryer and detergent. But, there are only 2 of them and can be occupied for hours if using the full process of washing and drying. Club floor on top floor open to everyone is awesome. Great views and very comfortable. But, the thing that really sets this place apart is the staff!!!! Can't say enough good about them. Everyone you meet is friendly, helpful, and courteous beyond belief!!! Can't say enough good about them all!!!!!

Loved every bit: warm welcome at reception. Perfect space with smart outfitting for business folks in my cozy, well-appointed room. Nice touches; e.g., refillable water bottle stations. Accommodating service providers; e.g., when I left my bag for pick-up post work day. Perfect location--and quiet!

A nice, calm and clean hotel in perfectly located spot in New York city. The facilities there are “practical and rational “. The crew are decent and cooperative and the upper business floor is great to finish your work and have some coffee and fruits. This is our fifth stay in this hotel and I believe it won’t be the last.

With 27 floors, hardly a boutique, but with that feel. The top-floor lounge is awesome with work stations, comfy lounge furniture, espresso, snacks and a view. 2 blocks from Grand Central Station, so convenient to everything. And a 10-15 minute walk to Times Square. Friendly, helpful staff.

From checking in this hotel ticketed all the boxes! The staff were excellent and in particular Chris and Johnny! The rooms were spacious and well maintained. The Living room on the 27th floor is an excellent idea. Here you can have a continental breakfast and access to coffee/tea all day. At 5pm each evening there was an excellent wine and cheese reception hosted by Chris. Top marks to all the staff in Club Quarters, Grand Central, NYC. Thanks for a wonderful 4 day stay!!!!!! Pat&Kate

The hotel is very good for the price and centrally located - walking distance to the Empire State Building, Broadway and Time Square. The room was spacious for the location and price, and included a kitchenette.

Very Clean, comfortable, great staff. The suite was small but had everything needed and was great for 2 people f one is up earlier than the other. There are 3 elevators but for some reason they were slow and seemed often that only one was in use. This was the only shot fall.

The location of this hotel in midtown is perfect. Everything you want on your doorstep. The rooms are small but all you need. Clean, quiet and the added extras and staff make it perfect.100% stay again.

excellent location, very small rooms, poor room service, nice lounge in floor 27 but limited food and seating, they had Italian restaurants with really poor breakfast choices and taste and very high prices, on every floor there is machine where you can fill water bottle it is really good and practical.you can find better hotels with even less money.

Excellent location. Free wine and cheese from 5 to 6 was an unexpected treat and the quality of cheese was excellent. Club lounge on 27 floor has great view and all day free coffee and tea and soft drinks.

The whole staff here is amazing! Johnny, Nancy, Chris& Michelle have been BEYOND AMAZING!!!! This taff made me feel like welcomed always happy smiling making everyone laugh! The only reason why me & my cousin’s love coming here is because the amazing staff that works here. Also Elizabeth & Stella the cleaning ladies are amazing!!!!! Always come back to my room relaxed as if it was my own! Friendly staff and make you feel welcomed. Must say hands down BEST hotel ever!

This hotel had a great vibe for me. I liked the layout of the room. The room wasn't big but the design made good use of the space and was therefore an efficient room. I liked that purified water stations were available and the club room on the top floor was great! On my last day there I checked out and stored my luggage. I came back to the hotel to get my luggage and waited to meet up with a colleague. While waiting I sat on the bench in the lobby. I sat next to a hotel employee who was working on a laptop. He immediately stopped what he was doing and engaged with me asking what I thought about my stay. It turned out he was the hotel manager, Ralph Renz. Mr. Renz and I chatted for 20 or more minutes while I waited for my colleague. I appreciated that he took the time to engage and didn't seem put off or rushed.Prior to meeting the manager, I would have recommended the hotel but now I most certainly will! Every employee I encountered was friendly and helpful. Mr. Renz, you have a great staff and well cared for hotel. I hope to stay again but next time with my husband for a vacation! Thank you!

One of the best location in nyc and next to awesome food places excellent gym and vibe special thanks to Rey for all the help and assistance very good for travelers snacks water coffee even fruits and granolas in the morninggggg wow I will return

We stayed for three nights, everything catered for, small cozy rooms, clean and comfortable. Free coffee and snacks all day, fab gym on 3rd floor. Best part free cheese and wine on 27th floor every evening with Chris and Kevin . Fab hotel close to everything

Great location, clean, spacious room, and a lounge at the top floor with amenities like snacks, drinks, and an excellent view. The staff are very friendly. Chris, the manager, was especially helpful -- he went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our stay, welcoming us at the top floor lounge and helping us get coffee when we checked out. Highly recommend!

My wife and I stayed 5 nights in the hotel. The hotel is at a great location in midtown. We particularly love the common room on 27th floor where drinks & snacks are provided and which has a fantastic view of the street. We also want to specially thank Rey who had been very kind to us and assisted us with the baggage when our flight got delayed. In short, very pleasant stay!

The staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, the room was nice, location was within walking distance of lots of great stuff, and the amenities were awesome - loved the bottle filling stations and the complementary happy hour!

The hotel is correct but I would not recommend it, nor go back. The rooms are clean but a little old fashioned with dark furniture and dark carpet. Bathroom very nice and modern. Location close to Grand Central in Mid Town is a plus as well. The main problem is the lack of a decent reception area / lobby. There is none ... just one small desk with a person who clearly has too much work to handle all guests.

Clean room, excellent shower, and good technology (strong wifi signal, nice TV set and cable channels). Staff is polite and caring. Location is great, really near Grand Station. And drinkable water is made available for guests, along with plastic bottles.

Great deal in the hearth of NYC.we staied a week and everything was perfect.Quite,Clean,Reasonably big rooms,professional staff,Will come back again.Greast value for the price and the location.ooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooommmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmmm

Our family of four stayed over the Easter holiday in two separate rooms. The location is good, the staff are all friendly and helpful and Chris, who serves the free wine/softdrinks at 5pm on the 27th floor, is an attraction not to be missed! He is so cheerful and bonkers, made us all sing Happy Birthday for a fellow guest, whilst flirting with all the ladies - what's not to like?

First time in New York and the Club Quarters was a great choice for our visit. We were able to walk to so many of the famous sights which was a real bonus. The top floor lounge has an amazing view and is stocked with tea, coffee and snacks throughout the day. The room was larger than we were expecting for New York, the bed was comfy and the housekeeping staff did a fantastic job of keeping the hotel and rooms clean and tidy. There's also free guest laundry facilities which was really useful after a long trip. All the staff were friendly and helpful. So pleased we stayed here and wouldnt hesitate to book this hotel again if I'm lucky enough to return the Big Apple.

We booked the suite with the kitchenette and was very impressed. The rooms are very generous compared to most hotels in Manhattan and for saying it's a small hotel. We were only in town for 3 nights so were out most of the time so didn't get to make the most out of the hotel! However the staff were lovely when we did need them and even though we never made it to the 27th Floor for complimentary drinks we did have some nice hang out Times up there eating pizza from the 24 hour 99c takeaway shop! The hotel is in a perfect location with Grand Central Station literally one block down across the road, we were about a 10 min swift walk to Times Square however there is a express train from grand central to Times Square. We went to the hotel from JFK via the subway and found it all part of the New York experience and much cheaper than a yellow taxi! Check in was easy and hassle free and generally everything about this stay was perfect. The free bottled water in the corridor was also a nice little bonus too xx

We've stayed at this hotel any times. This time we really enjoyed the staff, particularly Chris, who helped us unwind with his jokes and friendly banter during happy hour on Friday after a 3 hour train ride. We later saw him in the lobby, and he quickly became our 'new best friend.' The hotel is clean and modern. If you're looking for atmosphere and charm, this is not the place. But the location and staff can't be beaten.

This was our third time to stay at the Club Quarters, and the first time to stay in the winter. We come to New York twice a year for trade shows, and this has become our go-to place to stay. The location by Grand Central Station is perfect to easily get anywhere in the city. The rooms are typical NYC where space is a premium, so efficient design is key. Upon request there are some rooms with two double beds, something not always obvious from the booking sites. The lobby, staffed with super helpful folks, is essentially non-existent, rather a place to check in and out, inquire about services and information, but not a place to linger. That is reserved for the top floor which has probably the best feature of the hotel. The living room is a comfortable place to meet, hang out, use the computers, grab a snack or coffee (complimentary), or enjoy the view from the terrace - which is winterized for the cold-weather months. A great view of the Chrysler building and other mid-town buildings reminds you from every angle that you are in the heart of things. Additional little things like water bottles and chilled water dispensers and a supply closet on each floor are great little features. During our stay, they even had a happy hour featuring local wines. With so many dining options nearby in a variety of price ranges, including the Grand Central Market - this is a super convenient, hospitable place to stay in New York.

Well situated hotel, exterior looks deceiving but excellent inside. Staff very helpful, rooms spotlessly clean. Two minute walk to Grand Central and plenty to do in the vicinity. I would have no hesitation in returning.

It’s a great location. The place is clean and the staff is great and friendly. Wine sampling on the top floor is a must and the view is awesome. It’s affordable so staying there a few times a year is doable.

The Club Quarters at Grand Central is perfect for a short (I stayed three nights) business trip to Manhattan. The Midtown location couldn't be better -- and it's next to the Grand Central station, so you can easily get anywhere in the city. The hotel is clean and functional. The rooms are comfortable enough and internet is free and fast. A great bonus is the lounge (actually there are two) on top of the building where one can work, read or socialize (and there's a happy hour with wine every afternoon) enjoying good views of the city.

Great location. Efficient rooms but comfortable and relaxing. After a long day the happy hour is a nice benefit to discuss upcoming meetings and tasks for the next day in a relaxed atmosphere. I would recommend this hotel to my colleagues if they have business in Manhattan.

I travel to NYC all the time, this hotel was in a awesome location! It was a few blocks to grand central. a hop skip and a jump to Times square. The staff was welcoming and Accomidating. There was Two entrances for convenience.and There was a great brunch place 1 block away. Overall awesome expereince wuld def reccomend again.

The hotel has great location in Midtown, the room was very clear, the staff is very friendly and helpful, the air-conditioning was a bit loud and in the bathroom sometimes there was not enough water pressure, but otherwise everything was fine, worth to go!

I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central in March 2018 whilst on business to the UN, I found the hotel to be well located to all the main transport linkages, hub of New York, restaurants, shopping and within walking distance to most Tourist attractions like St Patrick's Cathedral, Central Park etc. The staff were friendly and available to offer information especially Chris whom went out of his way to make our stay memorable. The Hotel is generally clean but the rooms look a bit tired and dusty.

Good location. Comfy bed, was well rested. Nice view from 27th floor where you can have a drink, relax or go online on your/their computers. And staff is what I liked the most, friendly, helpful and nice!

Great business hotel in the center of Midtown Manhattan right beside Grand Central station and very close to Bryant Park, 5th Avenue and Time Square etc. touristy spots. Nice amenities lile fitness rooms and guest laundry intended for business travelers but great for tourists too. Really liked the snacks and happy hour on the 27th floor. Rooms are slightly small, but perfectly acceptable for one or two people. The hotel and room were clean and furnishing was simple and nice. Staff were professional and helpful. I had a lovely stay and would definitely return again, and recommend to friends.

This hotel was a really efficient use of a small space - in the rooms and lobby. Quick check-in and checkout - and friendly staff. Great midtown location close to numerous subway lines and attractions and good restaurants. The room was compact but really utilized the space well. We had a small “suite” with a small living room with a pull-out couch and kitchenette, with a sliding door to divide it from the bathroom and adjoining bedroom. It was a tight space but workable for a family of four. Not sure it would be enough space if traveling with teens, but it worked for us. Traffic noise was a bit loud but turning on the fan was enough to eliminate it. The hotel was otherwise quiet despite being busy, and was very clean. I also liked the conservation efforts - in-room recycling bin, filtered water with reusable bottles in the hallway, and the heating/cooling turned off when the room was not in use. I would stay here again happily.

Have stayed in New York twice before but this hotel was the icing on the cake!.Location was great couple of blocks from Grand Central,room not huge but great king bed so slept well,but the main thing about this hotel is the staff nothing to much trouble ,it’s unfair to name just one but the standout is Chris Prandy ,not just for his wine and cheese evenings but his friendliness and energy. The only worry I have is that next time I go to New York their will be no room for me !!.

For the price, The rooms were a good size, well equipped and clean. Staff were friendly and very helpful. The club lounge on the 27th floor had a great skyline view and was well stocked with complimentary coffee, soft drinks and snacks.

This has been a great visit. The happy hour was awesome and we had great wine, great company and Chris our host mind that Chris our host was really good. He was fun and very informative. We had a we had a great time at club quarters in grand central Midtown Manhattan

He is gregarious, funny, engaging and a fantastic host. He is an asset and so full of energy. Made my stay much more fun than I could have hoped for. The Club Quarters is in a great spot to wander Manhattah and if Chris greets you, it will be a good stay. Enjoy!

Great hotel, nice suite (good size, even the 3rd floor on the street was quiet). Great room amenities including fridge and microwave. Highlight of the hotel had to be the 24/7 27th floor lounge with complimentary tea and coffee. But 5pm is Wine Time! Special shout out to Chris, so friendly and kept the wine flowing for my Mum ("my favourite mum!" said Chris). Top service in a top hotel.

Wine and cheese with Chris was amazing! He is awesome!! Chris took excellent care of us! The wine and cheese were delicious! Chris is the best host! Very attentive! Thank you for everything! We had a great time!

Great place to be. Thank you to all the team (specially chris) for your attention with us. We Will come back here without any doubt ! The room was perfect and clean. The location is great . I recommend this place to others guests

Happy hour in 27th floor and the host Chris is awesome! Room is small but nice, coffee maker in the room and pure water stations in every floor are nice. Prefer room in the upper floors due to traffic noise from the streets. Friendly staff at the hotel.

The hotel has a very good location, in midtown close to Grand Central, subway and busses are easily accessible. The people in the hotel are really nice and helpful. We had a nice room with view on Lexington Ave .. still quiet (except for the heating which was irregular but loud.) A real treat is the clubroom on the 27th floor with tea, coffee fruit and goodies and a nice happy hour. Chris and his colleages are lovely hosts.

Love the location, being across the street from GCS was very helpful. The Staff is amazing & very helpful in assisting us with a variety of questions/requests. All that we encountered were very friendly and welcoming, whether it's walking in the front door or spending time in the Living Room on the 27th floor. The rooms are somewhat small, I'm sure because it's NYC & being a more business oriented hotel but felt spacious enough when my (3)cohorts and I gathered in one for a conference call one evening. I also felt the room/hotel was very clean.It's the little things that catch my attention, like asking for extra hangers shortly after check-in & having them minutes after; the distilled water fountains on each floor with bottles available for use without charge; there was a washer/dryer available for use as well, however, I did not personally use it. (I just love the idea that it's even there & free of charge!) I did go up to the Living Room on the 27th floor, it was comfortable and cozy & the view was amazing! If I timed it right, they had snacks & drinks available on top of always having really good coffee available by the push of a button. I had a room with an excellent view of the street, great for people watching as I drank my coffee in the mornings and when I closed my curtain at night I did NOT hear the traffic as I thought I would. The overall quietness of the hotel was a plus. It made for a great nights rest after a busy day of meetings and the hustle n bustle of NYC. I do travel quite a bit (business/personal) and not every place has the staff you'll positively remember, this place definitely did. Thank you to Ray, Debbie, Johnny and Chris!

I reserved a room for 2 nights for business travel, but needed to leave NYC after just one night due to a pending Nor'easter. The staff was VERY helpful and accommodating with early checkout, something I cannot say for colleagues who chose another hotel. Highly recommend this hotel.

What a great location. All of NYC is easily accessed. Although the rooms are small they are well designed and efficient offering good value. The 27th floor social lounge offers computer and coffee service with a great view.

Great place to be. Conveniently located in East village safe and clean neighbourhood. The view was great from my room overlooking the crossing toward hemsley and lexington. Corner room was fabulous!!!

No Frills Business and Personal Travel Hotel . rooms are clean, small but have the right amenities for comfortable stay. 27th floor great room with indoor and outside seating is fantastic.
