All day snacks are nice extra. Gym on third floor is adequate for quick workout. Great location two blocks from Grand Central Station and all east side midtown restaurants

Absolutely love staying at Club quarters grand central! The hotel is very clean, and has a lot of little touches that set is apart from other hotels. 27th floor has complimentary drinks, snacks, great views, and also does an hour of complimentary wine and cheese at 5 pm daily. Special thanks to Chris who serves up the wine, he was so welcoming,friendly-his customer service was superb and made our stay all the more enjoyable. I look forward to staying at this hotel again next time I'm in manhattan.

Perfect location! Excellent service! Many thanks to the great staff for all their hard work and exceptional customer service! Many thanks to the general manager with the nice german accent! I highly recommend this great hotel to anyone visiting manhattan!

A hotel with very high standards in a very central location. Thanks to Chris for serving complementary wine at five a clock at the top floor. Thanks to Debbie, Mustafa and Rey who are giving great service in reception. And Elizabeth who did a thourough job in cleaning my hotel room. Thank you!!!

This was a very clean hotel, and everything was made very simple. We had the complimentary wine in the evening, and we had a quiet night's sleep. It was nice to get up in the morning and look out to see the people walking below.

It was a pleasant stay in your hotel. Next time i will come in New York, i'll be there ! I really like your place for working at the 27 floor. And my room was very clean ! I want to thank you ! My stay in New York was really great !

Robert Rey and Chris Prandy are a REAL dynamic duo. These are the guys that'll make your stay THAT much better. They're very well customer oriented, can recommend plenty of great spots to eat or sight-see!

I want to especially appreciate Elizabeth for good room service. Rooms are very clean, location is great in mid town. Evening wine hour and 27th floor lounge just fantastic. I wish breakfast was available on the 27th floor, but all in all, this is a good deal for NYC midtown.

The things that make this hotel great are nice touches like the yoga mat and resistance bands in the bedroom, the lounge area with the free drinks, chrome casting Netflix from your phone to the TV, the refillable water bottles, fruit and snacks, the washing machines, free WiFi... And wine night was a lot of fun! I'd definitely recommend and stay here again.

Booked a room for my birthday just to get away. I called prior my arrival and spoke to Lola about restaurant options and spa services. I was beyond pleased with my room (1102) Perfect corner room with a great view. Lola’s suggestion to the Sea Fire Grill was yummy and the Premier 57 spa is my new favorite place. I will definitely be back! Everyone was so nice and welcoming.

Loved staying here - the room was comfortable and the common room (living room) was an added bonus. Only the rather short bed was a surprise. The location was great. Wifi worked well. All my needs were met although the price tag was a bit high.

2 room suite with small kitchenette. Worked well for having a refrig and microwave to warm up breakfast. Coffee and fruit available on the 27th floor in the lounge. Small exercise room and laundry also available. Mustafa at the front desk was especially helpful with answering questions, making recommendations and check out.

This place is very accessible (from Grand Central) and overall, pretty nice. It's one of the best balances of being nice while not being unrealistically expensive. The room was better than other manhattan rooms I've had in the same price range. The biggest reason I will book again with CQ at this specific location is because of the staff. The first part of my stay, the staff working seemed inconvenienced and impatient. It really rubbed my the wrong way, but the reason I'm giving this place a 5/5 is because of Chris, Rey, Robert, and Khari. They were the team working on the afternoon of St. Patrick's day 2018 - which is when I was checking out - and they completely sold me on the place. These guys were perfect - they work together perfectly and are personable and know how to engage guests like I've honestly never seen before. If I started a hotel business, I'd hire these guys immediately. They talked to me, made me feel valued, and really completely sold me on CQ Grand Central. For this reason, I will definitely be going back. Hopefully everyone gets to meet these guys during their stay. To Chris, Rey, Robert, and Khari - thanks, guys, you are awesome and work together perfectly as a team. Made the stay absolutely worth it.

5 night break in Manhattan from Ireland. Hotel is situated just across from Grand Central which is a great base for onward travel. 7 day unlimited MTA card for use on subway as well as Buses with a cost of $32 is well worth the money. Just 2 subway stops into Times Square. 10 min walk to 5th Ave. Rooms are fine for Manhattan standards. Free bottled water on each floor. Free snacks tea coffee in lounge on 27th floor which also has free wine & cheese reception daily fm 5 to 6pm. Hosted by Chris who will go out of his way to make you fell welcome and generous with the wine! This is my 3rd trio to Manhattan and if returning again would definitely stay here. Also plenty of delis bars restaurants within walking distance and just around corner from Fitzpatrick’s hotel that has nice bar called the Wheeltapper.

Great time had a PK at the Bar on St pat s day We had family and friend s together for the holiday we stayed over for one night had the kids with us everything was perfect. Truth be told he is like a most gracious host and your in his living room grew escape it’s like staying at an old friends house. While we came only from Staten Island still nice place to have to come home to on a day when the city was insane. Rooms are great also lol Thanks PK Jim

I wanted to say a massive thank you to Mustafa and Debbie at the Club Quarters hotel in midtown, NY. Their service was absolutely exceptional and will be the reason we come back again. Mustafa was particularly helpful throughout our stay and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. Thank you and see you again soon!

Rare 27th floor rooftop! BYOB except 5-6 where you will find Chis serving up wine, jokes and a good time. Fresh cold bottled water on each floor. Excellent “living room”where you can get coffee, soda, fruit and light snacks. Convenient mid-town Manhattan location. Easy walk to Times Square, Rockefeller Center, United Nations.

Good hotel for New York and in a great location. Friendly service with a great viewing terrace on the 27th floor with free wine and cheese at 5! Thanks @Chris for the service and for making us laugh! We had a good time.

Chris - the host... is absolutely AMAZING!!! Will definitely be my hotel of choice... the way he greets and personally takes care of EVERY guest is outstanding customer service... and his personality is great :-)

Great location, services and really friendly staff. What I really liked was having a yoga mat in the room with the possibility of choosing classes in the TV. The hotel also offers to bring exercise machines to your room. Another detail I loved was the water machine and recycled bottles to re-fill at any time. If meetings finish early they offer complementary drinks and food in the lovely top floor :)

Staff was super friendly! and I loved the 5-6pm complimentary wine & cheese as ell as the morning coffee & fruit on the 27th floor deck overlooking the City. What an awesome way to unwind or start your day. Rooms were kept clean and the location was great!

My team and I had a release party on the 27th floor. All I can say is, the night was incredible. Staff were very helpful and very friendly to all of the guest. Special thanks to Lola and Mustafa for all of their help and hard work to making the event amazing. Also the rooms are incredible and spacious. This is the place to go if you want to impress someone or even yourself. 7 star rating from me. Thanx again Lola. You are the best!

Love this Hotel. Cute clean rooms. Great friendly service especially from Chris and Shuba. Each floor had a water station with refillable bottles. That goes a long way with me since I drink a lot of water. Awesome rooftop to look over the city and had snacks available. Located near 5th Ave and not far from Grand Central. Less than a mile from Times Square.

Stayed a night while I was on a business trip. Although I didn't spend a lot of time in the hotel because I was out and about, when I did stop by my room, I was always greeted by the person at the front desk. Rey (I caught his name) was friendly and would make small talk. I appreciate his attention and will have to come back when I visit New York again.

I threw a release party on the 27th floor in the hotel and my stay was absolutely amazing. The staff was welcoming and very friendly. I want to give a special thanks to Lola and Mustafa. Their customer service was impeccable. I will definitely stay in Club Quarters again in the near future. Thank you for everything!

This was about the eighth time I've stayed at this Club Quarters Grand Central. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean and decent sized. Staff very friendly, professional, and helpful. They recently started a 'Wine at Five' tradition in the club room on the 27th floor every evening at 5pm. Free local wine and cheese and snacks, was an excellent happy hour party atmosphere and the host, Chris excelled at his job, what a great personality! Looking forward to visiting again next month.

Staff are extremely helpful, central location and easy access to every thing NYC offers. The room is great, bedding is excellent the only draw back for not giving the five stars is the continues noise coming from the next room guests due to the thin walls, as well as there is no safe in room.

Great location in midtown, very nice rooms. On the smallish side but very clean and well laid out. Great rate for a Thursday and Friday. Nice wine tasting event in the common room on the top floor. Staff was EXTREMELY DISCREET, which was well appreciated. I would stay again.

Chris is the most fabulous host imaginable of the nightly wine tasting. He makes everyone feel at home and is very attentive. Every night between 5 and 6pm, the 27th floor is the perfect place to unwind and connect with friends, new and old! The wine is delicious and the host is fantastic. It’s the best thing about Club Quarters Mid-Town.

I enjoyed staying at this midtown location, the staff is super friendly, the price for the room was great the view was nice and the restaurant davios was great too. The beds are comfy and the showers are clean the rooftop is really relaxing and at 7pm the hotel as a happy hour free booze!

Enjoyed our stay very much, close to all the hot spots in NY. Every day at 5 to 6 they serve great wines and snacks complementary on the rooftop. Chris made this a very enjoyable hour with his great hostmanship.

Great hotel, especially because there is Chris in the living room from 17 to 18. Free wine and a really great guy! Great wine, great guy, great time! Thanks a lot! He even fills your glasses when they are empty!

When I got to the room, it was awfully hot. It felt very musky and the air was extremely dry. To combat the heat, I turned on the AC, but the fan was SO loud. This kept waking me up during the night. The bed was advertised as a queen, but seemed smaller. The price wasn’t terrible for the location it was in (Grand Central), but the price I paid for being sleepy/cranky the next day was way greater.

The location is great! easy to find and also across the road from a comic shop! Me and my family came here for a holiday and my god it was awesome. the rooms were tidy and had a great view of New York. The customer service from Chris (who was a big dragon ball super fan) was excellently inviting during the wine and cheese tasting party! That guy was really funny! who made everyone feel welcome. Mustafa who was also working on reception was also very inviting. great staff for a great hotel.,

Rey and Debbie were amazing! Rey was especially kind, helpful and funny from the moment he greeted us, making this leisure trip so much more fun and exciting. I recommend this hotel to anyone. Definitely coming back!!

This hotel is clean and comfortable. The lobby is small and efficient (no frills). I used the app to secure my key. It worked well. The room is small but perfect for business travel where you are spending a lot of time in the room. Housekeeping does a nice job of refreshing the room. The bathroom is efficient. The shower (no tub) is small and functional. The hall closet has ironing boards, irons and some amenities for your usage. Each floor also has a water dispenser with water bottles. The upper floor has a lounge with snacks and shared work/relaxation space. There is a nice outdoor patio outside of the lounge when the weather is warm and pleasant. Some local restaurants will deliver meals/snacks but with all the choices in NY, there are great options within walking distance. Overall a pleasant hotel and great for business travel.

The location is perfect near all subway lines which is very convenient. The rooms are very clean and the staff is very friendly and helpful. In the heart of midtown. I will be returning to this hotel again.

A great find! No-nonsense business hotel in fantastic location. Nothing luxury about it, but clean and very functional.Pros: great price, perfect location, good view if you are on a high floor, free water(!), free coffee and snacks, free printing, nice lounge with great views, friendly staff (especially Lola, Chris and Elizabeth, the housekeeper).Cons: small (yet functional) rooms, low floors aren't as nice (avoid second floor), elevator issues fairly regularly, getting things such as extra towels can take multiple requests.All in all, my go-to in NYC.

I unexpectedly needed a room for the night whilst staying in New York and came to Club Quarters as I had stayed in other branches and had always found it excellent. This time did not disappoint, in large part to front desk staff member Mustafa who went out of his way to accommodate me despite the last minute nature of my booking. He was very friendly and welcoming and really went the extra mile. I cannot thank him enough for how helpful he was in unexpected circumstances. The location of the hotel is very central which was great and the room was lovely.

We had an amazing stay at this hotel. The concierge and employees went above and beyond to make everyone feel at home. Not only is the location central, they hosted wine and cheese nights for free! Our room was clean and quiet, and we had everything we needed. I highly recommend this place and will be returning. Thank you for an amazing time!!

Hotel is conveniently located to Grand Central trains and subway lines. Room was clean, quiet, and secure. Good set-up for business travel; lots of outlets in the room for charging multiple devices. Friendly and helpful staff, both front desk and housekeeping.

Very clean, new room. Small, but everything you need. Table for work area. Staff was helpful. TV system worked well providing various services. Convenient to mid-town. A number of close restaurants for dinner or breakfast.

As soon I entered at the Hotel I was greet by Front desk Robert, very friendly and made me feel welcome. I went to my room and I was impress on how clean, and nice was the room. The view from my room was amazing, I was in 17 floor and I can see the city from 2 different windows.But then I realize my heather unit was leaking and carpet was all wet. I call FD and they send 2 very helpful employees to take a look, they did everything possible to fix the problem and to try to dry carpet, but that was no much they could do.Hotel was full and the didn't have another room for me. So we have to stay there.Staff was very nice and Hotel is very clean.They definitely deserve 5 stars in my review if not for the leaking problem.

Provide additional seating area in lobby and on the 27th floor. Fruit and snacks were very good, unfortunately the water machine was not working on 2/28/18 on the 27th floor. The front desk held out luggage while we attended a meeting, which was much appreciated. Great service!

I didn't expect to need a room but with short notice I was able to find a great room and a great rate that saved my weekend.Fortunately Rey at the front desk was able to put everything together for me to be able to enjoy a night away from home and not have to worry about any of the details.Don't hesitate to book here and if you have any questions rest assured the staff will be able to satisfy your concerns.

The rooms are not big and the hotel is older, however, the rooms were very clean. This hotel is very centrally located to all the great sites like Times Square, Grand Central Station and the Empire State Building. The staff was very friendly and accommodating when I asked that they change my room. I was also very pleased that the cleaning staff was able to locate my missing phone charger and return it to me.

When I travel to certain cities I make sure to look for CQ hotels as they will always give you a solid, consistent experience. Club Quarters near Grand Central is again, a great location and the price is excellent considering all. Its good to see some of the same people working there for so long, it makes the stay more familiar. John and Zishan always lend a hand to myself and others. If you need well located place to stay with great accessibility to anywhere in the metro NY area from Manhattan, this is the place

Everything about this hotel in my opinion was fantastic. The location being a minutes walk from grand central for the subway and being able to walk to times square and broadway was perfect. The lounge on the top floor which had free coffees and snacks and wine at 5pm was great after a busy day and for getting you going in the morning. The staff were fantastic as well, so friendly and offering to help with anything you need.

After we had the worst flight in history we arrive at this midtown hotel. We were welcome by Rey at the front desk. He was so accommodating and knowledgeable of the city that he made us realize that we were in NYC. The room was small but very cozy. Walking distance from grand central station. I know we are staying next time I go to NEW YORK CITY.

Very nice cosy hotel with perfect location in New York City. Close to Grand Central. Definately worth price.Free wine, cheese and coffee from 5 to 6. Chris is amazing. He is fantastic entertainer and very helpful.

Booked this hotel because I wanted something convenient to Grand Central Station. Absolutely loved it, the staff are wonderful, the rooms spotless & the location couldn't be better. Grand Central Station is literally across the street. Rooms are quite small, but that's the norm in NYC.

Hotwire got me a killer rate in Club Quarters Grand Central. Perfect location for my 3 day business trip, walking distance to all of my meetings midtown. Rooms are small but I guess standard size for NYC. Nice lounge upstairs to work and relax, terrace with a cool view. Happy Wine and cheese hour every day from 5 to 7pm, cannot beat that. only thing> the fitness room is really a converted room so super small with no view, not inviting.

An economical hotel in mid-town Manhattan. Have stayed here numerous times for one-night stays when in NY on business. Very convenient to GCT. When not busy they sometimes give free room upgrade. Lobby is tiny and it is a no-frills kind of place. But it’s clean, comfortable and rooms have basic amenities (ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, etc) you expect.

If you're a single traveler like me, the Club Quarter rooms are perfect. Although a little smaller than an average hotel, everything is clean, modern, and there are great amenities like bottled water, chromecast in the rooms, fresh fruit, coffee, soda, and wine at 5PM.

The hotel was across the street from Grand Central, which was perfect when traveling around the city. We flew into LGA, so the uber was only $35, a lot cheaper than booking a car service or even a yellow cab. The 27th floor had a complimentary wine hour that was great, offered to guests of the hotel only. Zishan and David were extremely kind to us, every night when we returned they welcomed us with smiles, chocolates and asked "if we needed anything?". Great choice for a hotel when in NYC!

I had contacted this hotel before making our reservation, with a million and one question. Lola and Zishan did not have a problem answering any, in fact they went out of their way to give us the best advice and helped us beyond our expectations. From the time we got in, till the time we checked out, our entire trip was thought out well, thank to the two helpful individuals! David was also kind enough to replenish our rooms with whatever we needed as we were out the whole day and would forget to take off the DND sign. Great stay, can't wait to be back!

My recent stay at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central Location was hands down my finest experience in NY City in quite some time. The room was very clean and adequate in size. In fact, the staff was even able to make accommodations to get us checked in hours earlier than we expected. There is a parking garage a short 2 blocks away that allows for a hotel discount in fees (Most Helpful, especially for NYC) The staff are all very professional. Mr. Johnny Ospina was on duty in the afternoon and evenings and he was able to do a tremendously good job securing all of our city needs from transportation to restaurant suggestions and reservations with incredible speed. He really made our stay comfortable and stress free, and who doesn't want that while traveling. Ask for Mr. Ospina and be well taken care of. If respect, leisure, and fun are what youre looking for in a hotel Club Quarters, Grand Central is for you. Thank you to the whole staff.Andrew DiClemente

For almost a year, a colleague and I have been traveling on average two times a month to work in New York City. After a few visits we discovered the Club Quarters, Grand Central, a very pleasant surprise! We are close to our client on 42nd street but also an easy distance from our client's locations in Downtown and Uptown. We've sampled Davio's Northern Italian Steakhouse (****) downstairs and many good restaurants in walking distance of the hotel. CQ is also in easy walking distance of Broadway. Staff members are friendly and helpful. Specifically we've had help arranging transportation and directing us to local venues by Justin, Robert, Julio and Rey. We have used the "Living Room" on the top floor for meeting with our clients--great space for that! And the wine and cheese (a recent addition) from 5:00 to 6:00 is a nice way to start the evening.

Got stuck in NYC due to snow storm at home but Chris and Justin were fantastic from check in to giving travel tips and generally doing a great job. Hotel location is excellent as it is just around corner from United Nations and it is close to loads of restraunts / bars

I love staying at Club Quarters Grand Central. I often get there late and am greeted by the coolest overnight staff, Zishan, Lola and David! They seem to always be laughing and enjoying their “job”. The rooms are simple but clean. The water dispenser is genius! I don’t care that I have to leave my room to get an iron and board, but that’s small. The beautiful view on the 27th terrace is the cherry on top! A great hotel overall!

I chose teh hotel at last minute for its convenient location to all the places I wanted to visit while in Manhattan. It was on walking distance from everything important including Penn station, grand central terminal, fifth Avenue and Rockfeller. Room was nice and comfortable as well. The staff was very helpful. I forgot my wallet in the room on checkout and the hotel staff arranged the postal of my package once I had left. It was a very professional gesture.

This is a great hotel that offers so much, for a reasonable price. Best value hotel I have. stayed at in a long time. The 27th floor has coffee, computers, a great view, and a wine hour that offered some tasty wines. I initially had trouble printing out a few things from the printer on the 27th, but Zishan was able to help me out with that problem. The staff is another strong reason why anyone should stay here.

Place is hands down amazing with out going staff such as Zishan help me out, as much as he could with aiming in the right direction as to where the right places to explore and the right places to eat highly recommend this place

Great location, literally round the corner from grand central terminal, 15 minute walk from time square, and same distance from the rockafeller centre and the empire state, clean and tidy room, very helpful staff in reception

We booked what I'm pretty sure is the smallest room available -- which is definitely small, no question. But not only was the price even smaller -- cheaper than a fairly low-end Air BnB! -- but the comfort and service were excellent. This is the quintessential case of value for money. There are bigger rooms, so if you really need space, it's available at a higher price. But this was partly a business trip -- all I needed was a good place to work and a comfortable bed, and this room was perfect on both counts. For working, there was a sizable table with lots of outlets and really excellent broadband. Best of all, the Club Lounge on the top floor was a big, roomy, well-appointed place to work or meet outside the room, with great views, all-day coffee and snacks, and even complimentary wine in the evening. As for the other comforts, the bed was just-firm-enough, the shower was strong and roomy, and there was a Keurig coffee-maker in the room to supply the day's first cup. For the small price-tag, I literally couldn't have asked for anything more. Oh, and Davio's restaurant was also great, both for dinner and breakfast.

I had so much to do in such little time, but Zishan made our itinerary fun and exciting! We were able to pack so much with such little time! Zishan recommended the perfect restaurants for us to dine at as well at the sites to see! Thank you for making our trip nothing short of amazing!

The first night I got there, I had booked the wrong dates - complete error on my end! However Zishan was able to make the adjustments and take care of the mishap, in the most professional way! Thank you for your help!

Stayed here for work and everything was perfect. Free wifi, an amazing business center, and free water - what else can I ask for? The entire staff focused on making my stay as stress free as possible. Toby was very helpful and polite, cleaned my room perfectly everyday! Zishan, was extremely helpful as well, didn't matter what hour of the night - Superior customer service!

My daughters and I recently stayed here and I couldn’t have been happier. The room view  was delightful and the room itself was clean, comfortable and spacious. It is a terrific location for shopping. But, without a doubt, the very best part of the hotel is the staff: helpful and efficient. A special thank you to the hotel desk staff Rey for taking a great girls getaway and turning it into once in a lifetime trip. Rey recommendation did not disappoint  he definitely Knows the area.Can't wait to come back!

Rooms are clean. Service with a smile. The energy Chris had was contagious on the rooftop for complimentary wine hour with cheese and crackers. Great idea! Suggestion - nicer if breakfast or brunch was served on the rooftop. No complaints. Rooms are quiet.

The hotel is perfect for a short stay, the bed is comfortable, the room is clean, nice shower. I in particular like to exercise a little when I travel, and found the fitness room lacking compared to the rest of the hotel. Nonetheless, the entire staff where very hospitable, helpful, and entertaining (Chris - Happy Hour Host)

We had a great stay over a rainy weekend in NYC. The room was clean and well appointed and and nicely laid out. There are several nice touches, like the refillable purified water bottles. The "Wine Hour" at 5pm was worth a return booking all on its own! Chris was a delightful host and kept the cheese and crackers coming and our wine glasses full! The location is also great, right on top of Grand Central and an east walk to Times Square, the Theater District, Central Park and the Chrysler Building. Will definitely return.

VERY ATTENTIVE DESK STAFF Stayed one night to meet with a friend who had a layover. Hotel desk staff Rey was very helpful and pleasant. Room was clean, and quiet. The lounge on 27th floor is a must. Price for February is very good for quality and location. Will definitely book a room there again!!

Great weekend rate. Room was clean and tidy. Plenty of room for 2 people.Good location in mid town. The Front desk Rey very nice gentleman, was very helpful made my stay very pleasant. Had the best weekend ever!!

Truly enjoyed my stay. Perfect location, clean rooms and an excellent staff, especially Zishan. Mr. Zishan was incredibly professional, courteous and very helpful to us during our stay - I will definitely be returning.

Very nice hotel in very convenient location. Clean and spacey rooms. The members of the staff are great, very kind at all times. Especially the guys Rey and Chris, always happy to recommend where to go and how to do it. The only thing I would change is that I would add a small fridge to the room, but still, five stars.

The hotel is excellent. My girlfriend and I spent a weekend there and it was simply great. The location is super convenient. If you are interested in Asian food, it is only one stop away by metro to the Korean town (or walk for 15 to 20 minitues) in Manhattan or 4 to 5 stops to East Village. The front desk staff, Rey, is very friendly and helpful. This hotel offers yoga mat and resistant loops in rooms! This is wonderful! I will definitely come back again and I recommend it to everyone!

The staff were very professional and courteous. They made me and my family feel especially welcome. I would like to single out two of the guest service reps, Julio and Ben. They both were very kind to my children and took the time to answer any of the questions we had. I highly recommend this hotel!!

Where one stays is a big part of a trips success. We stayed at Club Quarters and it was the key to a great vacation. The service was amazing! Front desk was always helpful. Wine and cheese with Chris, serving smiles all around, was truly a highlight.

Great weekend rate. Room was clean and tidy. Plenty of room for 2 people. Housekeeping did a fabulous job.Good location in mid town. Front desk can be quite busy as there is no real lobby just a small desk for check in.

The location of this hotel is excellent, you're right in the middle of midtown Manhattan. Upon my wife and I were greeted at the front desk by Justin Mrwik, who's customer service was excellent. He had us set up quickly and answered all of our questions about great local restaurants. I really enjoy German food and his recommendation did not disappoint. I would highly recommend this property and if you're lucky enough, you'll have Justin there to help guide you.

Shuba (front desk agent) was very friendly and welcoming. Being in NYC for the first time, she suggested top places to eat and visit during my short stay. She was very attentive to all my needs and made sure my room was serviced everyday before I came back. The service i received from all staff, especially Shuba, made this trip wonderful. Can't wait to come back!

This is my trip to new york and wow what an eye opener this hotel is ideal the staff are really friendly and helpful.I wanna say thank you to Mustafa,Debbie and Rey for being so friendly and welcoming. I will defo stay here again no questions asked. Thanks guys and stay safe

Quite simply, I can't think of a single thing that this hotel could do to improve. One employee, Chris, made our stay, but the whole hotel was excellent.I would strongly recommend staying at Club Quarters on 45th. Chris provided the greatest customer service experience I've ever enjoyed - including stays at Four Seasons, Hilton and Fairmont Resorts. Thank you, Club Quarters and Chris!!!

Modest, modern European style hotel for travelers who don't plan on spending time in a spa. . Nothing is missing. Its new, clean, efficient designed rooms including space for doing yoga. They provide each room with a yoga mat! There is a table for work or to eat-in, No safe so take your computer and your jewels with you.

This was an amazing hotel. Upon arrival I was warmly welcomed by the staff, Suba and Rey. They were extremely friendly and made my stay in New York City very easy. Rooms are hygiene and comfortable in all aspects and if I needed anything the staff would quickly respond to any concerns I would have. This hotel ticked all the boxes on my list and I look forward to returning whenever I am visiting NYC again.

NY hotel, close to Grand Central Station. Small rooms, (as all are), clean, nice of perks (free water bottles), wine and cheese reception at 5:00pm every night...snacks available 24/7. Rooftop terrace enclosed..we watched a snowfall at dusk with wine and cheese...very beautiful! Chris was our host for the wine/cheese party..he had a lot of personality and made it fun!

This is a wonderful, affordable, clean, friendly hotel with a great location and staff.Very good workout facility.Very reasonable parking rates at close by garage. .We stay there every time we come to New York and will continue to do so

Located a few blocks from Grand Central Terminal made it very easy to get around. Room is small but has everything you need. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We greatly enjoyed our stay even though we didn’t experience everything the hotel had to offer.

Northern European hotel vibe: Modern, clean rooms, with very competent and friendly service staff. Liked the rooftop clubroom and expresso machine! Great location near Grand Central. Somewhat small room no problem in NYC, given that we were only there to sleep.

This is a great business hotel if you are looking for lodging basics without the frills of a lavish lobby, restaurants and gift shop. The room was clean, well furnished, modern and comfortable. I had a small refrigerator, microwave and working table which provided a good working environment for completing a project proposal and email. The staff was super friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions and directions. Overall, this is a great value for business travel in NY city.

We stayed at this Hotel for a quick weekend getaway. The rooms are spacious and the layout of the rooms is accommodating for work or just lounging around. Our room had a kitchenette which was very convenient, as we like to cook or have a late night snack. There is also a Lounge on the 27th Floor which serves refreshments and light snacks. The Guest Service Agent/Concierge, Chris was phenomenal! Chris was absolutely friendly and genuine. Chris was able to answer all our questions about local attractions in the city, in addition to suggesting a few great local restaurants. Chris was super sweet, patient and hard working. Chris was also the Host upstairs on the 27th Floor and was able to greet every single guest with a smile and a warm authentic greeting. It really shows Chris cares a lot about his guests as well as his job. Can't wait to come back! Great location and within walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants and Grand Central Station. :)

From arrival to departure, I was very impressed by all that the hotel offered, and especially the hospitable employees, especially Chris in the lobby and at the evening social on the 27th floor. The quietness of the room was so appreciated and allowed me to get great rest! The WiFi was stable and fast...and you must try the HDTV InnSpire technology to "CAST" your smartphone or tablet movies and content via bluetooth on to the HDTV...so simple and only took seconds to make it happen.The fitness center was clean and had ample equipment. They have water stations with filtered water and provide you with reusable bottles...so SMART and responsible for the environment.The evening social hour was FUN, and full of guests have a great time...And Chris was up there being a GREAT host!Location was superb and really allows guests to experience NYC on foot...and there are so many restaurants, small food stores, and shops within minutes.Kudos to you all...I will be back!

The hotel was excellent. Great room and location to the east side. Lola - I believe that was her name - was so friendly at check in and Chris was also extremely helpful. Was just an overnight, but we’ll be back.

Wine and cheese nightly from 5 - 6. Chris is awesome!!!! His personality made the experience memorable. This is such a welcomed experience. I definitely recommend this establishment and I hope to be back soon.

Chris is fabulous! With friends and family, he took care of us and every one else at the happy hour. A true asset to the hotel. He remembered me Ann's a business associate from my business trip the week prior. What a guy!Makes this a true memorable experience.

the rooms are clean and great quality. Chris is amazing! he’s very attentive, kind, energetic and helpful! the wine hour from 5-6 is absolutely lovely and definitely worth it. grand central station is a very short walk away and there are plenty of great restaurants around, either via subway or walking.

Great location. Clean rooms. So close to Grand Central Station. And the wine happy hour is amazing. The host, Chris is awesome. Pours wine and give the best restaurant recommendations. Will stay here again for sure.

This is a great hotel for short stays in NYC! It's in the heart of midtown, very close to Grand Central Terminal and the subway, compact, clean, comfortable and quiet. They make great use of the space while including everything a business traveler would need--a table with built-in seating for working or grabbing a quick snack, microwave, coffee maker, and a nice, large bathroom. I'd definitely stay again!

Loved my stay at Club Quarters! Was with them for four nights, staff is all very courteous. Room did not feel too small compared with other nyc hotels, but it’s definitely not very big. The lounge is great and i loved the water bottles and fill stations

I came at about 10 a.m. and expected to drop my baggage and walk until 15.00 but Rey gave me a room upon my arrival. Everything is clean and in perfect like new order. Chris made his best on 27th floor for their "Wine at 5" everyday event.

Right across from Grand Central Station...great price, in a safe location...room was small, but comfortable. Free bottled water, WiFi and amazing wine and cheese hour...ask for Chris...he’s an amazing host...(also snacks available 24/7.). Great place to stay! Will be back!

The property has a more homier feel than the many larger hotels around it. Convienent to many sites and love love love that many rooms have a kitchenette... Allows you to bring home all those leftovers from the many places that I tend to eat at when I travel. Chris was wonderful and accommodating. Love that they had an evening social in thier community living room and of course Chris made sure everyone was comfortable and able to enjoy a nice relaxing wind down after a day of touring.

Club Quarters Grand Central very nice hotel !Perfect location . Rey & shuba were very friendly and helpful in making the check-in process a breeze. They were quick to respond to any questions or inquiries I had. Also Lola was wonderful when I had any questions about places to go .The room I stayed in was excellent and featured a kitchenette . The hotel was very peaceful & quiet. Everything was amazing and great view . I would definitely return to this location.

Very nice place, the staff is kind and attentive. Friendly staff especially Chris during wine and cheese hour. He loves Canadians. Highly recommended close to so many great places. Would stay here again! Merci Chris!

I was in NYC for a brief 17 hours so my time was focused on the business I had to accomplish. However, when choosing my hotel, price was of the utmost importance. I wanted an efficient place to stay near Grand Central Station so I could get in and out easily. The room harkens to the IKEA showroom floor where careful thought was given to the placement of everything. But it was so efficient and comfortable, it did not feel small. Then you throw in their app, where when downloaded allows you to check in and use your phone as a room key, I walked right in, dropped off my bags and out I went to do my business. Back in the evening and up I went to my room (again, with no human interaction) and the next day I checked out on my phone. Done. These are small, efficient rooms, but yet clean and very comfortable. A great value.

We needed to stay in NYC for a few days. Child in hand, we needed a place which allowed work and family to commingle. What a great hotel! The staff is really terrific. Very attentive, The business area is useful and spacious, with amazing views. What a lovely experience. The hotel has a 5pm wine and cheese hour. Excellent. The roof top looks over Midtown and if you’re lucky you can see sunset. Children are welcome -- even if the point of the hotel is business. The neighborhood has excellent food. Cabs can be flagged on Lexington in seconds. Don’t miss the Oyster Bar at Grand Central, two blocks away. The lasagna across the street at GENTE is fantastic! The hotel makes it all possible.

This is the first time I stayed at this hotel, every employee are very nice. I have to mention my housekeeping, Toby! Very kind lady, even leave two lindt chocolate every day. Really nice experience at this hotel.

Club Quarters Grand Central is a great location. Very clean, nice top floor for coffee and continental breakfast, great view on the balcony. Staff is very professional, thanks to Chris, Rey and Sasa for your service and hospitality on a rainy weekend in NYC. We will be back!

I stayed here for 4 nights on a business trip. The hotel felt very safe and you could only operate the lifts via your key card.The club rooms were a good size, clean and the bedding was really good quality. There's a really good lounge on the 27th floor where you can work, have a chat and they supply tea/coffee & fruit. When I was there wine was offered free of charge between 5-6pm.Great location, very close to Grand Central Station, which has a great food court.

Club Quarters Grand Central is a prime location and steps away from Grand Central Terminal. If you need to access Metro North or the subways, this is the perfect location. Rey & Mustafa were very helpful in making the check-in process a breeze. They were quick to respond to any questions or inquiries I had. The room I stayed in was excellent and featured a kitchenette. The hotel was very peaceful & quiet. I would definitely return to this location.

The location can’t be beat and the NYC sized rooms are mod and convenient. The balcony on the 27th floor is the place to be on a spring of fall evening- 27 stories above Lexington Ave in the heart of mid town. Gym is small but clean and the staff are fabulous.

The hotel has a very good location. The rooms are just like the ones in the pictures. Maybe, the only fault is that the doors are a little noisy and you may listen when other guests open or close them. The linving room on the 27th floor is great and offers coffe/tea machine, sodas, cookies and wine at certain time of the day.

I travel to NYC often and over the years this hotel had become the only place I stay. Rooms are modern, clean and the staff is always professional and friendly, especially Zishan.The location is great, right next to Grand Central in the heart of midtown.

I was pleasantly surprised with recent stay at Club Quarters Grand Central. First, the location is great, easy access to the theatre, restaurants and Midtown NYC. The rooms were comfortable, well appointed with a very friendly atmosphere by the staff. Shuba and Mustafa were great, they helped to locate nearby services finding the closest, doublechecking hours of operation and giving me directions. On my way out the cleaning staff called down to say I had left a toiletry case ...I was a few steps from leaving.I highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay there again. Say hello to Shuba and Mustafa for me!Jim Boston

The hotel is clean, and the staffs are helpful. I was greeted by the front desk staffs Lola and Rey. They quickly checked me in and gave me information on the amenities and places to visit for the weekend. I stayed for two nights. My room was clean, and the view was amazing. I needed more time to check out, so I called the front desk and Sandy (such a sweet lady, borderline dry humor) was kind enough to give me an extension for my checkout. She was very attentive to my need, and asked if there is anything else she can assist with. Overall, the stay was wonderful! Definitely will come back again.

This place is fine in a pinch. And the staff is as helpful as they can be. Not the manager. Just the staff was helpful. I had to complain for 2 days in order to move rooms because there was no heat in the room. Engineering came to try and fix it three times but nothing worked. It's FEB in NY. I had to demand a move. It was not offered. There's not even back up like heaters for if the unit doesn't work. A kind night front desk guy sent his personal heater up when he was leaving his shift for the 2nd day that I was freezing. Thank you! I tried to get a hold of the manager to discuss this. No return calls. You can tell that the staff cares more about the hotel than management and the building issues.

This hotel is great with everything you need for a business trip. Boutique hotel with a nice sized room equipped to work comfortably in between your meetings. Every day at 5:00 pm there is a free cocktail hour at the hotel rooftop lounge area and make sure you ask for Chris Prandy - best waiter on the planet and ready to serve with the biggest smile ever ! Thanks Chris. See you in a couple of months when I am back.

Club Quarters near Grand Central Station was a perfect location. You walk into the lobby and a sense of order and peace descend vs the chaos and hectic pace that is palpable on the outside of their door. New York City is exciting, simulating, fun, and challenging. Having a peaceful retreat to return to heightens your enjoyment of the NYC experience. Club Quarters was our retreat - quiet, convenient, clean, well appointed and a blessing! Thank you.

We will be staying here again and have already recommended it to many people. The staff was so friendly and helpful. Anything we needed was taken care of immediately. The wine Happy Hour is so warm and the views are beautiful!

Stayed for a week at Club Quarters in Winter. Was impressed that the top floor of the hotel is a lounge area for guests with plenty of snacks, drinks and a nice view. This floor could have easily been turned into a penthouse! Chris and the rest of the team made us feel welcome. The Italian place Davios connected to the hotel makes a great casual dinner. The hotel is close to Grand Central, and the subway making it very convenient to get around and explore the city.

Great staff, comfortable rooms, and a great location. Robert was a fantastic host for the managers free local wine happy hour. They recently added a Peloton bike which helps elevate any winter workout to new heights!

if traveling to the city by rail, the location of the Club Quarters Grand Central is ideal. Once off Metro-North, you can be at Club Quarters in 5 minutes and no matter where you go around the city, just about any train gets you back to your hotel.

Excellent Hotel handy for Grand CentralChris is a brilliant host who will do everything he can to make your stay good. Handy for a number of excellent eateries and the food market at Grand Central. Accommodation is also very comfortable.

Great stay! We were immediately greeted in the lobby with a friendly smile. The staff member at the front was so pleasant he was in such a good mood i immediately knew it was going to be a great stay!

Would really recommend this place to anyone going to New York for a trip away .. for the price the amenities , location and staff were next to none . Rooms were small (like most New York hotels) but clean and had everything you needed

I needed a single night stay before moving to the Grand Hyatt for a business engagement my office had booked for me. Club Quarters was conveniently close . . . and turned out to be a fantastic choice! I would happily have stayed there for the entire trip!

More of a motel hostel feel despite the price. No bar, or lobby area and staff indifferent. There was a free laundrette, microwave in room and an odd dining area in room none of which we wanted or usedThe location is good but this did not compensate for the poor accommodation

This is a terrific hotel. The beautiful room was a good size for NYC, and had all the amenities, including coffee maker. Very friendly staff, fitness center, and an amazing restaurant (Davios). This is my new go-to NYC hotel.

It's a fantastic hotel. We booked a standard room with two beds. We have been very impressed with the rooms. They're spacious, clean, comfortable beds and lovely bathroom. When we arrived we found out there's free wine 5-6pm and free coffee and bottled water all day long. During the free wine hour the staff are lovely, definately must give Mustafa and Chris a fantastic customer service shout out! They're bubbly, friend and make conversations with you, as well as offering advice on where to eat and most importantly, top up your wine glass! Cannot recommend this hotel enough to people, it's a must stay whilst you stay in the big apple !Love the two British girls x

Staff is great (Zishan Mustafa, Carmen, maintenance man...), always willing to help. The room was comfortable and clean. Hotel amenities are a plus: coffee and fruits in the morning, wine in the afternoon. Hotel is very well located.

Such a nice time in the lounge. Chris was a great host and it added to the great experience staying at this hotel for a few days! The location of the hotel is great, the room was really comfortable and had everything I needed and the staff were extremely helpful!

All staffs in this hotel are very kind. I stayed to feel comfortable up to them.Special thanks to Ray, Robert, Ani, Yuki.Guys process my request friendly and quickly. And give me my best recommendation.And lady are cleaning my room perfectly every day. I will stay this hotel next visiting NY.

Stayed at Club Quarters by Grand Central again this week. Perhaps my 6th stay. It was an amazing price - which I guess is supply and demand in January. Very nice room, and the "Living Room" on the 27th floor was a new find - newspapers, fruit, coffee, etc. And I love that it is half a block from Brick, the CrossFit gym on Lexington.

Really great hotel. Super-convenient location, very reasonable prices, classy amenities. Also, Zishan at the reception was awesome—he helped me out with a problem with my reservation when I arrived late at night and saved me a lot of trouble. I definitely recommend this place!

Rey and Johnny are the faces that greet you. They by far are an asset to this company. I can’t wait to come back. They recommended a fabulous restaurant that was close by. They also recommend that we eat in their in-house restaurant Davios. We had breakfast there. That also was out of this world. Thanks you for making our short visit so welcoming. And delicious!

The hotel is clean, spotless actually.The beds are comfortable.The TV is capable of streaming from your phone, free wifi.The people are nice, Small lobby with great people.The location is great, walking distance to Grand Central Station.and there is free wine at 5:00!!!!!

Island of quiet and peace in the vibrant city. Close to a good number of major attractions and very close to public transportation. All staff very friendly and helpful. Room well equipped for extended stay, full kitchen which includes ability to prepare a full meal if desired. This hotel will continue to be our go to property when in Manhattan.

Staff was very friendly and welcoming. Location was ideal! A few steps away from grand central and 5th Ave shopping. Definitely staying here again! They even have a daily complimentary wine tasting which I didn't catch on time but I plan to next time!

1. very quiet at night2. comfortable bed3. terrace with a city view on the 27th floor4. every evening free wine5. During the day free coffee, tea, fruit, biscuits6. you can leave the bag for several days in the luggage room

As usual, Club Quarters checks all the boxes for service, friendliness of staff, convenience, and hospitable extras like free wine tastings. I am a regular guest, and will continue to be for business and pleasure accomodations.

Stayed 2 nights in 2 different rooms as I checked out and had to extend my stay unexpectedly. First room, the mattress felt like it should be replaced. I was also on the third floor and found it noisy. Next night, room and mattress were great. 5th floor location made a difference and it was much quieter.

This was the perfect choice for my four day business trip. Centrally located, very affordable rates, and a small but well appointed room made for the perfect nest. Staff are exceptionally nice, too! I have already been recommending it to several people!

Most of the staff are friendly and helpful, however you do get the odd one out.. Staying here on a business trip, need to use a pair of scissors tonight and I thought I’ll go down to the front desk and ask to borrow one instead of calling the house keeping. I was infotmed by the staff on duty that they can’t lend me one but I can bring the item down to the front desk if I want. As the item is heavy, I turned down the offer. At that point， the front desk staff offered to send someone to my room to help me - an hour has gone pass, still no sight of anyone turning up and this is 22:30 so the hotel is not even busy.. Guess it’ll be easier for me to just buy a pair of scissors as I still have 10 more nights to stay here..

I stayed in the Club Quarters Hotel in January 2018. The room was small but clean, functional and in good condition. The hotel offers online check-in and check-out - no waiting time at a reception desk and the NFC enabled smartphone can even be used as room key. The hotel has an arrangement with an adjacent restaurant but keeps it overhead to a minimum on account of its location. However, there are very good business facilities and a launch at the top floor. Altogether an attractive package if you primarily look for a good and affordable accommodation.

CQH is close to many places you want to see and is accessible to the subway. It is close but far enough from Times Square and the play district to not be in the middle of tourist mecca.. Rooms were clean, staff was friendly, and the value was terrific. The room had an efficient layout and did I forget to mention that the shower was quite acceptable.

I stay at this hotel often due to its proximity to my corporate headquarters. It's quiet and unassuming in a very hectic area (right near Grand Central). I like that it's low-key, but clean and friendly.

I had a wonderful experience in the Club Quarters social space. From working in the early afternoon with espresso and snacks to wine and chit-chat at 5pm, I had a productive and enjoyable time.Chris, the server in the social space, was a phenomenal host who made me feel welcome and offered great dining suggestions. I would definitely stay again!

When I stepped in, I was greeted like a valued family member! Rey, at the front desk was personable and professional and took care of my needs. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. Grand Central Station was a block away, so this was a very convenient location. I would definitely recommend Club Quarters as a reasonable place to stay in NYC.

Club Quarters was surprisingly cute.... small but had all the necessary amenities we needed. The wine at 5 on the 27th floor was our favorite part. The entire staff was very friendly and attentive. Lola checked us in and out with the biggest and brightest smile. From we can tell everyone seems to enjoy their job. From the room attendants to the front desk. Our room was small but clean. We will be back!

Chris (Sunshine) in front lobby is your go to guy for anything you need. Great personality and great help. Very pleasant stay. This hotel is in a great location. Near subway trains, eats, and landmarks.

I needed a spot in Manhattan for a night. Having stayed at CQ in DC, Phila, Chicago, Boston, I was curious about NYC. I didn't have very high expections, but was extremely pleased. The room was larger and lighter than I expected and, as always at CQ, very clean with a very comfy bed. Given the time of year, I had to run the heating unit, which is always noisier than I like, but that's not the hotel's fault. It did work well. The staff, especially Robert and Chris, were remarkably friendly. I liked it so much that I booked a room for a friend who needed a place the very next night. I'd stay again.

I was pleasantly surprised at how nice this hotel was. Great location and amenities. I especially liked the hydration stations on each floor and the snacks/espresso machine on the 27th floor! Will definitely stay here again.

Excellent to walk around, there are lots of restaurants and shops in the area. Also pretty close to the subway and Grand Central Station, where you can take the shuttle to La Guardia airport. Rooms are comfortable and sound proof. The guys at the reception are friendly and helpful. Great city views from the terrace in the top floor.

I had to go to the airport during the evening rush hour. Johnny in the concierge team ordered me a car, made sure that it was on its way, kept checking on its status and updating me and helped get me to the airport in time.Great service!

My boyfriend surprised me with a weekend getaway at CQ. We stayed in a suite and had a great experience. The room was very clean and organized. There was a mini fridge, stove top, pots, dishes, and utensils for cooking, which was amazing since most places take forever to delivery breakfast on a sunday morning, and my BF came prepared to make me an amazing breakfast! Their rooftop offers beautiful views at night, and is nice place to have drinks with friends.We were also greeted with amazing service by their friendly staff: Yurissa, Alberto and Pete. Thanks for making my stay great.

TV didn’t work sporadically, phone in room didn’t work. But great location and liked the purified water in the hall. The lobby has a very cold feeling and could use some decoration. The room key had to be fixed several times. The front desk people were nice.

Chose this hotel because it's in close proximity to my office. Had early morning meetings at the office and it was more conducive to stay close by. Staff was extremely friendly, helpful and professional. Bed is very comfortable, pillows way to soft..but just my opinion. Clean room. Only cons i had was when i arrived there was no dial tone on the room phone. A tech came up to fix, however, did not resolve. Another day passed & no resolve. I mentioned it again to front desk who then sent another tech to fix. All.it needed was a battery replaced. Hotel should have checked with me to see if phone issue was resolved. Also, there was a delay on both TV screens in my room. Sound wasn't keeping up with words. Annoying. Water pressure in shower & bathroom toilet was poor. If need to iron, have to retrieve one from the closet in the hallway. Different for a NY hotel. Lounge and terrace on 27th floor was nice.

My eighteen year old son and I recently stayed at the Club Quarters Grand Central. We were there for College Touring/Theater auditions, while squeezing in a little NYC sightseeing. The hotel was very clean and modern. The 27th floor's heated terrace views were breathtaking; one could relax up there for hours, experiencing peace and tranquility. The hotel has limitless bottled water, and complimentary snacks. There's also a complimentary wine reception from 5-6 p.m, Mustafa gives very generous pours with a warm smile. You ask, why did she title her review "The Best Hotel Staff in NYC? I work in the travel industry. Therefore, I am very accustomed to experiencing superb service in domestic and international hotels. I must say the staff at Club Quarters Grand Central met, and acceded my expectations. The hotel manager Ralph set the tone of excellence, as we corresponded a few times prior to my stay. He met my requests and double-checked to see if we were happy with our accommodations, after we checked in. Robert, and Chris were usually located near the first desk, Chris in the day and Robert at night. These gentlemen continuously went above and beyond to ensure my son and I had a phenomenal experience. They were very professional, friendly and welcoming throughout our stay. I could not pass through the front doors without them asking how my tours went, did we enjoy the Broadway show, did we need any directions, or how my son's auditions went. Their kindness made us feel as we had made friends in the big city. Additionally, Debbie, and Sosa were very friendly and helpful. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone in search of a great location and a warm, friendly staff. I guarantee you will be more than happy with this choice.Many thanks to Ralph and your amazing staff. Ya'll take care now. (In my southern accent (Memphis).L.B.

This hotel is well setup for the business traveler. Rooms are modern and efficient. While the rooms are small, they are well done and do not feel small. Good spot if you need to be on the east side of town.

Room was small but well-appointed; loved the thermostat within arm’s reach of the bed, the magnifying mirror in the bathroom, and the nice common area, complete w/ espresso machine, fruit, and snacks. Location was convenient and parking was a mere $33/day!

Booked this hotel for a short, weeeknd getaway. Very close to Grand Central, maybe a block away. Staff was very friendly, helpful, and attentive (especially Chris, Sandy, and Mustafa). Standard room was large by NYC standards and very clean. Favorite part was sipping cappuccino in the beautiful enclosed terrace on the 27th floor. Will likely stay there again.

Great trip to NYC, booked at a decent discount and enjoyed the hotel a lot. Let us check in at 10 am for free (check in at 3) and had a luggage room for the day after even though check out was at noon. Luggage room attended by employees so I felt safe leaving a backpack with a laptop in it (not always the case).

I spent 6 nights with my wife at Club Quartes GC and we were extremely satisfied. The property is located just outside Grand Central Station on Lexington Av. and 45th street, close to the subway, many restaurants and with easy access to all the attraction on midtown and uppermidtown.The room was what we expected in New York but vwery confortable. The hotel doesn't have a proper lobby but the check in was a breeze and the guys were always helpful and ready to give assistance.The hotel has a fitness room on the 3rd floor, free water dispensers on every floor and a meeting room on the 27 floor with a terrace and a spectacular view of Manhattan. On this room there are always free hot beverages and snaks and at 5pm they serve complimentary wine for guests.I would highly recommend this property.

Very nice modern clean hotel in Midtown Manhatten.Safe location with an extremely nice and efficient staff.Always look forward to staying at Club Quarters Hotels.The Italian restaurant on the second floor is an award winning dinner experience.

I always look forward to coming here. It's convenient, the staff is wonderful and Housekeeping is terrific. The rooms are always meticulously clean. Like all CQs the Living Room is relaxing and this view is especially nice.

Customer service was excellent. Front desk employees like CHRIS brought compassion and care when walking in and out of the hotel. Whether it was the gym, 27th floor lounge, views, clean room, everything was on point.

This hotel was an excellent choice. The room was very clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was perfect! Grand central station was right across the street. We were able to commute without a problem. Rey did a wonderful job assisting us. We will definitely book this again !

This Club Quarters is my "go to" place when on business in NYC. Comfortable and clean. Rooms are small-ish, but very comfortable and well appointed, with a modern touch. The club living room on the top floor is a huge plus and a great place to relax or take your takeout dinner--the snacks and beverages are awesome. The living room is very nicely appointed and the terrace is a wonderful feature.

Decided to spend a romatic evening in nyc with my girlfriend and we choose to stay here. Alberto was great from the moment we checked in with awesome recommendations of places to go nearby. Will definitely return soon.

Had a very nice stay in a Superior room. We have stayed at the Club Quarters Midtown many times over the past several years but were disappointed in our last stay so decided to try the Grand Central location. Significantly nicer with better amenities (for example, this one has snacks, beverages, fruit, etc available every day instead of only weekdays and then there's the free wine/snacks every day at 5PM).Everyone, including the cleaning staff, was very friendly. We'll definitely be back.If you stay at Club Quarters frequently get their app - lets you check in, check out, and you can use your phone as your room key (or get physical key cards if you prefer).

Had a wonderful stay at the Club Quarters Hotel earlier this month. Zishan at the front desk was such a pleasure to deal with during our stay - he went above and beyond for us to make sure that our vacation was truly memorable! A+ for service! We look forward to staying at this hotel again very soon!

This hotel was awesome! Super friendly staff and great location. I will definitely stay there again on my next trip to NYC. The room was perfect... comfy bed, really clean, updated and very quiet. I also ate at the hotel restaurant and it was great.

I stayed at club quarters and met this amazing individual named Lola. I wish everyone in the industry was like her. So helpful, and so nice. I’m definitely coming back. It felt like home. Everyone was great but Lola stood out.

First! Love Chris, Justin and Mustafá!Small clean hotel right off Lexington Ave. Less tourists traffic and outstanding restaurants within walking distance. They give you a deal on parking. Woohoo! The room is well designed with comfortable beds and pillows. Keurig pot and free bottled water on the floor. Fridge and microwave even in our “club” size room. There is a Club level that offers a free happy wine hour 5-6 with snacks. The elevators operate with key card. I felt safe and very comfortable. I got a super deal via hotels.com and two nights towards a free stay. They have a cappuccino machine that is pretty good. It is not the Carlton Ritz but I will be back for our next city trip. Loved it.

Friendly, energized personnel was very helpful. We have been going to different hotels for years in Nw York, usually they are very old, not very clean, not very friendly. This boutique hotel is has very quality. 27 th floor is one of the best part of it. I highly recommend it.

Our stay here was absolutely lovely. Myself and my boyfriend stayed here for a week on a romantic getaway. The location is ideal, minutes away from amazing restaurants, stores and great sights. The staff are wonderful! Nothing is too much and they are so welcoming. Every time you enter or leave the hotel at any time, someone was there to greet you and wish you well. They also have great recommendations for places to eat and things to see. The room itself was spacious and warm with a huge window to look outside. The bed was really comfortable with high quality bedding. Fresh toiletries and towels were provided every day. There was a very plush blanket in the room too, perfect for the winter stay!This is without a doubt the nicest hotel stay I’ve ever had, the combination of the service and the location made it the best vacation yet!Thank you to everyone who made our stay so perfect.

This hotel was hotel was close to perfection. Hopefully Robert will be working on the night you choose to stay. I’m not sure what department he worked in but he would have done anything to make my stay enjoyable. The whole staff went above and beyond. I stay in many hotels as a flight attendant for AA and I can say that my job did a wonderful job picking this hotel for our layovers. Loved it!!!!!!!!

Typical CQ. Just what you need. Clean. Quiet. Nice coffee lounge. Even had wine tasting for early evening. Location in mid town can’t be beat. Didn’t go diwn to the steak house, but heard that it was very good.

The hotel is locate in the center of everything, such shop, restaurant, Deli and Grand central station. Staff are very polite, helpful and smile all the time. Inside the room are very nice and touchy together with coffee machine and soundproofed room. when we checked in, we were give room on 26th floor which was amazing view of Chrysler building. We were amazed with that and in the evening everyday , they have provided complimentary drink, tea, coffee, wine and nibble which are free of charge. I couldn't say anything bad about this hotel and next time we will definitely stay at this club quarter again for sure.

Lots of little extras ... Lounge on the 27th floor with coffe and snacks all day. Happy hour between 5 and 6 every evening with wine tasting. Bottled water on all floors. Staff was very friend,y and went the extra mile. Really enjoyed my stay!

Just spent the night at Club Quarters GCL! Was welcomed by everyone. Hell this is New York! Mustafa especially made this stop put a smile on my face! thank you Club Quarters! Thank you for all the hospitality. I can’t wait to come back! Plus the room is great and so is the location

We loved everything about this hotel. The great location, the free bottled water, the super clean room, the nightly wine social, the pleasant helpful staff, etc. It took just minutes to walk to Grand Central Station. And a great price!

Oh MY Goodness!! This place is a dream come true. The security is PHENOMENAL!!! I am a middle aged woman who travels alone. I frequently say “Where are we if we’re not safe?”From the moment you enter you will be greeted by Chris, Justin, Robert, Shuba, Rey, Peggy, Johnny or Mustafa. Immediately you feel like a VIP (and we are, aren’t we?)The rooms are fabulous. What I liked the best is the magnifying make-up mirror. I did mention that I am middle aged. I have environmental allergies. At my request maintenance came to my room to clean the vent. Anissa, Betty, Connie will ensure that your room is spotless.The absolute best feature is the 27th floor. Not only is it the place where the business center is, free wine is served at 5pm, free breakfast is served until 9:30 am, it is the location of the most exquisite view of Lexington Avenue.Enjoy your stay!

The hotel was very nice I was given a beautiful room from Lola when she check me in at 6:45 in the morning then on Late night my key didn’t work and I believe the man was zishawn who made me new key and made sure I got in the room by calling me in room. Free water on my floor and beautiful lounge on 27th floor where serve wine

I was scheduled for two nights in the city for work. My trip was extended an additional two nights due to weather. The CQ staff bent over backwards to accommodate the rest of my stay. Rooms are clean, modern and quiet. Location is PERFECT!

My boyfriend and I stayed here. At first I was really hesitant when he booked it because looking at the pictures it felt too nice for the value we were paying. Must I say it was exactly as it was in the pics. VERY clean. Comfy bed and pillows. Nice bathroom. I wish we had a bathtub as the showers were a little small. The room isn’t large but enough space for two people. But it’s NYC so the size will have to be compromised. It was so comfortable nevertheless. The location is EXCELLENT. You’re near everything, Time Square, Broadway, Central Park etc is all walkable even in the winter. Service is so on point. There is free wine everyday. And I’m not talking about little wine tastings, the pour is very generous. A staff member will pour top off your glass for you. The best part of this hotel is the staff. They are kind, resourceful and so helpful. I want to give a shout to Mustafa S. He recommended all the right stuff and went out of his way to make sure we felt comfortable and had the most amazing stay. We will definitely come back to this location just so we can have him as a conceirge. He is so friendly and loves his job. The other staff members are great too. We were sad to leave. Check out this hotel if you want value, convenience and helpful staff. The best. So happy to have stayed here.

Club Quarters is like having a home away from home. The staff performs outstanding work. Justin, Mustafa, Rex, and Sandy are just wonderful individuals who do everything possible to MORE THAN SATISFY their customers. I especially appreciate their living room where I can use their computer at no extra charge. That is in addition to delightful refreshments including soft drinks and, again, at no extra charge. Stay at Club Quarters and you will never be disappointed!

Nice, recently renovated. Small-ish rom, but big enough. Clean throughout and friendly staff. 27th floor lounge was outstanding, with seating out on deck or inside living room environment. 2 minute walk to Grand Central and Library, a bit longer to either Times Square or Empire State. Short inexpensive cab rides to most common destinations. Plenty of food options nearby, especially on 3rd Ave.

Room was comfortable, clean and welcoming. Service was friendly and efficient. We Enjoyed the living room on 27th floor. Wine at 5pm a nice amenity. Coffee and snacks available. Davios excellent meals.

This is a great hotel for solo travelers or perhaps a couple who aren't staying very long. The room I stayed in was very compact but I think they used the space well. The mattress could have used an upgrade but was fine for my one night stay. Tiniest closet I have ever seen in a hotel but i only had to hang up a few items. They also had hooks on the wall for your coat, etc. Overall the room was pretty comfortable and I found it to be quiet. It also came with a newer tv than other hotels I've stayed at. I hate hotel tv's where there's always a 10 second delay just to change the channel. I was on the 8th floor and I appreciate that they provide refillable plastic bottles that you can fill up with purified water. My interactions with hotel staff were limited but the check in/check out process was fast and efficient. Location is excellent.

Having stayed at Club Quarters on 45th and Lexington on our 3 most recent visit to NYC. The location is great, rooms are good sized, amenities (in the form of the lounge cannot be beat), and the staff is super.A special shout out than ks to Justin and Mustafa for their professional, friendly service.

At the corner of Lexington Av.and E,45th Street,you are very comfortable to reach Grand Centralstation where you can get almost all connections you need.Very pity that the room provides no refrigerator.(specially in summer time) Good thing that the eachfloor provides water server with empty bottles! Great idea.

The hotel is clean, professional, quiet and centrally located. The staff is wonderful, efficient and so pleasant. I won't stay anywhere else. Justin found us a room after a canceled flight. Chris greeted us every time we can in and out. Mustafa took great care of us during the wine hour.

Amazing experience, the location is great everything is close and accessible within a brief walk. Most Importantly, Mustafa.S is a fantastic member of the Club Quarters team, he has provided us with a map and set us up for success!! Thank you!!!

Located a quick walk from Grand Central, this hotel is in a great location and has some of the best prices in the area. CQ is always one of the first hotels I check for when making business trip plans. Rooms are small, but perfectly functional for what you actually need. Staff is always pleasant and the amenities are pretty good.

Rooms a bit small but clean and workable good location near gc and mid town attractions. I wish the bathroom had a solid door with no glass if some else is in bathroom light shines through glass door can keep up or wake you up. Overall very good.

I’ve stayed in many Manhattan hotels and this is among the best I’ve experienced. Nice rooms and fairly quiet except for the car horns (unavoidable in Manhattan). Self check in was convenient as well.

Convenient location, comfortable rooms, communicable and welcoming staff, so quite a good choice when you are in the business trip. In the evening it's good to have a walk around Manhattan, so can recommend that

We stayed here in November for 4 nights and it is a good hotel with a great location. There is lots to do around the streets of the Hotel. It is close to Grand Central Station. The staff are friendly, there were two downsides for me, firstly I found the towels to be quite hard and secondly was there is no actual roof top bar, but they do give you free wine at 5pm.

This is my second time staying at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central. It is a great hotel for my needs. I stay over when I will be at work late and the commute does not make sense for getting back in the office as I want to. Decent mattress, always clean, usb ports, great bathroom. Even the smallest room has a little sitting area to get some extra work done or relax outside the bed. Friendly staff. Easy check in and easy checkout.

The heater fan was so noisey I had to turn the system off before going to sleep, I guess I should have asked to have my room changed. Blasted out of bed at 0430 for a fire drill that morphed into a false alarm (some fool must have been upset about the drill and decided to pull the alarm again).All in all, this is a nice hotel, hopefully they will fix the heater before renting out the room again.

We have just returned from a week's stay at this great hotel. The location is just perfect for exploring the city, it's central but far enough out of the way that it's much quieter than expected.The lounge upstairs is a lovely touch, free coffee, snacks and cold drinks are such a nice gesture and show how much the hotel care about their guests.Our room was spotless. My only minor criticism is that the mattress was very bouncy, I felt like I was on a boat everytime my partner rolled over in the night as it created like a wave effect, although he is a big rugby player!If we return to New York, we wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel again

Stayed at the Grand Central, New York multiple times. Always value for money considering it's location and room standard IMO. Staff are always friendly and very helpful.
