I will continue to stay here every time I am in New York (at least once a year) and almost look at it as a home away from home now.

Lovely building and great location. The free wine that was available at 5pm every day was a great touch that really started the nights off well! Located right next to grand central this meant that you had easy access to everywhere.

This hotel is in a great location, close to Grand Central and our room had a fantastic view of the Chrysler Building. The rooms are clean and good value for money. The staff were always helpful and pleasant, making our stay a memorable one.

Cute, calm, and clean. I really enjoyed our stay. Great ideas like having cold, filtered water available, as well as tea and coffee 24/7 make for an enjoyable experience. Discreet, nice personnel, helpful. Great location!

Location (easy access to East Side museums + Sarge's deli) and price were important for us, and that's how we ended up at Club Quarters/Boutique Hotel Grand Central. I will definitely check their prices the next time we make a trip to NYC through Grand Central. The front desk service and the room were excellent, and the few minutes I spent in the living room for Wine@5 were a fantastic bonus. It was fun to be, apparently, the only Americans staying there...I'm sure there were others, but we met guests from Argentina, France, Germany, etc. We splurged on breakfast at Davio's on our second morning (with the 20% hotel guest discount for the buffet) because there was a blizzard and felt it was well worth the extra $3 per person over an excellent deli breakfast our first morning.

The hotel is great overall, with fast Wi-Fi, good accommodations, helpful staff and amazing location. Times square is just a few minutes by foot, and for those who feel like walking, other locations like the Empire State Building, Flatrion building, Macy`s and many other locations are within a walking distance.

The accommodation in Club Quarters goes beyond the actual room and facilities. The staff are truly world-class. When I was doing laundry in the laundromat in the 3rd floor, I was helped by the reception staff (Debbie) so professionally and so genuinely, I felt like I am not just a customer in the hotel. In the laundromat, another staff (Elizabeth) helped me figure out how the laundry works. She also asked me if she can be of assistance. Between Debbie and Elizabeth, I can say that Club Quarters treats its employees well for they radiate warmth, professionalism: something I don't often see in similar hotels. Kudos!

From the very finely dressed, cheerful and helpful greeting, I was happy I selected Cub Quarters again. The service was impeccable and the rooms were very well thought out with respect to space. The room had everything we needed and bed was very comfortable and even all the people on the elevators were nice! Did you give everyone happy drugs??

I stayed in the hotel for Christmas from 29 dec till 3 jan. This was the worst ever experience. On my check in the receptionist provided me the club room which is cheaper and worse than i actually reserved. I booked a standard room. He changed it eventually but only when i asked to look at my reservation and insisted to provide the correct room. Then the total amount of invoice for my staying at the hotel was bigger than what was stated in the reservation. The receptionists could not explain to me why it was more expensive for THREE days each time promising to figure it out but never did. They only managed to do it on check out when i was one foot in the taxi to the airport.Then at the check in i gave my credit for deposit but asked the manager not to charge the card as i was going to use another card for final payment at check out. You know what, they did charged it despite my ask. I requested a refund at the check out and paid by a different card. I still did not get the refund confirmation! Although the receptionist Debbie promised to email this to me on 3rd jan. The last important thing (there were of course more minor unprofessionalism i would not mention here) is that i forgot my hairdryer in the room. Of course i wrote once i found it was left at the hotel (next day!), then i called to the reception several times but they don;t answer neither to emails or to my calls either transferring the calls to someone, or just hang up.this is the worst customer service i ever experienced in my entire life. and given it's Christmas time, it's even worse. This is my first ever ever review. I have to register here to write. How angry I am. The hotel is good, but people working there - they just don't care, so unprofessional!

Stayed here for a business trip. It is very clean, affordable, amazing staff and service. The lounge upstairs on the 27th floor is absolutely amazing. Great for lounging, business, awesome wifi (even for video conferencing), free coffee (and it is good), free snacks, free soft drinks. Great place. No brainer- stay here!!

Room was little big small but it was not in problem. Because is very unique and comfortable. And its piece de resistance was great great location. I suggest one thing is desk is too small so can make complicated situation if lots of people together in.

I love this hotel. This was our 3rd stay at this hotel and has become our go-to when we travel to Manhattan. It is in a great location, very convenient to Grand Central Station and the Subway. The rooms are nothing fancy, but are always clean and have enough space for you to put your luggage and be able to relax and enjoy the room and view. The staff is always friendly and available if you need anything. Looking forward to another trip here - hopefully in a warmer month!

Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central is an amazing hotel, and believe me i searched and saw a lot of hotels and a lot of reviews for each one, before i book. First of all it's very clean, the room is very comfortable, great and free wi-fi. Safe, central and excellent location. The staff is polite, very polite, especially a man at the reception but i didn't notice his name (sorry about this). We did a really quick check in and check out. No hidden charges. Safe hotel. Great price for what you get. 27th floor amazing. Everything was great. Our honeymoon was a really beautiful period of our lives and this Hotel for sure made it even better. Thank you Club Quarters.

Convenient location - close to everything but not in the middle of the Times Square mess. Lack of a big lobby, bar, etc made getting in/out of the hotel a breeze. FREE water bottles also a plus. Room was a decent size by NYC standards & even had a sitting area.

I love staying at Club Quarters. The hotel is clean and the service accommodating. I love the bottled water refillable stations on every floor and the living room area. The beds are extremely comfortable and the closet space ample. This is our favorite hotel to stay in the city.

Rooms was small but quite comfortable. Large window with view and lots of outlets to charge phones. The club level was very comfortable with complimentary coffee, snacks and fruits. Large glass enclosed terrace with great city views.

Stayed at this hotel from Xmas to 3rd of Jan 2018. Room clean and comfortable. On 27th floor there is a convenient lounge for guests where coffe, tea and refreshments are always available to guests. Few steps away from Grand Central. Special thanks to Elisabeth of the staff for keeping the rooms.

Simply loved it, excelent staff very helpful and nice. Great location. Realy good beds and the room was very good. We walked to diners in Times Square to have bronch and it took about 15 minI will for sure stay here again

I stayed in this hotel over the New Years holiday. It is nothing fancy, but was clean and comfortable. The staff are extremely friendly and always available for requests. (Don't let the small, bland lobby fool you!) The rooms were clean and comfortable. Since this is NYC, I expected the room to be on the small side, which it was, but it was laid out well. I enjoyed having the table and bench seating area. The room was clean although the hotel is starting to show some slight wear in some areas. But, again, overall it is very nice! The bathroom did seem on the newer side and had plenty of hot water. I was on the 5th floor with a window on 45th and it was quiet. I did not have any issues with street noise. (I do live in Chicago though, so your mileage may vary.) My one major complaint was the beds are NOT comfortable. I could feel the springs through the mattress! I was disappointed because I combed the reviews on Trip Advisor and several mentioned the bed being comfortable. This was absolutely not my experience. But, the busy days helped me to sleep well enough since I was so tired at the end of each day!Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others as l had a nice experience!

We came into NYC to visit friends for the holidays, and were pleased with the experience at Club Quarters. The club floor is a great amenity, with terrific views, and the rooms and service were equally well done.

I highly recommend this hotel due to the location, the cleaness, the staff which is very helpful and friendly!! The complimentary service is amazing, they provide coffees, snacks, happy hour in the evenings with red and white wine.

Great location and modern rooms. Have stayed here twice and enjoyed both. Easy checkin and out. Investment seems to be placed in the room quality not an elaborate lobby. Will book here again when traveling to NYC.

We had a pleasant stay here. The customer service was superb especially from Chris Prandry. He hosted the 5pm wine hour. He was fun, attentive, informative and welcoming. We will definitely stay here again.

We stayed in CQ Grand central for the Christmas vacation. It is a very nice experience. The people working here are very friendly. The room is very clean. The living room on 27th floor provides a nice view and drinks and fruits. We quite enjoyed it.

The experience I had in this hotel is really good ... there was a employee her name is Evelyn she was really good and polite ... the hotel is perfectly located ... it’s in working distance to everything

couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at club quarters grand central. hotel was perfect in every way and location can't be beat....2 blocks from grand central station. i was very impressed with everything about our visit.

Our family of 5 stayed here the week before Christmas. We had 2 rooms that we booked through a hotel clearinghouse and I called the hotel directly to request the rooms be located near each other which was easily done. The hotel has excellent amenities -- chilled, purified water dispensers on each floor, an excellent espresso maker on the 27th along with fresh fruit and snacks; and the staff is very responsive. The rooms are quiet and the beds are very comfortable. We have no complaints and would happily stay there again and whole-heartedly recommend it as a base for NYC.

Loved the room and it was a perfect location to get around by taxi or metro. The free wine at 5pm each night was a great touch too. Rooms were clean and made up every day to a very high standard and the staff always seemed to go above and beyond.

This hotel far surpassed my expectations. I paid a very decent price on a third party website and was amazed at how close we were to Grand Central. The room was cosy, with a great smart TV which allowed us to easily project Netflix from our smart phones. We also had access to a club lounge on the top floor with complimentary hot drinks and wine between 5 and 6pm. The view from the enclosed balcony was amazing! You might want to bring your own shower toiletries though, no shower gel provided.

At first glance, the hotel, including the tiny lobby, the room and the rest, seem quite outdated. Almost a relic from the 70's. But after a short while, we discovered some advantages that outnumbered the hotel's shortcomings.The service was very friendly and helpful. Worth noting is Ray, who helped in solving a problem with a flight ticket, beyond the call of duty. Other staff members were helpful too in various ways.The highest floor of the hotel has some kind of a lobby replacement. Not only can you sit there, but you can also enjoy coffee, snacks and a glass of wine during a "happy hour". All, free of charge. There are a couple of computers and a TV there, for the guests as well. We could use this service for several hours, even though we have already checked out of the hotel. There's also a free launderette, which we found very helpful.Oh and the location is also great, right on the corner of Lexington Ave. with some of the city's attractions and subway stations nearby.

I stayed at the Boutique Hotel of Club Quarters, one of I believe two near each other in the Grand Central area. The Boutique Hotel is just wonderfully run and a pleasure to stay at. The premises are modern and elegant; the rooms designed for your comfort; and the cost is reasonable. I entered on the avenue side, where there is a hotel restaurant and so, I checked in by riding a small elevator to the second floor. Check in was so simple. I don't know whether that is an alternative method to their lobby check-in, but it only took a minute. I liked the individual temperature and air controls within the room. It's winter now, and I could get the room to be pleasantly warm.

It is well located hotel with a friendly staff. Rooms are rather small and reminded me the interior of a caravan, mainly because of the chosen furniture. I had no view from my room and not possibility to open the window. Not sure if this is normal for Manhattan, just was surprised. Also, there wasn't much to choose from during the breakfast. But the top floor of the hotel is great for relaxing, taking a complementary cup of tea, coffee, cola and having a nice NYC view.Would I come again? I think so, but definitely wouldn't rate it as 4*.

Having traveled from California we looked forward to a memorable experience in NY. However, it was a total disappointment when we got to our hotel room and the view was of the HVAC duct system. You could have warned us and given us the option. You didn't.Long story short; we left the following morning eventhough, we had paid for two nights.

I booked a room at the Boutique Hotel, and when I checked in I realized this was the poor relation of the Club Quarters Hotel located in the same building. They are both owned by Club Quarters, but be forewarned that the Boutique Hotel is restricted to the lower floors and has "fewer amenities." What are the Boutique Hotel guests missing? I can't say, because we are not allowed up on those floors, but I the amenities include a lounge and views of the city. This is kind of silly, because Club Quarters is not a fancy hotel chain, but offers small, efficient room space for business travelers. This also describes my queen room. The segregation into two properties under the same chain name seems pompous and unnecessary --- but the rate was an excellent value for NYC with a convenient location right across from Grand Central Terminal.

my friend and I stayed here for 3 nights last week, so lets start from the beginning. We arrived around 8:30AM and the staff was very warm and welcoming and did their best to get our rooms ready as soon as possible. They offered to store our luggage and we hit the city running. Our rooms were ready around 11AM which we were very thankful for as check in is not until 3pm, I believe. We each had our own rooms, but they were connecting rooms which was PERFECT for us... we love traveling together but like having our own space. I stayed in a standard room and it was a good fit around 300 sq ft but when your in the greatest city in the world you dont spend much time in your room. Although I have to say this was one of the most comfortable hotels beds I have ever slept in. on the 27th floor there was a lounge that offers beverages and snacks and at 5PM each day a wine tasting. It is also acros the street from Spa 45 which I highly recommend. Besides the above it is one block from Grand Central Terminal and that was probably the best part... in NY its all about location and to not have to walk blocks to find a train was AMAZING. Thank you Club Quarters Grand Central for a great stay and I would for sure come back to stay at your property.

Club Quarters, Grand Central is a great hotel for the business traveler. The rooms are nicely set up with work space and plenty of accessible power outlets for all electronics. The Midtown location is convenient to everything. The daily wine reception and 24/7 snacks in the lounge are a nice touch. Chris, the concierge, is great - friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.

The Front Desk staff were great. In particular, Debbie and Zishan. They were very helpful, informative, professional and provided outstanding customer focused service. They are excellent professionals in the hospitality field.

Obviously, a block from Grand Central is prime real estate. I'm a guy who's never spent more than $169/night for a hotel room. So, midtown Manhattan prices were a new experience, to say the least! :-)When I initially walked into our room, my first impression was, "Wow, this is small."But, I soon realized that this was the most well-thought-out hotel room I've ever stayed in. Everything was there in a very neat little package. Plenty of outlets and charging ports. A great bathroom and shower. Plenty of storage. It was as if someone had planned out every square inch of the room. And, of course, everything was clean and new. And, that view!A shout-out to Chris, the concierge on duty much of the time we were there. Super friendly and helpful and just an all around positive guy. In fact, I was impressed with every staff member with whom I had contact. Friendly. Professional. Knowledgeable. Positive. Helpful. If my wife and I ever get back to NYC, we'll be back to this Club Quarters. Good job, everyone!

We stayed here 29th November for 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. Excellent room with a superb view, very comfortable bed and everything needed for a perfect stay. The happy hour at 5.00 pm on the rooftop terrace with wine, fruit and nibbles is a lovely touch and very rarely seen in hotels. Every member of staff we encountered were nothing other than, friendly, helpful and polite. Fantastic location with Grand Central being just a few minutes walk away.And last but not least is the hotel Manager Ralph Renz. We exchanged a few emails prior to our stay as it was a surprise for my husband's 60th birthday and he gave me lots of helpful tips and advice. On meeting Ralph he was charm personified, totally professional and obviously loved his job - it showed Ralph! On arrival there was wine, chocolates and a hand written card from Ralph welcoming us to the hotel.which was a lovely surprise. Ralph - it was a pleasure meeting you and we will definitely return. Our very kindest regards to you and your family - Helen and Ray x

The service I experienced was not good. Regarding the location & amenities, those are fantastic. However, the sound outside is really annoying. I couldn't even sleep at all. They charged about $400 per day, it was not deserve it.

Dirty, it smell bad i told the “front desk” never did a thing.. the furniture ir old and not well taken. The phone never worked and i yold them day 1. I had to wait 3 days for a pillow. They do not clean the bathroom.Very bad experience. Many more hotels for that price much better.

Staff was friendly and helpful. Room layout accommodated business travelers with WIFI and a nice table area for working with a great view of the city and plenty of ports for charging. Room temperature control was easy to set and there was even an extra blanket for added warmth. Cooled/filtered water (and water bottles for easy portability) provided, along with the concierge area with complimentary afternoon snacks, coffee and soda were welcomed after an afternoon of travel.

It was my first time at a Club Quarters and I liked it very much. A very efficient use of space, which is needed in NYC! I was unaware of the parking situation, but got lucky that there was an opening in front of the hotel where I could run in and get the map they provided to the lot they use - liked the discount there! I'd stay again, but would suggest that they give the front desk personnel a little more room to work with instead of the tiny desk provided.

Club Quarters is no frills but is otherwise excellent. Good service, great location, everything works and there is a useful lounge for coffee and a chill. Price was good too. The dine-in option from local restaurants is also a great add-on, for when you're just to tired to go out.

very central, friendly staff and great locations only a walking distance away. the room was great with a coffee machine and a great tv with apps so you can bring up information on the city and things to do. the bed was very comfortable and the room was spacious with a nice little seating/dining area. the hotel itself has a great 27th floor lounge area and a restaurant on the ground floor if you fancy a quiet night. we would definately stay again.

I arrived at the club a bit tired, and the staff got me check in pronto with a polite efficiency. The room was much more than i had ever experienced at CQ (I've stayed with them for more that 20 years)..it was a junior suite, comfortable, clean and neat. On the less desirable side there was a past guest's used take out refuse under the sink cabinet an oversight by the clean up house keeping person and supervisor. The environment and facility. Simply great on scale (this isn't the Waldorf Astoria or the Plaza). The Club Lounge on the top floor was useful for kicking back at night and as a venue for a short meeting. Only problem was with the printers and printing a document from my apple device (and finding knowledgeable staff to find there was no solution).

I have stayed in hundreds of hotels, all over the world, for business and pleasure. This hotel was a great experience in may ways. I'll try and keep it short. We arrived on Black Friday and left on the following Tuesday. That's a BIG WEEKEND in NYC. A crazy time to be there, but the staff was wonderful. The check in was quick and accurate, and all the desk managers--on all shifts--were helpful, knowledgable, and personable. The lobby isn't much, but who cares! Out those double automatic doors is the greatest city in the world!!!My room had a great view. It was small (its NYC), but it was comfortable and practical. A Queen bed, a small L-couch with a movable table, and a closet. The bathroom had its own door. It had all the necessities a traveler might expect: comfortable bed and pillows, a good HVAC system, great internet [though Sunday night and early Monday morning were jumpy], a good selection on the TV, Kuerig coffee maker, good shower, and great housekeeping service. There is digital key access to the rooms, along with the elevators, so security for my wife, daughter, and I was never an issue. We felt totally safe (btw--all over NYC, too.]It's all about location, location, location--the East Side is great. Lots of food options. I find it a bit quieter than the West Side. Especially if you come in from LaGuardia.They have a water cooler that dispenses filtered water--and they provide the bottle too! Awesome little perk.There is a 'living room' on the 27th floor with TV, business station, and refreshments, snacks [good ones, not cheapies], fruit, and even carbonated and still water on tap adjoined to a room with tables to work upon or hold small meetings, and comfortable chairs surrounding small foot tables for socializing. There is also a terrace to look over Lexington Ave to the North and South, and they were offering a free wine tasting everyday sponsored by a local vineyard from 5pm-6pm.Highly Recommended!

Hotel Property is located right across the street from the famous Grand Central Terminal----excellent location to get around in NYC!Outstanding customer service by the entire hotel staff; Justin, Shuba, Lola, Debbie----and everyone else; THANK YOU VERY MUCH!

Great hotel to see all the main sights. I stayed in room 1802 which was very clean and spacious. Free bottled water available on each floor and hot drinks on floor 27. Only a 10 min walk to Time Square and Central Park. Loads of places to eat nearby. Overall, very pleased with my experience.

I like the Club Quarters venues in Manhattan generally and the one on 45th and Lex is my favourite. It's a modern purpose-built hotel, with 27 floors, I think, around 10 rooms per floor. The rooms aren't huge but are modern, very comfortable - great beds - very clean and efficient. The room I had recently had a very convenient seating area with a table that was perfect for using a device, writing or eating. The hotel is super-quiet. The three elevators all worked all the time and all arrived very promptly. The staff are terrific, very efficient, friendly and helpful. I was checked into my room almost three hours before the official arrival time. The location is perfect for me, as I use Grand Central a fair amount. Lots of nearby places, and GCT itself, to eat and drink. Will certainly return.

it's my third time to stay in Manhattan, Club Quarters Hotel (Grand Central) it's the best hotel I've ever stayed , quiet , good location and there are variety style food restaurant nearby ( Hong Kong / Korean food / Japanese food / Thai food ) besides that , you may choose Greek or Chipolata , five guys also. You can 100% believe me , since my wife and I stay in Club Quarters Hotel 2 weeks , 14 nights.there are a comic store across the street !You only need to take 3 mins walk to Central station , it means you can go anywhere from this central traffic and Subway start point.Service : the staff are nice Clean : they clean up and provide supplies everydayAdvantage : soft bed , free cold water offer , At weekend , there are even have some holiday marketand I really enjoy it .I am no doubt that I will choose Club Quarters Hotel againwhen I come back next time in N.Y

I was there for a week and found everything very pleasant and convenient: Room size, room coffee machine and above all fridge and microwave. Large window with views, helpful staff and the best of all, a well planned living on the 27th floor with free coffe, tea, fruit, PC, printer and electric sockets. Two minutes walk to Grand Central Station, et. Will repeat. Yet, one drawback was on arrival and the confussion about two things: Reception at the given address, Lexington Ave. was non existant, and nobody there. Someone appear and reconducted us to 45th stree. Why? And linked to that is the question of the name of this hotel. I had booked for Hotel Boutique but and that 45th Street it was called Club Quarters, which was not the name of my hotel. All this was very confussing and irritating. Fortunately once accomodated to those weird circumstances, the rest was much to my expectations

Stayed for a week in June. Found the location to be ideal for what we wanted - somewhere a bit quieter with excellent transport links. 2 minute walk to Grand Central meant we could be on the subway in no time. We got a high floor room with a great view of the Helmsley Building all lit up at night. The room itself was a fairly decent size for the city, and very clean. There was a fantastic 27th floor lounge area with outdoor terrace, providing free tea and coffee, fruit and other little items, a great way to kick start the day with a nice view. Returning to NYC, we would definitely stay again if staying in Midtown.

I travel to NYC for business and have stayed at Club Quarters, Grand Central several times. I was not familiar with the chain, so when I saw the name on my company's preferred hotels the first thing I thought was "is this a "gentleman's club?" But then I reasoned that my company certainly wouldn't put something like that in the list. It was convenient to the office and Grand Central, and it was better priced than some of the other choices so I decided to give it a try. Taking the chance was well worth it - this is now my "go to" hotel when I travel to NYC. The rooms are small, but well laid out, very clean and well lit. It's also refreshing to have outlets where you need them - everywhere! Check in/out is done in the small, sparse, but very appropriate lobby via kiosk or staff (the lobby is not always staffed, but that's never been an issue because of the kiosk). Room amenities include the standard soap, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion and hair dryer. if you need an iron, there's a closet in the hallway for guests (what a great idea!). On a recent trip I stayed at the Hyatt Grand Central (someone from my group wanted to stay there) and was completely disgusted (awful smell and really showing age. Couldn't wait to get home, shower and do laundry). Anyway, I was so please on my last trip to get back to Club Quarters again!

I've stayed at the CQ near Grand Central a couple of times and my stays have been pleasant. It's one of the cheaper hotel to stay, and for that you get a great location, a relatively small room, a bathroom with excellent lighting and a good-sized shower, big screen TV, etc. There was no closet, just a free-standing wardrobe that worked well for me (traveling alone, only there two nights). It could hold about 4 outfits, so if you're two or more and staying for more than two days, you'll struggle with the closet space. The breakfast room is a nice space, has machine coffee (like the kind we have at work, which is awful). If you're a coffee drinker, head around the corner to Starbucks. If you're a wine drinker you can head straight down to the LL to Davios, grab a glass to bring back to your room. Very convenient. Check-in and check-out was quick and easy. The lobby is very small, has only one bench that seats about 3. No frills here.

I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. Rooms are smaller but to be expected from a boutique style hotel. The room was clean, modern, and the value was amazing for the location! The service was great, I loved the water bottle station in the hallway.

Room was clean, stylish, and a bit larger than expected. Super comfortable bed, and the lounge on the 27th floor is a great place to chill! Centrally located (good for walking!), and lots of subways nearby.

The hotel staff were all very friendly and accommodating. Without exception. Our room was clean, modern with up-to-date amenities. i.e. Keurig coffee maker, smart tv. You need your room key to operate the elevator and there is free bottled water dispensers on available on your floor. Short walk to Grand Central Terminal and Rockefeller Center.

Nice, comfortable business hotel in midtown. No restaurant or bar, but there are plenty of options within a block. Beautiful business lounge and terrace on the 27th floor. Friendly and helpfull staff.

Great location - basically across the street from Grand Central and within walking distance of St. Pat's and Rockefeller. Good basic amenities at a reasonable price for NYC. Liked the 27th Floor Club Room. Staff were very helpful.

If all you need is a comfortable bed near Grand Central, this is the perfect place for you. But if you like to feel like a little more hospitality (and prefer a shower you actually want to be in for more than the required minute to bathe), look elsewhere.

I travel a lot for business but had never stayed at a CQ property. Recent quick trip to NYC had me staying near Grand Central. Had a small efficiency / mini suite, which was fine. A/C was pretty loud.One plus- I left behind a couple of small items by accident and when I called them back, their lost and found process worked really well. I paid the shipping and emailed them a FedEx label and had my stuff back in 2 days. Better than expected service!

Firstly check in was efficient but very impersonal. This is the most disappointing hotel reception area I have ever experienced and we actually turned to walk out to look for the 'bigger' reception area. No info was given on the hotel or the area at all. As for the bedroom, I have holidayed in NYC about 12 times and this is one of the poorest rooms I have stayed in. Very dark and dingy with a double bed pushed against a wall and only room for 1 bedside locker and one night light. The bathroom was an ok size but the shower had very little power and no matter how much I tried it leaked to the floor every time. There is a 'socialising' area on floor 27 which looks lovely in the hotel's website but when we went up on the Saturday night we were very quickly turned and told it was not for hotel guests as it was a private party. Very poor service for hotel guests and one of the main reasons I would not return to this hotel. This hotel was not cheap and on top of this we were not allowed to avail of an area which was advertised as being for hotel guests. I can only assume the hotel was making more money renting it privately! Location wise this was excellent, close enough to Times Square (10 mins at most) but far enough to avoid a lot of the noise. All in all would I stay again? No I would not as there are better value hotels which provide higher levels of customer service just as close to Times Square.

I'm not sure why this hotel is on my company's "preferred" list! I had to change rooms because of the street noise and a wet spot on the floor. Also, the water pressure in the shower was awful. This hotel was not worth the price. It felt like a dorm room.

Club Quarters Grand Central clean, modern and centrally located on 45th near the corner of Lexington Ave. Its an easy walk from Grand Central.Don't expect an expansive lobby because... there isn't one. There is a desk with that is staffed and the elevators. That's it... but it works.The room was small but nice. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom clean and modern. The hotel amenities include a laundry room. Nice if you plan on a longer stay but don't want to pack your entire wardrobe.

Fabulous hotel. Great location! Walking distance to things such as grand central, empire state, times square and the Rockefeller centre. The subway from grand central is so easy to use to get to further places such as the statue of liberty and 9/11, you just get a top up card and a one way trip where ever you go on the subway is $2.75. The hotel has decent sized rooms for new york, doesn't feel cramped. Clean and comfortable. Only problem I had with the 5 nights stay was when the people in the room next to you open and close their door it sounds like they are entering your room! Loved the free wine and nibbles on the 27th floor (please don't stop doing this) that is what made me book the hotel over any others and I'm so glad I did.

We booked three nights at this hotel. Very centrally located two minutes from Rockefeller Centre. Small room but it fitted our requirements. Nice terrace on 7th floor where one could have breakfast, lunch or supper. Great view to Rockefeller Center and the Cathedral. Overall a positive stay with friendly staff.

Very local to most attractions .. Will definatly stay again.. loved it 10/10 i recommend this hotel to anybody .. brilliant fabulous city views , i had a view of the chrysler building peeping over . xx

This is our second time staying here and we had a pleasant stay again. The room is small but the space is very efficiently designed so it doesn't feel crammed. We wish the bed is less bouncy and they have kind size bed, but it's hard to come by in Manhattan in this room size. We also like the fact that the hotel is away from all the actions yet close to Grand Central Station. Within walking distance, we can access all the eateries and go about our business. We used to live in this neighborhood so everything is familiar. The extra nice perks are the water stations on each floor, the roof lounge area and the patio, where we can relax and enjoy coffee and snacks, while taking in the city skyline that I am never tired of.

Centrally located, good service and amenities, clean and comfy bed, good wifi -- really hard to beat! The only drawback was the noisy air-conditioner, couldn't fight the noise even with my ear plugs on. Nevertheless, with its price (not exactly cheap but it's Manhattan and it's Fall in New York afterall) and location and everything I still highly recommend this hotel.

Great hotel at a very central location, with really comfy beds, super reliable and fast WiFi connection, big smart TV, nice alarm with USB cable docks, and very silent for NY standards (had a room on the 19th floor), AC unit worked well too and could be adjusted to one's preferences easily. In addition, the hotel provides a selfservice to take cool purified water in bottles, great for on the go or just to drink in the room. No safe in the room (clubsize room) and no fridge either. TIP: I booked trhough expedia with a 10% voucher code and that was way cheaper than trhough booking or hotelscombined dot com.

I spent at week at the Club Quarters Grand Central while on business in NYC. The main attraction of the hotel is the location - two blooks away from Grand Central. While the reception is small and bald, check-in was efficient and fast. The rooms are clean (albeit small as everywhere in NYC) and everything works and is well maintaned, even though furniture was a bit worn. The terrace and the room on 27th floor with free coffee and water are an asset. If you want breakfast you have to go out to an adjoining restaurant or use a mail-order service. Would definitely recommend, not least because internet speed is reasonably high and works very well.

Had a disgusting stay in this hotel. The room next to mine was already flooded with bathing water due to faulty water drainage BEFORE I check in.They gave me the room anyways and I could barely walk into my room coz the hallway was flooded and the carpet was soaked. Ew. Luckily the carpets inside my room wasn't too wet at that time.I called front desk. They said they will send someone to fix the problem but didn't offer any change of room. No one came until next morning, and as you would expect, the bathing water soaked all the way from hallway into my room and by the time I wake up the next morning, my room was not walkable. I called front desk again. This time they sent someone to set up a fan in the hallway. I decided to leave my room early and stay out late to allow more time for them to clean up my room.Unfortunately, after 14,15 hours on the street, I only returned to my room to find a huge fan inside my room, with the windows and door left WIDE OPEN. Yep I was shocked as hell. How can they leave my door unlocked? How can they open the window??? And of coz, the carpet was still soaked heavily. Finally they agreed to give me a new room at this time. But I was too busy checking my luggages and belongings to see if there were anything missing. I had to dry up a couple of the important documents - the papers were all humid. Thank you very much. I cannot believe this is actually happening in a four star hotel. May be I was unlucky to have a soaked floor but the way they deal with problems was very very disappointing. I will definitely not consider staying in any hotels with the name clubquarters on it anymore. (One thing I have to say, all the staffs were friendly and polite during my stay. I believe it's a poor company policy and lack of guidance in such conditions more than personal faults of the staffs. Sorry for the criticism but it was really bad I have to be honest)

CLUB QUARTERS was able to accommodate my family of 4 when our flight was cancelled due to Hurricane Irma.The staff was very friendly and attentive to our needs (laundry) and really helped us feel at home for the time we stayed (4 nights).The children enjoyed the complimentary wi-fi and computers and daily snacks provided. My wife and I really enjoyed the sky lounge on the 27th fl. and the daily wine tastings from 5 to 6 pm.The location in Midtown (45th St. and Lexington) made the stay even better!Special recognition to management (Mr. Renz) and his staff for making the booking process hassle-free and quick. I highly recommend Club Quarters for your next stay for business or pleasure here in the NYC area.

The hotel is remodeled and it has a modern, clean look. Very comfortable, clean, great location and it offers everything the modern traveler needs. Just a couple of blocks from Park Avenue, and practically across the street from Grand Central, Club Quarters is my 1st choice in Manhattan from now on.

Great hospitality, rooms are fairly large considering its in Manhattan. But the bed - King size - was two twins pushed together. They kept separating throughout the night, and the mattresses were worn and the springs were squeaky. Price is great for one night, but if you are staying longer, just stay somewhere else.

This hotel was fantastic, and so reasonably priced through Hotwire, could not believe a hotel could possibly provide every need any travel could ever want, from complimentary happy hour wines, lattes, fresh ground coffee, snacks and soda, bottled water, laundry use and soap, and all free of charge. You just don't see that anymore without an extra charge, The staff went over and above to assist you when necessary they were so friendly always a smile on their faces. The location of the hotel was within walking distance to everything. Everything was so clean and security was excellent, best place we have ever stayed.

Booked this hotel for one night after coming off a cruise. We arrived around 9.30am and even though the check in time is not until 3pm we were given passes to their lounge and open air balcony on the 27th floor. We could help ourselves to free tea/coffee and chilled water. After a coffee or two and taking multiple photos from the balcony we went out for a wander around the area. We returned around 12 noon and tried our luck and asked if they had any rooms ready. We were given a front room on the 7th floor. It was nice and big with views into the street. There was no fridge in the room but it did a have coffee maker with cream and sugar and if you needed an iron and board they were in a cupboard in the corridor for everyone to share. We could also get chilled water on each floor as well which saved a fortune when marching about NY in 28 degrees. After another great night in the city we had a lazy morning until check out at noon, again though when we explained we were not flying home until later in the day they let us keep passes for the lounge. We went across the road to a local deli for fresh made rolls and wandered off to the park for lunch and returned a few hours later and just sat on the balcony people watching until it was time to get a taxi to the airport. Very relaxing.A big thanks to the lovely staff at the Club Quarters for their hospitality, we will be back.

Staff is really nice. However, hotel was a bit outdated. Bathroom had a very strong mildew smell which was off-putting. Given these conditions, I feel the price was too high. However, location is pretty good as it's right next to Grand Central.

The hotels are great for couples but not designed for families. Excellent staff, nice clean modern rooms but don't look for restaurant/buffet. We stay often in these hotels so we know what to expect. We stay there for the pricing and great locations.

I average about one a week and the staf treats you like family. The rooms are clean, practical and comfortable. Excellent air conditioning which is crucial on a hot summer day. Special thanks John and Rey who are two amazing ambassadors of your hotel, always friendly, outgoing and helpful. Not only do they remember me each time, they always welcome me back by name as soon as I walk through the door.I also wanted to give a thank you to Pete the maintenance guy. What a nice guy! I had an issue with my air conditioning a few visits back and had the pleasure of meeting Pete. He not only fixed the problem quickly, he did so in the most friendly manner. Talking, joking and sincerely apologising for the inconvenience. The most impressive thing was that the next time I stayed at the hotel, I ran into meet and he remembered my name when saying hello to me.Business travel is never fun but the staff at Club Quarters Grand Central make it so much more enjoyable!

Stayed here for three nights. The room was small but nice and clean. The best thing about the hotel was its location it was walking distance to all main places in New York and around the corner from the subway

Had never heard of Club Quarters but the reviews looked good so decided to chance it. I'm glad I did. The room was clean and comfortable if a little small (but the size is reflected in the price I guess). The club lounge and terrace are great and the staff were welcoming and friendly. Recommended for anyone who's looking for great value & a clean, comfortable place to stay. Photo shows the view from the terrace.

I had a very pleasant stay at the Club Quarters. The location is very convenient and the room was cleaned every day. Zishan, one of the employees, went the extra mile and was incredibly helpful when I needed assistance.

Found this on the American Express site. Found it to be reasonably priced, and for our visit, the perfect location. Free purified water, on each floor, sure beats paying $5-$10 a bottle you usually see in hotel rooms. Love the style and modern look of the hotel. Clean and comfortable. The deck was an awesome place to enjoy a bottle of rose'. Would definitely come back to this hotel when traveling to NYC.

Got this on a cheap deal. And honestly this was one of the best I've had recently. Just perfect for business. Clean, modern room layout for people who do work, and whats more.......connectivity from my ipad to the TV so I could watch Netflix and Amazon from my ipad but on the TV. It worked a dream as the internet in the hotel was really speedy. The top deck view and lounge was lovely, and great if you nip round the corner to get some food and you need somewhere to eat it. Location superb, right next to Grand Central. You can anywhere from here. All in all, totally satisfied.

This hotel is in a good location to get to most of the sites. The rooms were clean and comfortable which is all you need in NYC. We were on the 4th floor which was a little noisy with the street noise, but we still managed to sleep ok.

The hotel lacks the fancy lobby you often see in NYC, but it's in a great location, very clean - small but nice room and bathroom, free wi-fi, and a great terrace on the 27th floor looking in 3 directions. Walk to Grand Central and Times Square. It would have been great to have drinks on the Terrace, but there is no bar. You are allowed to take your own drinks up there though. I would stay here again.

Room was clean and comfortable. Service was excellent and very professional. Location couldn't be better! My only complaint was the lack of view from our room. In fact, we faced the air conditioning and heating system machineries.

Zihan checked me in past midnight and was super efficient and friendly. My office had sent over a doc to be printed and he said he already printed it and it was waiting in my room!! Talk about excellent service! I also was able to get late check out and was upgraded to a larger room. Room was clean as well, and there's a water dispenser and coffee/tea up on the top floor. Super convenient to grand central and the metro.4 stars and not 5 stars is because I still havent been credited the deposit on the hotel room and its been over 2 weeks and I've been chasing.

This hotel is so central for everything. When we first arrived we noticed that our pick up time had not been changed so the girl at reception phoned the bus company and rearranged the time which was so appreciated. The hotel had very graciously gave us an upgrade to a suite for our 30th wedding anniversary, which delighted us. The suite was spacious and spotless, it was tastefully decorated the bed had lovely crisp sheets. On our floor was free bottles so you could fill them with nice cold water. All the staff we came in contact with were lovely. If we go back to New York I will definitely rebook this hotel.

We have been to NYC many times, this was certainly one of the best stays we have had. centrally located, clean and within walking distance to almost all attractions and neighborhoods. Great places to eat in the vacinity as well. the view from the 27th floor bar area is fantastic.

Excellent value, great staff, beautiful and very comfortable bed and room,Well worth the cost. Would stay there again when in New York. Walking distance to everything worth seeing in central manhattan

We were very happy with our choice for the hotel. Nice, very clean and renovated, and very close to the hype in Manhattan namely Times Square, Fifth Ave, and so forth. We loved the terrace on the top 27th floor which has a great view of Lexington Ave and 45th st, and Chrysler bldg. As for parking, the hotel gives you the address of the parking upon your arrival. Simply check in (takes less than 2 minutes if you have reservation) and drive your car to their recommended parking lot with preferred rate of 33$ per day which is a good deal in Manhattan. It's a 5min walk back to the hotel.

From the moment we stepped into this hotel, we were treated like we were their only patron. Angela who completed our room set-up was very professional and a wealth of knowledge around the area. The room was small, but what rooms are not small in NYC. However, we were able to maneuver easily. Room & Bath were both very clean. Happy Hour, 24 hour coffee, tea, and sodas available; as well as snacks. We paid in advance and were completely satisfied with this hotel.

Great location. My husband was here for business and I was here to see the sights. Minutes from the Chrysler Building and almost directly opposite Grand Central station. Clean, business style, no frills room. We were upgraded to a room with a fridge and microwave which was most appreciated. Not a huge amount of storage space though fine for our needs. Air con was noisy but then it over-rode the traffic noise and cooled the room quickly so can’t complain. Staff very helpful and professional and the room was always clean. Would definitely stay here again.

First trip to NYC for my daughter and I - my 50th birthday present from her. This hotel is in a great location midtown just below (3 minute walk) Grand Central Station. There is no foyer but 24 hour reception - check in took a few minutes - we had a standard Queen room - spotlessly clean, comfy bed, good quality toiletries - coffee machine, iron & board - good size shower- rooms aren't big but ample - we were out and about from 9.00 am to 22.00 pm so NYC wasn't about the hotel. Chilled water complete with empty bottles to fill yourself on each floor. On the 27th floor there's a lounge with outdoor terrace with complimentary tea/coffee hot choc, chilled cans of coke etc and snacks - can't imagine this is commonly offered in NY. Our room was on the 24th room so traffic noise was minimal - slept really well and I,m a poor sleeper. Luggage is kept securely on check out day at no etc cost. Booked on Expedia less than £100 per night - I would say this is excellent value and would happily stay again

First of all I'd like to thank the staff for making anything and everything as easy as possible for my family! Lola, Zishan and Sandy thank you for dealing with all of outbreaks birthday shenanigans! You were all true stars! The 27th floor is one of the most under rated roof tops in New York City! A birthday to remember!

Ideal location! Clean rooms! Friendly and helpful staff! I left my phone in a taxi, Zishan and Lola calmly and smoothly called all the necessary people to get my phone back! Thank you so much for everything! Knowing that the hotel has such great and helpful people working for them, will make me return without a question!

Modern decor. Rooms are a little tight feeling. Lack of staff in the lobby is a little disconcerting. The restaurant connected with the hotel is first rate. Promised discount for staying at the hotel didn't materialize. Conveniently located within a couple of blocks of Grand Central.

My room was fairly spacious, very clean, and with a comfortable bed. I had a corporate rate, but this was quite affordable midweek when NYC hotel prices are high and a solid choice for the money. I'd stay here again, no problem.

Having stayed at the Club Quarter in other cities we decided to look for a CQ hotel in Manhattan for our NY long weekend in mid-June 2017. Given the options available in terms of CQ hotels in Manhattan, we first called the CQ customer service for some help. We were initially thinking of staying in downtown Manhattan but it became clear that the area becomes very quiet at night whereas we wanted to be in a more lively environment. Amongst the midtown CQ hotels, Grand Central is the newest and has a terrace on the 27th floor facing the Chrysler. Choice made! Looking at the reviews on tripadvisor, we were a little concerned about the traffic noise at night and so we contacted directly Mr Renz using the email address he had left on his replies to customers' comments. Long story short, we were pampered with a room on the 19th floor with great views on Lexington Avenue. We were greated with a personal note from Mr Renz with his contact details in case of any problem. (Mr Renz also emailed us during our stay to make sure all was good but we were too busy enjoying our break and forgot to reply...)The room was new, clean and comfy as expected; the bathroom spotless. We had no issues in sleeping at night. The breakfast room (including complimentary fruit and snacks) on the 27th floor with access to the terrace was great.The reception staff was also very friendly and helpful; we missed breakfast at The Comfort Diner down the road, which was highly recommended. We will make sure we pay a visit next time we are in NY. We would like to thank Mr Renz for having taken care of us and for making our short stay in Manhattan such a great experience.

I stayed at the Club Quarters Hotel from 10th June until 15th June, the staff are friendly and helpful. My only issue was the room i asked for with a kitchen, should have been in a quiet room as i am a light sleeper, however on arrival i was given a room which was directly above the Air conditioning on the outside roof. I asked for a change of room, but was only offered a standard room, which i took for the first night. The following day i was offered a room on a higher floor with full kitchen which i took. The room was excellent and well furnished, only problem the room air con unit was so loud you couldnt have it on at night, and again the outside roof units vibrated so still no peace. The positive side was the Hotel was very central to everything, close to Grand Central, Chrysler Building and walking distance to Empire State. The roof top lounge was another bonus having outside sitting area, over looking Lexington Avenue. Overall a good choice, but wish something could be done to make rooms Quieter, in room air con units to loud and positioned at end of the bed. Would stay again but only if i could check out the room first.

This is a place I stayed in for the second time, despite a bad experience the first time round. I won't go into the bad experience because the hotel went out of its way to make amends. But this around, something seemed to have gone wrong with their management and service. First the pros - this is a preferred hotel for me because it is right next to my manhattan office. From a convenience perspective, this is great. Another pro is their 27th floor lounge. You have to go there to see what it is. They have an open balcony with breathtaking views of manhattan where you can sit and work, and sip coffee/tea. Now the cons - the standard rooms are tiny (even tiny is a euphemism, they are claustrophobic). I specifically requested for a paid upgrade to a 1 bedroom suite, which is pretty comfy. I used to be a regular with Midtown Courtyard (boy, do they have large rooms! I used to love that place). Now back to the club. When you are business traveler, you expect efficiency. Especially in a place like Manhattan. These guys messed up my laundry twice. Once, they were not taking the express laundry option, saying that they take last order at 10 AM whereas their laundry slip clearly has that option (I used that in my last trip too!). When I asked them to check, they came back and accepted it. Next up, the laundry was messed up. Shirts were not properly ironed. What was requested to be boxed was put on hangers. Undergarments, instead, were boxed! Shirts were not properly ironed (Double cuffs were crumpled and not folded and ironed). When I raised the issue, they blamed their vendor. My take was "I dont care for your vendor. I gave YOU my laundry. It is YOUR responsibility to maintain basic level of service". The same thing happened next time I opted to send clothes for laundry. Moreover, the front desk kept refusing to pick up laundry and kept asking me to bring it down. That was when I told them I had a lot of laundry and needed help in bringing it down. I stopped using them for laundry service thereafter. When you are traveling for over 3 weeks on business, laundry is a key factor. If your suit or shirt is messed up, you are screwed. And I do not want this hassle while traveling on business or otherwise. Hence, I am not staying with them again. Twice burnt.

The room was clean the front desk was very helpful especially the young woman that was pregnant she was very helpful because of her I would stay again but I would not be at the restaurant and she was nice enough to be able to give me a small discount is best that she could do She is an asset to your establishment

Easy access to Grand Central. I was able to walk the few blocks from the train. Top floor lounge with indoor and outdoor seating is a fabulous addition. Nice view out over the city from the lounge. Comfortable room, with a window. Easy check in.

As most Club Quarters, they cater perfectly to the solo traveler or to couples, not a family oriented hotel. The comfy bed, which is not too firm, not too soft, gives a great night's sleep after a weary day. I love the location and the bottled water, which makes it convenient on the go.

This is my first review ever! Had to take a moment express how appreciative i am of club quarters and their staff Lola an Zishan! This dynamic duo were so fun and on point,. They were friendly,professional and knew just where to send us to eat. Just an amazing energy. The terrace was my favorite. The weather was perfect and the view of the Helmsey was breathtaking. The room was very clean and comfortable. We will definitely be back.

Oriented towards all visitors. Highly recommended for its location. View of Empire State from upper floor was beautiful... especially for tourists. Lounge on Top floor with panoramic views was absolutely stunning. ( Icing On Cake )

This hotel is well located if you're planning on walking around New York for a couple of days. There's easy access to all the main sights, to the trains and bus tours. If you are after frills, it's not the place for you but it's clean and the staff are friendly.

Great location, close to everything, subways, good restaurants, and shopping! My room was always clean and always like the free coffee in the room. the staff are amazing, very attentive and always smiling! Had a fantastic time and definitely come back and stay with them again.

We stayed here on a recent visit to the city. Very convenient location. As one does not usually spend a lot of time in a hotel room while in the city the rooms are small, very small. Very compact. Not much space for clothes etc. No place to store your suitcases. Very strange banquet seating with a sliding table. Not sure what that was about it was impossible to use. Not sure what their thoughts were. The bathroom is again very small not much room for your toiletries. The shower was Great, however. Rain shower type faucet and as it was not a tub you didn't have to climb in. Pocket door to separate from the room. Electrical outlets on one side of bed and nothing on the other. Perhaps they only have singles stay at the hotel but when will hotels learn to put plugs on each side of the bed. We all travel with at least one and usually two devices per person. This was frustrating. I mean how hard can that be I wonder. Nice staff and wonderful roof top terrace with a coffee machine and snacks all day. Lounge areas but the furniture was modern and not what I would call comfortable inside. Outside was comfortable and great views. Free Spring water dispenser on each floor. Free wifi. All in all it was a good stay and we would come again I think.

I stay in a lot of hotels for business and this is a good one.The hotel's location is fantastic, right beside Grand Central station, with great views from some rooms.Check in was very quick and the staff were very efficient. I was given an upgrade to a suite which was absolutely lovely. The rooms here are small but really nicely kitted out. I had a small kitchen with fridge, microwave/oven combo, sink, toaster, pans, crockery and cutlery... everything you'd need in fact. The living area had a small sofa bed and a desk with two chairs, plus a wardrobe. The bedroom had a normal sized double bed and wardrobe. The bathrooms was modern and clean with a basin outside - a good idea if two of you are getting ready I guess.My suite was on a corner and had floor to ceiling windows on two walls - with wonderful views up Lexington and across E 45th Street. I also paid an extra $50 for a 3pm check out which was well worth it (although it comes to a fair bit more with all the city taxes they add on!).Overall, a lovely, clean suite in a smallish hotel, nice and quiet, in a fantastic location. What more could you want?

I just want to say that my stay at club quarters was amazing. The staff was so nice and helpful from check in to check out. The parking garage had a fire so my car was stuck in there and club quarters was so accommodating in helping me stay another night, they honored my previous night rate (since i had not planned on staying a 3rd night but had no choice, this led to a saturday night stay which typically costs more) They got us a room for that third night and helped ease my stress. They also were so helpful with bringing up sleep better kits and a humidifier to the room. Everything I called for was at my door immediately including help with my bags. The next day my car still was not able to get out and the front desk offered to let me stay in the room until 3 this was so so appreciated since i was essentially trapped and could not go too far since my bags were at the hotel. Overall, the kindness and professionalism that was shown was excellent. The Club Quarters staff truly knows the definition of hospitality and I was beyond impressed sometimes little things can turn an annoying situation (my car) to being ok, and thats what they did. They did all they could on their end to make the whole scenario easier and it is very very appreciated, so thank you to the day crew and the night crew for getting me checked in, helping me with my bags, bringing me my sleep better kits at night and making my overall stay a great one. Aside from the amazing service from the staff the location is ideal and the rooms are spacious and clean. No complaints. Thank you.

Stayed here in February 2016 for a quick interview. What I like about this place is it doesn't over-promise on anything it can't deliver. The rooms are tiny, as expected for a NY room. Though it was simple, everything seemed fairly clean and well-maintained. This seems more like a hotel for professionals passing through than for city vacations. Located only a few blocks away from Grand Central.

I was in NYC on business. We stayed at the CQGC for one night, but even on a weekday it's a great location, an the skyline view from the room is AMAZING! The staff was very accommodating. The rooms, although small, are always clean and neat, which is most important. These hotels are always in the heart of the city with great amenities. So you don't spend much time in the room anyway. It's located in Midtown just blocks away from Time Square. And there are tons of food and shopping options within walking distance. And the black-out curtains help you to sleep through rush hour noise and daylight below!

Perfect location in midtown; great hotel staff; extra clean rooms! I will always stay at this location for any of my future business and personal travels! I love the features of the smart tv's so I could watch any of my streaming apps; Netflix, HBO/Showtime On-Demand, etc! THIS HOTEL IS A SUPERB CHOICE AND I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!!!!

The hotel does not look very glamorous from the outside but is pretty decent in the inside. The lobby area is small and unassuming but the rooms are nice. The location of the hotel is awesome, near Grand Central, a lot of touristy stuff is in walking distance. Positives:- Room was nice, ours was on the 20th floor and we had great views- Location - Terrace with amazing views, you can bring your own food, there's a microwave, fresh water ,tea, coffee, cutlery and cups in the lounge & terrace area. We'd just buy dinner elsewhere and eat it up there as the views were spectacular. It really is a massive bonus to have. - Bed comfortable, room decor quite decent Negatives- Not exactly glamorous hotel, just decent. - No lobby to sit around- Lifts are a bit of a nightmare, they take ages to come, always seem so busy. Overall a good stay, it was expensive but still better value than most places in New York for a very busy weekend we were there.

We had a nice stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central.The hotel is well located, clean and efficiently run. Oriented towards business travellers it provides many amenities (and nice club room/views on the top floor).A special thanks to John, Debbie and the rest of the staff for the excellent service,Vladimir Ivanow

I was allowed to check-in an hour before their standard check-in time at no cost, which was appreciated after an 8 hour flight. I'm not sure if I was given a free upgrade, however the 'Club Room' I booked was larger than expected (room 1210). Bed was comfortable, large smart TV and coffee machine, as well as fast WifI (50Mbps/down). The free filtered water and bottles was a great idea, and the free coffee, fruit and breakfast bars on the 27th floor observation deck were great, as was the view. The only 2 points to keep in mind are that air conditioning unit was very loud so this had to be turned off at night, and the shower/taps sometimes took a while for the hot water to filter through. Overall I'd definitely stay here again.

I have stayed in Club Quarters hotels in Philadelphia and London, and feel that this is distinctly less successful than either of them. The location is perfect and the view from the 27th floor lounge is great, but there are just too many things that are not right here. My wife was upset that in our room there was no way to latch or bolt the door from the inside so no one could get in, for example. Some rooms had this feature, but not ours. The heating/cooling system did not work properly and when someone came to look at it, he said that it was fine, by which he meant that you could put it on all the time, on low. But the "auto" function did not work, and it gave off a rumble of about 50 decibles, louder than a dishwasher. There were other things, all small, not crucial, but the overall impression was that there was no consistency or quality control, in contrast to what I expect from this hotel. We stayed a week, and immediately before and after were in better hotels for lower prices elsewhere.

Fabulous location really Central for all the sites, amazing rooms, just the little things that make a difference like having a USB port next to your bed. Little water bottles so we could fill them, cereal bars and fruit in the morning. Fantastic would definitely recommend to anyone and stay again

Hotel room was very clean and well-designed - also VERY quiet. But what made this hotel really special was the 27th floor lounge with the coffee, snacks and computer set-up at all times of day - and the fresh water bottles available on each floor. For a work trip, this was heaven!

From the lobby to the elevators, from the hallways to the penthouse living room where we had coffee and wonderful views, the hotel was immaculate and pleasant to be in The same goes for our room, the shower area, and the maid service. Club Quarters is also reasonable for a city hotel. The one time we ordered Room Service, the breakfast was hot and delicious. Very good coffee.

while the price room size is on the high side this conveniently located hotel is good for short stays. Excellent AC a rarity in the city. A club on the 27th floor makes it easy to hold business. Starbucks is at the corner.

We stayed at Club Quarters (aka Grand Central Boutique Hotel) for 4 nights and found it to be a perfect, clean and comfortable bolt hole so close to all the sights we wanted to explore. The room are small but designed well and the decor is modern. The 27th floor sitting room is excellent with coffee and tea available and plenty of space to spread out and do any computer work, etc. (the rooms also have good connectivity). Great view too. Davio's Restaurant at the base of the building is fantastic with the food plentiful and of a very high standard. If you fancy buying your food and taking it back to the hotel, you can buy a brilliant selection at the Grand Central Station market. On the 27th floor of Club Quarters there are tables where you can sit and enjoy it. We highly recommend this fairly priced accommodation option.

This place has it all: large room, free coffee, free bottled water, free snacks, helpful staff, close to GCT, and of course a clean, comfortable room. I have to remember to stay here anytime I come to stay in the city. No complaints, only compliments!!

This hotel was recommended by a friend. The location is fantastic and really convenient for being in the heart of the action. Their is no lobby as such, but our room was clean, big enough, well equipped and comfortable. The lounge on the top floor was convenient for coffee, papers and work stations if you needed to log-on. This is a hotel designed for business people, but would work for anyone requiring a great base in the heart of NYC.

This Hotel has a unique location by Grand Central Station in the heart of Manhattan. Walking distance to Central Park, St Patricks Cathedral, Rockefeller center etc or take the subway anywhere in town. The hotel had a laundry room for guest as well as exercise room and a lounge in the 27th floor with free coffee and fruit,snakcs during week days, The rooms are efficiency style with small kitchenette, nicer to get a suite. The prices a re reasonable for this city

We stayed 5 nights and we really liked this hotel. The first night they gave us a room at 4th floor and it was too noising considering the traffic on the Lexington avenue. The next day we asked and they provided us another room and they moved all our bags. The terrace is great as the view. In that area you can have a tea or coffee, really nice.

Well, we've been here 3 nights and have settled in to the Superior room we booked. No idea why we were not allocated the same room on the first night, and no explanation or apology from 'the management'. So, I have to say that despite the above, the hotel is ideally situated, has very good facilities, and if I was returning, I would definitely use as a base. I would book the superior room again too.

I recently had an event and needed to rent a few rooms for our clients. The event was close to the east side of Manhattan so we tried this hotel. I was able to arrange for accommodations for my clients through one of the managers, Mrs. Pierre, who was very friendly and accommodating. My clients enjoyed the location and I would certainly recommend this location to anyone visiting Manhattan.

Great location, very close to Grand Central, especially if you exit on the Lexington side. Room was clean and had all necessities for a business trip. You cannot beat the view from their guest work area that had snacks and coffee. There were water bottles and water dispensers on the guest floors and there was a washer/dryer and gym on-site.

My family and I stayed here for 5 days! The hotel have thought of everything and couldn't be nicer or more helpful. Fresh water and empty water bottles. Free wifi. A clubroom to print out boarding passes and grab a coffee. The rooms are functional and more than comfortable for the amount of time you spend in them, which is minimal! Would highly recommend.

A girls getaway weekend with friends turned out to be a great location. We were central to everything and able to walk or subway directly from the hotel. Very basic and comfortable. Decor and amenities were up to date and bed was very comfortable. would stay again for a quick visit.

This hotel is not great and you will probably be disappointed the first time you check in. After the first impression you will discover that the hotel is very convenient with a fountain per floor where you can filled in a bottle of water. You have free coffee in the top floor. The gym is small but convenient.The restaurant is good and rooms are ok

After check-out, I gave my bags to the hotel to hold for a few hours. Upon return, staff were unable to find them. I insisted to help with the search, and we went from room to room. Finally, we found my bags not in a storage facility, but in some guest room (not mine). What were my belongings doing in someone else's room? How did they get there?

Stayed there for 2 nights and it's a great hotel for business travellers. Taxi from JFK to hotel is about US$60 and if you are on a budget you can take the NYC Airporter (shutter bus $18 per way) located few streets from this hotel. Grand Central station is a block away..Right across the hotel, you can find deli, Asian food and many other choices around within short distance.Room is clean, lift is spacious and 24 hours access to the club living room that offers free coffee, tea, fruits & snacks. They even provide bottles by the coolers where you can fill water. Really neat idea!

The room was comfortable and the furnishings were new. The room did not feel small or cramped. There is a dispenser for water and bottles to hold the water....which is a plus for me! The staff was excellent. The location is very convenient and I will stay here again.

The good, you cannot beat the location- only a block away from Grand Central station- the only downside to this is that there is a lot of traffic noise if you are not on one of the upper floors (where we have stayed before) - but hey its NYC There is also an excellent lounge area with a nice view, and snacks throughout the day. The one bedroom hotel room was perfect for a family as there was a sliding door with glass that gave the kids a separate space, while enabling us to see them. The staff is also very nice and helpful- just take note that there is often only one person at the front desk and you may have to wait. Also, both times that we were there we noticed at check out that we were being charged for extras that we did not use, and in one case for an extra night.

A nice, clean, and comfortable hotel in a near perfect location. It was easy to find, and had a decent restaurant in the lower level. Close to Times square, it was our first time in NYC and the experience was great. We will return here. My only annoyance was the fact there was only one pillow for each of us...I sleep with two.

Location is great, just two blocks from Grand Central. Excellent service. Rooms are Ok. The TV software is amazing. Rooftop business center is among the best i've seen in my life. Perfect for a business trip to the great apple.

Everytime i visit this hotel which is my fav from CQ I always find it very pleasant to find Michelle she always take care of me and make sure my stay is great. Ray also gave me a great room. Michelle thank your for everything.

Booked the small room for one night, was pleasantly surprised on the size of the room. Perfect for two people. The room was spotless and they had a good use of space. I liked the bottled water stations on each floor along with the complimentary coffee in the family room. The outside deck had an awesome view and was a nice place to hang out...it was nice that is was enclosed for the winter so you could enjoy any time of year. Location was great being right across from Grand Central. Appreciated the key card system for the elevators for security.Would defiantly stay here again!!!

My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights from the UK. I booked this purely from there trip advisor reviews and it was wonderful! Massive room for a couple, a sofa & sitting as well as a king sized bed. The room was very clean and little toiletries in the shower room, it was quiet and just wonderful after a busy jam packed day and evening to relax in. The free coffee on the top floor with a viewing balcony was such a lovely added extra compared to other hotels. No lift problems and also loved the free bottled water available on our floor. I'd highly recommend this hotel it was in the best location to walk to Time square, Central Park, 5th avenue, grand central terminal is at the end of the block and restaurants in easy access! Don't hesitate but stay here you'll not regret it

The hotel is petite and the staff is friendly. But the moment you enter the room, there's a smell of bleach. You get used to it quickly. At least that prves that the room should be clean right? Nope. I got rashes on the leg and hand. The staff changed my room in the middle of the night. This new room's TV isn't functioning. The heater is not heating. But I'm checking out in a few hours so what the hell. The one thing I hated the most is that I was offered complimentary dry cleaning as a peace offering. When I mentioned that I am checking out today, I was told that it has been offered, and if I make use of it is up to me. Really? You'll be coming to drop off my clothes at home after I leave the city???

My initial thought when I got to my room was "what a dump." It's not the most appealing decor. The room and bathroom could have been a bit cleaner. The mattress was thin and uncomfortable. The walls were thin and I could hear ever word said in the next room. No room service to speak of (but there's a pret a manger right down the street). On the bright side the wifi was great and free. The staff was lovely. Bathroom is spacious by NY standards. Colleagues were also staying in the hotel and they were completely happy with their room so maybe I was unlucky. For the price it's a good deal. But I'd rather spend a bit more for some comfort.

Initial impression when arriving at ground floor entrance on a busy, New York Friday night was disappointing: scaffolding everywhere around, spilt liquid on floor, uncooperative reception. Not good.However, room was better than expected and the next day the reception and concierge service was100% better. In fact I he concierge could not have been any more helpful.The really good things about this hotel are:1. Great roof terrace with complimentay fruit, cereal bars and sweets2. Location close to Grand Central Station food market3. Complimentary washing machines and dryers
