Club Quarters has become my preferred choice for business trips in the US. Don't expect a fancy lobby or stylish furniture. Do expect great locations, decent-sized clean rooms, friendly and professional staff, a working area with free coffee and fuits, bottles of purified water available on every floor, a top notch WiFi connection, and reasonable prices.

The room had a microwave, refrigerator, and coffee maker.They held my bags until I was ready to leave.And of course I love the bottles They provide for fresh water.And several good restaurants across the street.

This was my first experience at a Club Quarters hotel. The strong point is its price and location. Given its Grand Central location, you are easily in reach of anywhere in the city. Given the price, it is expected that there are aspects you can't expect. For one there is simply no real lobby. But to make up for this, there is a wonderful lounge on the top floor with ample comfortable chairs, flat screen TVs, computers and the New York Times. Free coffee, tea, and sparkling water are always available. Plus Monday - Thursday there are free snacks as well. This then is a terrific place to relax when not out on the town. Rooms are compact, but this is no surprise in New York unless you have money to spare. But the layout of the rooms keep them comfortable. Plus those dining at the associated Italian Restaurant are entitled to a 15% discount. (I didn't dine there so can't comment on the quality.) Each floor also has a place offering bottles which can be filled with cold water. In fact my only real objection was the antiseptic smell when I first entered the room, a smell that dissipated after the initial hour or two. But given the cost and the location, it is a hotel to keep in mind.

This review overlaps the one we submitted for the Boutique Hotel at the same address. The difference is apparently that some floors are Boutique and other are Club Quarters. This is now our favorite place to stay in NYC. The price is always competitive (made our reservations this time via Trip Advisor). The rooms are reliably clean and comfortably outfitted. The staff is very welcoming, accommodating and helpful. Our favorite aspect is the spacious lounge on the top floor, complete with computers, a fantastic coffee machine, and large screen TV. The balcony at that level has a great view of the neighborhood and is comfortable year-round.

Value: An exceptional find for the price. Room was on the 12th floor overlooking New York's famed Central Station. Location: Exceptional location, right in the middle of Manhattan. Central terminal is right outside the hotel and you can catch a subway to anywhere in the city. It's about a 15 min walk to Times Square for example. This hotel has the feel of a business hotel instead of being directed at tourists e.g. the hotel lobby is small and businesslike.View: The 27th floor "living room" communal area has a spectacular view over the city and the Chrysler building. Tourists would pay good money for the view. The communal area has a nice coffee machine (cappucinos etc) and has food (fruit, m+ms, peanuts, breakfast cereal bars) on weekdays (not on Sat/Sun from our experience).Rooms: Our room was modern but small (apparently small rooms are a standard in New York) and had a comforable large double bed, flat smartscreen TV with netflix, Youtube and online food ordering from nearby restaurants. Coffee machine, fridge, nice bathroom and shower. Also, the rooms are extremely soundproof!!Facilities: Computers and printing facilities are provided free of charge on the 27th floor. Wifi is also free and extremely fast - approx 250mb download speed)

The hotel is conevnient and reasonable. The room is very clean and the location is very good very close to the rail station, bus station and Subway station. The staff is kind with smile. I will stay at the hotel in the future.

Clean, comfortable, efficient rooms with plenty of power outlets. Small gym, great lounge and terrace on the top floor. John at member services is amazing. Always friendly and helpful. Very impressed that he remembers my name and always get a hello by name before even checking in. Perfect hotel for the business traveler. Love the free bottled water.

This is the best of the NYC Club Quarters. Clean, nice desks and sofas in the rooms. Really nice 27th floor work area and patio. Gym is better than most Clubs. Staff are friendly. Location is ideal near Grand Central. Lots of entrances to station within 2 blocks.

I have stayed at this hotel five times since October 2014. Very convenient location to Grand Central and all sorts of nice eating places and shopping. I found it very convenient and economical whenever I traveled solo needing to take care of personal business in Bronx I can just take the Metro North Train and off I go.

This is a good business hotel or tourist hotel! The location is great - Grand Central is around the corner, Rockefeller Center is a 5-minute walk, and getting around is very easy. If you are going to be here for a couple of days I recommend the room with the Kitchen Suite. Davio’s is downstairs if you enjoy fine dining…. the food and service is excellent!! I enjoy having access to the self-service washing machine, fitness room and club living room with terrace for coffee, snacks and computer access. I have stayed here several times and the people are always Wonderful!! I would like to thank both the Guest service managers Michelle and John for their professionalism and patience, Toby thank you for being so efficient in cleaning my room, Ben for fixing the printer and Ricardo and Peter with the maintenance issues. If you need a comfortable hotel for business or leisure, this is it!!

I wasn't sure what to expect walking in as the reception area is small and basic but staff were very friendly and welcoming. Once I got to the room everything I needed was there, the longe area on the 27th floor more than makes up for the reception entrance and the location is a real bonus! I really enjoyed my stay, would be happy to recommend it and I would go back. Don't expect too much luxury, though standards are good.

Great location, staff friendly and helpful. Great value. Living room on 27th floor lovely. Would return without hesitation. Close to transit, room snug but efficient. Water pressure in shower only distraction.

On arrival all I saw was a very small reception desk and three lifts. Nothing else. Was a bit apprehensive but I should not have worried. All the staff were friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. We stayed in room 2402 from 23rd Dec 16 to 28th Dec 16 This had a nice, comfy double bed, table and chairs plus bathroom. The view was fabulous. Lexington Ave, with the Chrysler building one block over. FREE wifi and a hotel ipad (you have to leave a cc just in case you lose it) :)... Up on 27th floor you got FREE coffee, apples, oranges, cereal bars, nuts, chocolate and cans of soft drink in the fridge. Free use of computers and printer on 27th floor and a view of Lexington Ave. To me this was hotel is ideal. We were within walking distance of everything, shops, sights, Central Park and my favourites, Byrant Park & Grand Central Station

I booked a queen superior room with a kitchenette but it was a room without kitchenette,only a microwave and a small refrigerator.I asked for changing room but the boy at the front-desk told me that there were no room for 3 persons with kitchenette.The day after I asked again to a girl and she showed a different room on 12th floor with a kitchenette.She added a cot as a third bed and we changed room in ten minutes.She was very friendly and professional.Great food service at 27th floor,but not pleasant that over the weekend there were no snacks as there were departures and,probably,the staff of the hotel wanted to avoid customers departing to take away!On Xmas day would be an added value to find at 27th floor some snacks or a typical American dessert for customers.My husband works in a 4 stars hotel in Venice,my brother is the President of the hoteliers'Association in our Country and so we know what it means to try to meet the needs of our customers so that their holiday will be remembered and appreciated.

Stayed here for 4 nights in early December 2016. Brilliant location for accessing grand central station, Times Square etc.Rooms are spacious and well equipped (a little bit of a freshen up would be good as some areas look a little tired)Staff are great and really helpful.Great facilities for guestsWould stay here again without hesitation

Very convenient to go everywhere in the city. Very nice view on the top of building to enjoy the evening light of street. Grand Central station is close to go. Service is excellent, room is very clean, though it is smaller than we expected。

The location was excellent, the hotelrooms were newly refurbished and clean. 10/10! Only the heating system was a bit louder than the normal operation. Tha staff was friendly and helped if it was necessary.

In my opinion this hotel should be considered 3 star at best. It is much too expensive for the size of the room. There is no lobby or real hotel like front desk. It is more like a motel setting than a hotel. You enter the front door and straight to the elevators. The service is poor, I think they are short staff. We asked for towels and it took them 1 hour to deliver (we had to call two times to remind them and even after the 2nd call it took 30min). It seems that this is an apartment building turned into a hotel with very small rooms. With the price that you pay here, you can get a much better hotel in the area.

We love staying here - it's close (enough) to family on the Upper East Side and the midtown action. It's across the street from Grand Central so travel anywhere by train/subway is just a block away.We had a 1 room suite last year and a Superior room this year. The Superior wasn't much different and still had a small kitchenette, desk, and xtra lounger that folds out into a twin. Each floor has filtered water available and the top floor is a lounge for use by all - coffee machine, snacks during the week in the AM, computers, tv, and both and indoor and outdoor seating area. Nice to get out of the room without leaving the hotel. The fitness center is decent but if you walk as much as we do, you don't really need it. We have not tried the restaurant - too many other options in the city.

The hotel has essential services with warm but professional welcome. You Can have breakfast in the italian restaurant located in the lower floor and there is a living room on 27 floor with free coffe ,te and water + great view ! There is also a small laundry ...free cold water at every floor.

The location was excellent just round the corner from Grand Central and the bus stop for Newark Airport. All the main tourist attractions were a short walk away. The area was a little more sedate as being a bit further away from Times Square which was good. The staff were really friendly and helpful and the room was was clean and comfortable. The heating worked well which was good as we had a cold snap. The TV did not work when we arrived, but maintenance came very quickly and fixed it. The lounge area and terrace was a bonus so it meant we could take a bottle of wine and watch the world go by. Water and bottles were available and a coffee machine in the room, there was also coffee in the lounge and nibbles in the week. We were on the 25th floor and had a good view. Lifts were speedy. I would stay here again.

NYC is an expensive place to get a hotel. We consider this hotel a great value. The staff is nice and very helpful, the rooms are clean and large enough, and the location next to grand central was perfect for us.New York is always busy, and there are sirens heard throughout the night. We planned ahead and travelled with earplugs and slept great.

We booked a small queen room for five nights. We arrived an hour early and booking in was no problem.The hotel is simply perfect for a trip to the city - the room is small but if your idea is to laze around in the hotel for a week, book a suite, this is just right for explorers who like to return the a comfortable, clean, central and welcoming room at the end of a full day of amazing.The USB points are useful, the bathroom compact and well designed and there is more than enough closet space for two people. The lounge area on the 27th floor is an unexpected bonus: glorious views in three directions, lovely coffee and apples/granola bars/bananas in the morning - all included in the room rate.The wi fi is no-mess-no-fuss and fast.The mid-town location is fantastic - 5 minutes' walk from Bryant Park, 200 meters from Grand Central and a 10 minute walk to Times Square.I took a chance in booking the CQ in DC for our week there early in the new year and am excited that I did; if it is as good as this one, we're in for a great stay.Fantastic stuff, you guys!

My husband and I just stayed for 5 nights and couldn't have been happier with location and room. It was within walking distance to the subway and only a 1/2 hour walk from Broadway for seeing plays (we're fast walkers). We had a standard room that had an extra part with a sofa bed, small fridge and microwave. The Queen Bed was extremely comfortable. It's New York so there's always noise but the white noise machine I travel with covered most of it. The snacks on the 27th floor were a really nice touch. We would definitely stay here again!

Arrived at the hotel to discover a Service Lobby, effective and efficient, no frills. The room was nice, clean and had all the amenities expected of a hotel room: Bed, side chair, desk/table, plenty of power stations for electronics and USB. Nice location in proximity to city sites - just a few blocks from Rockefeller Center and Grand Central Station.

The room was squeaky clean, nice and modern. Great set-up...bed...a booth with table setup that I think is very cool. Plug ins on this table for charging electronics. We walked to see the Christmas lights....mighty cold but only about a 15-minute walk to Saks and the beautiful lights of Rockefeller Center...the ice rink, large Christmas tree.

I stayed for 3 days at Club Quarters on my first visit to NYC. The staff was nice and always willing to help you when you ask something. The location was great, near to the Grand Central Station helps a lot if you like to take de subway. The rooms were comfortable and the wifi was free and high speed. Definitely I'll come back.

Quick check in always a winner when you have been waiting for airport connection for 3 hours. Room good size, only stayed for 4 nights so perfect for us. I found storage was great for a few nights. No view sadly but hey it's New York who stays in their room? I have to say my second visit to this wonderful city and no city noise at night was fantastic! Safe available on request, iron, ironing board and hair dryer all in room. Good housekeeping as well!! Location 7 min walk to Times Square or use the subway fast connection from grand central literally across the road! Had to say I would defiantly consider staying at a club quarters again great new chain of hotels. Oh last thing the roof terrace....wonderful views, very private and particularly amazing when you get proposed to! See you guys on our honeymoon!!

Great hotel staff really friendly would recommend and definatley go back there Also hotel great location for everything and had amazing stay all the family really enjoyed great break for everyone excellent ☺️

We extremely enjoyed our 8 night stay at the Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central. It offers perfect location in midtown Manhattan, a walking distance from major sites such as Times Square, Rockefeller Center / Top of The Rock, The MoMA, 5th Ave., Empire State Building and Grand Central Terminal as well as proximity to numerous subway stations. The room was clean and tidy and the staff was friendly, generous and kindly assisted when needed.

Great stay! Rooms are just like you see in the pics. We got a club-sized room and I was afraid it was going to be small, but it was perfect for a couple and very clean! I liked having the closet and the living room upstairs was really nice... the snacks on the weekdays were nice in between coming in from sightseeing all day and a later dinner. Elevators were quick and nicely secure. I'd definitely stay here again, but there were a couple of things that are minor that they could work on: We didn't know about the $150 incidentals hold til check in (idk what for as we didn't have a frig or anything) and when we asked about it we weren't given any answer other than a very curt it'll be released at checkout. We only got 2 bath towels, 1 hand towel, and 1 washcloth for 2 people. I'm not a towel hoarder, but felt limited. The next days no washcloth at all, good thing I had brought one from home. Coming in at midnight you really don't feel like calling for a washcloth or towel. Also, the bed was comfortable, but we'd roll toward the center where it was worn.All those things are minor and easy fixes, but I hope it helps them to continue to be at the top of their game. Keep it up Club Quarters!

This was a perfect hotel for us. The room was small but immaculate; it included all the expected amenities. The location was perfect for visiting the East and West sides of Manhattan and it is two blocks from Grand Central. Also, the price was right. As well, the attached restaurant offered a very nice, continental breakfast for $10.00! I will stay here every time I come into the city. The one negative...the coffee served for breakfast was a Costa Rican variety that I found undrinkable. I'm a Dunkin' Donuts fan.

Spent a weekend in NYC arriving by train. The hotel is conveniently located near Grand Central Terminal. Easy access to the subway and train. Our room was small but well appointed and the staff was courteous and helpful through out our stay. An impressive art collection as well.

The hotel has a great location and within easy walking distance of many iconic buildings. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, our room was very adequate and clean with all you needed for a short break. I certainly will book this hotel for our next trip to N.Y.C and would recommend it to anyone thinking of staying in Manhattan..

It's a great location for when I come in town. I do like that you have to use the card to use the elevator. It would be nice to have a Continental free breakfast. There use to be snacks and drinks on the 27th floor but those were remove last time I was there, I was disappointed.

Perfect hotel, nice staff ,close to all the shopping centers and the walking distance to any where in the midtown is enjoyable.Happy to be a guest in ten days and welcoming to do it again.Thanks a lot.

The hotel was located right next to the grand central terminal. We booked a superior room. The superior room has a kitchenette with two burners and a fridge. The rooms are a good size for New York. They also have a club quarters area with comfortable seating, snacks during the week in the evening. They also have a chilled water bottle station.

I've stayed at other Club Quarters many times and have nothing but good things to say about the facility and the staff. The Club Quarters Grand Central, however, really distinguishes itself with a very comfortable, clean room and outrageously good wireless Internet. I'm embarrassed to say that my Internet at home isn't as fast or good as this, and this with the hotel full for the Thanksgiving holiday! If Internet is important to you, I would rate this hotel as the best I've ever experienced, and I travel a lot.This chain is really designed for the professional traveler, but don't let that turn you off to booking a room for a holiday. The price is a real value in NYC. There is no fancy lobby or bar, but there is a "living room" on the top floor with computers, a business center, an outdoor balcony and a coffee bar.The location is superb. It is one block from Grand Central and Metro North and the subways. Travel here is very convenient.Great hotel, great amenities and great price. I'm a fan!

Rooms were a little dated and compact but in a good location, within walking distance of time square and Central Park. Easily accessible during all hours and had facilities on the top floor to print tickets etc.

Hotel is in a good location and neighborhood. Sign for hotel is hard to see when approaching. Look for Davios italian restaurant, the hotel is in the same location. Updated and clean. The beds are very small (doubles).

The perfect choice in NY, second time at Club Quarters (Midtown & GC) , but I'll be back again. All the facilities, central location to reach every point of interest & shopping, tranquillity....and a unique terrace at 27 th floor.

This is a great hotel. Comfy, clean and a great location for a reasonable price. Walk right down the block to Grand Central and lots of awesome restaurants and shops. Catch the train from grand central to anywhere you need to go. It's perfect. The rooms are small but hey, it's New york City. Also, I Loved the water filling station in the hall.

We went to NY for the first time in October. This hotel was a great location- the subway was easily accessible but we could also walk to close attractions like Times Square, 5th ave, Central Park, etc. We were tourists so didn't know much except for what we learned from reading up on NY before coming. This hotel was good, rooms obviously not very big but good enough for the 2 of us. Only complaint is that the bathroom didn't have a fan so it was a "cozy" 6 days. There are lots of great restaurants in the area and it is In a place where it's not AS loud as Times Square. Rooms must be sound proof because we didn't hear a thing once we were in our room! Wifi was great too, extra bonus.Reception was very helpful and willing to help with navigation and restaurant recommendations. Uncle Paul's pizza really was the best pizza we've ever had and we got the bubble tea from across the street every day. There was also a street festival on the Saturday which was very cool.. the street around the corner from the hotel (I thing 42nd?) was shut Down to traffic and there were hundreds of vendors set up with food and things to sell. The cab ride from the La Guardia airport was about $50 but we hit long weekend traffic on the way in.. we decided to Uber back to the airport for our departure and it was $20. Hope you enjoy your stay in NY! We can't wait to go back.

Club Quarters at Grand Central location was an excellent place to stay for a reasonable price . Rooms were small but very efficient in their layout and functionality. We stayed on 24 th floor. Less noise on upper floors from street noises. Staff was friendly and helpful. Bed was very comfortable. Davido's (sp) Resturant was connected. We were able to get a drink and bring to room or 27th floor lounge at end of a long day.

I had to go to NYC for work and have to use my company's travel site. Since my boss strictly monitors our expenses, I needed to select one of the least expensive options. Although there were a few cheaper options , the reviews were bad. I figure I could justify spending an additional 10 bucks to get a place with great reviews and only a half block from my meetings.I loved my room. It had a comfy queen sized bed and I liked the modern décor. I felt like I had a Midtown apartment. The Hotel doesn't have a breakfast plan, but there are tons of coffee shops near by. I would definitely stay there again.

Excellent stay. Very pleased. The hotel was located very well for travel. Could have been a little closer to a Subway stop however. Plenty to do in the area.. Loved the ice and water availability within the hotel. Loved the close proximity to Starbucks and Restaurants.

This was my first trip to NYC - and throughly enjoyed staying at CQ. Really nice room - it felt like a little apartment. Good view out of the window. All clean and smart. Great to have a lounge on the top floor. Friendly staff. Would definitely stay again!

First off - Possibly one of the best hotels I have been to in the New York area. It was a close walk to the Subway, Close walk to Times Square, plenty of food choices around, great view, great employee interaction, overall great time was had for my weekend stay. Nothing to complain about.

Also known as Boutique Grand Central (address on Lexington but the reception area is the same!).Great location near Grand Central. Rooms were good size with large comfortable beds. Water stations on all floors very handy. Lounge on 27th floor with free coffee / snacks. Terrace has views along Lexington and the Chrysler Building is a block away.Staff very helpful. Will use again.

Having just spent seven days at this fine hotel, I wanted to share my experience. This visit is actually my second time there and I was not disappointed either time. The hotel is at a great location, just a few feet from Lexington Ave and 45th and close to Grand Central. My room was clean and coffee, fruit and various snacks are provided for everyone's enjoyment on the 27th floor where there are comfortable sitting areas. The terrace at this level provides great views for photo taking or just sitting and enjoying the experience. Computers are provided; you can print out your boarding pass if you need to. The small workout room is quite adequate, I feel sure, because it was not busy. Washers and dryers are available if you are into doing your own laundry. Regarding the staff, they are polite and professional. I can only speak very highly of the staff at this hotel. Because Club Quarters at Grand Central has provided me with the comfort that I desire, it is my hope to revisit during my next trip to New York.

Stayed at the Grand Central location for a long weekend in late September. I found the listing by accident on Hotwire. They had a moderate rate and the location worked for me. I had never staying at a Club Quarters before, but the reviews were good. Had an uneventful stay there which is good! Loved the free water on every floor and the free laundry facilities. The rooms are small, but there is a lovely lounge on the top floors with a terrace to hang out in. There is also coffee and nuts in the lounge too. The location was terrific being right across Grand Central station. Made travel very convenient. With rates skyrocketing in Manhattan, Club Quarters is a great option and less expensive than other chains. Not fancy and don't let the lobby fool you. I'd highly recommend it.

Our recent stay at Club Quarters Grand Central was everything and more - and we would certainly stay there again if given the chance.First and foremost - it's a great location, situated close to Times Square, Grand Central and the 5th avenue shopping precinct without being too close so that you never get any shut eye!The staff are fantastic and a credit to the hotel - helpful, polite, attentive and friendly and the room cleaning is immaculate.The rooms themselves are not very large, but are designed well and have everything you could possible need - with a larger bathroom and very comfortable bed. Great cable television too!The laundry, gym and Level 27 lounge facilities (espresso coffee, computers etc) really make this hotel stand out from the crowd.Overall - it's a fantastic choice for a couple of singles staying in New York wishing to see the sights. It's not the cheapest hotel I could have stayed in during our time in New York, but it was worth every penny!Thanks for a great stay, Club Quarters.

This hotel is very central. Steps away from Grand Central Station, a few blocks from the UN building and in the opposite direction a few blocks from Times Square. Rooms have free wifi which is great because a lot of hotels charge high daily rates in Manhattan. There's a lovely lounge on the top floor which is a great work space/chill out area. There are fantastic views of the city a nighttime from the top floor balcony. Free coffee/tea in the lounge which is another added benefit.

Check in was quick and easy And the room itself (10th floor, overlooking 45 th) was perfect. Great collection of amenities and loads of plug points for all those gadgets we use. In particular the USB sockets for barging were really useful.

A good hotel. To far east for my liking, but booking late left me little options. Finding the entrance is not easy, you can see the sign but the entrance is far from obvious. Friendly, helpful staff, and a decent bar, 'wheeltappers' underneath.

The view from 27th floor was beautiful and we really liked the complimentary water and coffee, there were sodas and breakfast bars available sometimes, but not on friday-sunday. The costumer service was good, everyone working at the hotel were very nice. One guy working in the lobby booked a table for us at a restaurant and when we were at the restaurant the waiter brought us complimentary champaign from him. The location was great, grand central station just a few steps away, times square is in a walking distance and a lots of stores and restaurants close by. Loved that Bath and bodyworks is in the next building :) The room was a bit small but it was clean and the bed was very comfortable.

Great location. Close to Grand Central Stn.theatres, shopping and many other attractions within Manhattan. The hotel is a no-frills offering. Rooms were smaller than anticipated, but neat, clean and functional. You're close to a number of eating establishments outside the hotel itself.

Based on New York standards, the rooms are big clean and comfortable, the staff was professional and courteous specially Rey Velasquez. The hotel is very close to many attractions but far enough away so it is quieter and less foot traffic. I recommend this hotel to anyone for business or vacation.

I stayed here for three days In October 2016, I found this place to be great, loved it's a small quiet hotel, the room was very clean and well organized and the staff was friendly. There is a great club room on the top floor which is great for working as you look over a nice part of the city . It was also priced less than the big hotels. Would definitely recommend if you want nIce clean base camp that's not a mega hotel but close to restaurants, grand central. will look to stay again

I had the pleasure of staying at this Club Quarters on business and my stay was amazing! Zishan and Sandy are the best in the business. They were extremely professional and kind. They even gave me recommendations on restaurants and nightlife. It's a nice treat when the employees go above and beyond your expectations. The hotel itself is beautiful; the rooms are a decent size in comparison to other NY hotels and they even have guest necessities (i.e. shower caps, sewing kits, etc.) in a closet on each floor (which is nice to not have to wait for someone to bring the items to you). They also have complimentary purified bottled water! I could go on and on but nonetheless, I truly enjoyed my stay.

Very cool and comfortable hotel. Great location.Very pleasant and helpful staff. I got a lot of help from the staff about the nearby services and places. I enjoyed the stay here and felt no difficulties . the club living room (27th floor) was serviced well and has a lot of selections snacks, coffee, tea and other refreshments.My favorite hotel in New York.

You can't ask for a better location just a block from Grand Central with easy access to train lines or a quick walk to many New York sites. The hotel has a simple lobby and efficient rooms with modern furnishings. The bathroom and closet were both spacious. The room was quiet and the bed comfortable. The hotel had some nice features including fresh cold water available on each floor and bottles for filling. A really nice touch for thirsty travelers. They were also wonderful upon checkout letting us leave our bags until our later on the day flight. Excellent stay!

This was my third stay at a Club Quarters hotel and it was great just like the past two stays. Room isn't large but when you're in NYC the room is for sleeping! Clean and modern, Kuerig in room, chilled water in hallways, courtesy room with coffee and computers on 27th floor and the views were great. This Club Qtrs was conveniently located close to Grand Central (thus the name) but was a short walk away from Times Square and Theatre District as well. Uber'd to/from airport (about a 45 min ride from LGA).

The Club Quarters was extremely comfortable and updated. This property has such a great location for New York city, and is centrally located in midtown New York. The staff was very nice and friendly. Cannot wait to visit and stay here again.

Brilliant hotel for the sites, very clean and nice staff, defiantly recommended for ease of getting around, just round the corner fromGrand central station so very easy to get to from the airports. Defiantly would use again

Newly built this property has standard CQ rooms and also an excellent restaurant called Davios similar to sister property in Philadelphia. Very convenient to all the shopping in the Terminal and on 5th Avenue

I really enjoyed staying at the heart of the city @ this hotel.. It's very convenient & excellent customer service & friendly staff! They have beautiful clean lounge at the 27th floor with a good view of NYC.. The hotel is close to everywhere with 15 to 30mn's walk at most! I would like to say a special thanks to Guest Serv. Mgr Robert & to John you guys have the best customer service & attitude!

The sensation when you get to this hotel is a bit weird. There is a simple desk as a reception. But the room was very comfortable, although I didn't like the decoration. There was a table, a spacious wardrobe, a comfortable wardrobe and a spacious and clean bathroom. When I walked around, I found that this non conventional hotel has a lot of room for conventions and things like that. I would recommend this.

Great hotel with well appointed rooms and a beautiful fully serviced lounge. The best part of the experience are the staff. Very pleasant and helpful. From housekeeping to reception and maintenance. Very knowledgeable and honest about nearby restaurants and services. Thank you all.

I stayed in a small unit for a long biz trip. Did the job at a "reasonable" price, by NYC standards. The lounge floor and biz centre met my needs. I would recommend the hotel and the location, Grand Central

Perfect place to base yourself for sightseeing. We could walk to most of the main sights. Rooms were on the small side, with not much space for suitcases, but I suppose this is to be expected in NYC. It was a really clean and modern hotel. The rooftop lounge area with coffee/ snacks/ etc was a nice touch, with good views of the Chrysler building. Overall, I can't fault this hotel.

Stayed here at the end of May for a quickie NYC weekend sightseeing after a week in Rochester. Very central and a block from Grand Central Station, I bused from Newark airport. Only was in the room to sleep so the small size was perfect for me. Loved the refillable bottled water stations on each floor. Room was clean, well decorated and outfitted. Front desk staff was very helpful for directions and info. Would have been nice if the terrace had been opened to non members.

The location was great, near Central Station, and the rooms are cosy. Very clean and with good dimentions.It´s a simple hotel, and I has an important detail: they have bottled water and coffee free for clients.

We enjoyed our stay at Club Quarters, Grand Central, the hotel was very clean, nice amenities, laundry, on the 27th floor club room with coffee, espresso, snacks and a lovely view from the terrace on the 27th floor, comfortable seating.The rooms have a kitchenette which was very handy, the beds were comfortable and the staff was friendly and helpful. Easy walking distance to Grand Central Station and Times Square

I love Club Quarters hotels and often stay in this hotel chain when in New York city. I have always found them to be perfect in every way -- definitely 5-star hotels. This particular facility, however, while wonderful in other ways, has several room sizes including 2 "categories" that are very small, so I was surprised and disappointed at the size of the room I had; it was barely large enough for me, alone, and was glad my husband was not with me because it would have been impossible for two people to be comfortable in it, despite the queen size bed (which, was very comfortable). I called the front desk to see if there was another larger room available, and was told they were sold out (I was also informed that my room was NOT the smallest, that there were also smaller rooms) but to their credit, they were willing to help move me the next day to a larger room (which I declined since I find moving more inconvenient than dealing with the small size). On the positive side, however, every member of the staff--housekeeping, front desk, "engineering" (who brought a mini-refrigerator to the room for my medications) -- were WONDERFUL in terms of attitude, professionalism, and competence. The restaurant was also quite good, with attentive wait staff, quality of the food, and very good value. I also love the complimentary "purified" water available on every floor, where you can fill up as many bottles as you want! I would definitely return to this hotel, especially if my favorite Club Quarters hotel (opposite Rockefeller Center) isn't available, and hopefully the next time I'll get a larger room! And I would recommend it to friends.

The hotel is located near Gran Central in Midtown, a perfect location for going around NYC by public transport. The room was small but confortable although there was no refrigerator nor safe. The facilities in the top floor were nice but limited (coffee, apples and bananas and cereal bars). The towels were limited. The elevators very busy.

Great location and facilitates, including complimentary hot drinks in the 27th floor lounge and bar, with amazing views both day or night. Friendly staff, clean room and comfortable facilities. Perfect for over night or longer stay.

Though I was quite surprised to discover my room to be of such "luxurious" aesthetic "dimension", albeit not grandiose in physical size, I was most shocked to discover their service standard equal to that received at the most expensive hotels in which I have stayed. A fantastic "buy" in New York City!!!Chief among these "beyond the call of duty" guest staff is certainly, Michelle (last name unknown) who shocked me quite completely in her handling of my own senior moment disaster brought on by my forgetting to pick up my luggage. I had left it in the hotel lobby "hold area", after checking out of the hotel. The hotel had agreed to hold the luggage while I found a restaurant, and had breakfast, and then picked up my car from a nearby parking garage, before leaving the city. Upon leaving the city and arriving at my destination in Montreal, I realized I had forgotten to return to the hotel for my checked luggage. Disaster! Thank god for Michelle, who came to my rescue when I phoned the hotel, and she advised me on contacting Fed Ex. for the addressing label and payment logistics. She then found an appropriate box in the hotel to package my luggage, and then took its contents to the Fed Ex store nearest the hotel to complete all necessary procedures. It was a potential major disaster, made entirely manageable by her most professional, and generous intervention. She served my need, and the hotel's good name, in a most satisfyingly friendly demeanor. Club Quarters is my "go to" hotel of choice, on all my future trips to N.Y.. A cold city, at any time of year, made toasty warm by such friendly, and authentic professionalism. Thank you, Michelle, and Club Quarters, as well. A very comfortable, and pleasant stay.

I chose this hotel due to luggages and having to arrive into GCT. Loved the hotel, here are the pros:1) It was so close to GCT, so close to the main subway lines.2) cosy and modern feel3) spacious and modern bedroom and bathroom - beautiful skyscraper views4) usb charger so no need adaptors!5) wifi works great (all the time)6) personnel very helpful to look into things for you7) safe walking areaCons:None. This is a perfect urban hotel!

All useful amenities are available as standard. Convenient location all for business travel and loisir. Extremely welcoming staff. Especially clean hotel. I would recommend to everyone, regardless what the type of travel is.

OK, yes, the rooms are small, but manageable. The lobby is non existent. BUT the view from the terrace and the snackage and coffee machines, plus the Apple work stations make the other issues worth it. I would stay again.

This hotel is in a good location, very close to Grand Central station and the Chryssler Building. The rooms are very small, but the WiFi is good and there was minimal road noise, there was no view from my room. The reception area is very small but the staff very helpful. The lounge area on floor 27 with outdoor seating was great with free tea and cofee and snacks/fruit in the morning. An overall pleasant stay

Staff at reception area is unfriendly and abrupt. Business center sucks! Room is small and uncomfortable. Stay at one of the other Club Quarters in Manhattan. While the location of this place is super, the one at Rock Center is so much better.

This hotel is right by Grand Central and from here you can walk basically anywhere, being in Midtown. Love the self-service checkin/checkout and the lounge on the 27th. I had a queen bed room which was small, but very rationally arranged. Of course space in Manhattan comes at a dear price. As a word of caution, the wardrobe is small (only 8 hangers), there are no drawers in the room therefore very small storage space. The bathroom has only a shower, which is what I prefer (no need to waste space for a batch tub that is hardly ever used). Did not try the restaurant, has there are many viable choices just around the corner and in front of it! On the negative side : when I got to the lounge one morning there was no coffee; the printer was not working and they told me to wait for maintenance to arrive, after 30 minutes of patiently waiting, I left! Do not get a room on the 2 nor the 3 floor as you may be next to the flag, which keeps banging on the wall making a metallic, annoying noise.

Long weekend with another couple. Visited New York a couple of time before, but first time staying in this chain. We chose it as it was a good price and good location in East Midtown near Grand Central and the Chrysler, but not right on Times Square & Broadway so a bit quieter at night. Managed to get rooms on the same floor. Arrived during a heatwave & thankfully the rooms have AC. Rooms modern & clean & we didn't hear our neighbours. Street noise as expected, but didn't disturb us too much. There is a fitness suite which we didn't use, but there is a rooftop terrace and indoor lounge which are lovely and definitely the highlight. My only complaint was on the Friday there were complimentary sodas & snacks, but these aren't available over the weekend, which would have been very much welcomed, especially after waking around in 35 degree heat all day! It's a nice extra touch, just disappointed that you are penalised for staying at the weekend. The coffee machine also broke & wasn't fixed until the Monday. Water and ice were available and we just ended up bringing back our own drinks and snacks. We extended our check out time to 3pm as we had an evening flight for $50 plus tax & just shared a room for this to keep our bags there during the day & have showers to freshen up before heading to the airport which was great.

The hotel reception was tiny on the ground floor but very quick. Not sure if this was the main check-in area but couldn't find any other one.The room is small, even for New York standards but to be fair we weren't in it for too much so didn't really matter.The hotel does have a lot of nice touches though. Free wifi was stable and quick. Room was quite quiet but you'll never get away from the road noise in most of the hotels.Loverly outside area on the 27th floor where you can take a beer or coffee and overlook the area around you.It's a 'do it yourself hotel', if you want extra pillows, go to the room and get them yourself.Want to borrow an iron or more coffee ? You need to go to the area to get them.Still enjoyed it here though and would stay again at the right price .

This is my preferred hotel in NYC. No lobby, excellent lounge on the 27th floor, coffee and drinks all day, free wifi and for a very reasonable price.Excellent location across from Grand Central station; great team! Clean and reasonable size rooms.

Stayed for the weekend just to hang out in the city ....getting to the hotel was easy. Good location midtown...walk to broadway...room for my purposes of a place to sleep...very clean..great water pressure in shower fairly modern ...wi fi in room ...keurig coffeemaker in room...bottled water available on the floor..27th floor "living room" very nice with terrace and and view of Lexington ave...will definitely stay here again...and staff was very pleasant check-in and check-out. ..

Great location for visiting Manhattan on foot. The rooms were clean and spacious, staff was kind and helpfull at every request. I especially appreciated the laundrinette provided with complimentary soap. At every floor there is fresh depurated water available 24/7 and from monday to friday there is a smack point at the 27th floor with hot and cold non alcoholic drinks and frresh fruit. The terrace at the 27th floor is amazing, having breakfast there was a great benefit. Another important thing being in Manhattan is security and Club Quarters protects their guests by allowing access to the floors only by using the key card.

Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights.Its on the corner of Lexington ave og 45th street. Right beside the GrandCentral where you can take the subways anywhere in NY.We had a Clubroom with queensize bed. They offered to upgrade, but we were satisfied with the room.A bit small for our big shoppingsuitcases. But put one the top of the closet worked out just fine.A nice room and bath. Had a fridge, microwave and a small coffee machine.There is a lounge and terrace on the 27th floor.Free selfservice washingmachines and a small gym.It takes 15 min walk to Times Square and it took me 7 minutes jog to Park Central.There are free watermachines on each floor. Lots of restaurants near by. Or you could just buy some take out and sit on the nice terrace.The bus from Newark Airport stops at 41st street and it takes you 5 minutes to walk to the hotel.Love this hotel and gladly recommened to other travellers.One small complain though.The coffemugs in our room were a bit dirty. But housekeeping changed it immediately. So good service.

This was my first trip to New York and the hotel made it better than I expected. The hotel was in a brilliant location, so close to Grand Central Station, so easy access everywhere! The room was a perfect size for a young couple, it was air conditioned with a fridge. The bathroom was a good size and very bright. It is a very secure hotel as only residents can access the lifts up to rooms.

Excellent central location close to grand central and walking distance of 5th Ave. The standard rooms are actually quite spacious with good size shower and also air conditioned. Rooms also had tea/coffee etc and other nice touches like USB charger plugs! Beds were comfortable and rooms very clean and I'd say my room looked as thought it was recently decorated. The hotel had an excellent roof top lounge and terrace which during the week are stocked with snacks, cans of juice, water, tea and coffee. What was disappointing was this was not stocked during the weekend. Staff were very helpful and always polite - the maintenance man (I think his name was Paul) was always very pleasant and cheery when we spoke with him in the lift on his way to the next job, reflective of the standard throughout the hotel.

Our stay at Club Quarters: Grand Central was fantastic! Immediately when we arrived, the front desk staff was very welcoming, friendly, and enthusiastic about our stay. They had even honored my request (weeks ago) for a city view room on a high floor for my girlfriend's birthday (and then they even said happy birthday to her!). We got into our room and found it to be extremely clean and well kept. It was small, but all we did was sleep there so it didn't matter. The bathroom was also really, really clean and a perfectly fine size for two people to get ready in. The location of the hotel couldn't be more perfect... With a subway station just a couple blocks away you can travel north/south on the 4/5/6 trains, east/west on the 7, or take the shuttle to Times Square (the S train). Anyone who has been to NYC knows that the subway is the way to go and wow this sure made it simple. The 27th floor lounge ("living room" they called it) has complimentary coffee, tea, fruit, and stacks in the morning as well as both regular and carbonated water. Each floor has a water bottle machine to fill complimentary water bottles (this was great since we were there at the end of July and buying water bottles can get expensive). Lastly, for those internet users - the wifi is FREE (yes, it's actually free! None of that $25/night stuff!) and is really fast. Overall, the experience was top notch and we will absolutely stay here (or another Club Quarters) again.

My second visit to this Club Quarters (which has an entrance on East 45th St) but is the same hotel as Hotel Boutique which has an entrance around the corner on Lexington. Maybe someone can explain that one. My room this time was on the 2nd floor so it was considerably noisier this time. I used the self check in machine in reception which didn't give me a chance to request an higher floor. Machines are no substitute for human customer service! Apart from the noise the room was fine and a reasonable price for Manhattan.

We stayed in hotel Boutique for 4 nights in August 2016. On the first night we got a room on the 4th floor - which was o.k but there was no real window (the window was facing an AC yard). We asked to switch the room to higher floor with view - and got a nice room with a great view on the 26th floor - facing the Crysler building.The staff was really nice and helpful. There was a water bar with plastic bottles - on each floor (which was great) and terrace on the 27th floor is really nice.The location of the hotel is also great - close to main areas and to grand central station.The rate isn't cheap - but it's NY....

I enjoyed by stay and the hotel was very nice and clean. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location was good, very close to transportation. The hotel just needs a pool and it would be complete.

Excellent, could not fault it, very good position, clean and quiet. Polite, helpful staff, would definitely book this hotel again. Nice touch with the washer/ dryers, went home with clean clothes. View from room was excellent!

The location was great, walked to most places and grand central station was round the corner.However the rooms are tiny and dated. There are little flys and insects in the room, had to get my room changed. It was higher up but still same small and dated room. I would not recommend it as it was very expensive and it felt like I stayed in a 2/3* budget travelodge.

Good central location close to grand central station. Modern room facilities. Nice lounge on 27th floor with complimentary coffee/tea & patio looking out towards Chrysler building. Lobby checkout experience not good with grumpy unfriendly staff.

Good business hotel. Rooms are small but well equipped. Square table looks weird at the beginning but is effiecnt for working. No fridge is available in the room. I will be probably staying here again.

Excellent location literally across the street from Grand Central. Top notch service and perfect suite. I was upgraded to a suite and it had a fully equipped kitchen plus all out sofa bed. Very good value,

I was surprised that there was no Bar Fridge but an awful lot of concentration on WiFi, which was of no interest to me. I asked one night for Room Service but this was no really acceptable to the management.

Service was excellent. Room was well kept. Very modern feel to it. A block and half away from grand central station. The Terrence on the top floor is great for a night time view of the city. Also a brief walk from time square and Central Park.

This was a fantastic find in NYC. We stayed here for 6 nights, and the hotel is in a perfect location for sightseeing, within easy walking distance to attractions including Times Square. The room was well equipped, bed was comfy, and we had a room on one of the higher floors, so it was very quiet with no street noise. There was also a free lounge with tea and coffee with a fantastic terrace with great views of the city. They also offer free printing facilities, a free launderette with 2 washing machines and dryer, and they even provided detergent! Loved it and would stay again for sure.

I booked this hotel through Travelocity. I was heading out on Saturday morning, very excited to go and stay here. I had a medical issue arise and was in urgent care Friday night still hoping I could get on medicines and still make the trip. I was not able to do so. I called the hotel directly Friday night giving my situation and was telling them I want to still make the trip but there was the chance I could not depending on how I felt in the morning. I could not make the trip :(... I called Travelocity Saturday morning and they called the hotel two different times to to see if they would refund me or even a partial refund, NO giving on the hotels end. Yes the reservation I guess upfront had said non refundable. Yes understandable somewhat. But when a medical reason occurs you would think they could work with you. I did not want to miss this trip myself along with my husband and daughter. We were meeting my daughter on Sunday flying into to NYC from a trip. We were coming down spending 2 days 1 night in the city. Very disapointed on Club Quarters Grand Central. Sorry you were not able to meet me on a partial refund. Very unsatisfied customer. Thank you.

This little hotel has very small rooms, almost no lobby, but great views and great location! The rooms are efficient and it was the perfect size for my 2 nights solo stay. I loved being able to walk to most things and the subway is across the street. As mentioned in past reviews, the air conditioning is very loud and can be bothersome but difficult to sleep without the air on as it was so hot when I was there. I would recommend the hotel but get a bigger room if you have more than one person.

I did enjoy the stay in the hotel. The room was cleared everyday. The prize was good if you want to be in the center, metro station is in 2 mins walk. Breakfast was not included but the area gives you many opportunity to have breakfast

This is our go to hotel in NYC. We have tried many of the hotels in Times Square, but the area is very crowded (a lot of tourists). We travel to NYC 2-3 times a year to shop, and meet up with friends. This hotel gives you great access to Grand Central to hop on the subway and go wherever you need to. They hold your luggage with no problem so you can drop it off and go and bring it to your room when it is ready. The rooms are small, but so are all hotels in NYC. The room is comfortable and you cannot hear a lot of the outside noise that I have found to be an issue at many other locations. I love this hotel for the convenience to the trains and subway, the location being outside of a tourist area, but can easily access times square and other popular areas within minutes and for the price. Great price for what you get no matter the time of year!

I took my first trip to NYC ever November 2015. Booked the hotel through Hotwire and it chose Club Quarters, grand central. The hotel is lovely from the outside and inside but the room was so tiny! It felt like I was in a matchbox honestly, and also thought are all NYC hotels this small?!

Rooms were fine, no lobby downstairs with no warm welcome. Within seconds our credit cards were asked, very direct.Free drinking water on every floor.Nice outside terrace on the 27th floor.Free coffee and tea. The location is great, which explains the high prices.

Hotel was perfect for my purpose. Very clean, and quiet. Also great location. While there was a coffeemaker in the room, it would have been nice to have complimentary coffe or a light continental breakfast icluded in the room rate.

Good location, very near Grand Central, free wifi, enjoyed the view at the Terrace which has free coffee/ tea and fresh fruits. Will surely go back to this hotel. The hotel has friendly and very accommodating staff.

This hotel was convenient to theaters, times square, and central station. Very nice room. Web site review of room was very accurate. We enjoyed having the water dispenser and bottles out side if our room.

The elevators ran slow but other than that no complaints! Really nice hotel with a great location!! Really nice view from the terrace and the complimentary drink station was a nice touch as well. Also really liked the bottled water station on each floor!

nondescript entrance but pleasant staff. Clean, but double rooms very small. One small wardrobe, and little space between bed, walls and window. Furnished in a modern style, but no room for suitcases. Asked for early room service a couple of times when going out, but disappointed no action taken. Nice 'meeting room' and balcony on top floor, with great do it yourself coffee, and fruit and protein bars.....no breakfast as such, but plenty in area. Too small!

This is the third Club Quarters I've stayed in. I like the model and they are all quite similar. This one is no exception.The location is good on Lexington and East 45th. It's near everything, a short walk to Grand Central and nice distance away form the craziness of Times Square.The rooms are just as they appear in the photo's on trip advisor. The rooms are clean, small but big enough, the bed is reasonably comfortable. This is not a 5 star hotel but it's comfortable.My room looked directly into the wall of the building next door, but on the positive side it was quiet with none of the street noise. It had great free WiFi, nice bathroom, coffee machine and as is usual with Club Quarter free water via a machine near the elevators. Nice touch, especially when its 90+ / 32 degrees outside. The AC worked well and individual for each room, but is noisy.Everything was more than acceptable, the service was friendly and efficient. Grand Central station with all the markets and food places within 1 minutes walks. More than enough Starbucks in all directions all within 1 minutes walk too. Everything you want.This hotel doesn't have nice views and isn't one of the grand hotels but it is safe, comfortable, clean and well priced. I recommend it.

Great value hotel. Nothing fancy, but clean, safe and centrally located to GC. Not the type of room where one would just want to hang out or relax. The beds seem short but just because they are tight versus the opposite wall. One complaint was a lack of water pressure for the shower. Good size bathroom.

Great choice for central location. Friendly staff. Bought take-away food from deli, help yourself hot and cold food, took back to roof top terrace - amazing views! Free ice for drinks. Perk to have fresh fruit and cereal bars free at breakfast with the tea and coffee, although not at weekends.Used mainly by business people. Close to Central Station. There was a street market on the Sunday.

A very compact modern hotel, that offers a great location with comfort! A beautiful terrace with a fantastic view of Lexington Ave while you drink your morning drink of choice! My room was a beautiful Queen size, with a fridge, microwave and keurig coffee facilities.

All in all it was a nice experience with this hotel. The location is just fantastic, the staff is funny (sometimes sarcastic), and we liked very much the chilled-purified water on our floor and the coffee machine on the 27th floor. The only deficiency was the breakfast. The hotel management should take the time and go on a tour for Europe's 4 star hotel chains, like NH in Germany or Radisson in Scandinavia and take a photo: now, that's what I call a breakfast! I didn't like, that we had to search for a place every single morning to eat something, because the hotel's breakfast was really poor. But really that's the only thing! In addition the room was clear and overall the hotel, too!

It is a very excellent hotel everything is fine the staff , location , room, cleaning level, balcony and the whole service is perfect My next trip for sure I will be with them againAnd for sure I will advise my firend and my family and any one I know to book in this hotel

I was priced out of some of the major chains I usually stay at in this area of Manhattan, so based on reviews, I chose the Club Quarters. While the lobby is spartan and small, don't let that discourage you. The rooms are more than adequate as far as modern amenities and decor. The bathroom was clean and bright and bigger than most. And it was quiet. I did not have a chance to enjoy the restaurants or other amenities, due to my quick stay, but am looking forward to checking it out further on a future visit. Great job, Club Quarters. I will happily return.

The hotel is in a perfect position for walking through The most important actractive streets and avenues, bryant park and times square. Employers are very polite and professional, kind and good looking!! I lost my I-pad on a taxi and their help it was a salvation! I found it after two hours. Never forget! See you soon!!!

The hotel is well located, has friendly staff who go out of their way to make one feel appreciated and welcome. The location is also excellent, easily accessible to Port Authority, grand central train station, Broadway and fabulous restaurant all within walking distance

We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The hotel, within a very short walk at 45th and Lexington, from the eastern exit of Grand Central Terminal, is immaculately maintained. Our room, while not large, was certainly well-equipped, comfortable adequate for our stay. Every room booked has access to the 26th concierge floor comfortable conference room space which has coffee and some basic snacks available on every business day but not weekend days. This space also opens up to a terrace with a terrific view of the Chrysler Building to the west, etc. Each floor also has a rack of free plain water bottles with a water dispenser near the elevator bank. We took advantage of the fact that, if we billed our meal at Davio's Steakhouse downstairs, we got a 15% discount on the meal we had to celebrate our daughter's college graduation. It was a terrific meal and we'd certainly recommend the restaurant as well.

Had to travel to NY and did not want to spend a fortune. Club Quarters has very modern upscale rooms at reasonable prices. Not the largest hotel room I have stayed in but considering you are dealing with NY real estate I believe it is par for course. Had everything you need just condensed in smaller real estate. Location is short walk from grand central and very centrally located for museums, broadway, shopping, etc.

Great location for my purposes, price was a good value. I love the rooftop terrace. Great for morning coffee and catching up on business/news. Strong WiFi throughout. Room was comfortable and clean, it had what I needed. I've stayed here before so I knew what to expect. Those expectations were met.

+ nice location next to grand central+ very efficiently managed+ small, but very nice rooms, no noise pollution (my room was in floor 19)+ free fruits and soft drinks on top floor+ fast internet- bed a little soft, loud AC

This was my second visit to this particular Club Quarters, since my office relocated to the neighborhood. As expected, the rooms are small - it's a business traveler's hotel and it's New York City, so the size is expected. I wasn't expecting, though, a room that felt so unclean that I was afraid to take my shoes off. I have no proof that it was unclean, but that was my feeling when I walked in.I was also disappointed that I was placed on the 3rd floor. I checked in after 11pm and didn't have the energy to argue, but I highly recommend that you request to switch. The 3rd floor has communal services like ice machines and the gym, so it's always noisy. The doors don't extend all the way down to the floor, so the noise easily sneaks into the room - as does the light. You will also hear street noise! Do yourself a favor and move to a higher floor. There always seemed to be one elevator out of order, so expect to wait on your way out or in. While the staff was pleasant, I had to ask 4 times to have the TV fixed, which is 3 times too many. I generally like CQ properties, but this is one I won't stay at again.

We thought we "settled" to a cheaper hotel when we moved from a 300USD hotel to this one to save cost. Boy, we were blown away by their attention to details and what was on the offer. They offered free water (bottles are provided), free all day gourmet fresh coffee, snacks, and fruits on the Club Floor, accessible to all guests, with computer stations at your disposal. They also offer free iPad for guests to use during the stay and they have very good and strong free wifi. We requested a fridge and a microwave and those were delivered within minutes. They would even deliver an elliptical machine to your room if you want one (we didn't make that request). The room is small but got everything you need. It is very clean and relatively quiet except those occasional sirens from the streets. Location is great as its just a stone throw from the Grand Central. We have found a jewel in New York City and we will return for certain. Cons: bed and pillows are way too soft.

I found that this hotel is amazing! The staff was so great and cooperative. Things were resolved in seconds. Excellent restaurant is on the lower floor. You can even go to work out in a fitness room ( of course if you will find time for it during your stay in NYC).

Excellent stay! Clean, quiet, well-located, modern, all the amenities i wanted ( even the usb port was the newer, fast-charging type)The rooftop was a pleasant surpriseTime on the clock radio was very much wrong, which makes it kind of uselessThe price was right. Will make a point oestaying here when I'm in NYC

I have been very impressed with Club Quarters Grand Central. The rooms are standard small hotel room, but nicely appointed. The big win is the 27th floor sky terrace balcony and lounge/study area. When you travel for business it is so nice to have a place you can go to relax and unwind after work - and sometimes when you have more work to do! They have policies very accommodating to changing travel plans, offer water bottles on all floors, the basement has private access to an upscale restaurant with bar and sports bar area for those nights you are beat and want the comfort of not having to leave the building. The sky terrace and lounge are laid out with comfortable tables, chairs, loungers, desks and tables for a group, if needed. They put out snacks and offer soft drinks, water, tea and coffee throughout the evening - wonderful for decompression moments!The staff is friendly and helpful. I am normally a large hotel highest tier member but am now looking at Club Quarters for the cities where they are located. The extra comforts are definitive for me and maybe for you! Give them a try!

The place hardly feels like a hotel when you enter - reception simplified and automated. Rooms are small but adequate for single/business vistors. There is a wonderful japanese/korean restaurant (riki) across the street and plenty of coffee/take out food places around. Close to Grand Central and UN offices.

Nice as promised, great value for money. Room was clean and comfortable. Good iron and ironing board (something I often don't find in hotels). Super convenient location by Grand Central. Would definitely come back!Can be a little hard to find from the street a night. Just do a quick google street view before getting there.Shoutout to Yannek at the front desk who checked me out and gave me the tripadvisor recommendation card.

Excellent place to stay, very nice rooms/bathroom. Excellent location. 10 minute walk to time square. Great facilities within the building, free washing machine/dryer usage and powder. Great top floor terrace with amazing views. Help yourself to fruit, water, tea/coffee and cans of soda whenever you please. Wifi was great! Couldnt fault this place. If i ever get back to New York, would stay here again. Also extremely well priced :)

This hotel located relatively good for the eastern side of the city and quite a challenge if you have things to do/ see on 7,8,9th AV and or if you wish to use the red line frequently.. As you will be doomed to have very long walks to cross from west to east and backwards.As for the Hotel itself it is clean quiet and has the twist of the homie club on the 27th floor and the balcony which overlooks the city.In short use only if you don't need the western avenues

This was the second visit to this location by my wife and myself. Initially I thought I would not be writing a new review as my report last year was glowing but somehow the experience was even better this time around . The staff was friendly, courteous and very helpful. I would particularly like to thank Robert who was very helpful to us on both Friday and Saturday evenings.

Myself and my girlfriend spent 3 nights here and loved it. Less than a 5 minute walk to Grand Central, 15 minutes to Times Square and plenty of shops just a stones throw away on 5th Ave.Room was spotless and well furnished, and the bed was very comfy. We had a corner room which gave us a nice view north onto Lexington Ave and west across 45th street. An amazing view to see first thing in the morning. Would definitely return if we get the chance.

This was second time staying at this location. First experience was not so good (there was an electeical system issue in my room) second time, for business and it was perfect. The beds are comfortable and the rooms were perfect for what I needed. I enjoyed my stay, I only wish there were a few more amenities in the bathroom. Otherwise, I'll be back!

Stayed here with my girlfriend for a weekend. Quality is consistent with other Club Quarters I've stayed at. A small but clean room, comfortable bed, decent view from the 20th floor. Great location - close to Grand Central Station, NY Public Library, Times Square, the UN, and many other attractions. Also close to many subway lines. Minor complaints: the bed was small for a queen-sized, and the air conditioner was very loud. All in all, more than adequate at a reasonable price.

Beautiful view from the terrace in the roof. You can take there free coffee and fruit in the morning enjoying an amazing view on NYC. The service is slow: probably too many guests for the staff. Rooms are small but functional.

Excellent services: free lounge in the 27th floor with a spectacular city view, complementary cofee and drinks there, computer, printers, internet connection, laundry room in the 3rd floor, roooms with complete kitchen. And without the noisy environment of manhattan hotels

The aircond sounded so extremely high we could not use it. My suggestion is, dont go here if you will want to use the AC, because you will not be able to use it unless you want to get your self a hearibgdisorder. Otherwise: clean, small, a little far away from everything, expensive. And boorig place. The staff in the "reception" are not interrested in any thing else. Than fooling around with each other...

Club Quarters is perfect. Great location, rooms are new and well appointed and comfortable, very large guest business area and terrace on top floor (27) offering great views of midtown Manhattan and the Chrysler building, free guest laundry on the 3rd floor. Rooms are somewhat small but that's fine, I don't do gymnastics in my room and it's more than made up for by the public spaces like the large 27th floor terrace. This is now one of my favorite NYC hotels for business travel in mid-price range. If your employer is still willing to pay for stays at places like the Waldorf or the Plaza then go for it, but for value you can't beat the Club Quarters.

the location is very good and the room is very clean.i think it is the best choice for family to go to New York City to go shopping in the center of the New York City. The price is relatively low for other similar hotels at the same period

Stayed here for two nights recently while on business, chose this among the selected offerings for it's good reviews and they are all accurate. Unassuming lobby - doesn't even look like a lobby - but there's always someone there and they were always pleasant and efficient.The rooms are small but it's NYC; everything you could want is right there and the bathroom is small but perfectly appointed. The rooftop garden and business center are terrific. The purified water is another big plus. Didn't try the fitness center so can't comment on that.I would stay here again, certainly.My only comment is that this time I had a rental car and needed to park it, when I finally got to the hotel (traffic of course being thick) I couldn't see a place to pull in, or park. I was told that I needed to go back and park in one of the lots a block away, since it's a one-way street this required more than a few attempts by me to get there.So knowing this would have saved me some hassle. The larger hotels have valets who just whisk your car away and this is what I thought would be the case, but Club Quarters is smaller and doesn't have that. Next time, I will check or just make sure I don't have a car at all.Other than that one minor hiccup, everything was just great.

Was here on business and haven't stayed in a Club Quarters before. Reminds me of many European hotels where the space is very efficiently laid out - but all very smartly done. No major lobby but a nice work space on the 27th floor - including an outdoor covered patio. No room service but some restaurants will deliver and it's already set up to do so. Love the free chilled water - grab your own bottle idea (or use one of theirs). Beds were extremely comfortable and felt more like home than a hotel chain. Overall a great stay for a good price - esp in NYC>

Clean, very good location, price (for New York), equipment is new.Good desk service, friendly and eficiente. Help me gettig transport to airport and storage the lugagge.Can improve if Clubquaters offers the possibility to take breakfast.

Do not eat breakfast in the Davios restaurant recommended by the hotel. It is diabolically poor, does not offer value for money and the staff in there just do not seem to care. The hotel should advise guests to eat breakfast at one of the many super places close by.
One night, good quality/price ratio.Hotel well located. Staff helpful.The room was clean and in line with the website's description.I stayed only one night. Good compromise to be located in Manhttan.

Spent 2 nights at the Club Quarters right across from Grand Central Station, so rate 5 stars for location and access. Give this site another 5 for staff service, and 5 for the amazing top-floor club living room with an outside terrace (clear views to the south to World Trade and north as well), and excellent WiFi. Finally, five for cleanliness, well equipped rooms, space for group meetings on the second floor, and good security. Also, some wonderful restaurants and take out opportunities within a few hundred feet. Wonderful place to stay for business or pleasure!

The hotel was very convenient for public transport. The staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was clean with a modern shower room. The air conditioning was noisy so we turned it off before sleeping. The wifi was fantastic. Would return.

The Club Quarters is a very nice establishment. Very modern, Very clean. Privacy door to separate the sitting area from the bedroom.Amenities: sink,microwave, dishes (4), flat screens (2), separate climate control units in each part of the rm. A added perk....water dispenser (hallway) that has a rack of "new" empty bottles so guest can fill at their leisure (unlimited use). The staff very friendly and accommodating. My room was upgraded to ensure I had a sleeper sofa and the view was amazing (floor to ceiling Windows) in the bedroom w/ a city view (rm 508) ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️1/2Parking is a slight issue, however, to be expected since its NYC and space is limited. The property has an agreement w/ a nearby parking garage "Icon Parking Garage" .....a little difficult to find since u pass several along the way and the name isn't as visible while driving. The garage offers a discount if you are a guest, just have the front desk validate your parking ticket. Lastly, easy access to the subway (next corner /Union Station) and 1 stop on the subway from Time Square. Overall, I am truly pleased and definitely will make a future reservation.

Highly recommend this hotel. Stayed for 1 night only for weekend getaway. Checked in early and they had available room ready. Efficient, professional and courteous front desk staff. Excellent location, convenient to most of what you might want to do in Manhattan. The building is new and everything is functional. Had great view on the surrounding building's roofs and on the avenue downstairs from my room on 20th floor. The views are even more beautiful from the 27th floor lounge area which also has open balcony which was so pleasant to experience. Room itself was on a smaller side, size wise, but thus is to be expected in most of hotels in Manhattan. Everything in room/bathroom was well appointed, clean and functional. Lots of light and great views! The lobby of this hotel is very small and resembles more apartment building entrance rather than hotel lobby ambience but this is compensated by the very nice(although small) top floor lounge area. In summary, I would return to this hotel and recommend it to anyone traveling to NYC, particularly for shorter stays.

The concept is great, strip away the frills, but make the hotel rooms really work for the traveller, business or otherwise. Free wifi is fast, simple and excellent, no snail pace free system then fortunes to upgrade to one that works like so many hotel cons. I took a basic room on a secret price from hotels.com, so that probably explains my location next to air con units on a flat room outside the opaque window on the 4th floor. Silly to give this to anyone on a first visit to any property, because of it I would think twice. We all know about first impressions. I have booked colleagues into these properties before and they have all been happy, which is why I tried one myself ahead of booking 8 room nights in NYC in June. Room is spotlessly clean, lovely bedding, functional, clean bathroom, shaving mirror at usable height for a change, although I do have to move round in the shower to get wet, but that is common in so many other hotels today and I should lose weight anyway. Green rules - and saves money! If they have nicer rooms with transparent windows, I could be persuaded to give all my NY business to this company.
