Beats all the 'economy brands' hands down and no silly 'free breakfast' with stale baked goods and powdered 'scrambled' egg.

I booked the room online and spent two days. I have to say the room is fine and the price is reasonable. Clean, nicely decorated. It is centrally located for someone like me that enjoyed walking. Try this hotel and safe your cash to explore fine restaurants that NYC has to offer.

I stayed 3 nights in a mini queen room. The room was small but clean. The free coffee at the top was good. However, no refrigerator was in the room. Moreover, while leaving the attitude of the person at the reception was not problem solving at all.

The best thing about this hotel is its location, and if you want to be in midtown it's pretty perfect. Our room was nice and had a mini kitchenette which isn't something I have seen often in NYC hotels. It's a nice touch, though with so many amazing eat out options we didn't actually use it as much as planned. The room was pretty quiet for NYC and seemed good value for money. We had some nice views over the streets below.The only possible downside here was that there wasn't really a lobby to speak of, just a hallway to the reception desk and elevators. I didn't mind this at all personally, and can't think of a reason this would be a deal breaker for anyone, but am mentioning it just in case.

We have recently returned home from our stay at the hotel and I have to say it was an excellent stay.We stayed in one of the rooms on floor 9 which had a kitchenette. The room was excellent very clean and had enough space even though it had fridge and a sitting area. We felt this was really nice as it allowed us to store fruit and things in the fridges. The view from the room wasn't excellent however the balcony on floor 27 definitely made up for this. We only ventured up there on the last couple of days and we really wish we had gone up earlier. It is such a peaceful little space with excellent views of Lexington allowing you to watch the world go by. It was also a nice little sun trap late in the day when you just want break.The area is excellent, it is close to Timessquare and Fifth avenue without being too noisy / busy at the hotel (about 5/10 minute walk) to these places. In addition to get to those places slightly further out the subway link is within Grandcentral so you can get about very easily.I think what makes this hotel stand out compared to others is that I really felt the Staff cared about how they make the Guests feel. The staff always asked how you where and if you asked a question they where always willing to help, although only small things it definitely makes you feel more welcome, and I think all of the Staff are a credit to the hotel.When we come back to New York next we will definitely look at booking this hotel again.

If you do not mind the fact that there is no lobby to speak of, and that there are no fancy towels and robes, this place is great. The location is superb, if you need to be in Midtown. The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. The staff is helpful. The highlight is the terrace with overlooks Lexington Avenue in the 27th floor, it is a great place to relax with a coffee. There are also meeting rooms in the second floor. they have obviously tried to keep expenses low and to provide only basic services that business travelers want, without the luxuries. The only downsides: the low floor rooms are noisy because you can hear the street ( it is NYC after all). Te trade off is that those rooms are larger than the upper floors, I suggest that they invest in safes in the room: it is a pain to have to go to the second floor to store your valuables, and that they also provide nicer towels ( the ones on the room are a bit rough). A plus would be if they would offer some breakfast items in the top floor, and some wine during happy hour, as many ohter NY hotels do ( for example, the one at 48 & Lex) . A definite repeat if the price is right at teh time of booking.

This was a jewel tucked away in midtown. I enjoyed staying outside of the tourist hustle bustle while still being able to access by foot whenever I wanted. I would highly recommend it. Great value and great location.

Staff were extremely friendly and even delivered clean wine glasses from the bar up to the room to celebrate our Grandmothers birthday with a bottle of Champagne. Directly across the street from Grand Central Station

Small well appointed room with a great shower and the staff is terrific. I would recommend this boutique hotel to anyone. The location could not be better; close to the IRT 4,5 and 6 and Grand Central Station, the Lexington Avenue, Third Avenue and 42nd Street buses, lots of restaurants,

Excellent location near Chrysler Building, many other sightseeing highlights in walking distance, next subway nearby.Many amenities on the top floor (very good coffee, sometimes snacks and fruits, three Imacs). The smallest reception we've ever seen, but friendly and very helpful staff (special thanks once again to Robert!) Rooms and gym are small, but very clean and well equipped, especially the bathroom.

Ideal location for a central distance to all the main places to visit. Hotel clean and spacious room. Convenient fresh water in the hallway. Shame not to have taken advantage of the services to the 21 floor.

There is a lot of good things about this hotel. The location is good being so close to Grand Central with the food market just down the road. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The only problem we did have was we booked a superior Queen room which was listed with a fully equipped kitchenette but when we got there it only had a fridge,microwave and coffee machine. We were expecting plates and cutlery so we could take full advantage of the many takeouts and the food market. Apart from that one detail we had an excellent visit.

Stayed for four nights over the Easter weekend. We had a small but functional room, lovely and clean, bathroom was very nice, shower wasn't very powerful. Wardrobe space was small but fine. Like other reviews, the fire alarm went off and was left for over half an hour before being told all is ok. Not very professional.Apart from that we would definitely book again as very central to everything. New York was fab.

First time in New York, so spent a fair bit of time researching hotels that met my budget and requirements. This hotel was excellent in terms of location, cleanliness and value for money. The club lounge on the 27th floor was great for printing out our tickets for tourist attractions & shows! The free tea, coffee & refreshments were an added bonus! Lovely friendly staff and quiet bedrooms. A short 15mins walk to Times Square & Broadway. 15-20 mins to Central Park. Did not need to use a taxi once over the 5 days we were there. If returning to New York I would definitely stay here again!

We were with my wife at hotel boutique club quarters it is an excellent and a very clean hotel next to RockFeller center, empire state building, time square and grand central. The staff is very nice and professional, we dealt with Michele she is so kind. You can ask for Yannek, very sympathetic helpfull pleasant gracious and professional lady . I really advice you this hotel.

We stayed for four nights and it was a great location. 10 mins to Time Sq, Empire State, Rockefeller etc. 2 mins from Grand Central station and subway. The "free refreshments and continental breakfast" was just coffee so that was quite poor and a misrepresentation. Pretty disappointing really. The roof top area was nice though.They gym was small but reasonably well equipped for a hotel gym. There was a fire alarm one night and the staff seemed like they didn't know what to do and didn't know how to work the alarm panel. After 30 minutes (at 4am) we were finally told we definitely didn't need to evacuate which was just as well otherwise we'd have been waiting for 30 mins in a burning building being told not to evacuate. Every time they tried to re-set the panel they set off the alarm again.......grrrr! Yes it's good that there's a fire alarm system etc. and it could have been worse but the staff need to know how to work it properly!

We stayed for 4 nights and this was a perfect location to visit the City. Close to every important sight, nice, clean room on the 26th floor, spectacular view! Perfect!!! Would recomend it anyway! Would come back again!

I love the bottled water fountain outside of the rooms. Great views and wonderful lounge, observation deck on the 27th floor. The staff is pleasant and the rooms are clean (albeit a little small, but not at all uncomfortable) and well kept. I have a wonderful stay, each time I visit this hotel!

Hotel was spotless and the staff were all very friendly. Room cleaned daily and bed was really comfy. We upgraded our room which had a separate living area and two TV'S. Not that we watched much TV as we were out and about all day. The location was ideal it was close to Grand Central and a short walk to 5th Avenue. I would definitely go back. Stevie and Kat

I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. It is perfectly located for trains anywhere in the city, whether from Grand Central or via the shuttle to Times Square. It’s probably fair to say that it is better suited for the business traveller who is only in the city for a few days – the rooms are small and don’t have a great deal of closet space, but as a solo traveller that wasn’t an issue for me. There is no safe in the room, though a luggage lock works just as well. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and coffee in the rooms – a rarity in NYC, I believe. Each floor has access to chilled purified water (which was a Godsend with the early spring heat during my stay and the late nights returning from the bars) and there is a great lounge area on the 27th floor with free coffee, snacks and wireless printing, as well as a great terrace looking onto the Chrysler Building. It took me a few days to notice that my room on the 26th floor had the exact same view! I have no doubt in my mind that this hotel will be at the top of my list for my next trip to New York City.

It has all the essentials - and it has a nice area at the top to look out over the city. That is why I initially booked this hotel. and the view is good. As for the room itself. Average. Perfectly fine. No real issues. The lobby is non-existent - pretty odd, really. on the whole, It's non-pretentious. You won't be bothered by doormen grabbing your 5 pound bag you don't need help with. Comfortable bed. No real bells or whistles. It's near whatever you need.

Excellent stay here for NYE 2015 with my partner. Very clean hotel, very close to the centre and walking distance to Times Square, grand central terminal and Central Park! Will return to this hotel. Staff friendly and great prices could not fault anything.

We stayed at Club Quarters Grand Central for a short city break. Arriving from JFK, we took the Air Train to Jamaica and then the E line subway to Lexington 53rd St. The hotel is then a 10min walk from there. Grand Central Station is just a stone’s throw away. Other central attractions (Times Square/Central Park) are easily walkable. Grand Central Station is ideal for trains Downtown. This made the hotel a perfect location for us to visit all the major sights.The hotel has a small lobby and rapid elevators up to the 27 floors! We were up on the 23rd floor, with great views of Lexington Avenue down below. Being high up meant we didn't hear much traffic noise. Our room was very clean, had a comfy bed and decent shower. The hotel Wi-Fi was very good, easy to connect to and a good speed. Free drinking water was available from each floor and the 27th floor lounge. The 27th floor terrace and lounge were great for spending some time out of the room for a drink and a game of cards. The hotel had a luggage room and looked after our cases on our day of departure, which was appreciated. Highly recommended this hotel!

I loved it. It was clean, located in a great location, 24 hour access with card, safe, secure, friendly employees and our room was ready at 12:30pm. AWESOME! Would definitely come again! I loved it here!

We arrived an hour or more before check in time and were graciously offered a room right away. It was very clean, had all the amenities we were looking for and the bathroom was stylish and bright. Loved having access to the Club level for complimentary coffee and the lounge with free printing. Staff were efficient and friendly at check in and departure and helpful when we asked about dinner options near by. Convenient for access to Times Square, Rockefeller Ctr, MoMA etc. I would recommend & return ourselves!

Rooms are small but, then again, so is the price compared to other Manhattan accommodations. The HVAC unit is a little loud, especially considering that the compact nature of the room puts it pretty close to the bed. Having a mini-fridge in the room would be a great convenience too. Not to be missed is the 27th floor 'living room' and it's attached balcony – an amenity worth it's weight in gold. The bathroom was also quite satisfactory.

I spent a night at the Club Quarters Hotel at Grand Central for business. The check in desk is very inconspicuous and one can mistake it for a security station. Anyway, the check in and check out process was very fast and the staff was polite. The room was exactly as expected, it was clean and tidy. I was on the 20th floor and it was very quiet even though I overlooked Lexington ave. the filtered water on the floor was very convenient plus there are refillable bottles available. The room is equipped with a big TV which unfortunately I did not get a chance to enjoy. There is also a Keurig coffee machine for your personal use. The hotel is also at a very convenient location. It is a block away from the subway (7,4,5,6). There is a 24/7 Duane Reade two blocks down (Lex & 47st) and a 24/7 Deli that serves a variety of tasty hot food (Ashley Fine Food @ Lex & 48st).

Excellent hotel, with lots of nice extra touches, as described by other reviewers. We were on floor 23 and it was quiet. The bed was like a cloud that enveloped our tourist weary bodies. I would highly recommend and would definitely stay again. Thank you to all the efficient friendly staff at Club Quarters.

I regularly stay here while traveling for business. There is no flashy lobby. It's small and efficient. The rooms are small but clean, comfortable and reasonably priced. Perfect for when you are simply looking for a clean bed because you'll be out of the room all day. There is a business lounge where you can gather with others and enjoy a beverage. There is also a small fitness center. Bathrooms are clean with plenty of hot water. Also love the water coolers in the hall. It's a great amenity. Ironing boards and extra coffee can be found in the hall service closet.

First let me begin by saying don't expect a big reception desk. But don't let this deter you. The room was exactly what's in the photos. It was quite nice. Room and bathroom were spacious considering you're in NYC. Bed looked comfortable until we laid down. If you love to be envelope by your mattress then this is your hotel. If you like firm mattress and pillow look elsewhere. We were unable to sleep due to the mattress being so soft. Luckily, we only stayed here for one night. But the location was ideal. Only a block from Grand Central station. That's a great base for roaming the city.

I recently stayed here for 4 nights on business. Small comfortable room at very good rates. Try to get room nearer top floors as quieter and great views of City. Perfect location for mid town and Grand Central station. Loads of delis and bars, restaurants nearby. Good clean place but nothing fancy. Reception a little drab but do not let this pout you off. If I was with my wife I would have good for height cost accomadation but perfect from short business trip

Small boutique style hotel with chain benefits. Quiet, exceptionally clean and convenient Manhattan location. Room was smaller but well laid out with all the essentials. Same true of bathroom. Bed was very comfortable. Club Living Room on the top floor was a nice gathering place with 24 hour coffee/espresso available. The filtered cold water stations with refillable bottles throughout the hotel and individual Keurig Brewers in each room we're very convenient. The temperature control in the room was a bit inconsistent. The hotel is connected to Davio's restaurant which has a bar. Otherwise no restaurant or bar in the hotel, but with so many in a short walk it doesn't matter.

great staff great location very comfortable beds loved the free wifi and water bottles you fill at ur need mins from everything location location location wonderful views and super cute restaurant down stairs :)

I have stayed here for most of my trips to NYC for business. Are the rooms very small? Yes. Are they clean and comfy? Yes. They have a fantastic Italian restaurant in the lower lobby and they have a rooftop space that has a great view of Grand Central and a nice area to relax. Depending on what floor you are on, it can be noisy at night when trying to sleep. So if you are not used to NYC noise, ask for a room on a higher floor.

To refer to Club Quarters as a hotel would be an insult. This is truly a home away from home. This is because every member of their staff is a true professional who go beyond a mere level of satisfaction when providing exceptional service to the customer. Michelle is just one example of such an individual and the manner in which she handled one of my requests. In addition to the clean and comfortable rooms, you will thoroughly enjoy their living room on the top floor overlooking Manhattan. You can elect to view a wide screen television program or work at their computer (three available), or read a fresh edition of the Wall Street Journal or New York Times, or enjoy refreshments....all on the house. Yes, this "house" is my home away from home when I am in New York City every January!

The hotel is terrific, very European in the thoughtful design and fittings of the room. Service was impeccable, in spite of the great blizzard we encountered that weekend in New York. The restaurant in the lower level even opened up with a skeleton crew (thanks Marco, et al!!) to serve us 'stranded' travelers. Canceled train reservations? No problem: we were able to use the 27th floor lounge to work all day, after checkout. We will definitely look for Club Quarters (and this additional brand - Grand Boutique) on future travels. Thanks!

This place is absolutely amazing, especially for the price! When I first arrived, I entered through Lexington Ave which is not the main entrance (it's around the corner on E 45th St.) and was certainly confusing since this entrance brings you to the second floor. Long story short, I was given a free upgrade for my troubles - from a basic room to a suite! The customer service is amazing and the rooms are clean!! This is coming from someone who is crazy about being clean and neat so even though this isn't a Hilton or Sheraton, you can feel at ease when making reservations here. Also, parking is on E. 45th St (just a few blocks down) and since you are a guest at the hotel the rate drops to $28/24 hr!!! The average rate is $60/24hr! HUGE savings! Thing is, to keep the rate at $28 you can't take your car out and check it back in. BUT, no big deal since Grand Central is around the corner! In addition, the filtered water is also a plus as well as the Keurig coffee machine that is in your room. I didn't get a chance to check out the gym or the views from the top floor, but I'm sure those are great as well! I'd certainly come back!

There is not one thing wrong with this hotel.Our room was fabulous with a coffee maker,microwave and fridge. The bathroom was spotless. Seriously spotless and cleaned well everyday.The 27th floor room is just astonishing. really well laid out and with coffee snacks fruit and newspapers throughout the day. Sensational views too.Free Wi Fi and wonderful hubs in the wall for charging phones. No crawling around trying to find a spare socket . Every thing had been well thought out. Water stations and bottles on each floor.We were on the 12th floor and apart from hearing the odd garbage truck early in the morning we experienced no noise at all.The staff were there if you needed them and unfailingly polite and helpful.We would unhesitatingly recommend this place to anyone staying in New York. We were really sad to leave.

Let me just say that this hotel was incredible :) I booked it off Hotwire and was not sure what to expect as I've never heard of the hotel. Based on pics hotel seemed nice, however I have been to some hotels were the pics can we deceiving thus was a little weary. Upon arrival we were incredibly impressed! Hotel was perfect location ! So many good little restaurants near by! The hotel size was perfect with nice hot showers. The TV was huge and the bed comfy! they also have free water which was nice! We had such a fun little get away for the weekend and would recommend this hotel to anyone! We enjoyed drinking some champagne on the 27th floor before we went out for the night. Deff a great place!!!!

I chose this hotel based on location , reviews and price. It was almost a last minute deal and I was not disappointed. The hotel is small but very well located for those who are looking for easy access to NY attractions and transportation. Very clean, polite stuff, no concerns about anything. It is close to to Central Park, Time Square and Broadway. Indeed I walk to several places and enjoyed my stay. There are restaurants nearby and very easy access to subway at the Grand Central.

My experience here was great, totally recommend it. Good location, good service, rooms and beds are comfortable and very good free wifi. They have a floor with free coffee and other things, this same floor has desks for any meeting and small lounge areas. The only thing I didn't like was that the bathroom door has frosted glass so there's not much privacy when you are in the bathroom and that the room didn't have a small fridge. Didn't have breakfast, actually didn't even ask if it was available.

We went to city for Kentucky basketball game and to see the city for the holidays. Hotel was centrally located and the staff were all friendly and accommodating. The rooms were spotless! The water stations in the hallways were very cool. Ive never seen that before. The manager Robert gave us a wonderful dinner suggestion and even hailed cabs for us when we left. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!! It was perfect! if you go ask for Robert and tell him The Kentucky Wildcat fans sent you. #blue nation

I got a great rate on HotWire and found this to be a clean, reliable hotel, with helpful staff and with a great Grand Central Station location. Easy to walk to Time Square (14 mins) and other popular spots. The complimentary water and snacks are a nice touch.

The combination Hotel Boutique Grand Central / Club Quarters at 45th and Lexington is my first choice for stays in Midtown Manhattan. The rooms are fresh, modern and very well-sized for the city, the 27th floor lounge has outstanding workspace and views - and the location - right across the street from Grand Central Terminal - is unparalleled.

We really enjoyed this hotel. We started in a standard room and then moved to a suite because we were there for a week. The suite has a larger than normal mini fridge, a stove top, convection microwave, and pots/pans/utensils. Free water is available on each floor. Rooms are decent size for NYC standards but clean and we'll done. More hooks would be nice in all rooms but that's my complaint for most any hotel. There is a streaming device so can view phone/tablet content on tvs. Hot water is quick and plentiful. The 27th floor houses the lounge and outdoor terrace with views of Grand Central, Chrysler, and Empire State. Free coffee selections and, during the week, snacks.Free wifi. Free gym - limited but ok. Elevators quick. Great location. Far enough from the crazy of Times Sq but easy to get most anywhere. Highly recommend.

I really like staying at Club Quarters because it is like being at home. The rooms are small but extremely clean and comfortable. The hotel affords views of the city that are hard to find in other hotels. The 27th floor has an outdoor veranda and a living room with a latte machine which is complementary, computers and printers, large screen TV, as well as healthy snacks and drinks. The location atop Grand Central makes it easy to get to all parts. There is a complementary washer and dryer as well as a fitness center. The staff is very helpful and accommodating. I would give it four stars minimum.

Room was clean and good sized,the water stations on each floor was very convenient. The lobby is simple, but they make up for it with the nice business center on the 27th floor. It has a great background of the Chrysler building, and is big enough for multiple groups. The free water, coffee and snacks are a plus.

The room was clean and comfortable. While not large, the rooms are big enough to be comfortable. In addition to a queen size bed, it had a small sitting area with a table. Bathroom was big for NYC and very clean. Service was excellent. I was on the 7th floor and it was a little noisy - typical for midtown. I would recommend a room higher up to avoid the street noise. The hotel is located two blocks from Grand Central with easy access to the subway. Free Wi-fi that actually works in your room . There is a deli right across the street that is open until midnight. Overall a decent hotel at a good location.

The stay at Club Quarters Hotel, Grand Central was fine. Typical New York hotel with small rooms and no lobby. We had a horrifying experience there and won't be staying at Club Quarters again. Someone used a key card to walk right into our room at 2 a.m. My husband and I screamed and the person left. I called down to the front desk freaked out to tell them and the guy who answered the phone said "oh he must have misheard the room number" and that was it. No "sorry" or explanation. The staff either gave someone access to our room or walked in for no reason at 2 a.m. while we were sleeping. The front desk seemed to know someone was coming in and wasn't phased. It deserved an apology and we didn't get one. I was shaken and couldn't sleep for the rest of the morning. Needless to say we won't be staying here or at this brand again.

Great hotel, in a great location. We had a queen room, good size, comfy bed, sofa/seating area. Tea & coffee machine, hair dryer, iron & ironing board. iPod dock. Free unlimited water from machine outside room door, free coffees from machine on top floor lounge area. Rooms were very clean, nicely and newly decorated. Hotel staff friendly and helpful. Great location, just across the road from Grand Central so ideally situated. Would definitely return again and recommend if you just want someone nice and simple to stay.

I booked this hotel in lieu of Waldorf Astoria. They were in a similar price range but club quarters was 10$/night cheaper so I chose it. Big mistake. I booked a room for three adults. Called in advance. They told me I was going to have two fulls. I arrival I found a full and a tiny chair that turned into a tiny bed. I'm 6'2, and paid 456$ for 2 nights....asked the receptionist to help me out. Eventually after insisting offers me to move to a larger room w roll out bed. I accept. We Repack and move rooms. On arrival to the new room, the maintainace guy tells me that he can't bring the roll out bed - also, quite rudely. I go down again. Eventually the receptionist agrees to send me the roll out bed. The roll out bed turns out to be even worse. 1) it's not even made, 2) it's for an 8-year old boy. What to do? For starters never come back to this place. Shame on them and on their service.

Perfection: location, staff, room: beautifully appointed, comfortable, efficient. Davio's Italian Restaurant on the lower level is 5-star food and service. Highly recommend - we will stary there again.

From the moment we arrived the men and women at the club quarters hotel couldn't do enough for us. John at the reception greeted us and told us if we needed anything he's be there for the duration of our stay. The room was nice and clean, while a little dated in terms of colours the rest was up to date with modern bath room, big TV with ways to connect any device you liked to it. The bed was "beautiful" as my partner put it, there were lots plug sockets that also included usb ports for charging and two wired network ports. The wifi was free and fast throughout the hotel including the fantastic terrace which had free coffees, tea, soda and snacks. Only problem was that it was a little noise from the traffic but hay what do you expect from the city that never sleeps.All in all awesome stay would definitely stay again.

I am a fan of Club Quarters and have stayed at most of their US properties and London as well. There is a lot to like about this hotel, but when it came to sleep quality it fell down flat.First, here's what's good. The location is terrific. Close to Grand Central and the Lexington Avenue subway line. Lots of restaurants of all categories nearby. Across the street from a late night deli so snacks and drinks are readily available. The 27th floor lounge is very comfortable - a great place to get work done or read the paper. The staff is friendly.However, I was in a room facing Lex Ave. on the 7th floor. While the room itself was as nice as any CQ room I have stayed in, it was impossible to sleep due to the street noise from Lexington Avenue. Cab horns, trucks going in and ot of the post office across the street and thin glass windows make the room super noisy all night long.They need to better insulate the windows and add thick curtains to absorb at least some of this noise. It doesn't have to be this way. I've stayed in other hotels nearby on Lexington Avenue and slept just fine.I don't know if this problem can be fixed and its a shame because otherwise this is a great property. But sleeping is the whole point of a hotel and if they can't get that right, forget about the rest.

Hotel is located in a rather convenient part of Manhattan. Rooms are clean and well equipped. Very nice balcony on the 27th floor where you may have free coffee and feel the pulse of the city. Lower level rooms are a bit noisy as they are receiving noise by the huge air-conditioning devices of the near by buildings.Price of the room a bit higher than average.

We stayed here last month for 14 nights and I was delighted with it. we were on the 6th floor and we had a little suite, which contained an L shaped banquet with table. there was a microwave and a fridge which was very useful. the bed and pillows were very comfortable and extremely clean. The bathroom was spotless with excellent toiletries and lovely white towels. The lifts were very quick. Through the week there are complimentary snacks and fruit on the 27th floor lounge On the 3rd floor there is a guest laundry. 2 large washer / dryers they even supply the detergent. The location is fantastic. Staff are very helpful and friendly. People moaned about not having a concierge, personally didn't bother me. We are very capable of arranging our own things plus if you need to find out anything the staff were there to assist. the hotel is very much aimed at the business traveller although we were on vacation and if ever I returned to New York I would absolutely stay here again.

Just returned from 5 night break here. Room comfortable but small. Lifts very slow to arrive. Excellent location.Main complaint is that the advertised 'refreshments' just aren't provided. Coffee was available but snacks/cold drinks were filled once on Monday and empty for remaining five days. Other reviewers have also commented on this so it wasn't a 'one off'As mentioned by another reviewer they just don't answer emails which is unacceptable so probably ok unless you have a query or problem but doesn't offer good enough value to put up with shortfalls in service when there are so many other options.

Visited with group of friends. Convenient central location and small but perfectly adequate rooms are good value.Hotel has a small gym but it was generally empty so not a problem if you want a treadmill. Only a couple of km to Central Park though so that's a better option for a bit of exercise.No restaurant in hotel but food delivered from nearby, but being central NY there are endless choices a few minutes away.Only problem we had was with delivery of a couple of order from Amazon - although they had been delivered and signed for by the hotel staff, they didn't pass them to us until requested and even then failed to hand one over. Following chasing the hotel then returned the package as undeliverable - a month after accepting it - rather than pass it on to me. Since then Club Quarters have failed to respond to my emails.In summary, a good hotel if you don't need any real customer service, otherwise both head office and local service unsatisfactory.

Great location, modern and clean boutique hotel in Manhattan. Friendly staff. Many amenities. Room was a little small but the bed was comfortable. With the great city, all I needed was a clean room and comfortable bed. I would stay here again.

I am Sreedhar from India. I stayed in this Hotel in the room 1213 for 20 days while I was in a business visit to Newyork. The service is really good. Small but beautiful rooms. The 27th floor gives you a nice glimpse of the tall skyscrapers of Manhattan. The crysler building is too near.The staff in the reception are really nice and helpful. Two names I can recall is Robert and Michelle.These two people make sure that you feel great once you are inside the Hotel.In short, a really great place to stay

27 Floor Hotel on the corner of Lexington and East 45 St in midtown Manhattan. Grand Central Station is a short walk with access to subway and rail. Rooms can be on the small side but are well furnished and modern with bed, table, settee, flat screen TVs and a modern bathroom with shower. Though aimed at Business Travellers I had 5 nights here and found it to be very good and excellent value. There is free wifi throughout and bottled purified water available (free) on each floor. The 27th floor living room has a terrace area (great view) coffee and a business area. My room was very quiet apart from the expected NYC street noise. Good choice hotel

Just returned from New York after a four day visit for my 50th birthday. We were on the 23rd floor and the room was compact but had everything we needed. This hotel is ideally situated to walk to 5th Ave, Time Square etc and is just round the corner from Grand Central. I agree with previous posts that the reception does not do justice to the rest of the hotel but the friendly and knowledgeable reception staff certainly make up for it. Shout out to Robert who always welcomed us with a smile and gave us some great tips for local bars and restaurants as well as directions and advice.We bought a two day ticket for the big bus company to get around which worked really well. Tip - they never check tickets and we got on for a third day without being asked for tickets. Wonderful views from the top deck but wrap up warm cos it's freezing this time of year!.Would definitely recommend this hotel to use as a base for your trip and the wifi is free and really fast. Handy coffee lounge on top floor with Mac PCs and a printer to do your online check in.

My husband and I spent four days at this hotel--a combination trip of business and entertainment. The lobby is off-putting since it sports only a reception desk and a single bench. Our room--a standard on the 4th floor--was small, no view at all. Those are the total list of negatives. Everything else was great. The staff is friendly and helpful. The entire hotel is impeccably clean. Our room was quiet. There is a spacious and well-appointed 27th floor lounge with fireplace and a terrace with a view. Coffee us complimentary and very good. The hotel is well-located. Grand Central terminal is just around the corner with its Xmas boutiques and tempting gourmet market. Plan on staying at the Club Quarters next year.

I stayed here for two nights on a business trip with my wife tagging along. The room was not big but had everything we needed, including a well-arranged couch & desk/table and lots of well-placed electrical outlets to charge electronics. The location, right next to Grand Central, is excellent. The lounge & balcony on the 27th floor were a comfortable & quiet place to relax. One odd thing is that there was no chain lock on the door (despite the fact that New York law, which was posted on the door, seems to require such a lock).

Customer Service was pleasant, simple, friendly. Room was clean, quiet and spacious enough. Is great for someone who is going to NYC for business or who is "traveling"... Not necessarily a relaxing spa vacation. We had a bad view but we spent our time sleeping in our hotel and that was it so I didn't care. My view was office buildings 50 yards away. Kind of alley view. Location was out of the way enough you didn't have Time Square tourists being annoying outside your hotel but still close to everything you need. We are walkers and enjoyed walking everywhere. Our first 2 days we clocked 25,000 steps (roughly 12 miles on foot with some metro). Day 3 we did 45,500 steps (roughly 20 miles on foot). We did Bryant Park, the entire Central Park Loop, the giant church 3 ish blocks away from Central Park in Harlem, 5th Avenue shops, Greenwich Village, One World Center, Empire State Building, Flatiron building, The Met, Grand Central Station, Times Sq, St. Patrick's Cathedral, Cathedral of St John the Devine. Anyway we did this from Fri afternoon to Sunday evening. My point is, it's a great location. The only thing we metro' to was One World Center and Greenwich then back uptown. Free wifi and bottled water. Great balcony view on the 27th floor. Only tiny tiny downside. When you shower the room steams up very quickly and starts to smell damp. We tried to crack our window to let fresh air in and the humidity out but the window opening situation isn't really easy to do. I would stay here again.

I arrived here for a 4 night stay and every night was great there was a little noise from 4th floor at night but I still slept very well its location is 15 mins walk to times sq and 3 mins to grand central station wifi is very fast and there is a lounge on 27th floor where tea coffee fruit are available though out the day I will recommend this place to others and I would stay here again soon hope to see you soon Kind regards Matthew

The room was clean and reasonably quiet, given the midtown location. The staff was friendly. Elevators arrived promptly. Location is great. Compared to comparable hotels in the area, the price was quite good.

My visit last week was my second visit in 9 months. My room was on the 15th floor - very little street noise on Lexington Avenue, clean and spacious for Manhatten. This is not a luxury hotel, but the amenities are awesome. The room was modern and well appointed with a nice sitting/work space. The bathroom was modern and clean with good water pressure, nice towels and quality toiletries. The hotel has a beautiful indoor and outdoor space on the 27th floor with comfortable places to entertain, work on their McIntosh desktop computers, or enjoy the view of Grand Central Station and Lexington Avenue. According to staff they have food in this area during the week. The gym/fitness room is small, but has quality cardio and weight equipment. If you need a larger fitness facility ask for a day pass to the NewYork Sports Club next door. The location of Club Central is across the street from Grand Central Terminal (train travel). There are several excellent restaurants within a couple of city blocks and lots of small quick/counter top eateries. Check out 3rd or 2nd Ave for a large variety of places to eat. Across the street in Grand Central Station there is a large food court with several of NYC's famous walk-up eateries represented. There is a Starbucks across the street. Take a short walk to almost anywhere in mid-town, catch the subway 3 blocks up or there are thousands of taxis cruising down Lexington Blvd. Parking is two blocks from the hotel and runs about $45/day. My first visit to this hotel in February 2015 was a disaster. There was a very rowdy party going on right outside my door well into the early morning hours. I do not recommend staying in the handicapped accessible room if you can help it. The room is a decent size, but the location on the second floor next to the lobby and elevator make for a very noisy visit.We met several airline employees, businessmen/women and several couples. I am not sure this is a good hotel for children, but I will definitely be back on my next visit to NYC.

Do not agree to room 412. It is just above the flag poll, and the flag metal hook keeps banging the metal poll and those clicks are really loud and disturbing. I did not have 1 minute of sleep the entire night.What an hotel room is good for if you cannot fall asleep?Upon checkout the receptionist did not bother asking me how was my stay.Also their website says you can use the club room which has refreshments , apparently it is only has refreshments on weekdays but you cannot know about it until you arrive. I paid 190$ before tax and did not get any value for my money.Except the above the room was very clean and the hotel is pretty new and nice. If not the noise issue (which indicates really bad service) I would given it 5.

I stayed here for 4 nights in October 2015 for business purposes. Super efficient check-in. Room with good working space and free and fast WiFi. There is a lounge on the 27th floor plus terrace where you can have your own food and drinks. The hotel has no restaurant but it takes only steps to find a place for breakfast or dinner. Coffee machine in the room, but Starbucks next door. It is a comfortable business hotel close to subway station Grand Central. The hotel is a good base for midtown and lower Manhattan.

Comfortable, well-appointed rooms in a very convenient location.Nice public area on an upper floor with computers and a printer, TV and hot coffee.Excellent service and top price/quality ratio.This is our new home away from home in NYC.

This is not just a hotel, it's an experience! Although the rooms are small, it makes little difference. It is visually luxurious because of a roomy 27th floor lounge (both indoors and outdoors) where you can see Manhattan buildings lit up at night. On early morning the lounge has breakfast treats (granola bars, fruit, newspapers). All day and all night free espresso, latte, cappuccino, and tea are available as well as computers, wifi, and printing. The halls have thoughtful touches - a guest closet for extra pillow and blankets, water bottles and water. Downstairs staff very considerate and helpful.

A small, well run, well maintained hotel near my company's office and next store to Grand Central and an easy walk to many of the sights in mid-town Manhattan. The rooms are small but well designed. There's a small table with a L-shaped coach in the corner and a microwave and mini-fridge tucked in a cubby hole by the door. The closet and bathroom are compact and but again well-designed and very functional. The bed is comfortable and works great for one! (Haven't yet stayed here with my wife and it might be a little tight for the two of us!) And the feature that makes it special is the "living room" and roof top terrace on the 27th floor. Free snacks and coffee and a priceless view of Manhattan!

This hotel is a model of efficiency. There is very little furniture in the lobby (no lounging!), there's just one staff member working the desk at a time, there is a self-check out kiosk, and the room is configured to allow a full-sized desk. Clearly the hotel is designed for the business traveler who needs to hang up some clothes and find a place to sleep. No frills here.Which works out well when you realize you're in NYC. You don't want to be in the hotel room anyway! I found the elevators to be prompt, the common areas were clean, and the staff is friendly. Davios is the in-house restaurant, and breakfast can be a little slow if you order from the kitchen. The rest is perfectly fine.Two things that I thought were odd about the hotel: (1) there's no luggage caddy, so there's nowhere to open your suitcase, and (2) there's no safe. I would prefer both, but you'll have to make do without them. There's a stall shower in the bathroom instead of the usual tub and I thought I'd splash water everywhere, but it worked out well. No puddles, and the tiling is clearly new. I didn't have a standard outlet by the bed, which I thought a business-focused hotel would offer. There's a USB outlet by the bed and a standard outlet at the desk, so if you use your phone as your alarm clock, be warned.

V simple but functional and efficient layout of room w air con control and tissue box within bed's reach. V smart and efficient design of bedside tables on both sides. Room big enough to open our huge luggage. Water dispenser w bottles for self service at lift lobby on 3rd floor. Only bad thing was that most rooms weren't ready for check in at 2pm, so we only had the 3rd floor room which was more noisy (office, gym, laundry room on 3rd floor). Laundry room looks to be free, with laundry detergent provided. Great location too.

Perfect spot to explore NYC. Minutes walk from grand central, times square, Central Park.Room is ok. Clean.The snacks were always out in the club room and nobody could figure out the coffee maker.Small issues and the location and cleanliness more than made up for it. Would stay here again when visiting Manhattan.

The hotel's staff is so accommodating and very personable! Our room was super clean and everything looked fresh and new. We also found the rooftop patio and enjoyed the beautiful weather! Robert, the front desk staff person , actually remembered us from our previous trip almost a year before!

Yes I love the hotel itself BUT If you book on their website it gives you the nonrefundable rate, which cannot be changed! And they don't tell you until it is confirmed!!! It is charged up front. If you scroll to the very bottom of their page you might find the refundable rate, but I think it is pretty hidden. You should probably book through Expedia or another website in order not to get caught like this. The cost is exactly the same. I called as soon as I booked it and they would not change it. I think that is smarmy.

The reputation was tiny rooms but a nice surprise. Very modern, all the new, comfy bed, good access for laptops and phone charging. Barhroom was small for all my cosmetics but very clean. Nice touch with the refillable water stations. Good access to Grand Central.

Great efficient rooms with kitchenettes. Made for the business Traveler. Secret rooftop access and lounge too. Light on service staff but that's to be expected. No concierge service. Plan ahead and you won't need it!

Stayed here for 6 nights early September 2015. Booked through Bookings.com after some research, price was very good compared to similar hotels in the general location. Next to Grand Central Terminal, easy to find, quick check-in. Thought the standard room was a good size, not as small as described in other reviews, Queen bed, single chair with tray height table, with a small computer station with a small roll away ottoman. adequate sized wardrobe with closest rod and a couple of drawers. The washroom had a shower, no tub, very clean. My only wish is that they would have an in-room safe instead of deposit boxes. The floor had a guest amenity closet with irons and ironing boards, extra pillows, extra soap, coffee pods, sewing kits, shower caps. The 3rd floor had the ice machine and 2 laundry wash/dry machines, with soap, free for guest use. Each floor had the water dispensing machines and empty bottles to fill. Loved the guest lounge on the 27th floor, work days they have fresh fruit, Granola bars, pop for guests. There are 3 Mac computers with 1 network printer to use, and there is a coffee machine that also did Lattes and Capucinos 24/7. The bonus is the terrace with tables and chairs with the fantastic city view, great place to have a drink to wind down, or watch the city go to work while having a coffee. What annoyed me had nothing to do with the hotel, but with guests taking advantage of the hotel, people leaving all their garbage around the guest lounge, grabbing more than their share of the food, not returning the irons to the closet for others to use, taking the newspapers out of the lounge to their rooms. My only beef with the hotel is that on the long weekend, one of the elevators was out of service the whole time, and at times, only one elevator was available for guests, while the other was being used by staff for cleaning carts etc, had a few long waits, hopefully this doesn't occur all the time. The staff in the hotel were all friendly, quick to respond on a couple of requests. The location was great, took the subway everywhere, convenient to GCT, restaurants everywhere if you want to stay close. Walked the area at night, felt safe, no issues. I highly recommend this hotel, you won't regret this gem.

I stayed at the Club Quarters for two nights; its location in midtown east side is perfect. Clean rooms, all guests Amelie's and accessories are available in each floor, free WiFi all around, free all day open lounge on the 27th floor, with all day coffee and snacks. Second floor lounge and meeting place, simply practical and the for the right price.

The perfect place for a business trip to New York. Great location in Midtown, steps from Grand Central. Very well priced. Don't expect a fancy lobby or a concierge. Just a good, clean and spacious room for a great price. Probably not the New York experience you would want for a holdiay but definitely just what you need when travelling on your company's budget. A good indication of the price/quality ratio is that most of the guests that I bumped to in my visit were airline crew members.

Very convenient location across from Grand Central Station, this clean, quiet, straightforward hotel offers good space, clean first-class accommodations in a great location. As true of club quarters spaces, it is not a full service hotel but really concentrates on providing quality accommodations for experienced travelers. Water bottles available outside of every elevator, a large lounge on the 27th floor overlooking Manhattan, free Wi-Fi, newspapers and other periodicals and beverages and snacks, makes it a great place in the center of Midtown.

Before we checked into Club Quarters we noticed an amount that was overcharged after booking with booking.com. After a few calls with booking.com and speaking with Club Quarters directly upon arrival we were able to straighten out the situation. The very gracious people at Club Quarters gave us a room upgrade to the 21st floor and breakfast for our weeklong stay in their great hotel restaurant, Davio's. We are already looking forward to our next stay in NYC and wouldn't hesitate to book with Club Quarters again!

I have previously stayed at the Club Quarters opposite Rockefeller Center, so I am familiar with the brand. When booking this trip, I saw there was a great deal for the Grand Central location, so I booked it for our long weekend trip! The location is great! Easy to find and just a few blocks from the subway, with tons of restaurants near by. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful, which can be hit or miss in this city. We were checked in an hour early and given room 2404 on the 24th floor. We had a perfect view down 45th street and Grand Central. Our room was a good size and very clean. There was even a mini fridge, microwave and a Keurig in our room which was great! The only issue I had was the AC kicking on and off throughout the night. We werent sure how to adjust it.The terrace was probably our favorite part of the hotel. It is open 24 hours and has plenty of seating with great views! My boyfriend works 3rd shift so he has trouble sleeping during "regular" hours. The terrace was perfect for the nights he couldnt sleep. We were told there were refreshments and snacks up there as well, but they were only available the last morning of our trip. The espresso machine was a great addition, but it would have been nice to grab something other than a hot drink.Overall, we had a wonderful experience here. I look forward to returning and will recommend this hotel to everyone!

I had a quick trip to New York and found a last minute $150 per night rate here. The standard room is nice, modern, and comfortable. The layout was perfect, however no bath, and no full length mirror in the room. I could see the Chrysler building from my room on the 26th floor. The top of the windows do open, if you want a little air or noise. The inside/outside lounge area on the 27th floor was a great place to just hang out, or do some work. Front desk could be a bit more friendly.

Excellent stay here for a couple of nights. The room was relatively spacious and comfy, if a little loud from outside. Great location!Once your settled all the ClubQuarters amenities are excellent - wifi, tea and coffee, water etc and fantastic lounge on top floor with roof-top area. Great area to chill or crack on with some extra work!

We were really happy with our stay here. After a small snafu (got sent to a dirty room: full disclosure, it was 1pm so we were thrilled to even be given a room that early) we were placed in a larger room on a higher floor that was perfect. It was clean, had a nice layout and was functional. Parking was fairly priced at $28 at a nearby garage (drop your bags at the hotel, then park! It is 1.5 blocks away) and the neighborhood is close to Times Square, Broadway, Grand Central Stn and more. We felt safe, even at night, and the area made me think New York may even be cleaner than I thought! With various discounts we paid $220 mid-week for one night, and based on my research it was well spent.

The location of the hotel is excellent, very convenient for walking or taking local transport. We got a very good deal, but of course the room and the bed were rather small, though clean. If you want to be more comfortable, then maybe you can upgrade and spend a little more. Around the hotel you can find all sorts of bars and restaurants. Plus: traffic noise is not so bad, we slept comfortably.

My son and I stayed here for 4 nights. The location was awesome as it was near many spots that we visited. The room was spacious with a nice work area and many plugs for electronics. The bed was clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and well lit. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable. The only problem we had was our room cards (which was also needed to get to our room using the elevators) did not work a lot of the time. The hotel also had a lovely deck which was perfect for bringing back food and eating under the stars. They also have computers with a printer for printing out boarding passes which was very handy.

Female staff offer better service and respond to requests and information. Male staff at front desk are snappy and not impolite. Computers are not high speed and it is hard to get assistance at the business center.

This is the newest of the CQ hotels in New York and it has become my "go-to" place for business when I am in NYC. My employer is a member of CQ so we are encouraged to stay there. Like other CQ properties the rooms are tiny and not where I would want to stay if I were not by myself -- would be claustropobic for even two people in a room. But for pure functionality it is like the other CQ properties, which is fine for business trips where you use the room for sleeping and little else. The location is great since it is very close to Grand Central Station and the various subway lines. The common room on the penthouse floor is very nice and even has outdoor areas for meetings in nice weather. The only negative is that unlike the Midtown or Rock Center locations there is no in-house dining option. There are tons of places to get breakfast nearby but sometimes it is nice to not have to leave the hotel in search of food in the morning -- particularly in the winter or when it is raining. But overall this is a fine, though standard place to stay if in the city for business.

Our room was small yet enough space for not feeling like being in a can ,it was clean, with a wonderful view of the surrounding buildings, this was my second time to stay and I truly felt like home the night shift manager Jean Claude was nice to us as he helped us finding whatever we needed and was very very professional too wifi worked perfectly and daily room cleaning was provided I would definitely recommend this hotel

I asked for a quiet room , and I got it. The room was stylish, great view, friendly staff, and had a great resto on the bottom floor. Loved it. I will definitely stay again. It was in walking distance of most attractions, shopping is great, took very little time to get to MOMA on foot, which happened to be having a garden musical night with new bands!

The residence is downtown, really in the hearth of Manhattan and, to reach some touristic places, you don’t even have to get on the metro. It is close to the Grand Central Station (less than a ten minutes’ walk) and even closer to the arrival of Expresss buses from JFK and La Guardia airports. It offers comfortable apartments with kitchenette. Our apartment was small, clean, with a beautiful view on the surrounding buildings, wifi worked perfectly and daily room cleaning was provided. The kitchenette had the basic cutlery but, as you are in the center of Manhattan and grocery stores are difficult to find, the use of the kitchenette is unlikely. Those who have children and want to stay here are strongly advised. The traffic on the very busy Lexington could be noisy at the lower floors, ask for an high floor. There are no common spaces available for guests in the lobby, which is really small, but there is a beautiful and large executive room on the roof. The terrace of the executive room, with plenty of tables, gives you the opportunity to relax (always with the noise of the ubiquitous traffic). On weekdays mornings complimentary fruit and snacks are available. Complimentary coffee is available all day long. PC and a printing service are available in the same room.

Easy automated checkin and out is also augmented with a person. The hotel has few amenities other than the clean, well appointed rooms. There is a lounge with coffee and a nice view. As well a clean cold water dispenser and empty bottles for do it yourself complimentary water bottles. Much nicer than paying $6 a bottle in the room, like most places.All in all a great deal, especially for $119 on several discount sites.

Quaint little hotel. Smallish room but had a Kuerig and free bottled water that you filled yourself. Good steady Wi-Fi, great view from the 27th floor and very helpful staff. They kept our bags locked up while we had a walk about in the city. Convenient location just down the street from Grand Central Terminal. Walked to Times Square and other places around. Not too far at all. The only reason we didn't give 5 stars was because there was no bathtub and the bed was kind of soft. Other than that it was great. Would definitely stay here again!!

I've stayed here multiple time now. The rooftop is nice for a drink. It's a block away from grand central. The staff is a hit or miss. Some are very nice, other's couldn't care less. I came back to my room to find that towels that I hadn't used were stained with God knows what. I called to have them replaced and was greeted rudely but the concierge. Not only was he rude, he hung up on me and my towels were never replaced. I also had a hard time sleeping with the air conditioning system on... it sounded like a 747 taking off. The hotel it's self is average. It's location is hard to beat though.

The good: I was upgraded to a "superior" room which was spacious by New York City standards, including good size bathroom with a shower (no tub). The room ceiling was very high and entire wall of windows made it feel even larger. There was free chilled filtered water available on each floor as well as fruit, snacks (nuts, M&Ms, trail mix, etc), coffee/espresso, tea, and soda in the lounge area on the top floor. The lounge area also has an outdoor terrace. There is a restaurant with a bar right downstairs. Hotel is conveniently located very close (5 min walk?) to Grand Central Terminal with tons of dining options and great subway access. There's shopping nearby and short train ride is Central Park, Times Square and other touristy attractions. Its about 30 min from JFK airport by taxi (with no traffic). Most staff were helpful and friendly. Free internet in rooms.The bad: do NOT agree to room 202, it is the absolute worst location a room can have. Literally next door to elevator (as in you can press elevator button while standing inside the room) AND directly across from a meeting/banquet room (maybe 15 feet away). One night they had a birthday party and it was loud until after 11 pm. There's also a pilot lounge right across so generally this area of rooms is very noisy and has lots of traffic at all hours. And since its only on second floor, you have tons of street noise and street lights shining right into the window. Late at night, the surrounding area felt a little seedy, although during the day its perfectly fine.I would stay there again provided that I get a superior room and as far as possible from room 202.

Nice rooms. Helpful staff. We loved having access to drinking water at all times and the snacks they had during the week. Staff was helpful. Rooms were a good size and the staff accommodated us to make sure our 2 rooms were together

We were in New York City for a week in July and stayed at the Club Quarters Grand Central. The room we were assigned was designated "Superior" (with a "kitchenette") as it could (and did) accommodate three adults. The location was excellent: it was walking-distance close to several attractions of NYC, including the Rockefeller Centre,the Times Square, and Fifth Avenue shopping, among other others. We were pleased with the hotel facilities, too: our room was comfortable and clean; the housekeeping staff was on-time, efficient, and was quick to respond to our requests for extra towels and bed linens etc. And though the hotel is at the intersection of the always-bustling Lexington Avenue and East 45th. Street, the room we stayed in was quiet. We found the terrace on the 27th floor of the hotel to be an added attraction--it offered an impressive view of New York skyline, and was a lovely place to sit, relax, and enjoy the various kinds of coffee the hotel had for its guests 24/7, and fruits and snacks, too. For us, the terrace was a pleasant "retreat" after a busy day in the City, and which added value to our stay at the hotel. We also liked the fact that there was complimentary chilled water in bottles available on every floor, and a small laundromat with (detergent) for the guests' use--and "on the house," too. But what made our stay particularly pleasant was the overall friendliness of the staff, and here we would like to single out Mr. Jean-Claude, the Guest Services Manager. Manning the front-desk, he was poised, patient, courteous, efficiently and effortlessly multitasking, and enormously helpful. To my mind, he is an asset to the management and the hotel. I wish more hotels had individuals like him interacting with and helping guests. We have two suggestions for the management: first, to make the terrace a smoke-free place, as is the rest of the property, and, second, somehow try to persuade the guests who use the "living room" adjoining the (open) terrace not to walk away with the newspapers, which, of course, is something easier said than done. In conclusion, while the room rate was a bit on the high side (it being New York City in the summer), but the cost was more than made up by the positive experience we had at the hotel, overall.

Great location right across from Grand Central Terminal, at Lexington and 45th. Very modern interior with comfortable, clean rooms - we paid a bit extra for a fridge and microwave. The lobby is almost non-existent, but there is a full time attendant and we were able to leave our luggage safely at the hotel before our room was ready. Be sure to go to the roof-top deck for lovely views at night and yummy coffee, latte, et al, and fresh fruit in the morning. I would stay here again.

This place was clean, easy to check in, no noise from the street and when we told them the coffee machine was broken they sent someone right away to fix it. The place is only 2 years old so everthing is new. They also have free bottled water that you can help yourself to. You can't get any better than this hotel.

The Club Quarters (also known as Hotel Boutique) is located just steps from Grand Central Station. I was in NYC for business meetings and the hotel was within walking distance of all of my meetings. I stayed in a one bedroom suite. The rooms are somewhat small, but not claustrophobic. In the kitchen/living room area, there is a refrigerator, microwave/convection oven, sink, plates/silverware/glasses -- a table that doubles as a desk and four comfy chairs. The queen bed was very comfortable. The rooftop living room/common area and outside deck are lovely. I stayed at the height of summer tourist season, so I paid a pretty high per-night rate, but I will nonetheless definitely consider staying here again when I visit NYC in the future.

Quick trip to NYC for a yoga class and lunch with friends. Staff was very courteous and helpful. I arrived several hours before check in time expecting to store my bag but I was allowed to check in and go to my room. My shower curtain had an odor and they replaced it immediately.Room was small but fabulous. Love the small retro table and banquette. Best feature is the lounge and terrace on the 27th floor. Really liked the quiet, understated vibe.I will be telling all of my friends about this hotel.

Small size room, but it was cozy and very clean. They provide good amenities, such as free wifi and purified water. It was really nice touch. Coffee and tea in the room was also good. Even if you don't have a bathtub in your bathroom, you will get a nice shower room instead.

Stayed in June 15 for 1 night, while on business travel.The room was a bit small, fits one queen bed, a bed stand and a chaise. That's about all there was room for. However it is clean and comfortable.Not sure why Club Quarters hotels are always so noisy but nothing that earplugs won't take care of.Conveniently located to Grand Central, the UN plaza and about a 20 min walk to Penn station.I would definitely return. Kudos to the staff for being so friendly, helpful and accommodating.

Nice, clean, near subway station. Easy and fast check-in.Big room and amazing view of the Empire State from the window. Confortable mattress and hot shower.High speed wifi internet available with no charge.Great terrace space on the rooftop with beautiful view of Manhattan skyline.

My husband and I recently stayed it and it was a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Kudos to the amazing staff who made the stay even more memorable. The Gin and Tonic at Davios bar on LL was awesome :) We got a great room that was both spacious and functional. I would highly recommend this place. It is also easy to walk to times square etc ( though takes about 10 mins or so)

Amazing hotel. Very happy with my stay here. We loved it. Great location. Room was very clean. Close to many attractions. Not too much noise. Over all. I would stay here again when I come back to New York City

Stayed at Club Quarters for 4 days and I couldn't be any happier. The place is incredibly clean, unbelievably clean I would say. It's quiet, the staff is so friendly and amicable, very courteous. They have a awesome deck area with coffee, cappuccinos, lattes and teas at no cost. They also have chilled purified water stations at each floor for free as well. They also have a fitness center but I didn't go so I don't have any information on it. The beds and the pillows, OMG! Super comfortable. It's in Midtown Manhattan but away from the big crowds and the hustle in bustle. Close to everything in a 10 min walk, great restaurants around for any budget. I can't recommend this place enough. Can't wait to be back.

We stayed at CQ during the July 4th weekend and overall our experience was enjoyable. The location is very convenient with several subway stations being just blocks away. The street noise level was quite manageable.The room was clean and small but efficient, considering its size. The bed was very comfortable, which was much appreciated after a full day of walking! I liked the modern appliances in the bathroom (note: there is no tub, shower only) and a functioning hairdryer, which seems to be a challenge to come by in many hotels. There are no irons/ironing boards in the room, but they are available on each floor. The cleaning ladies are extremely helpful and happy to assist.Points taken off for the loud A/C unit and a quite unpleasant front desk staff member who checked us in.

Great value, clean room, comfy bed, free wifi, filtered water... there were many great aspects of the hotel. However, the sound proof was poor, we can hear people in the hallway, the elevator coming up and down, and the constructions around the hotel. It was simply too noisy to get any sleep at all...

I have stayed at this location a few times because it is well located to my office. However, there are certainly compromises. I have never had a problem with the "Guest Closet", except at this hotel - the ironing board was so bad this time, it left marks on my pants because there was no padding.The room is very small but functional. The TV is a decent size with a good list of basic stations. The water pressure was low. I also find the area a bit noisy at night from the traffic.They also charge me a full rate for a missed night after LGA was closed and many flights canceled. It is within their right but found out that my colleagues either had their charge waived or reduced to the lower room night at other chains.

The location is great - walking distance to everything! Line E "Lexington/53 St" subway stop is 8 short blocks away which takes you to the hotel from the JFK airport and back (only a 30-40 min ride on a weekday).This is my 3rd "Club Quartes" in NYC that I've stayed at, and it's lovely.Clean room, comfy bed, blankets.There is an armchair, a small desk, an iPod charging dock/alarm clock, a Keurig machine (3 coffee K-cups and only 1 teabag - I asked for more at the front desk).Wi-Fi is fast and free.Free refillable bottled water.Our room faced the street. It was quite noisy at night but it's New York.AC was nice. We used it only briefly - though it was hot out, our room was nice and cool.Check-in was breezy as was the check-out.

Although rooms are small, they are well appointed for a business traveler. Free wifi. Business center in the top floor Living Room where you can get snacks, use the computers, print documents, etc. I didn't try the restaurant located below and connected to the hotel. No lobby but quick checkin/out.

I've stayed here several times on the company's dime and would do so on my on. The staff are great!Good sized rooms for midtown and the efficient layout really helps. Keurig coffee maker, charging stations, free fast wifi and conveniently located A/C and light controls round out their thoughtful electronic amenities. The bathrooms are spacious for midtown and again, the efficient layout makes them seem larger than they are. Quality soaps and shampoo are included. The location is superb with many options for restaurants and clubs nearby. There's bottled water stations on each floor and the 27th floor lounge is perfect for a quick coffee, cappuccino or a snack and newspaper while viewing the city from their covered patio. There's a couple of computers for those who don't travel with their own smartphone or tablet, if any still exist. The reception is on the second floor but there's a staff member to direct you as you enter.

My son and I stayed at the Club Quarters for a weekend and enjoyed it. It's a very quiet hotel--we didn't hear a peep from the next room or corridor. The location can't be beat.My son, who is an adult, slept on the eensiest, teensiest little pullout couch (chair?), but says it was comfortable. My bed was a tiny bit saggy, but otherwise fine.The only downside was that there wasn't enough toilet paper and only one towel in the room when we checked in. But we found the closet that had those supplies and were happy.

I stayed at the Club Quarters Grand Central for three days near the end of June, 2015. The hotel was in a great location for exploring Manhattan from downtown, midtown and uptown. Easy to get to from the airports. The hotel staff were friendly and accomodating. The room is typically sized for Manhattan, and did have a nice view onto Lexington Avenue. Many quality self service amenities available, including a business center/living room and terrace on the 27th floor. It was an overall good experience and I'd stay there again.

I recently stayed at this hotel for work while I was in NYC. I had stayed at a couple of other hotels in the same area in the past, but none of them measured up to this one.This hotel offered a great view from the 27th floor, this area offered a great space to work from in the day and a fantastic view at night.

I stay at the Club Quarters Grand Central fairly often when in New York on business and have always found it to be a solid hotel. The staff is generally nice and the rooms, though not large, are fine for a business trip or a couple on vacation. The Club Lounge at this location is nice as well--very spacious.

The staff are helpful, polite, and efficient. This hotel really caters to its costumers.The rooms are very nice and comfortable. They provide water bottles and filling stations for them. That was a great little pirk that just added to the feeling of getting my money's worththe city. The gym was small but the equipment is well thought out and perfect. The 27th floor balcony/entertainment area is just awesome. We ate our dinners out There, it is such an amazing view! I will stay here again when I'm back in the city.

This was our first visit to Club Quarters, but it won't be our last. This hotel was super clean, comfortable and modern. The staff was friendly and helpful. They have a really nice covered balcony on 27th floor that you can admire the city from. We really enjoyed our stay. We'll be back!

Clean, pretty tastefully put together and a great location. Would like to see them add more in the way of room service but it is New York and if you want something delivered to your room they can certainly accommodate. Roof top is awesome and free wifi. Overall, great place and will be my go-to for Midtown hoteling.

I don't need a lot of space when I'm in a hotel in New York. I'd rather be out anyway. CQ does a great job eliminating what I don't need in my stay and giving me exactly what I need (like endless, fresh bottled water). The only thing I wish was that the snacks in the club room were available on the weekends.

This hotel, in a perfect location for visiting all the attractions of NYC, is a real gem. The rooms, which are quite a good size for an inner city hotel, are super comfortable. The bathroom is one of the best hotel bathrooms I think I've ever come across, because although there are no windows it seemed light and airy. The shower was perfect; the water drained away beautifully, it was big, and there was a great little shelf to put your shampoo etc on. The little table and bench seat was great for working at and I imagine for relaxing at too, though we were on a work trip. The staff were really friendly and very helpful. Overall, this is definitely our hotel of choice when in New York for either work or play. Thank you so much. We hope to be back soon.

Excellent location, great service with very helpful staff. The club space has good work space, a lovely terrace with a view,,,,, and with free beverages and snacks during the week, it is just a nice treat. The only thing that I miss for a 5 rating is a fridge in the room, and also a separate safe in the room, as It is not always convenient to have to go to a separate floor, even with generous opening hours.

Room was designed to be compact yet plenty spacious for one traveler. Smart phone charging station and a workspace that doubled as my dining table when I ordered dinner delivery. Flat screen TV tucked neatly into wall. Variety of light fixtures allowed for bright or low lighting. Very nice touch. Engineered to make maximum use of space--everything in its place, and a place for everything. Only quirky drawback was open shower in bathroom and awkward shower fixture. Designed for easy cleaning and total ADA access, but there was always a puddle of water on bathroom floor afterward.

I have stayed at all of the Club Quarters in NYC. This one is my new go-to hotel. Especially delightful is the guest lounge on an upper level with a breezy terrace with a view.The Euro-Modern rooms are small but usable and I'm not in NYC to stay in my room! For the first time the bed in my room was uncomfortable. I was promptly switched to a higher rate room with an excellent bed. I appreciate that there is a sufficient number of outlets to charge/use todays techno gear. Like all Club Quarters there is a bottle-it-yourself water dispenser.The staff was helpful, friendly and attentive.I will continue to use Club Quarters for my future NYC visits and this one in particular

This hotel is perfectly located, a block away from Grand Central Station and tons of restaurants and shopping places. There was no lobby but a very cool club room on the 27th floor with free coffee (lattes, cappuccinos etc), free wifi, computers etc. There's also a terasse/ balcony with an amazing view of Manhattan! The staff is really friendly and helpful too (especially Jean-Claude). The only low parts were that the rooms are extremely small (not fit for couples or families) and that the coffee really sucked (but at least it was complimentary!!!).Overall: great stay though. Vividly recommended!

I booked this on Hotwire.com to get a cheap price ($141/night plus taxes) for a 3-4 star hotel near Grand Central for one night (Hotwire offers verrrry cheap rates but you don't know the property name until you pay; I have had great success with Hotwire for you people who haven't tried it. Also with car rentals and such.....). I saw this hotel on Hotels.com today for $354/night! :-O So unworthy of such a high rate.I had the worst night sleep ever. The room had a weird smell of Fabreze (or something similar) no doubt left behind by housekeeping. It was disgusting. But I don't like overpowering, chemical-like smells. Although I was above the 15th floor, the street noise was pretty bad. I heard incessant beeping throughout the night (work trucks reversing??) which drove me insane.
