The pillows were too plump (possible suggestion, add two pillows that are flat to the bed or put them in the closet!). The grey-ish hues chosen in the room really irked me too. The room seemed dingy in some way (it wasn't really but it seemed a bit....).I ran into housekeeping in the elevator/s 3 times during my one night stay. Listen, I'm no snoot, but do I have to stand next to the stinking bucket/s??? Jeeeees. Never mind that the elevators are SLOW. Also, one thing I ALWAYS look forward to when I stay at a hotel is a BATHTUB in which to soak. Only showers here, at least in my room. I revisited the hotel online and that was not mentioned in the description on any website! I was not happy. So I showered and went to plug in the dryer to blow dry my hair (I was in a rush) and the cord attaching dryer to wall outlet was like a foot long!!!! C'mon - who is going to steal a hotel dryer??? SO I dried my hair bent over....On the up side, they have an open terrace on 27th floor. Inside, you can make coffee and tea. There are 2 desktop computers. You can read newspapers. The gentleman in the lobby, Justin, was quite friendly and eager to help. We were early (approx 1300hrs) and he checked us in early (we didn't even have to ask). Check-in is 3PM. The location is good if you need to be near Grand Central - the express #4 & #5 subways are inside as is the local #6. You can walk to many places and attractions, the MoMA too.I highly recommend the restaurant downstairs which is called Davio's. Great service (sit with "Kim") and great food. But that is a different review.Also, I must mention that I forgot something in the closet (got no call about my item although hotel presumably has your contact info!). However, after a month of back and forth, I finally got a gentleman in lost and found who expedited my item to me (via FedEx and no expense to me). Kudos to him (you know who you are).

A nice new hotel in a great location, just a few steps away from Grand Central. Friendly staff with an excellent hotel manager! Will stay here again in the future. Thank you Club Quarters for an enjoyable holiday weekend!

I've stayed at all three Club Q locations in NYC (I live upstate and come to the City for business). Like the others, the Grand Central location is NOT romantic, charming, funky, or full of character. What it is, is efficient, well located, comfortable (decent bed), quiet, and well thought out as a business hotel, with a very good desk and work space. It's also usually about half the price of a 4- or 5-star hotel in a comparable location. Sure, the rooms are small, but that's true of many NYC hotels, including some that are much more expensive. Location is fantastic, at 45th and Lex.

This was my first stay at this location and I cannot say enough good things about the staff and the accommodations. My wife and I were more than pleased with our weekend at Club Quarters Grand Central.

This was a short visit to New York City. However, I was very pleased with the accommodations and the service I received at Club Quarters Grand Central. I received excellent service from my check in time until my departure. Aneshu went above and beyond by returning an item I left in the room. Although the rooms are small they are very well-kept. I will stay there again on my next trip into New York.

I love this hotel. I stay here every time I come up to New York, and it makes me want to keep coming back. The location is unbeatable, the staff are terrific, and the rooms and amenities are perfect for the business traveler. It's not luxurious, but it is very well appointed, clean, and comfortable. The rates are also reasonable, Especially considering the location.

This was my second stay at the Club Quarters at Grand Central New York City. The rooms are not large but this is New York and for two they are fine. The rooms are very modern clean and well laid out. There is a small table with power for working. Best of all is the Lounge on the 27th Floor. This has complimentary drinks all day and also has a large balcony area that would accommodate 20 people. The price is great for central NYC and the location is excellent to get around. Grand Central is literally opposite. You have a great deli in Grand Central as well if you do not want to go out. For me I will definitely stay here again as from JFK and Newark it is a very easy commute via the Train, Subway or bus. If you need a larger room check out their website as I believe some of their hotels have larger rooms and suites but for me the standard room is fine. The staff were very helpful and when I arrived early they let me use the Lounge while they prepared my room.

Very cozy hotel next to grand central. Room is small but pretty new and clean! Excelent option at NYC......................................................................................................................

We stayed here for an overnight while meeting friends in the city. The room was perfect - clean, comfy, modern, and quiet. We had plenty of room to get ready to go out - certainly a smaller room than some of the other hotels we've used in the city, but really, not an inconvenience at all. The price could not be beat for a weekend overnight either! The staff here really makes the hotel - they are very friendly and helpful - they suggested a great deli nearby to satisfy a NY deli sandwich craving (thanks Hugo!). We didn't get a chance to enjoy the "living room" upstairs or the bar/restaurant, but we'll definitely be back in the future and give it another shot! Bonus - there is a taxi stand right outside the hotel which made it very convenient to travel around and back to the train station for our ride home in the morning. Stay here - you won't regret it!

great overall, location, staff, rooms, facilities. great choice. it is very close to the metro, the united nations, it has great places to eat all around and the rooftop has a great view, a must see. all the staff very helpful

Conveniently located next to Grand Central, Club Quarters is a good choice. The room was spacious with a table and a few seats. Clean bathroom and good bed. Pretty quiet room (was on the 7th floor). This hotel doesn't have a restaurant or breakfast facilities - not really an issue in NYC I think.Only negative point is that I had to wait until after 3:30pm to get my room - not very pleasant after a long flight.

Nice place!!!!Not so spacious but very comfy and clean room. We were on the 25 th floor and had a wonderful view. The hotel is centrally located. We walked to the theater district and ate dinner in Chinatown. The staff was very friendly.

A friend and got a room for the weekend at Club Quarters to catch a Broadway show and make a weekend of it. From check in to check out my experience was that of a five star elite hotel. The room (club room) was small, but, clean, comfortable and very tastefully decorated. The hotel, restaurant, bar, lobby were immaculate. The entire staff was genuinely friendly, professional and very helpful with directions, suggestions of where to eat, etc. Thank you, thank you, thank you Club Quarters team for helping us to have an awesome weekend. Would definitely come back!!!

The hotel crew is very nice. Really liked the outdoor patio and lounge area. Location is the best across the street from grand central station. Shops & shows are all near by. If not grand central is across the street.Nikki was over the top helpful.

Great location, attentive service, the room is clean and nice, could be better planned space wise. Don't have breakfast here though, it's not that good. All in all it's all you'd need on a trip to nyc, comfortable, clean, well located and friendly.

Stayed here for the first time as my company has a deal with them for when we travel. The price point was comparable to boutique hotels throughout midtown at just over $220 per night. Rooms were very clean and location was convenient to the business I needed to conduct. It is definitely a no frills experience though. You fill your own water bottles for your room, you can go to a closet on each floor to get an iron or extra toiletries. They have a washer/dryer if you want to do a load of laundry while you're there. And at the end of your stay you check yourself out (which is supposed to alleviate standing in line, but there was still a line and the iPad didn't work so we we had to get an attendant to help anyway). Probably a good concept for tourists or younger people who want to do laundry but doesn't provide much in the way of amenities if you're someone who wants customer service and nice touches.

its a perfectly located hotel, clean rooms and a wonderful customer service. Especially jean claude Mbuyi manager of the hotel who made my stay me and my business partner exquisite. He was a great guide, great personality a perfect example of what great customer service should be. He made me feel at home and welcome from the beginning to end. I will definitely come back.

I would like to thank Mr Jean Claude Mbuyi in particular for his excellent service. I had to change a reservation at late notice that should have incurred a significant penalty. Jean Claude went above and beyond service excellence. Thank you Jean Claude thank you. Gabriella Sydney Australia

This Club quarters was convenient to Grand Central and the 6 train. The room was clean, comfortable and not huge. There was a restaurant in the building and a nearby deli. My husband had a business dinner in the restaurant and was satisfied. There was an unusual system of connecting hallways that left this woman walking alone a little perplexed but it provided for quiet at night. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The price was right. I would definitely return.

I wanted to take the time to personally express my sincere appreciation for the great professionalism and customer friendly service I constantly receive from Jean-Claude, who consistently make my stays at the Club Quarters - Grand Central exceptional.My compliments to Club Quarters for hiring such an extraordinary individual who loves what he does and make patrons feel special. Employees like Jean-Claude who truly know the meaning of customer service, makes staying at your establishment worthwhile!Mike G

Just steps from Grand Central terminal, and an easy walk to Time Square and all its attractions, Club Quarters is a perfectly located home base for travelers. The rooms are nicely decorated, and the whole property seems fresh and new. The staff is cordial and extremely accommodating, doing everything they can to make you feel truly welcome. All this and very reasonable pricing for a New York City property in such a great location. Will definitely return.

I have to say that, I really enjoyed my stay in this hotel! Everybody is really nice and they always help you for anything you might need. The service is perfect and they are very welcoming. The manager takes good care of the clients, and he was available for any request 24/7, M. Jean Claude Mbuyi was very helpful. Moreover the location is Ideal, the room is comfortable and the view from the last floor is breathtaking. I definitively recommend this hotel

We spent 2 nights at CQ Grand Central and it's a great location for NY. It's literally right next to Grand Central and walking distance from Times Square. We even walked to the Hell's Kitchen area for dinner on both nights and it's not too far to walk at all - just wear comfortable shoes!It's very close to the subway and the Lexington line takes you straight down to the Financial District and Battery Park and up towards Upper East Side and Harlem.The service was great. Everyone was very polite and professional. We had a quick, hassle-free check in and check out. Free wifi in the rooms. And also access to their lounge and terrace on the 27th floor with great views. Overall it was a very pleasant experience with no complaints at all.I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again!

For our NYC trip this weekend we've decided to stay at Manhattan this time. Club Quarters Grand Central is 10 mins away from Times Square. It is walking distance to Central Park, Times and 5th Avenue. Hotel was very clean and the receptionist Robert was super helpful. We parked our car at icon parking one block away from the hotel. Hotel has a contract with them so it is half price. We were to leave our luggage at the hotel at our last day. That was a super nice service. I definitely recommend this hotel and we'll book again if we have another Manhattan trip.

this was my first time staying there and I thoroughly enjoyed the Club Quarters Grand Central. It had Great rooms and great service. the night shift manager Jean Claude in particular provided such a great professional service to us as we were completely satisfied What I liked the most is that it was located in a great place which made everything convenient for us. next time When I come to NY again, I will definitely be staying here and strongly recommend this great hotel!

The devil is in the detail and these guys have it figured out! I stayed here when I was in NYC on business. My office was just 3 blocks from here and we have a corporate tie-up with the place. I stayed here for 4 week nights, in a Standard Room’ on the 14th floor, in the West wing, so my room was facing Lexington Ave. Despite being a compact room it offered ample space to move around and all the amenities a lone business traveler might need. I LIKED – That they are located 10 to 15 mins walking distance from Rockefeller/ Empire State/ Time Square/ etc… and Grand Central is 2 mins walk for when you need to take the subway or a train out of the city. That room was very well maintained and the staff was polite and helpful. The cleanliness was top notch. The bathroom was spotless and well laid out. The table and couch arrangement in the room, at first looked like it will be difficult to get around, but soon I realized that the table slides about making it easy getting in and out of the couch. The arrangement by itself proved very handy from a 'work from the room' perspective. You get a fairly large table to plant your laptop, phone, chargers, etc. on and work comfortably and the tea maker that also occupies the same space. The table also has some power connections built in that only add to the convenience.They have an ice and water dispenser (with bottles available as well) in the corridor on each floor. Again very convenient. The free WiFi connected easily and worked very well. So again from a work perspective it’s quite dependable.The Private Club Living Room on the topmost floor is a nice place to sit and work at as well. I did that some mornings and the place has a nice vibe… its spacious with very nice views of the outside. There are some decent restaurants around here, and some have a tie up with the hotel so they deliver to the room. So the one day I worked from my room, I didn’t need to step out just to grab lunch. The staff are very helpful in guiding you to the right places depending on the cuisine you're in the mood for. The Italian restaurant Davio’s within their building facility is awesome for steak! I really have nothing to include that I didn't like about this place!

I thoroughly enjoyed the Club Quarters, Grand Central. It had Great rooms and great service. What I liked best is that it was in a great location which made everything convenient. When I come to NY again, I will definitely be staying here.

This was my first time staying at this location. The area is close to healthy food options and restaurants. The rooms are great, and the customer service was outstanding. Justin in particular provided world class customer service. I would definitely Make this my hotel of choice.

my 1st stay in manhattans at this quite Hotel located on the 45th there are many nice restaurants near the Hotel, I like the comic store in front and the Japanize restaurant just in front of the gate of the hotel.

I love hotel itself location. Rooms are clean, No noisy. Receptionist is professional, check in/ check out very fast. I love the coffee machine in the room, a sofa are is nice, specious for work and dinner. Definitely recommend for everybody.

Accustomed to rather drab and overpriced hotels in mid-town Manhattan, I found this hotel to be genuinely comfortable and worthwhile. The superior queen room has everything you need for a 14 day stay, including a well equipped kitchenette with microwave and basic cutlery. The 27th floor clubroom offers 24 hour espresso drinks and fresh fruit on weekdays. Check-in and check-out are efficient and staff very friendly and helpful. A place to be recommended!

I had been planning out a trip to return back to the city I grew up in and was deciding on where to stay. I found this hotel and read that it had great reviews so I booked my reservation to try it out. I fell in love with the hotel & its location. It is very convenient being so close to grand central terminal and its a small walks away from times square. When I checked in a handsome man by the name of Alberto assisted me in checking in and helped me figure out new locations for my cousin and I to go to. He was very knowledgeable and friendly. The room was very comfortable, had a great view, and was something I have dreamed of for a while.The location is great, its near major transit, walking around is also an option if you prefer. I will definitely come back when the east coast weather becomes warmer.

The room was small, but very modular and efficient. The bed and bedding was comfy. I was very impressed with the front room desk. They were very eager to serve us quickly and very apologetic when I had to wait a minute or two. The entire hotel was well thought out and sufficient.

The only drawback is that the room is quite small (I had a "club" room), but the design is so thoughtful that you can get by with minimal inconvenience. Lots of clever details like hooks on the wall, shelves in the bathroom, that maximize the use of space. Comfortable bed and no problems whatsoever with TV or wifi (which is free). I did notice that the hot and cold water in the sink is extreme at both ends, so be careful.Another thoughtful convenience: each floor has a water machine where you can fill bottles with purified water.Overnight parking is available two blocks away. With my ticket validated by the hotel, I paid just $29.50, very reasonable for Manhattan.Courteous service, too.This is an obvious choice for an overnight stay if you need to be near Grand Central Station, the United Nations, etc. Bazillions of restaurants nearby. I cannot comment on the value because my room was comped by my host.

On the corner of E 45th Street and Lexington with easy access to subway / train from Grand Central.Room was comfortable although slightly on the small side. Access to PC and printer on top floor business centre, which also has a balcony with great views along Lexington. Used the attached Davio's restaurant once for dinner and breakfast but found it to be a bit overpriced - instead would recommend nearby Cafe Linda on E49th street for dinner, and Comfort Diner also on E 45th Street for breakfast. If you want a beer try The Wheeltapper Pub a block away on E44th Street.

The room was no smaller than elsewhere in NY so that was fine. The room was cold and the heating would only come on when you were in there so had to keep coat on for 30 min which isn't good. The batheroon is basic - the shower useless and the sink is in the bedroom, strange and not very nice. The good points - the bed was comfy, each plug has a USB charging point and there was free water which was excellent. The "lounge" on the top floor is a nice touch, great views, free coffee, soft drinks and some "nibbles"overall if I am on a budget I would stay here again - but the bathroom shower and heating let it down

It is a very nice hotel and very near to Grand Central. Rooms are very clean but somewhat small. People are very nice and helpful. Cold filtered drinking water is available all time for free. After check out, if you want they can take care of your luggage too, this makes your travelling easy.

The rooms were small, however that's to be expected in New York City. We stayed on the 25th level and it was just awesome. We only heard a little bit of noise but it never effected our sleep at all. The location of the Hotel is only 5 minutes from Grand Central so its soo easy to get around the city via the subway! The staff were great. We were able to check in a number of hours earlier with no hassle. They kept our bags after we checked out. They weren't left in the lobby, they were moved up stairs into another room. Will stay again if we are ever in New York again.

I was at Club quarter Grand central druing all star week end. My cildhood friends and I stayed there to enjoy the festivities. Great location close to the majority of events, the service was great. We had Jean Claude and Hugo and the rest of the team were very helpful. I will advise this location. next time I am back in the city and I will at Club Quarter Midtown.

Great time there , was there last year had a great time too I guess my come back should speak for itself because nobody can eat the same dirt twice. Jean claude M. The manager is just awesome great sens of humor but very professionally driven ,I like the availability. Great stay to sum it all up will definitely recommend people to go there....See you soon l.

Had lovely stay here with my husband. I have stayed at club quarters in the UK and US frequently and they are pretty much all very similar and this one is no exception. It is well located in Manhattan, clean, good service, nice "club room" with complimentary hot drinks and snacks, and a nice terrace with views of Manhattan. The free water machines on every floor are a great touch too. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

We actually had two great experiences at this hotel. We brought two bar stools from Ohio to the city to be given to some friends who needed to pick them up at a time that was convenient for them. The hotel staff stored the bar stools for the day, while waiting for them to be picked up from our local friends. We also telephoned the hotel about 40 minutes after departing when we realized we left our hanging garments in the closet. The staff was so helpful, rushing to our room, giving us an inventory of the items that were hanging in the closet and then shipped them immediately by Federal Express. We offered to tip them and they refused, stating they are not permitted to take tips. We received all of our garments 5 days later, which saved us from driving back into the city during rush hour. The room was clean, a great location in the city, and the staff was extremely helpful. We would recommend this hotel!

This was the first time I have experienced a Club Quarters and I am very impressed. The room I had was small, but extremely well equipped with everything a business traveler would need. Someone in the organization really knows how to equip a room. The Club Lounge was terrific and Ben an attendant really was very helpful with assisting with the computers and printer.Easy registration.Great location. We ate in Davio's in the lover level of the hotel fro dinner and were very pleased. I am a believe in Club Quarters! The sound proofing is very good.

Great hotel, Big clean room i really appreciate the 27th floor and its incredible view special thanks to the Office Manager Mister Jean Claude Mbuyi for his kindness and professionalism Ulrich Gambiga from Libreville Gabon

Club quarters hotels are one of the best places to stay in. Quiet, clean, ewith a good bed and centrally located. Wi Fi, coffee lounge and all you really need when away from home. Always glad to stay.

We have stayed in quite a few hotels in Manhattan and this one was carefully chosen for its location, value for money and hotel facilities. We chose a room with a kitchenette; a good choice as it turned out as it meant we were able to cater a few meals ourselves, choosing great food from the vast range of nearby deli's! And in Grand Central Terminal itself (a very brief walk from this hotel) the Market Place has a huge range of fresh foods, delicious breads, soups, you-name-it....The hotel also had a residents' lounge with free coffee, tea and (as in many Club Quarters) there was free filtered water on every landing. All of the latter make for good savings but the residents' lounge is also a good place to unwind, looking out at the Manhattan view, away from one's room. We occasionally ordered breakfast from a nearby deli, and that proved good value too. The weather for our January visit was predictably cold, snowy and well, COLD! The room heating was adequate but temperamental...but there are spare blankets available. Overall a good place to stay and we will certainly stay there again.

It would be an insult to refer to Club Quarters as merely a hotel. It is truly a unique experience that becomes a home away from home. The room and cleanliness is superior. The staff is extremely helpful and especially Robert and Hugo.

The shuttle from Newark Liberty stops right by here. It's right across the street from Grand Central and a reasonable walking distance from most midtown attractions like 30 Rock, Times Square, Saks, Chrysler Building, etc. Wifi was free and fast. Complimentary water was available just outside our room and there was a lounge upstairs with complimentary coffee and refreshments. Boarding passes could also be printed for free in the lounge!

When your start-up company is too cheap to spring for two rooms in the heart of NYC during the holidays, which means you've got to share with a colleague, then Club Quarters Grand Central is a great option. We knew we had a standard room with a queen bed, but where was the pull-out sofa bed? Oh, it's a....chair? Our concern was temporary, because the "chair" bed, was amazingly, surprisingly comfortable (see photos). No bar in the middle of your back, et c. Never squabbled over the queen bed because the pull-out was just fine. Even with the chair bed pulled out, there was still plenty of space in the room. We never had to fold it back in so we could walk around. This chair bed seemed narrower than a twin, fyi. Other things to mention that might not have already been covered in other reviews...Yes, location of hotel can't be beat. Yes, very clean! But the other things that we loved about our room, it had:-- good shower pressure-- some amenities provided - small shampoo, conditioner and soap (see photo)-- a complimentary coffee machine AND microwave. -- a QUIET, heating/air conditioning system-- plenty of USB plug-in stationsOther hotel perks:-- Down the hall is cold, fresh, self-serve filtered water. -- Private club living room was spacious, well decorated and comfortable with a high-end, free coffee machine for use. Cappuccino anyone? Minor CONS:-- There's essentially only one person at their hotel desk...and each time I saw that person, they were always juggling more than one thing, with more than one or two hotel guests waiting for them. They could stand to use another person to help.-- We arrived well before check-in time. After waiting our turn for assistance to check in our luggage at the desk, we found our luggage still sitting on the floor in the lobby later that night. Same thing happened when we checked out. Not sure if they just don't have a place to put it? Just seemed like anyone could just walk in and walk out with our bags.

Hotel is well located to most everything we wanted to do. Rooms are quiet and clean and have free bottled water. Free wifi and the club living room with snacks and refreshments plus a great place to work make this a good business choice

Great location with close proximity to restaurants, bar and Grand Central Terminal. I took the NYC Airporter bus rom JFK Airport and alighted at Grand Central Terminal. It only takes around 5 minutes to walk to the hotel. Returning to JFK airport is also a breeze, walking to 41st street (4 street down) and take NYC Airporter as well. You can find a Japanese restaurant opposite this hotel named Riki that open till late and does not charge any tips. Hotel provides free chilled water where you will need to get them at the corridor. Hotel provides free wifi and amenities such as hair dryer and iron. Don't be fooled by the small lobby when you walk in the hotel, the room are cosy and large enough for 2 luggage bag to be placed on the floor. Overall, hotel is clean with club facility at the top floor (27th floor). There you can find a large cafe area and also 2 iMacs. With that, you can purchase your tickets for places you plan to visit online and have it printed.

The hotel is just grate , grate view great rooms, clean, smell's great, the bathroom is clean, the location is just seconds from the grand central station, the fifth avenue is 2 blocks away. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Starbucks and other restaurants is nearby. I loved the hotel. The bed is a little bet soft but its ok.

Overall we had a great stay at Club Quarters Grand Central. The location is about a 10 minute walk to the Times Square, and two minutes to Grand Central. There are several cafes close by if needed. The rooms were nice, but can be small. We had the smallest room initially for two people but they made great use of the space and even had a small chair and table to use. We later upgraded to a suite for 3 of us. We were told there was a pullout couch but it was just a separate room with a mini kitchen and two extra chairs. The first night in the suite we were unable to get a cot or pillow because they were and had to have someone sleep on the floor, but they tried to help by sending multiple soft blankets and sheets. The second night they got us a cot and pillow. The bedroom window in the suite had a huge wall to wall window which gave for an awesome view. The staff were all very friendly and tried to help whenever they could. They even offered to get my mom some soup and tissues when she had a cold. There is an upstairs room available to guests with a coffee maker and a tv and chairs that was wonderful. They even have light snacks there sometimes too. Connected is also an outside area. I found the top floor to be the best part of the hotel. FYI, there is no lobby, just a desk for the worker. I would recommend this hotel to others and would stay again.

We travel to NYC several times a year and stay in different places. This is a great location, few blocks from the subway. Great food around the Hotel. The staff is friendly and good amenities. Check out the lounge on the 27th floor if you are looking for coffee/tee and some relaxation.

I stayed at the Club Quarters Grand Central for a couple of nights on a business trip. All I really needed was an efficient, clean, well located and quiet place to stay and I got exactly that. This hotel really deserves a 4, but they failed at a couple basic aspects: I left one bag at the front desk the morning I checked out. It took the staff 15 minutes to get it back later that day, and I was the only guest keeping them busy. Why getting a bag out of a closet could possibly take so long is beyond me. Other than that it was all good. I wish the room had an iron and board, something a business traveler usually expects in a hotel like this. I'm sure I could've asked for one, but it would've probably taken quite a while. If you're self-sufficient and don't need to ask anything from the staff is place is perfect. Don't expect anything special though.

Ideally located, lots of food options around, area felt safe enough.Room:Broken fan in the bathroom so expect steam showers if you get the same room. The sink stopper was also broken - held it open with a binder clip.Attached restaurant was rather pricey but was delicious.had them hold a bag on checkout day and it sat right there in the lobby for three hours....considering it had my laptop in it was a little disconcerting when I got back and it was still sitting there. Tried to use the handicap button to open the front door and it did not work and the guy inside just stood there while I struggled to get in with my luggage.Standard room is SMALL....just a warning.OH - they booked a private party so their much-touted special "club living room" where you can relax and use the computers and printers was CLOSED to the rest of the guests. Bad for business.

10-15 mins walk to Times Square, beautiful terrace with fresh free coffee, free bottled water on each floor, small but clean and neat rooms, big comfortable bed, polite and friendly staff, quick wifi.

was there with my family on vacation from paris in november ,,we had a great time ,nice view from the 27 th floor ,quiet internet relaxing room,,the service is lovely,,very friendly,,specially we met this guy from congo i believe name was ;jean claude, or manager on dutty,,very nice and respecfull guy,,,humble that helped me tru th whole process cause my reservation wasnt chowing up ,,its a nice place and i will defintely recommend it to my friends,and family,,,this place is the perfect place foe familly and other trips,,,,merci

Think this place has nailed the business hotel - my room was small and quiet but still suitable for working on a few reports on my laptop and had free wifi. The Club Living room is nice with 24 hour complimentary refreshments and access to newspapers. There's even a great view from the balcony of the "Club Living Room". Would also recommend for non business travel.I also like the touch having water facilities on each floor - they have water coolers with having fresh plastic bottles for guests to fill. Great location across from Grand Central Station and easy to access form Kennedy.The lobby was undergoing renovations when I stayed which slowed checkin and checkout.

Great boutique hotel with awesome restaurant and bar (Davios) in lower level. Located very close to Grand Central Station. Easy check in and significantly larger rooms than most mid-town hotels I've stayed in.

Stayed for 2 nights while attending a training across from Grand Central. Very minimalist hotel, but served my purpose well. As some have mentioned, there was no place for soap or anything else in shower, but it is so close to the sink it doesn't matter. I was on the 25th floor, but could still hear all the sounds of NYC!Would definitely stay again and highly recommend for business travelers.

This was the perfect hotel for a quick weekend Christmas shopping trip with friends. It is in very easy walking distance to Fifth and Madison Avenue shops, a variety of restaurants, Bryant Park, the theatre district, Central Park, and Grand Central, and a short cab ride to Eataly, Soho, etc. Everyone on the hotel staff was extremely helpful, friendly, pleasant, and cordial at all times. Requests - rollaway bed, extra towels - were met immediately. The room was really like a small very stylish, contemporary NYC apartment with a combination sitting and kitchen area, shower/toilet room with separate vanity area, and separate bedroom. All furnishings and materials were tasteful and of very good quality. I have never seen such efficient use of space in a hotel! In a relatively small footprint, everything was cleverly designed and arranged for maximum efficiency and attractiveness, making the space flow and seem larger than it really is. Three women with several shopping bags had plenty of room for an overnight stay! Our room was extremely clean and in excellent condition, as were the other areas we used - rooftop lounge, terrace, lobby and sitting area. There were many much appreciated extra touches in our room to help make our stay go smoothly such as free wi-if, two closets, fully stocked kitchenette, great lighting, small table/desk and chairs for two people with charging station, two flat screen tvs, etc. The hotel also provides complimentary water bottle filling stations on each floor. Based on this stay, I'm already looking forward to a return trip to this hotel and would not hesitate to try Club Quarters in other locations. Very highly recommended!!

Great location near Grand Central Station and walking distance from the United Nations. It was an odd experience though. Check in was smooth, but when I asked for directions to a nearby store the desk clerk sent me in the completely opposite direction. Bellman/houseman staff however were VERY helpful and friendly. EVERY back-of-house employee I met [housekeeping, maintenance, bell staff, etc.] were open, welcoming and quick with a kind word or helping hand. Front desk staff throughout 2 1/2 day stay were dull, bored appearing and unaware of their surroundings. Left bags in the lobby to load my car and thankfully nothing disappeared because the desk agent couldn't care less about keeping an eye on them. Had expected a package delivery and alerted the desk to call my room when it arrived. Never received a call yet the package was at the desk for at least 3 hours before I went in search of it. Other than that - the room was clean, efficient and affordable [for NY!]. Bed was VERY uncomfortable but maybe that was just my room as I heard from colleagues theirs were fine. FASTEST elevator I've ever been in [and I used to work in a building with 60 floors!]

Club Quarters has very unique approach, they are central located in down town districts. The rooms are extremely small and there is not lobby to speak of. BUT the location and price is great. The rooms are very European style--small but well appointed and very practical. They get the most out of every square foot and have GREAT meeting areas for business. At the MSG location they had an entire floor on the top of the building with sitting areas inside and out, great views of Manhattan, free coffee, and I think even a short happy hour with free beer and wine. PERFECT for business. I held all my meetings on the common floor/area. No need to go anywhere else. And seriously if you are in business how much time do you spend in your room anyway. If you want to try something different give these guys a shot!

I normally stay here at the Club Quarters Grand Central several times a month for work. The location is excellent and is just steps away from Grand Central Station, as well as shopping, restaurants etc. The staff is always friendly and helpful and the rooms are efficient and comfortable.But the real reason I am writing this review is because last week I left some very important documents in my room upon check out. By the time I realized it, my room had already been cleaned. I owe a huge thank you to Anisul in housekeeping, who sorted through bags of trash to find my items! After finding them, he coordinated their safe return and kept me posted. He even left me his email when he went home, just in case I had any further questions. Thank you SO much for going above and beyond Anisul!! I REALLY appreciate all you did!!

I have stayed at a half dozen Club Quarters while traveling on business. This on is easily accessible in the heart of Midtown, walkable to most everywhere I needed to go. The rooms are small but efficient and effective. Everything you need if you don't plan on spending a lot of time in the room. didn't have a chance to check out the restaurant or lounge. Only downside was they were grinding and re-paving Lex Avenue all night so it was LOUD, but most Manhattan hotels have the noise factor to deal with.

I recently stayed in the club quarters in grand central NYC , was the best service I never had and also the courtesy of staff and manager. Big luxury room that makes you feel like, you are in a suite. PS: thanks to the front manager,JEAN CLAUDE Tshimena Mbuyi for the hospitality he offered.

You can't ask for a better location. I had to find an Apple Store for a repair and it's right at Grand Central Station--a couple blocks away. Then I needed something from a pharmacy and ther's one right around the corner.But in a rush to get out the door, I left something in the room. The next day I called the hotel. Not only did they find it right away, they shipped it to my house in Chicago for free! Thank you Anisul!

Clean, quiet , very helpful staff !! Definitely stay here again maybe @ times square location .Keurig in the room which was awesome! Pillows were great . They held our luggage when we checked out so we did not have to carry it. The gentleman at the desk hailed us a cab !

I was on a business trip so the location was perfect. Proximity to restaurants is very good. Subway connections were very good too. The room was compact but very functional. The business Center was functional and the capaccino machine was divine. Workout facilities were adequate.

Stayed in this location for the first (and hopefully not last) time at the end of October. The room was small but extremely clean; it was the most functional and quietest room that I have ever stayed in for a business trip.Perfect! The business lounge on the top floor is a major plus, as was the restaurant at the basement level for those without time or inclination to look elsewhere. The filtered water was a convenience, and I took "to go" bottles with me to my meetings. As a single female traveler, one caution (which had nothing to do with the hotel): after a Broadway show, I failed to find a cab and walked back along 46th Street. The walk is not long, it was not totally deserted, all was fine- but at times not quite populated enough for me to be fully comfortable. All in all, highly recommended for business travel.

This hotel is reasonably priced and has a great location. We enjoyed the convenience to Grand Central and subway. There are many restaurants nearby and the staff is quite friendly. Our room was clean and a good size. There was a table to watch tv at and eat breakfast.

This hotel is perfectly located just around the corner from Grand Central, <5 minute walk from Time Square, Rockefeller Centre, Central Park and many museums and great restaurants. The rooms are very small and oddly designed to make them feel even smaller, but I am told this is normal for Manhattan. The wifi was fast and included in the room price. There was no breakfast included, but there is a wonderful breakfast bakery around the corner that we ate at every day. The rooms have water coolers, aircon and a good coffee machine. Also, there is a 24 hour lounge on the top floor with a lovely viewing deck and coffee and refreshments.

With most weekend room rates in Manhattan at $350+ (and many $500+), I decided to stay at Club Quarters Grand Central for one night in October. The hotel is in a great location if you need to be close to Midtown -- about a 15-minute walk to Times Square and even less to Fifth Ave. The hotel itself is clean and comfortable. The rooms are very small, but also efficiently designed so that no space is wasted. For one night when you're probably not going to be in the room long, you have absolutely everything you need. The free cold filtered water at all Club Quarters hotels is a nice touch. If you just need a place to be for a night (or maybe two), aren't going to be in the room too much, and don't want to spend a ton, consider Club Quarters.

I've stayed at the Club Quarters in London quite a bit and this one was on par with those (in stark contrast to the Wall Street location). The rooms are adequate and clean. Mine was a little funky for the work space. It was a table with a chair/sofa kind of seating arrangement, but it was totally functional. The club lounge is on the top floor, with a view of the Chrysler Building. It's very pleasant up there, and a great way to start the morning. There is an open-air terrace as well, which has clear plastic "windows" in place for the chillier months.Right by the north end of Grand Central, access to transit is excellent. Taxis are also readily available at the station, if they aren't driving past.I'd definitely stay there again. In fact, I'm getting myself out of this mess at Wall Street and back up there as soon as my business in the financial district is done!

Our stay at this hotel was fantastic!!!! During our trip we were hesitant to stay in Manhattan but after looking at the reviews and pictures on TripAdvisor we decided to experience staying at this hotel. The hotel Manager J.C. and staff was very attentive and professional during check in, and they advise us to keep our hotel key with us at all times in order for us to gain elevator / room access ( Added security).The room was very warm and cozy, however we wish there were more channel line up, once we got settled we inquired about restaurants since we arrived very late at night, they recommended a Deli that only delivers, the food was on point especially the burgers and fries. You get a parking voucher which is a discounted price for you to park your vehicle at the garage up the block. We will stay there again in 4 months.

The location, the room, the amenities, the staff -- it was all perfect! The room is on the small side, but it is so intelligently laid out. There is a table and L-shaped couch wrapping around a table with outlets to keep devices charged. There is a closet and a dresser and an iron, so your clothes won't look like they've been jammed in a suitcase. The lounge on the 27th floor is a terrific venue for meetings or relaxing over a drink (though I do wish it were better stocked around the clock). Free bottles of filtered water are a great touch. The location is absolutely unbeatable! I'll be coming back. You can't find a better hotel in Midtown!

I came to NYC for a quick visit and I am so glad I didn't stay in Brooklyn. This hotel ambiance is incredible, the staff was friendly and the Check in was on point. The hotel Manager Jean Claude made sure our room was ready before we got there, his personality made the first impression of it even more appealing and welcoming . The elevator was the fastest one I have ever been on lol. Moreover to add a few brownie points they have empty unopened water bottles for you to get purified water anytime, the club view area upstairs is absolutely beautiful, to see the night lights of the buildings and cars was so exciting. I would stay there again without any hesitation.

Initially I was impressed by CQ Grand Central. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the location was perfect. Some minor annoyances included the claim of fresh water (which is actually down the hall, not in the rooms) and the fact that the maid knocked my expensive make up off the counter and broke/spilled it and didn't acknowledge it. The real problem though, came after I left. I had changed my departure date over phone before coming out and then noted at check in that the check in computer was still reflecting the original date. I was told it was no problem. Then I was hit with an early departure fee when I left. I have called multiple times and either been ignored or shuffled from person to person. Finally I spoke to someone who said the fee would be refunded, but it never was. I called again and explained what happened and they tried to say it was my fault. I will never stay at another Club Quarters location after this experience.

My family and me enjoyed our staying in this hotel which is well located ,a few mins walk from Times square,5th avenue,Madison square and all tourist attractions..Big and comfortable rooms,delicious international breakfast and excellent service!I wanna say thank you to Robert who helped us since our arrival to NY and organized for us a special transfer car to the airport in Limousine!!!Next time I'll come to NY ,I'll stay again at this fantastic hotel !!Ilaria,the italian girl from Montecarlo

The current offering of mid-range hotels in Mid-town Manhattan is pretty awful. Most are old, poorly maintained, and over-priced. The Club Quarters is a nice new alternative. Although the rooms are small, the hotel is brand new. Everything works and is in very good condition. I am a big fan of the lounge and terrace on the 27th floor - a great place to work during the day or relax in the evening. Another plus is the laundry room with free machines and detergent. The gym is small and very basic but there is major health club next door which sells day passes. My only complaint is the street noise. My room was very noisy even in the middle of the night (I was on the 8th floor). I suspect the buildings owners may have cut corners on sound insulation when building the hotel.

This is a great hotel. While the rooms are small, they are VERY well designed and everything is new and perfectly clean. We like the location right next to Grand Central Terminal. In addition they have a Club Living Room which is a large lounge area with free access to two computers - which I am using to write this review. We would definitely return here if we visit NY again.

Just enjoyed a long weekend at this hotel and would definitely consider staying there again in the future. The rooms are small, but very modern and well-laid out. The employees were very friendly and helpful. Everyone greets you as you walk throughout the hotel and the front desk clerk, Christine F. was particularly helpful when we checked in. We were about five hours early and needed a room with two beds, but she was still able to find us one right away. She also helped with straightening out a reservation issue we had with the Rockefeller Center CQ, which was a big relief.The living room and terrace on the 27th floor were really nice, especially since the room itself was so small. We brought our breakfast up there to eat it, watched a little football another night and enjoyed a bottle of wine on the terrace another night. The free wifi and water stations were excellent perks as well. One of the only hotels I've ever stayed that had free wifi with a strong, easy to access signal!The location was great for tourist stuff, too, since it's only three blocks from the Grand Central 42nd St subway stop.The only negative I would say is that I found the bed extremely bouncy and uncomfortable, but that could just be me.

I was pleasantly surprised with the rooms at Club Quarters. Although the first thing you notice is the small size of the rooms, you also notice how well they were designed. The bathrooms were very nice. The TV and integrating the sound system by the bed so that you could hook up an iPod, phone, or iPad to play through the TV was a great idea. The bed was very comfortable, and the room and bathroom were both very clean. Overall, it is a great place to stay if you're looking to stay in the heart of Manhattan without spending a fortune. I would return!

I have stayed at midtown CQ on 45th street many times and loved the location (5th Avenue). But the new CQ right outside Grand Central is even better. Similarly a great midtown location but this hotel is new from last year and therefore a lot fresher and more modern. Best of all is the delightful top floor lounge that all guests have access to. The center is a modern coffee/espresso bar with several computer workstations and good seating in a modern decor. Running around it is a wraparound deck with seating and great views of the Helmsley building, the Metlife and other NY icons. Every night I was out there enjoying a bottle of wine watching the lighted buildings of New York. The Helmsley in particular puts on a show changing from white to blues and purples. Very pleasant and still a reasonable price. I hesitate to be so positive because after it is "discovered" it will be out of sight. Oh well!

Very nice hotel located Manhattan midtown nearby the Grand Central train station and Chrysler building. Nice and clean room. Breakfast buffet (served by the restaurand at lower level floor) could be improved as it is limited to the minimum.

Everything was fine at this hotel for our weekend stay until I checked out. The lone front desk clerk was on the phone, helping another guest and talking to me all at the same time. The clerk said everything was fine with my bill and agreed to email me the receipt. When I looked at the email receipt the next day there was a $38 late check out fee. I was stunned ! I travel for business quite a bit and have never been charged a late check out fee. I contacted the hotel and they said all guests are automatically charged a late check-out fee after a 30 minute grace period. When I made the reservation there was no mention of this policy. When I checked in no one mentioned this policy. If I had known that I was automatically going to be charged a $38 late fee after 30 minutes I would have changed my schedule that day. I could understand the fee if a guest checked out in the afternoon, but I feel this is an example of a hotel charge that was unwarranted.

The view from their patio was wonderful - the Chrysler Building, Grand Central, Helmsley. My only complaint is this - when we booked the room we wanted two separate beds and were told no problem they can separate them when we got there. What they failed to tell us was that it was an up charge of $20/night for that. Talked with someone on their patio who had the same issue. Other than that everything was great!

The hotel is clean, comfortable, and super convenient. They even have keurig coffee makers in the room to make complimentary coffee & tea. Thanks again to Zshawn who is an invaluable asset to the hotel. Hes very knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel on its own is fantastic. But He really made us feel really welcome! thank you

We stayed for two nights (Fri-Sat) in a suite on the 8th floor (room 802). I had asked for a room on a high floor and got the 8th, which wasn't bad, though not high enough to muffle street noise or for a view. Excellent location, a short walk to Grand Central Station and about 10 minutes to Time Square.The room itself was very quiet, clean and modernly furnished. Everything looked new as well. The bedroom was separated from the sitting room by a sliding glass door. The suite is equipped with a kitchenette, which was very handy. The bedroom area was tiny but sufficient. The sitting room was more spacious with a flat screen tv and two chairs. No sofa so we had to sit uncomfortably in chairs for hours after our son went to bed in the bedroom at 8pm. (There's an extra charge for cribs, so we brought our own pack n play.) Free wi-fi was a bonus.We booked through hotels.com about a week in advance for about $300 a night, non-refundable. The day we arrived I checked the rates for the suite and it had gone down to around $220. If you're able to book last minute, I think you can get a better deal than what we got. Nevertheless it was good value for a suite. The parking was $27 or so at an Icon garage (no in-out) near by. The door man (an older gentleman) was so cheerful and helpful. The people at the front desk at check-in and out (a tall young man and a dark haired woman) were pretty indifferent, but we didn't have any real need to interact with them. We didn't get a chance to use the amenities (gym, lounge) unfortunately.

I was hesitant about this hotel, as I didn't know what to expect. But we had such a great experience! Its right near Grand Central - we walked from Penn Station to the Hotel (it was a great day!) And when we arrived the lobby area was quite small, but thats normal sometimes for NYC. Check in was painless, no line, no wait. Very easy!! We got into our tiny room (which too is normal for NYC), but the room was very very nice with great amenities and furnishings, we had a great view, nice huge flatscreen TV, great bathroom, decent sized closet. The hotel staff were also great - very accomodating. I really liked the free water they gave to hotel guests as well as the in room coffee service. The location was good for what we needed. I would totally stay here again if the location fits my needs - a definite YES!

I recently learned about the Club Quarters group of hotels, and decided to give the one near Grand Central a shot because I had to take Metro North first thing in the morning. Having stayed at the CQ in SF and at other NYC hotels, I was not disappointed by this one.Yes, there is no lobby, and there was only one person at the podium checking people in. But I didn't need a grand lobby, and perhaps I got lucky when I checked in because it was quick and painless. Yes, the room was on the small side, but it had everything I needed for that one night, and I must say I have been at other NYC hotels that are much older with much smaller rooms. This is a newer hotel, and the room was nicely done. You wouldn't want to swing any cats in the room, and it could get claustrophobic with more than 3 people there, but it was well laid out and quite comfortable.The attraction to this type of hotel is that you are not paying for those extras you don't really need. The bonus was the lounge room upstairs that provided a wide variety of snacks (which could be used to make a decent breakfast) and space to relax, have a drink, and look over the city skyline. The one night I was there it poured all day and night, so the view wasn't the best, but the potential is there. The hotel also provides you with bottles of filtered water, which is a plus.Conveniently located just one block from Grand Central Station, this hotel was perfect for my needs. It would also be a good choice if you needed to catch the subway or walk around a vibrant part of town.

To Club Quarters Grand Central: if you only have one person at the front desk (note to other travelers: there is no lobby, none! Just a tiny desk next to the elevators and there is only one person there to meet/greet you, if he does that at all), who is there to deliver what your brand stands for, then please choose wisely. I had the most impersonal, inconsiderate, and indifferent customer experience this morning (Aug 30, 2014) upon arrival at your property (between 9am and 10am), as I am visiting the US Open tennis for the long weekend. To other travelers: if you are looking at the area around Grand Central, then you are probably prepared for a certain price range for your hotel staying. So if paying $20-30 more per night won't break your bank, look for a real hotel that delivers better customer experiences.

This hotel was everything it needed to be. Clean, in a great location, friendly front desk staff, and a beautiful terrace. The rooms were quite small, but it's NYC, so I expect that. The water bottle stations were a nice touch and came in handy with all the walking your bound to do in manhattan. The have only two critiques. Their website states they have iPads for loan however they only have a handful and none were available to us. Their website also states the living room has refreshments. I expected some fresh fruit or granola bars or something small. But the only thing in the living room was a coffee machine.

I used Hotwire to reserve my hotel in Midtown East for two and was assigned this hotel. Its blind reviews were great so I wasn't worried. It was only after my nonrefundable booking did I learn the hotel rooms only had one bed! I called the hotel (and Hotwire to no avail) whose receptionist was very kind in giving me various options for a bit more space. I was so impressed. Upon arrival at 12:40 (check in isn't until 3:00), the receptionist checked us in early because a room was ready. They were also going to hold our luggage had the room not been ready. The room itself is just as pictured online. Smallish, but very efficient, clean, and comfortable with lots of outlets for charging gadgets, energy-saving AC (motion detector so it cuts off when you're out for the day which can be changed), cold filtered water with bottles available, and more. The terrace on floor 27 was a delight to have. Each night we went up to enjoy the city sounds and sights (especially of the Chrysler building a couple of blocks away!). Any time we had a need, such as questions about the AC unit turning off, someone responded with a call or a room visit within minutes. The bed was very comfortable, and we both slept very soundly on the 9th floor. The hotel's location is fabulous. It is easily within walking distance to the UN, Rockeller Center, Empire State Building, and much more! Of course, catching a train at Grand Central is as easy as walking across the street. We hope to stay here again.

We stayed here for 9 nights and 10 days in the superior room with the kitchenette. The hotel is close to everything, walking distance to Grand Central from where you can get subway. Close to Times Square, Chrysler building, Rockefeller center, lots of restaurants and shopping. We had taken the New York pass for 7 days and also took 7 day unlimited subway pass in case we needed to use it, and we did use it a lot to just roam around. Traveling in a train was a first time experience for our daughter, so she wanted to use it every time. Day time try walking or using the subway which is faster and easy way around Manhattan, night time cabs are super fast. We took cabs to visit the Intrepid, 9/11 memorial, Empire State Bldg which was not too expensive. About the Club Quarters, try getting a room on a higher level as I heard people complain about the street noise. The rooms are smaller, but clean. there is free bottled water on every floor, free Wifi and you can chill out on the terrace with a drink or coffee. There is some free snacks, fruits and coffee too. It has a small gym room for people to exercise, and a laundry machine, which is great when travelling with kids or if you like to carry less clothes and its free (no need to carry coins yeah!). The downside is the machine is always occupied till late night as people use it a lot. The other downside for us was the kitchenette in the room was not what you will find in their website picture. It was just a coffee machine on top of a small fridge not the complete kitchenette with hot plate, sink, and dishes.The hotel staff is excellent, Jean and Christine are really good, helpful and always smiling. We had a problem with the A/C in the room the first night and Christine changed it immediately which was great. When we rented our car on the 9 night to drive the full east coast and Canada, Jean made sure it was safe outside the hotel and gave us the parking permission for the night so that we don't get a ticket. Overall the staff is great, hotel is worth the price, will recommend to friends and will stay here every time we are in New York.

It was my first trip to Manhattan with my family and the hotel location just across from Grand Central Station was perfect! The staff there was very helpful and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Jean Claude and the entire staff left a positive impression on us and we would love to come back again. Thank you for making our stay in NYC a memorable one!!

I stayed two nights at the hotel in August and almost had a perfect time.The standard room was clean and nice, and very sufficient. The best thing was the extras - having a free strong wi-fi connection, having a good coffee machine in the room, even the dock for charging the cell phone was nice. The hotel has a nice terrace on the roof and a "living room" with computers and printers for guests use. Someone really thought about making things nicer - and it works. In addition, the hotel's location is really good and the "aiprorter" bus stops near it.The only problem I had - and it was a big one - was the terrible noise coming up from the street all the way up to the 10th floor. It was really terrible. I turned on the air condition - which made a noise itself, but at least it was a steady noise. Otherwise I could not sleep, and I'm a very good sleeper. So, if you can make sure you get a room that is not facing the street, I recommend the hotel.

I stayed two weeks and reported that the direct dial phone in my room was not working. After four attempts I gave up as it was clear that no one was concerned. In other properties, I would have at least received a note from guest services with an apology. The issue was not addressed when I checked out.Overall the rooms are pleasant and clean. Small, yes, but I expected that. It was also too bad that the roof deck was reserved for a private event when I went to enjoy it on the last night of my stay.

This is a reasonably priced modern hotel within easy reach of NY attractions and amenities. Rooms are snug, but have everything in them including table and seating area, coffee facilities, docking station, flat TV, dimmer lighting, lovely ensuite. Decorated in contemporary design and colours. There is free WiFi, free safety deposit boxes, free water on every floor, and a gorgeous open 27th roof terrace with free refreshments. Hotel will offer bag storage if leaving late after check out. Reception very helpful with advice/knowledge and extremely polite.Only downside was the extortionate price of breakfast. Went down for a $15 continental, which was of little selection - Parma ham, melon bits, half a bagel and muffin, all that was left. What they don't tell you is that the waiter offers you orange juice and hot drinks and these are extra and overpriced. Go across road to deli and take something back to room or terrace. All in all, a great hotel that would definitely use again and highly recommend.

This hotel was perfect for my work at the UN and would be for anyone working in Manhattan Midtown East. Recently built its location at Grand Central Station is ideal. It has a 27th floor guests area that takes in the Chrysler Tower and Grand Central Station. My room was a good size, the facilities fresh and well maintained. While no restaurant of its own it has a to die for Italian restaurant adjacent and classic breakfast options nearby - especially a diner just further along 45th to the East.

I traveled for work for the week of May 27th. My husband went with me for a combination of work and much needed leisure. The accommodations were wonderful and a pleasant surprise, given the reasonable price. The rooms are a little small, but the location is wonderful and comfortable. There was water available on every floor and the wifi didn't cost a thing. The parking garage that offers the hotel discount is about a two block walk over to 45th and 2nd Avenue, which is fine and is almost to be expected in New York anyway. Great experience!

I stayed here recently for two nights at the end of a business trip.The room was clean and the staff very helpful. Food is available in the adjoining restaurant accessed via an internal door.Great open air terrace with free coffee and chilled water available on the top floor.I would be happy to stay here again if back in New York.

I stayed 2 nights and I was very pleased! May not have a luxurious lobby but it served my purpose very well. Free wifi, a nice bathroom and comfortable bed. Good air conditioning to cap it all off. It was very comfortable and I highly recommend it.

I was scheduled to be in New York for business for five days, and needed to book a hotel close to 99 Park Ave. The Club Quarters Grand Central was a short walk and very convenient ... but I worried about what it would be like as the price was reasonable (for NY City, Manhattan). Worrying was unneccessary ... the hotel was great. The room was small, but modern, clean, comfortable, and quite convenient. I wanted a place with a workout room, and the one here was never busy and had decent equipment. There was a great lounge on the 27th floor with an outdoor area. The lounge always had coffee and tea; it had breakfast bars and fruit in the morning, plus snacks and soda pop in the evening. Another perk was the free bottled water on each floor. When back in NY City for business - or even for a vacation, I would choose to stay at this hotel. I highly recommend it.

I stayed in the city after working for a few days. My room was small, clean with a great coffee maker. Free Water on each floor- huge cost saving in NY- free Wifi. The staff was friendly- great Indian close by. I would stay there again.

I would like to say that Robert was great at the front desk and he made the service a 5 star service all by himself. The rooftop Terrence was nice w the livingroom being exceptionally nice. I would love to stay here again. Great experience.

My stay here over the 4th of July weekend was really by lucky happenstance -- it was courtesy of a blind bid on William Shatner's favorite booking site! I could not have been more pleased; from the moment I checked in until my departure, the staff and hotel both exceeded my expectations. The location was ideal, and while the rooms are not overly spacious, I didn't feel cramped in the least. Total comfort (best hotel pillows I think I've ever slept on), and surprisingly quiet for a Midtown location. The unique CQ touches (like the Guest Closet, unlimited filtered water and fresh bottles, and the large/wonderful 27th-floor balcony) were so appealing. As I said to the delightful Christina at the front desk, I would make it a point to stay here again next time NYC is my destination, and not leave it to chance!

Located in the heart of everything, new and fresh, with a big, elegant veranda with lots of tables and seating on the 27th floor. Great views. Cappuchino, latte, coffee, tea on demand and brewed fresh in the adjoining 27th floor "living room" with sofas, TV, computers etc. Even icy spring water on each floor.We stayed in a "standard" room which wasn't large but was so thoughtfully designed and appointed it felt quite generous. Staff, including concierge Robert, very helpful and courteous. Recommend it highly, looking forward to staying there again.

My company has an account with special membership rates for its staff at Club Quarters. Club Quarters hotels are located in most major cities. My last stay was at the Club Quarters Grand Central. Although my trips to New York are business-related, this hotel is also a great place for tourists. It is a few blocks away from Grand Central Station, a central location for subways and commuter trains. . In addition to its convenience to public transportation, it's located in a great area for shopping. The hotel seems to attract a large number of visitors from other countries, and it is ideal for travelers who rely on their technology gadgets. Wi-Fi is free. Lots of electrical/USB outlets. A large room with balcony, free beverages and snacks, and computers is located on the 27th floor. The view is spectacular. The hotel seems to cater to the environmentally-conscious traveler. Free filtered water and containers are located on every floor; the heat/air unit is turned off when you arrive, but the thermostat allows you to adjust temperatures based on your needs. The standard room is small, but a superior room or suite is large and less costly than a standard room in many hotels, depending on the season. Each floor also has a unlocked guest closet that contains ironing boards and irons, and the hotel contains washers and travels, which is great for long stays. Basically the hotel has everything one would need -- comfy beds, large TVs, good lighting, and a very helpful and cheerful staff. There is a restaurant connected to the hotel that has great food, but is very expensive. There are many less expensive places to eat located in the vicinity of the hotel.Check-in reception is fast, functional but not grand.

We stayed a weekend in NYC just stop over on our way back from Florida to Europe. Were very pleased by the quality of the room and the location. Walking distance to Grand Station, Rockefeller Building... free WIFI and free luggage storage after checkout. We arrived before check in started which was no problem, as there were no rooms ready yet we were asked just to leave out luggage in reception and when we came back latter they were already in our room. View from the room window awesome, however I can imagine that it was also connected to the fact that we were at 23rd floor. If ever back to NYC would definitely stay there again.

Yes the rooms are not huge, yes there is no grand reception, yes there is no room service BUT it does have, comfy beds, big TV, good bathroom facilities with excellent lighting and make-up mirror in addition to a powerful hair dryer (unusual for USA).I stayed here on business for two nights and it was a 3 minute walk to Grand Central Subway to get downtown. Right near shopping and restaurants.Previous reviewers mention the top floor lounge, it is excellent with complimentary snacks and drinks throughout the day and good office facilities in addition to great views of the city.Would stay again if in NYC

Good location. Easy booking. Couple of blocks from Grand Central Station. Newly redone. Modest size rooms but everything is new. Nice bathrooms and bedding. Good value for a quick stay in NY. Just off Lexington. Small lobby area and checkin. Nice lounge on top floor for guests to hang out. Close to Many restaurants and short walk to Times Square. MTA Train access nearby. Sign up for their liberal awards program. Earn free nights. Friendly staff and atmosphere. Helped with luggage and extra pillows. Will return on future visits to New York. Highly recommend.

2 blocks from Grand Central, squeaky clean and new, small-ish rooms fitted out like boats with extreme space efficiency. Comfy bed with nice sheets and pillows. Big TV. Keurig coffee machine and pods. Built in bench seats with table for dining or work. Outlets and cords to support your devices. 27th floor terrace and "living room" for all guests. All this at an extremely good price. I will look at this brand first for NY and London. I spent the previous two nights on business at the tired, cramped Roosevelt and moved here for an extra solo personal night, a step up!

I stayed at this hotel with my husband for just one night as part of a quick stop to New York. It is reasonably enough priced for a new york hotel. It has a great location approximately 2 blocks I think from Grand Central so it was very handy just to get off the train and not to walk too far to our hotel. The staff were all very friendly and the hotel was clean. The reception area is small and could do with some chairs to sit on while you wait for bags etc. but that is only a very minor issue. Every floor has a filtered water dispenser with bottles as well which is a nice touch for the tourist who wants to explore the city! Also on the 27th floor is the club lounge, which you get in all the club Quarter hotels, they are just in different areas in the hotel. This lounge provides free tea and coffee, which was quite nice, but also free cans of soda and nibbles, an extra bonus. From the club lounge there is a lovely terrace from which you can get a great view of the Chrysler Building - which is extra beautiful at night. We stayed on the 24th floor and the noise from the street was still quite loud even with the windows closed, so I would suggest staying on a high floor as it can only be louder lower down!! Weirdly I think this may also be known as the Boutique Hotel Grand Central. The hotels are other side of the same city block and are connected internally. They do have two separate entrances though, separate reception desks so I couldn't be sure!!! I think it is both the Club Quarters and All is all a great hotel for short trips to the city!

If being in the heart of mid-town Manhattan is important, this is the place for you. If a hotel room is a place to collapse after a busy day or boozy night, this is the place for you. If you want free WiFi and cold water on tap, this is the place for you. If you want breathing space, a bath tub, a view of the city, and some of the glam of the Big Pomme, look elsewhere. The rooms have all the charm and dimensions of a monastic cell, but you may feel heavenly by the money you save.

I had only stayed in one other Club Quarters, in Washington, DC, and it's a pit, so I was worried about staying here. But, a colleague said it's nice, so I gave it a try, and he's right. The price was much lower than any other hotel on my company's preferred list, and there's a reason. Services offered are minimal, the lobby is tiny, the rooms are small (though they are small in many other NYC hotels). The place has been recently updated and I saw no evidence of construction going on. As noted in other reviews the common area on the top floor is very nice, with a great outdoor space. The room was nicely furnished - the only the thing it lacked was a safe. At first I was upset there was no iron and board, but it turned out there's a supply closet in the hall with those, extra pillows, and so forth. For the money, on a business trip, this was fine.

I stayed at this Hotel with a friend for a 2 night stay. It very comfortable, easy to find and good central location for New York City. The staff was pleasant and courteous. We arrived early and were able to drop our bags off but upon returning to get a coat for walking I was unable to get my luggage because it was up in the room but the room was not ready. This was the only negative aspect of my stay. The hotel room was very accomodating, tv, shower and bathroom were clean and roomy. The hotel has a floor on the top for the guests for coffee, espresso, etc. with tvs, daily newspapers and comfortable seating for all guests. It was a very nice surpise. This floor/area also has an outdoor patio (very good size) for guests to go outside and see the city while having coffee and/or reading. I found the outdoor patio to be a wonderful addition to see and hear the sounds of the city from above.

Not a very comfortable hotel. Very "minimalist" would be the best thing that I can say about this chain. Small rooms with uncomfortable beds and an RV dinette set in the middle. I felt like I was in a Winnebago. There is no lobby to speak of. The check-in is accomplished in a cramped entry way and the clerk is behind a podium. I felt like I was being booked into a prison. The inmates (I meant guests) are allowed just one wash cloth and a bar of soap. I am sure this is supposed to be "green" but I am sure it is just for show and it really just helps the bottom line. No restaurant or bar.

Really nice / new property - perfect location for our needs - welcoming staff and well organized accommodations!I love the ease of check in and check out - the free wifi / free water bottles close to Grand Central / as well as so many bars / restaurants - it made for a terrific weekend!

I've stayed in other Club Quarters Hotels and the concept is the same, no fuss, no hassle. This particular hotel is in a fantastic location in mid-town NYC which makes it easy to walk to pretty much everything.The hotel is new and modern with everything a traveller needs. The only minor criticism would be that the associated (privately run) restaurant/bar is located on the lower ground, where as in other Club Quarters you generally have ground level access to a restaurant/bar, so this one just feels hidden away.

The positives: The hotel is well situated on 45th and Lexington. The room was well furnished and very clean. The less than positives: The hotel is still under construction. There is no lobby. There was only ONE staff person to check people in and out. This ONE person stands at a podium and heaven help you if you are in a rush. This ONE person answers calls,checks people in, checks people out and manages any other staff. There is no restaurant in the hotel and no pool. However there is a lovely club room on the top floor with a wonderful patio and panoramic view of the city. In the club room there was fresh fruit and coffee.

I didn´t know this hotel. When i arrived it was difficult to identify. My check in was quick, very well done. The room is correct for my trip purposal( business) .
