The room is not so big but has Refrigerator, Microwave, Coffee machine, cable TV, wireless for free. Each floor has a tapped water machine with bottles that you can use . ( for free, which eliminates the necessity of buying water). The 27th floor has a good view and has also computers, coffee machine fruit and snacks. A Great place to have a informal meeting. Finally the staff is so kind and helpful. I was very well supported. ( Especially by Angela and Robert at the front desk). A really good choice!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Definitely more of a modern hotel. Clean & Reasonably priced. No complaints. There were free water bottles on the floor we stayed. Our room had a cool table & bench to sit at and drink your coffee or dinner if you prefer to order in. Would come back again!

I'm a frequent business traveler, and this is my dream hotel. Fast check in and check out, in person or at a digital kiosk. Standard room is larger than Club , and has a comfy queen bed, and a work table with outlets in front of a seat with a headrest or a chaise longue of just right height. Nice flat screen TV. Nicely designed bathroom with shower. Alarm clock has both iPod and USB docking, chargers, and connections for sound and projecting video to TV - even extra Apple connectors cables in the nightstand. Can control all lighting from the bed. 23rd floor lounge is a superb space for meeting with colleagues or just getting out of your room for a free cup of tea and a snack - with a great view & patio. Didn't go to the downstairs restaurant- either walked to Grand Central, Bryant Park or ordered delivery (for a reasonable fee). 1.5 blocks from Grand Central, great location for arrival/departure by train, easy walk to my meeting near the UN. Laundry facilities on 3rd floor. If you will stay frequently, you can have them dryclean & store your clothing, and set it up in your room for your return. Great (and very quiet) housekeeping staff. This was the least expensive hotel I could find in Midtown for my travel dates, and by far the best. Nothing I would change. This is my new go-to hotel chain!

Their Grand Central site is fairly new, and the rooms show this - modern but functional, very clean, large enough for business travel or couples (if you're used to European sizing). Great restaurant in "basement", OK gym area, nice lounge space.I like the shower, larger than typical stall, nice bright lighting, not much closet space and lacking much of a desk for work - the movable work-surface thingy has more style than substance other than support for a laptop.Had a Corporate rate just over $200 so great value to be had in Midtown, and self checkout is always appreciated. Since this is Midtown get a higher room if you want a quieter night sleep, even with the nice (softer) beds other reviewers mentioned.

Good location, friendly staff. They definitely cater to business travelers as lounge area had snacks, pop, water etc during the week but only coffee on the weekend. They have Three elevators but one was in service most of the time therefore wait for an elevator was quite long. Would recommend.

Like my title says this hotel is great for sleeping.The best feature I recall about this hotel was the bed, sheets, blanket. It was amazingly comfortable. I regret not looking for the brand name. This comment is justified by all the Pilots staying there. There are pilots constantly checking in / out.Besides the above, and for the price paid, everything else was fairly average. I stayed in two different rooms during my stay and each one was tiny. The hotel is not your conventional hotel. In keeping with the pilot theme, the tiny lobby has 3 electronic check in screens. The top floor has a lounge area where there are snacks / coffee with tv screen, but the area is very bland with nobody there. no bar. There is also an outdoor area which has quite a good view of Lexington AvenueThis hotel is well suited to business people who simply need a comfortable bed to sleep in. I would not recommend this place for tourists looking for a bit NYC flair. It lacks vibe and social amenities.Most of all for the price that I paid, I feel there is better value elsewhere.

I stayed at Club Quarters on Wall Street and had a fantastic visit, so decided to opt for the grand central one on this occasion. On arrival, there were building works taking place, I explained to the reception that this wasn't mentioned to us when booking and that it wasn't too pleasing to look at or to hear drilling. The staff member on duty remarked that it wasn't pleasing for him either, clearly missing the point that we had paid to be there. I then told him that I thought it was quite rude and he did offer us complimentary breakfast for the three days we were there. They then took a security deposit, however neglected to inform me that it was going to ring fence money and so I had limited funds for my vacation. We checked out on Saturday and as of Tuesday morning, I still haven't received funds. The rooms were quite compact and had little character and not enough storage space for two people. It was comfortable but certainly not worth what we paid. Needless to say we won't be returning any time soon.

on of my best vacation in nyc was in this hotel ,the personnel was great and professionnel....thank u so very mutchhhh jean claud i had a great time !!!!! and i cant wait to go back to new york ..... i garanty u that i ll recomand this place to all my friends !!!!

I was surprised when I walked into the lobby that so much construction was still going on. With a lot of people and luggage and construction workers all in one tight space, there was a feeling of chaos. Check-in was quick. The receptionist helped me with the machine and I went right upstairs. However, I felt like I didn't get much of an introduction to the hotel. It's only now that I'm back home that I'm finding out about the 27th floor lounge! I feel kind of mad that I didn't know about it! The scene was so crowded and chaotic that there wasn't much of a "welcome to our hotel and here's what we have to offer" attitude--even though the staff members were nice and polite.My room was nice, but looked onto the air conditioning units. Fortunately it wasn't noisy, but it was a terrible view. Otherwise the room was well-appointed and comfortable. I loved the little formica table, which I used both as a desk and for eating a late dinner that I brought in.Two other things that I wasn't so happy about: The elevators were slow, but maybe due to the construction. The other was not having an iron and ironing board in the room. They're down the hall in a closet, a little inconvenient because you have to get dressed to get them.Convenience is no issue at all for this hotel and that's what I liked about it. I guess I was excited to try the newest member of the Club Quarters New York hotels and came a way a little disappointed. Maybe when the construction is over, things will feel more homey.

Have stayed several times-check in is self service which is a real pain, staff is mostly foreign with accents, not responsive at all-needed a receipt for a cancelled reservation for which I was charged full room-called 4 days in a row including messg's for service mgr and never got call back, nor receipt after leaving my email with two folks who said they would handle it. Rooms are small, hallways tiny and claustrophobic. Tough to locate hotel as it's not well marked on 2nd floor to lobby.

I was very hesitant to stay here since I have never heard of Club Quarters and found a good deal on Hotwire before but was pleasantly surprised! I've stayed at many NYC hotels and you just can't beat the perks of Club Quarters - free wireless, free snacks all day, free drinks/water all day, club lounge. Rooms are extremely clean and designed to maximize space. My room was quiet and very comfortable. Lobby is no frills but how much time do you spend there anyways? Will definitely return.

From the warm greeting and assistance by Robert on check-in, to the Club Quarters Living Room -- with terrace -- on the 27th floor, everything fully met or exceeded my expectations. The location put me easy walking distance to my conference at the United Nations and to all the resources around Grand Central. The room layout and overall design was outstanding, and everything I needed was right at my finger tips. Definitely will stay there again!

The hotel is gorgeous and in a very convenient area of Manhattan . Every aspect of service was on point beginning with the front desk service agent to the manager who opened the door for my boyfriend (oops!) to the night auditor . Loved the George Jetson chairs lol and loved how we were upgraded ! Thank you for a comfortable (beds are amazing ) and wonderful stay ! Will recommend to all my friends and fam !

I had an unexcpect respone form the hotel . they are not professional, rude, and have an inpatient attitude. we reserved a room 10 days ago through on line broker and got the confimation, While I call the hotel, they could not found our reservation record. we been calling three times, finally they found out there is a missing spelling name input in the computer. while they searching, their attitude is very in patient and rude. I will not use this hotel again, they do not deserve to eran my business.

For business travelers such as myself, we spend a great deal of time in one hotel or another. Amenities are nice but a bed is a bed is a bed! The Boutique Grand Central Hotel was a welcome change from the check in, check out process. My coworker and I were greeted with genuine pleasure on our arrival at the hotel and this continued every time we left and re-entered. After our first visit we recommended to our Company to use Club Quarters exclusively for our travels and over the next several months had multiple week stays. Most notably, the two agents Jean-Claude & Christina were amazing. We travel globally and of all the Hotel staff I've met (and my peers agree)...Jean-Claude and Christina are at the top of the list. Professional, Courteous, and so much FUN, they have made me look forward to every visit.

We reserved this hotel on Hotwire and were concerned about the size of the rooms, and the fact that we had a queen bed in one of the rooms we rented instead of two twins. I called the hotel prior to our visit and was told they would do their best. When we checked into the hotel we had everything taken care of in advance. The rooms were NY small but very well designed and extremely comfortable. The staff were amazing. We had terrible weather and I saw the front desk manager go to his car to get an umbrella for one of the other guests. The 27th floor lounge was beautiful and had great coffee and cappuccinos. Even though NYC has the best tap water in the nation, they had water bottles and a filling station for them on each floor. Very cool. I will do everything I can to stay here again when visiting NYC. I also forgot to mention the great location.

This place is great for everything: room, cleanliness, position, lounge room at the top...But what makes this hotel a special place is Robert and Angela. The biggest smiles and help in the heart of NYC!!! You make this a unique place. Hope I will meet you again soon. Thanks!!!

Brand new hotel just far enough from the crowds but close enough to all that you want. Location is great. Hotel is clean and modern. Complimentary snacks, coffee, fruit. View from 27th floor lounge is amazing. But what makes this place stand out from the rest is the staff. Always smiling, always helpful, always speaking and acknowledging everyone that passes. Gorona is a doll and one of the friendliest girls I have ever met. I was fortunate enough to meet the manager. Tall, good looking and no pretense at all. Simply introduced himself as Billy in his southern accent. Easy to see he sets a fine example for his staff. This is my new favorite place in New York City.

My husband and I loved staying here for Valentine's Day. The room had a kitchenette and great views to new york city. We were warmly greeted by a very friendly staff member who made us feel very welcomed. We have no complaints, everything was perfect. The complimentary fill-it-yourself water bottle machines were awesome. We loved our stay here and highly recommend it.

In midtown for a meeting. Booked us at the club quarters in mid town. I have stayed at the downtown and WTC locations as well. This one is located just a few blocks away from Time Square. Like the other locations, the décor is modern. The rooms are small and comfortable. The very sparse lobby is made up for by the lounge area on the 27th floor. Free internet throughout the hotel. Think this place is common for airline pilots - must have seen a 1/2 dozen over 24 hr period. Each floor has free self bottling filtered water. The water had a plastic taste that I bet was from the bottle and not the water itself. Room had a Keurig coffee maker with one decaf and one regular coffee. Cleanliness: This is where I downgraded from a 4. I went to make a cup of coffee and found that the coffee mug had been obviously used (crusted material on the bottom and lipstick on the cup). The bathroom was clean and without mold. Security: There was no safe in the room. Needed key to use the elevator. Fitness room: Tight. 1/2 dozen machines, dumbbells and nautilus type equipment. They note that they will bring fitness equipment to your room. Restaurant: Davio's - didn't eat there at night, but a pilot that was leaving said the food there was fantastic. Ate the breakfast buffet. It was okay, nothing really to write home about. Overall: solid place that I would give another chance.

The hotel was great! The room was nice and clean with a great view of the city. The beds were very comfortable. I slept like a baby. The bathroom was organized and properly maintained. Great for either personal or business stays. The hotel is equipped with meeting and lounging areas with snacks, coffee and sodas. The club room on the top floor was amazing with the highest quality furniture and a balcony overlooking NYC. Alberto Pichardo provided great service when assisting me in making reservations. He let me know where to park my car so I would get a significant discount for staying at the hotel. He also recommended Davios, a really nice restaurant in the same building, so we could a get a discount and free appetizers for being a hotel client. He also provided a list of alternatives for bars and restaurant in the area. So to summarize the hotel had clean rooms, located in an ideal location, very friendly and helpful staff, spacious lounging/ meeting areas and a breathtaking view from the top floor club room. Will stay here again.

Excellent service. Great staff - Standouts would be Jean Claude and Christina. If your after a great location for Business travel or Site-seeing then this Hotel is a top choice. Visit the terrace on the 27th floor for some great views

So i made this reservations with the hope to you know get and hotel service normal enough specially with this MLK week end hotels are very busy and employees tend to be a little bit tense wow wow wow i was quite surprise t found out that some people still know how to do business. J-C his name was well done man. I stayed 3 days when i got there the welcome was warm people were available to help me and my family getting in the hotel it was fast simple and pleasant , late at night coming back from walking around i get in and this J-C start asking me how my staying was so far I'm telling him and i think he had felt that i was not aware of the 27th floor where he took me and then the 2nd floor offered me conversation he wasn't pushy at all but made me feel home. on the day i left my train was at 2pm but check out was at 12pm so i checked out they carry my bags to secure them in a storage gave me a card so i can get them when i want we seat in the living room as they call them free internet with Apple computers no codes and free drinks and food wow wow wow , i printed our ticket there for free and when leaving they helped us out. Great great service can't make any comment on the rooms as you can see the pics I'll just add that there's no scam they are clean class and fresh. this is my house in NY now on.

Even though I booked the smallest room, it was adequate and very comfortable. The guest lounge on the top floor was exceptional, with computers and printer available, as well as, complementary beverages, fruit and snacks. I enjoyed the terrific views from the lounge balcony.

As I understand it most of Club Quarters' guests have a formal association with Club Quarters through their employers or organization. However, when the Club Quarters has excess capacity, it welcomes other guests. My short stay at Club Quarters was one of the most enjoyable I have had out of nearly a dozen trips to New York in the last year or so.I had a Club Room, which I feared would be too small. Much to my delight it was just fine. In addition to the bed, armoire, etc., there was a small L shaped table in one corner which was set up for connection with various technology (frankly I was not certain how it was to be used). The room is state of the art in terms of technology on multiple fronts.Two of my criteria for a high quality stay are towels big enough to wrap around myself and glass glasses. Club Quarters Grand Central provided both. There are also water dispenser scattered around the hotel.One of the really outstandng features is the "living room" on the 27th floor. First, the view over New York is wonderful, and there is even a balcony to allow guests more wonder in good weather. The living room offers computers, a printer, and a copier--all of the tools necessary to business travelers. It also provides plenty of work space and corresponding laptop connections.Another plus is the complimentary fresh fruit provided and the extraordinary coffee machine. It stores fine Italian coffee which is actually ground by the machine. Choose espresso, cafe latte, cappuccino, regular coffee, hot water for tea, etc. It's all there. Complimentary soda is also provided.The staff is terrific from the people at the front desk to the various others I met around the building. I enjoyed a wonderful stay and would readily return. I do have two small suggestions. First, there is a wonderful high tech alarm clock which allows charging of one's I-Phone, etc. However, I could not figure out how to set the alarm. It is possible that instructions are contained in the book in the room with general information, and if so the fault is mine for not thinking to look (until now). The second is to label the pitcher of white liquid by the coffee machine so one knows whether it is cream, milk or half and half. I actually prefer milk in my coffee and would have been delighted to find some of that in the refrigerator.These are, however, nitpicks. I should also mention that the hotel is truly a five minute walk or so to Grand Central Station. Once there you can catch a subway in various directions, including the shuttle to Penn Station. And, of course, there are an innumerable choice of restaurants.If you have the opportunity to visit the Club Quarters, particularly if you are in New York on business, you will not be disappointed.

This is a new property and my first time at any Club Quarters hotel. They were offering great introductory rates. I hope the rates stay reasonable. Bed was extremely comfortable.Room itself was smallish, but perfectly fine for 1 person. Bathroom was spacious and spotless.Free WiFi throughout hotel was an added bonus. They have a lovely coffee room/ lounge area with balcony on the 27th floor. Perfect location, just steps away from Grand Central Station. The only downside was that my room had no desk. Perhaps larger rooms do. I suppose if I had work to do, I could have done it in the lounge on the 27th floor. Excellent Italian restaurant on property

Our stay was nothing short of a great experience from check-in to check-out. Upon our arrival, we were checked in by Christina Fonseca who was very friendly and helpful with the process and also gave us recommendations on what was in the area. There were a variety of things to do and the location of this hotel made it that much easier to get where we needed to. Our room was exactly like the photos on the site and had everything we needed for our stay. We will definitely return to this Club Quarters on our next trip to NYC!

With an impending snow storm, my office booked a block of rooms for commuting employees. The rooms are just as the pictures portray them. Very clean and plenty of space for two people. The little L-shaped couch is nice. Plenty of outlets all over the room. The room also came with a mini-fridge and a microwave.The TV is mounted on the wall, but I was able to hook up my Roku box to an HDMI port on the side. The wifi has no password so I had Netflix up and running in full HD within minutes while I unpacked.I would definitely stay here again if the opportunity arose!

Overall, the hotel is Ok with some great pros and some cons. I would go again if I don't find something better but it would not be my first choice. I booked two sup rooms with kitchenettes. first I got two rooms without and after much discussion, I was given the rooms I had booked. I can talk about room 202 and 203. The kitchenette is really not usable as it is only a fridge and a (weak) microwave. it does not come with any supplies, such as spoons or bowls to warm anything in the microwave. One of the rooms did not even have a table to eat/snack at. the rooms are very nice and large though even though they are on the second floor. they just did not have ANY real storage space. we managed to buy milk and cereal and were able to have breakfast in the morning but we could not really manage to have any meals, not even light meals. As for their standard rooms, we also stayed in 2102 and 1502, and both rooms are small (to very small) with a queen bed and a small pull out bed. definitely not for three adults as they say and even small for 2 adults and a child (like us). there is barely room to move around the bed. Overall pros:1. People are very nice. 2. the room at the 27th floor is awesome3. free continental breakfast on weekend. it's not great but sufficient with bagels, coffee and patries. 4. free wifi everywhere and free computers at the 27th floor5. free laundry at the 3rd floor - awesome when you need to dry some clothes in a rush after a day in the rain6. amazing location on midtown east in front of grand central7. it has a small gymCons1. noisy even at the 21st floor2. small rooms3. kitchenettes are not functional4. cleanness is sufficient but not great. they do the rooms really fast and you can tell. 5. close to non-existent closet space

Great location and hotel for under $200 a night! Location was right near Grand Central station and walking distance to Rockefeller, St. Patrick's Cathedral and many other places of interest. Newly renovated hotel with very nice bedroom and bath. Highly recommend this hotel to business or vacationing travelers!

We were at first excited to have been assigned this brand new property by priceline for another stay in NYC. The photos certainly looked nice enough. However the first sign of problems came when upon trying to reach the hotel at the reception number, to discuss our two room options, calls were simply never picked up. We tried calling the hotel different days over the course of a week to no avail. Finally, the CQ main reservation number informed us they were having issues with staff at this hotel during busy hours and connected us directly through their main line themselves (they pick up when corporate calls). The young lady we spoke to was to have annotated our accounts and reservations with our very late arrival time, twin bed request for one room and a few minor requests. Upon our arrival, the single stand that constitutes the front ‘desk’ was manned by a very rude, self-righteous individual who informed me there were no notes in our reservations. He then stated that we must have called the wrong CQ. The tone of haughty disdain for the "idiot out of town tourist" could not have been more apparent. I explained the hellish experience of even trying to get through and the rude man basically again went off on how there is someone always at the desk and they always answer their phones. In other words, either I am lying, or I am an stupid. No possibility that he could be wrong and their hotel is going through growing pains or worse during the daytime busy hours. The tone with which we were reprimanded, standing in front of the single computer joke-of-a front-desk was absolutely offensive and ridiculous – but it was 3.30 am and we were too tired to argue. Up to the rooms, to find the worst, motel-6 level ‘twin’ beds- uncomfortable beyond belief, - child’s size -with the light joke-of-a-mattress falling off the bed with any body movement -- and two half-used shampoo/ mouth wash bottles at the foot of one of the beds, and the added bonus of an apple under the bed. Leftovers from the previous guests, of course- and proof of a housekeeping that simply could care less (in fact, looking between the beds, the level of filth for a hotel only a month old was astonishing). Furniture in the room was horribly cheap sub-IKEA, already scratched up, and a worthless central table attached to the floor that did not allow for any movement within the room. Everything is cheap and tacky and poorly laid out. Back downstairs (its now 4.30 am) to ask for extra pillows/bedding (a new guy at front desk does not know how to get these) – and to discuss checking out within a few hours (paying for the first night, cancelling the rest). Again, the “front desk” guy has no idea how to manage this, he says we have to wait for the hotel manager to come the next morning at 10 am. The rest of the ‘night’ was spent on the phone trying to procure a cancellation for the remainder of our stay at this at-best two star establishment-from-hell. The next morning, 30 minutes to check out in the check-in (standing room only) area cluttered with twenty people trying to check in or check out, and two incompetent female employees, one of which took another 12 minutes to figure out how to print me a receipt for our stay. We paid $440 for staying four hours at this hotel, and its an experience I won’t forget in a very long time. On top of extremely cramped and uncomfortable rooms, with the worst beds we have experienced in the U.S. in the last decade, the sheets and bedding are either not rinsed properly of the detergents, or over-starched with atypical materials. My body was covered in a rash after the short time in that bed. Guests would be advised to check out mold growth on the shower curtains in the shower stalls as well, since whoever outfitted this hotel has not thought out that detail either.The hotel is a 2 star, at best. Poor staff, poor rooms, poor beds, no front desk, no services, nothing. Will never stay here again. Give it a year, and the whole place shall fall apart.

This is the newest of the Club Quarters Hotels in central Manhattan, recently opened It is located just a few minutes from Grand Central Station, with easy access to all that midtown Manhattan offers. It is the standard Club Quarters look, with a tiny lobby and self-check in services, with staff on hand to provide any help and information needed. They were personable and attentive. I have stayed in all the Club Quarters in Manhattan, and the gracious hospitality shown by staff is always appreciated, and consistent across all of the hotels there. Rooms are very pleasant indeed, and well set up and designed. It was tastefully furnished, a warm contemporary look, and the room looked out over the Manhattan skyline. Bed was extremely comfortable and it was such a restful room overall. The rooftop bar and breakfast room is excellent, providing a selection of pastries, bagels and coffee and tea, and this was included in the price. Great views over Manhattan in several directions. It was too cold to be out on the open terrace, but that would seem a great spot to relax on a hot summer evening. Internet is free, and works without fail at all the CQs. Excellent business hotel.

Great location right next to Central Station and walking distance from lots of things including Rockefeller, Broadway, Times Square and Music city. The place is very secure and has people at the entrance and needs a key just to get to the floor of you room. The room are tiny though but who's gonna stay in the room anyhow?Services are great from a laundry to club room with snacks for everyone. Coffee machine is great as in many Club Quarters. They have a workout room but better yet they have a deal with a local workout center for only $10. Ice is only on the 3rd floor. Water is available on all floors.If you find this helpful Please mark it so.Berny

At $1933.34 for Monday through Friday, you might expect an extremely high level of service, but that isn't what travel in NYC is all about, is it? I guess people are willing to pay pretty much anything to stay in Manhattan. Fortunately, I didn't pay for this out of my own pocket.I have considered bringing the family on a business trip, and having them stay with me, but I don't think I could have made this work at this hotel, simply because there isn't much room for additional cots in my standard sized room. On the plus side, there is a good business center on the 37th floor, with a few newspapers and magazines to share, free beverages, candy, nuts, TV, iMac computers, and a working printer/copy/scanner. The third floor has free laundry and a small workout room. But it almost seems like the the free touches suffice to remind a traveler of all of the more gracious places one could stay. Step outside of the business center to the terrace and you will find a very nice view of the Chrysler building and mid town.Also, on the plus side, the room was very nice. The bed was fantastic. The bath has modern fixtures. I liked the iPod station. The free internet was easy to connect to, and fast. There were plenty of electrical outlets.Security seems quite high in this property, with electronic door passes that limit guests to only specific floors (business floor, laundry/workout floor, lobby). There is no lobby to speak of. When I meet a coworker to begin our day, waiting in the lobby feels awkward, since there is no place to stand without being in the way, and there is no place to sit. I would definitely stay here again.

Really good rooms, FAR nicer than the one at the Rockerfeller Centre. Everything is new, the lifts were fast and efficient, the room was spacious, loved the location. One huge downside was the staff, oh my goodness they were so rude, uninterested and positively frosty to the guests. But you know what, we just ignored them and got on with it!!

I stayed in CQ for 8 days and i must say excelent hotel just one block from Grand Central Terminal where you can take subway for most of lines and 5-7 blocks from 5th avenue and time square.I got small club room which was good size for one guest, all furnitures are quite new and very clean. Small club room might be not good for couples with 4 luggages.CQ also offer free wifi, free bottle of water Must say that. 27th floor is amazing where can offer 24h free sodas, free coffee machine,snacks, cpu and printers. Staff very cordial and nice.For sure i will recommend this hotel for all my friends.

In the course of 4 weeks, I had 2 stays at this hotel. I chose it b/c of the price and most of all, the convenience for business travellers. When I travel on business, and I'm either on my dime or a client's dime, I like to keep it simple, but I want things. Like plenty of outlets for charging devices. Conveniences like the free cold distilled water. Free sodas and snacks in the lounge. The workout area was ehh, but I walked about 2-3 miles a day so it was ok. If you can, I recommend the superior room, which has a kitchenette and a cool dining/work table. It just opened so there were a few bugs, but overall I was very pleased with the service and the people who worked there. One hint -- there are limited number of irons and ironing boards in a common room on each floor, so if you are like me and iron everything when you arrive, you may have to hunt around on a different floor if yours are all gone. That being said, it is packed up each day by housekeeping and returned to the common area, so no one can use it and forget it in their room.The ability to order from neighboring restaurants and have it charged to the room was also a great convenience. Just one word on that -- as a San Franciscan, the hoopla about Rickshaw Dumplings is just that -- your neighborhood Chinese joint serves better dumplings.The location, on the other hand, can't be beat. You have all the subway lines at Grand Central, great neighborhood conveniences on Lexington Ave, and you're just a few minutes away from the insanity of overindulgence called 5th Avenue.

First impression not so great - two different groups were having issues with front desk staff while I was waiting to check in, and they didn't look happy at all. When it was my turn though they were very efficient and quickly found me a room,even though I arrived hours before their official check in time. Staff were very polite throughout my stay.Room was quite small but perfectly fine for one person (for two it might have felt a little claustrophobic but they probably have other rooms to choose from). Hotel is new and everything works well. Free wifi was perfect. Lounge on the 27th floor is great, especially when you arrive late at night and just want to drink a tea or coffee or grab something quick to eat. I didn't experience any of the issues with elevators that previous reviewers had.Location is perfect. Right next to Grand Central with easy connections to anywhere else in Manhattan. Area is very quiet at night and I had no problems with noise.I had stayed at a Club Quarters before in London and this property is much newer and more pleasant. It's not a 5 star hotel and neither does it pretend to be. To say that it's no frills wouldn't be fair either as it would be perceived as having no services - a lot of what you need is there, you just have to ask or read the instructions (e.g. there isn't an iron in the room but there are instructions on where to find one)For the price I paid and the location and cleanliness, I would definitely go back.

First time to NYC and we loved it. Took my daughter for her 18th birthday and had a blast. Club Quarters Grand Central was all that and more!!Yes the rooms are a bit small but very clean, comfortable and modern. Service was quick, staff polite with free Wi-Fi and complimentary breakfast, snacks and soda 24 hours was an added bonus! I left my phone charger at home and they lent me a brand new universal charger for the duration of my stay. I needed the iron and someone brought it to me within 3 minutes of me calling! Whenever we seen an employee of the hotel whether in the hallway or elevator they always said good morning, good day and acknowledged us - good customer service goes a long way.The only small negative was the elevators were slow at times but nothing to complain about. They also gave us a complimentary box of chocolates for this inconvenience....which I thought was not needed by nice all the same!Located just six blocks from Times Square. Lots of shopping, restaurants, live shows and near by attractions. Price was below average than other hotels that are within walking distance to Times Square.I am quite picky and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

After two consecutive nights in this hotel the second night was worse than the first...The first night only one of the three elevators were working and on the second night, none of the elevators were not working. I was on the 9th floor! Hello stairs. The rooms are tiny. The only seating in the room is a 50's diner type "L" shaped booth with a table fixed to the floor inches away from the seat. Totally unusable as anything except to unpack your bag which is on the table or booth because there is no suitcase stand in the non-existent closet where the non-existent iron and ironing board are not.I have nothing to say positive about this 'brand new' property.

First, let me start off by saying that the hotel rooms are small. Period. But I knew this going in - so they were exactly as expected - small.That being said, the rooms were clean and nice and actually a little bit more spacious than I had anticipated. I've stayed at the Pod hotels - which for the money are a good deal - but they are actually smaller than these rooms. I preferred Club Quarters for my business travel, because it is less "clubby" feeling. More business travelers as Club Quarters, less partiers.I'm giving these guys a 5 because I was actually pleasantly surprised by several things. The "Club Living Room" provides a free continental breakfast and coffee (limited variety - but quick and easy). It's set up nicely for business travelers - plenty of tables and workspaces. The 5 rating comes because I had already checked out and went to my early meeting and had 5 hours to kill before my flight. So, I came back to the Club Quarters (my luggage was stored) and the staff was very accommodating. They let me work in the Club Lounge (with free lattes) while I waited for my flight.I would definitely stay here again - especially if I'm looking for a good price in New York. If you are looking for spacious and luxurious, this is not it - you'll need to fork over the money to stay at a more upscale hotel. But I'm super particular - and this place is quite nice, just really small rooms. Summary:- Nice staff- Good place for business travelers on a budget- Great location- Nice rooms - clean, modern (hotel appears to be new or newly remodeled) - just small- The biggest downfall is the windows don't appear to be highly insulated and you can hear the street noise really well - Will definitely stay here again!

Pros Midtown locationNice new hotel, about 1 block from Grand Central Station.About 6 to 10 blocks away from Times Square. Taxi is not needed, just walk. It's way quicker to walk at no cost.Light breakfast included.ConsSmall beds and over priced Paid $250 per night.

Stayed here for 4 days on a business trip. Definitely not your typical hotel atmosphere. Basically just a tiny reception area, your room and the business lounge on 27th floor where you can chill and also have breakfast. This is a great option if you need a no frills stay for business. Breakfast is self help but options are limited. The room is of fair size and staff downstairs are friendly. The place has only recently opened and builders are still around to finish their work in parts of the building. I chose this hotel for costreasons but it was not significantly cheaper than other hotels. The wifi internet is free and connection is fast. Overall experience was not bad but I am not yet convinced that this is a better option to other hotels.

This is going to be a long review because I have a lot to say. I meant to take pictures of both rooms, but completely forgot.I booked 2 standard rooms for 3 nights directly through the CQ website and paid in full. When I arrived, I was told that the hotel was booked and that my RESERVED and PRE-PAID rooms were not available. I was told I was being DOWNGRADED to (smaller) club rooms and would receive credit for the difference for all 3 nights of my stay. (But it was not made clear how many nights we’d be in the smaller rooms.) While there was no alternative, I do not find this acceptable. If I have already paid for a room, I absolutely expect it to be available. There is no excuse for this. I proceeded with checking in, but was not told how (or when) the situation would be resolved.Moving on...In my small club room, because of the layout and small window, I felt a little claustrophobic. It reminded me of being in an exam room at a doctor's office more than being in a hotel room. The full size bed was comfortable (although small for two people). There was a chair, a bedside table and a small closet area that holds a few garments. That's it. The only place to put luggage was a weird shelf-like area that was built into the wall where the window was. In the bathroom, there was not much room for toiletries. There was a narrow shelf above the toilet, but as others have said, things can easily fall into the toilet. The shower was very small--about the size of a shower stall in a gym locker room, maybe a little smaller. There was a teensy tiny shelf in the corner that barely held a bar of soap and bottle of shampoo. The towels? Yeah, they're hanging on the other side of the room, right beside the toilet (literally), in the "splash zone". (If you sat on the toilet, your leg would be touching a towel.)I was irritated with the smaller room--and the entire situation, but went on about my evening. When I returned to the room later that night, it was stuffy and I could not adjust the air conditioning. The thermostat was set to 75. When I attempted to change it, it would go right back to 75. I called the front desk and they sent someone up to check it. The boy they sent up had no idea about anything (at all) and tried to tell me the room didn't even appear to have air conditioning. He said he'd send up an engineer. After about 20 minutes and no news or engineer, I called the front desk again. I was told they were looking into it and someone would be up shortly. After another 20 minutes, I called again. I was told there was no engineer there so nothing could be done and there were no other rooms available. I was offered a fan and an Amazon gift card for my inconvenience. (A gift card, I later found out, that was already freely given to everyone.)The next morning, I went down and spoke with the front desk about the situation. Everything got sorted out. I was able to move into my standard room. The other party traveling with me opted to stay in the smaller room to avoid the hassle of changing rooms.The standard room was much more comfortable. It wasn't that much bigger, but felt like it due to the larger window. Unfortunately, it had the same small toiletry area at the bathroom sink. This bathroom, while larger, did not have the shelf above the toilet. The shower was identical. What was advertised as a "work area" (which I assumed to be a desk) was a small table beside a floor lamp in the corner. This was not even a table you could sit at. This room did not have the weird “wall shelf” so there was nowhere to put luggage other than the floor. (Really?!)While the air conditioner worked very well in this room (temperature-wise), it behaved quite strangely. When it was actually cooling, it seemed the fan was set to a lower speed. When it stopped cooling and just the fan was blowing, it seemed to change speeds to high. I like white noise when I sleep, but the constant changing in volume woke me up several times.The free bottled water that is offered? That's empty (sealed) bottles that you fill yourself from a cooler in the hallway.Breakfast is said to be served until 10, but runs out well before 9.As other have noted, the elevators are EXTREMELY slow.One other odd note, taking the stairs down leads directly to the street. The outside door is not locked and can be accessed by anyone. I did not check to see if the inside doors leading back to the floor of the hotel were locked. (There was nowhere to swipe your room key if they were.)On a positive note, this hotel seemed very clean and the location was great. The subway was about 4 blocks away, though. If you stay here, check out Uncle Paul's Pizza. (It's listed in the little hotel notebook beside the bed.) They have DELICIOUS, inexpensive pizza and are open 24 hours! (If you check-in there on Foursquare, you can get $10 off!) There's also a nice Irish pub, The Perfect Pint, that's close by. They have a great draft beer selection and decent food.If I did not have the check-in/smaller room problem, my experience would have been much more positive. Barring that issue, I'd consider staying here again. My invoice shows they did apply the credit for the difference in the room costs, but I can't confirm that I received it until it shows up on my credit card.

For Columbus day weekend they were the cheapest. Then to my surprise everything was perfect. Excellent location, friendly staff, free breakfast, $50 Amazon gift card. 4.8/5. The elevator sometimes had waits but nothing crazy, would def go back.

Stayed at the Grand Central location in early Oct 2013. We booked the Club Room - the smallest room available, but still about 200sq ft, which is not bad for NYC (depending how much you pay for it). Positives: this is still a new property, so it's all new and clean; there was a complimentary breakfast (coffee, yogurt, pastries), BUT make sure you come early because they can run out of food. The service is pretty good.Negatives: there was no desk in the room or second chair - BIG NEGATIVE for someone traveling for business (or even for a couple); the bathroom in the Club Room is smallish; there is a shelf right above the toilet and things tend to fall into the toilet if it's open; it was still a bit noisy (but we were warned about it); only one elevator was working for most of the weekend (not a huge negative for us, but can be annoying for some).

I have stayed in all Club Quarters locations in NYC and in Boston and DC. They are all excellent hotels but the CQ Grand Central is by far the best of them. What makes it stand out among the others, even with the construction still going on) is its location and its staff. This is the newest hotel in the chain, very well designed and very comfortable. Amenities are better then what you might expect, all is high tech and user friendly. 3 Mac desktops and a printer in the breakfast lounge on the 27 floor, where tee/coffee and snacks and fruit are available 24/7. But most of all I'd like to say that the front desk staff is really exceptional. In particular Michelle was very friendly, helpful and professional in all my dealings with her and what I observed in her interactions with other guests and her colleagues. It is obvious that those who work at this location are not only friendly towards the guests but also towards each other which makes this hotel a very friendly and welcoming place indeed. This is bu far my favorite place in NYC now.Thank you, Michelle. Wladek K

I stayed here with a friend for one night when I added on a night in NYC and could not extend my reservation at the Club Quarters Rockefeller Centre location. We had a standard room which was a comfortable size.Everything is brand new so it looks great. The complimentary filtered water dispensers are a nice touch for thirsty travelers. Since the hotel had just opened they offered a complimentary continental breakfast. They are still working out some details - coffee machine stopped working during breakfast but there are Nespresso / Keurig coffee makers in the rooms. The terrace off the lounge was not yet open. The people at reception were friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

I'm still staying at the hotel but as it's just opened, I figured it was worth writing a review during my visit to highlight how good this hotel is - touch wood it stays this way! The hotel opened only last Sunday so although there is some building work going on and a few finishing touches such as Davios (opens in October), I really feel this hotel represents great value for money. My company has corporate rates for the CQ hotels globally and this really is a great great new hotel for its brand.Location: 4th and Lexington. You can walk everywhere very easily from this hotel which is good considering the UN are in session this week. Grand Central is a stone throw away and you can catch the subway there to get just about anywhere.Rooms: Exceptionally clean and big for midtown. I was lucky enough to get a bigger room as I was staying for a long whle (9 nights). This wasn't possible on my first night but by the next day, they had picked up my luggage, taken it to the new room and I got my new keys when I came back in. For Apple fans, the alarm clock allows you to charge your iPhone or iPad on it and still charge another device. They even provide the cables for you. Bed is large and comfortable and you can open the windows to get fresh air into the room - I definitely recommend Room 1204.Club living room: Definitiely worth a mention. Complimentary breakfast and snacks throughout the day, amazing view of the Chrysler building, two TVs, comfy chairs, iMacs and a business centre. Plenty of papers - the terrace isn't open quite yet but I imagine it will be a great backdrop for photos!Staff: They really make the place. They have been constantly helpful, hard-working and really friendly. Nothing is too much for them and considering they've still only got half-occupancy whilst the rest of the rooms are being finished, I think they're doing great.Other bits: In-room dining is available (deli, Italian, Indian, Chinese, Japanese), laundry charges are reasonable, free wifi throughout the building with a strong strong signal, free purified water and exceptionally comfortable bedding, towels etc.
